vi: Cậu bước tới bước lui trong phòng đôi ba lần. Sau đó cậu quay qua nhân vật lặng yên trên ghế. “Mẹ, đồ đạc của con sẵn sàng chưa?” cậu hỏi.
tr: James odanın içinde birkaç volta attı. Sonra koltukta kıpırdamadan oturan kadına döndü. “Anne, eşyalarım hazır mı?” diye sordu.
es: Su hermano recorrió la habitación dos o tres veces antes de volverse hacia la figura inmóvil en el sillón. —¿Están listas mis cosas, madre? —preguntó.
vi_translation: You paced back and forth in the room a few times. Then you turned to the silent figure on the chair. "Mom, is my stuff ready?" you asked.
tr_translation: James paced back and forth in the room. Then he turned to the woman sitting motionless on the couch. “Mom, are my things ready?” he asked.
es_translation: His brother paced the room two or three times before turning to the motionless figure in the armchair. —Are my things ready, mother? —he asked.

en: “Quite ready, James,” she answered, keeping her eyes on her work. For some months past she had felt ill at ease when she was alone with this rough stern son of hers. Her shallow secret nature was troubled when their eyes met. She used to wonder if he suspected anything. The silence, for he made no other observation, became intolerable to her. She began to complain. Women defend themselves by attacking, just as they attack by sudden and strange surrenders. “I hope you will be contented, James, with your sea-faring life,” she said. “You must remember that it is your own choice. You might have entered a solicitor’s office. Solicitors are a very respectable class, and in the country often dine with the best families.”
vi: “Sẵn sàng cả rồi, James,” bà trả lời, mắt không rời việc. Suốt vài tháng qua, bà thấy không thoải mái những khi bà ở một mình cùng anh con trai lỗ mãng, lạnh lùng này của bà. Bản tính kín đáo nông cạn của bà thấy khó chịu khi mắt họ gặp nhau. Bà thường tự hỏi không biết cậu có nghi ngờ gì không. Sự im lặng, do cậu không đưa ra lời bình phẩm nào khác, trở nên không thể chịu nổi với bà. Bà bắt đầu phàn nàn. Đàn bà tự bảo vệ mình bằng cách tấn công, cũng hệt như họ tấn công bằng các cuộc đầu hàng đột ngột và lạ kỳ. “Mẹ hy vọng con sẽ thỏa lòng, James à, với cuộc sống đi biển của mình,” bà nói. “Con nên nhớ rằng đó là lựa chọn của chính con. Nhẽ ra con có thể vào một văn phòng luật sư. Các luật sư là một giới rất đáng kính, và ở tỉnh, họ thường dùng bữa tối với các gia đình khá giả nhất.”
tr: Kadın, “Hepsi hazır, James,” diye yanıtladı, gözlerini elindeki işten kaldırmadan. Şu son aylarda, bu dobra, ciddi oğluyla baş başa kalmak ona sıkıntı verir olmuştu. Göz göze geldikleri zaman sinsi, sığ ruhu tedirgin oluyor, oğlunun herhangi bir şeyden kuşkulanıp kuşkulanmadığını merak ediyordu. Oğlu başkaca bir şey söylemediğinden sessizliğe dayanamaz oldu. Sızlanmaya başladı. Kadınlar kendilerini saldırı yoluyla savunurlar, bazen de, ani, anlaşılmaz teslim oluşlarla da saldırıya geçerler. ms Vane, “James, umarım denizcilik yaşantısı sana doyum verir,” dedi. “Bunu kendin seçtiğini hiç unutmamalısın. Bir avukatın yanına girebilirdin. Avukat sınıfı çok saygındır. Hele taşradakiler çok zaman en iyi ailelere, yemeğe çağrılırlar.
es: —Todo está preparado, James —respondió la señora Vane sin levantar los ojos de su labor. Desde hacía varios meses se sentía incómoda cuando se quedaba a solas con aquel hijo suyo tan tosco y tan severo. Temía revelar su secreta frivolidad cada vez que sus miradas se cruzaban. Y se preguntaba con frecuencia si James sospechaba algo. El silencio, porque su hijo no hizo ya ninguna otra observación, llegó a resultarle intolerable y empezó a quejarse. Las mujeres se defienden atacando, como también atacan mediante repentinas y extrañas rendiciones—. Espero que estés satisfecho con tu vida en el mar —dijo—. Recuerda que eres tú quien la ha elegido. Podrías haber entrado en el bufete de un abogado. Los abogados son personas muy respetables, y en provincias comen a menudo con las mejores familias.
vi_translation: “Everything is ready, James,” she replied, her eyes not leaving her work. For the past few months, she had felt uncomfortable whenever she was alone with her rude, cold son. Her shallow reserved nature found it difficult when their eyes met. She often wondered if he suspected anything. The silence, due to his lack of further comments, became unbearable for her. She began to complain. Women protect themselves by attacking, just as they attack with sudden and strange surrenders. “I hope you are satisfied, James, with your life at sea,” she said. “You should remember that it was your own choice. You could have joined a law office. Lawyers are a very respectable class, and in the province, they often dine with the wealthiest families.”
tr_translation: The woman replied, "Everything is ready, James," without lifting her eyes from her work. In recent months, being alone with her straightforward, serious son had become a source of discomfort for her. Whenever their eyes met, her sly, shallow soul grew uneasy, wondering if her son suspected anything. Since her son did not say anything else, she could no longer bear the silence. She began to complain. Women defend themselves through attacks, and sometimes, they launch attacks through sudden, inexplicable surrenders. Ms. Vane said, "James, I hope the seafaring life gives you satisfaction." "You must never forget that you chose this yourself. You could have joined a lawyer's office. The legal profession is very respectable. Especially those in the countryside are often invited to dine with the best families."
es_translation: —Everything is ready, James —replied Mrs. Vane without lifting her eyes from her work. For several months she had felt uncomfortable when she was alone with that coarse and severe son of hers. She feared revealing her secret frivolity whenever their gazes met. And she often wondered if James suspected anything. The silence, because her son made no further comment, became intolerable to her, and she began to complain. Women defend themselves by attacking, just as they attack through sudden and strange surrenders—. I hope you are satisfied with your life at sea —she said—. Remember that it was you who chose it. You could have joined a lawyer's office. Lawyers are very respectable people, and in the provinces, they often dine with the best families.

en: “I hate offices, and I hate clerks,” he replied. “But you are quite right. I have chosen my own life. All I say is, watch over Sibyl. Don’t let her come to any harm. Mother, you must watch over her.”
vi: “Con ghét các sở làm và con ghét các thầy ký,” cậu đáp lại. “Nhưng mẹ hoàn toàn đúng. Con đã lựa chọn cuộc đời mình. Mọi điều con cần nói là, hãy bảo vệ Sibyl. Đừng để chị ấy bị làm hại. Mẹ, mẹ phải bảo vệ chị ấy đấy.”
tr: Oğlu, “Yazıhanelerden, yazmanlardan nefret ediyorum ben,” diye annesini yanıtladı. “Sana tek söylemek istediğim, Sibyl’e göz kulak ol. Ona kötülük gelmesine izin verme. Ona gözün gibi bakmalısın, anne.
es: —Aborrezco los despachos y los oficinistas —replicó su hijo—. Pero tienes toda la razón. Soy yo quien ha elegido vivir así. Sólo te pido que cuides de Sibyl. No permitas que le suceda nada malo. Tienes que cuidarla, madre.
vi_translation: “I hate the offices and I hate the clerks,” he replied. “But you are absolutely right. I have chosen my own life. All I need to say is, protect Sibyl. Don't let her be harmed. Mother, you must protect her.”
tr_translation: His son replied to his mother, "I hate offices and clerks." "All I want to tell you is to keep an eye on Sibyl. Don't let any harm come to her. You must take care of her as if she were your own eyes, mother."
es_translation: —I detest offices and office workers —replied his son—. But you are absolutely right. It is I who have chosen to live this way. I only ask that you take care of Sibyl. Do not let anything bad happen to her. You have to take care of her, mother.

en: “James, you really talk very strangely. Of course I watch over Sibyl.”
vi: “James, con nói lạ thật. Dĩ nhiên mẹ phải bảo vệ Sibyl rồi.”
tr: “James, çok tuhaf konuşuyorsun. Sibyl’e göz kulak olmuyor muyum sanki?
es: —Hablas de una manera muy extraña, James. Claro está que cuidaré de Sibyl.
vi_translation: “James, what you’re saying is really strange. Of course, I have to protect Sibyl.”
tr_translation: “James, you are talking very strangely. Am I not looking after Sibyl?”
es_translation: —You speak in a very strange manner, James. Of course, I will take care of Sibyl.

en: “I hear a gentleman comes every night to the theatre and goes behind to talk to her. Is that right? What about that?”
vi: “Con nghe như có một quý nhân đêm nào cũng đến nhà hát, và ra đằng sau nói chuyện với chị ấy. Phải vậy không? Vậy là sao?”
tr: “Duyduğuma göre tiyatroya her akşam bir beyefendi geliyormuş, onunla konuşmak için kulise gidiyormuş. Aslı var mı bunun? Ne diyorsun sen buna?
es: —Me han dicho que hay un caballero que va todas las noches al teatro y luego charla con ella entre bastidores. ¿Es cierto? ¿Qué hay de eso?
vi_translation: "I heard that a noble person comes to the theater every night and goes backstage to talk to her. Is that true? What does that mean?"
tr_translation: “I heard that a gentleman comes to the theater every evening and goes backstage to talk to you. Is there any truth to this? What do you say about this?”
es_translation: —I have been told that there is a gentleman who goes to the theater every night and then chats with her backstage. Is it true? What about that?

en: “You are speaking about things you don’t understand, James. In the profession we are accustomed to receive a great deal of most gratifying attention. I myself used to receive many bouquets at one time. That was when acting was really understood. As for Sibyl, I do not know at present whether her attachment is serious or not. But there is no doubt that the young man in question is a perfect gentleman. He is always most polite to me. Besides, he has the appearance of being rich, and the flowers he sends are lovely.”
vi: “Con đang nói về những điều con không hiểu, James. Trong nghề này bọn ta đã quen nhận rất nhiều sự chăm sóc hết sức đẹp lòng. Chính mẹ từng nhận nhiều bó hoa cùng lúc. Đó là khi mà diễn xuất được thấu hiểu thật sự. Như với Sibyl, mẹ không biết hiện nay lòng quyến luyến của nó có nghiêm túc hay không. Nhưng có điều chắc chắn rằng người đàn ông trẻ tuổi đang được nói đến ấy là một quý nhân hoàn hảo. Cậu ấy luôn hết sức lễ phép với mẹ. Vả lại, cậu ấy có phong thái sống giàu sang, và những bông hoa mà cậu ấy gửi đến cũng rất đáng yêu.”
tr: “James, sen aklının ermediği şeylerden söz ediyorsun. Bu meslekte biz çok ilgi çekeriz, koltuklarımız kabarır. Bir zamanlar bana da demet demet çiçek gelirdi. Tiyatro oyunculuğunu gerçekten anlardı insanlar. Sibyl’e gelince; şu sırada ciddi bir bağlılığı var mı, bilmiyorum. Ama sözü geçen çocuğun kusursuz bir centilmen olduğu su götürmez. Bana her zaman son derece saygılı davranıyor. Hem de görünümünden zengin gibi, duruyor. Yolladığı çiçekler pek güzel.
es: —Hablas de cosas que no entiendes, James. En nuestra profesión estamos acostumbradas a recibir atenciones. Hubo un tiempo en que yo misma recibía muchos ramos de flores. Entonces sí que se entendía el trabajo de los actores. En cuanto a Sibyl, ignoro si en el momento actual su interés es serio o no. Pero no hay duda de que el joven que mencionas es un perfecto caballero. A mí me trata con extraordinaria corrección. Por otra parte, da la sensación de ser rico, y las flores que manda son muy bonitas.
vi_translation: “You are talking about things you don't understand, James. In this profession, we have become accustomed to receiving a lot of very pleasing attention. I myself have received many bouquets at the same time. That is when the performance is truly understood. As for Sibyl, I don't know if her affection is serious at the moment. But one thing is certain, the young man being talked about is a perfect gentleman. He is always very polite to me. Moreover, he has a wealthy lifestyle, and the flowers he sends are also very lovely.”
tr_translation: “James, you are talking about things you don't understand. In this profession, we attract a lot of attention, our pride swells. There was a time when I used to receive bunches of flowers. People truly appreciated theater acting. As for Sibyl; I don't know if she has a serious commitment at the moment. But it is undeniable that the mentioned young man is a perfect gentleman. He always treats me with utmost respect. And he seems to be wealthy from his appearance. The flowers he sends are very beautiful.”
es_translation: —You talk about things you don't understand, James. In our profession, we are used to receiving attentions. There was a time when I myself received many bouquets of flowers. Back then, the work of actors was truly appreciated. As for Sibyl, I don't know if her interest is serious at the moment or not. But there is no doubt that the young man you mention is a perfect gentleman. He treats me with extraordinary politeness. Moreover, he seems to be wealthy, and the flowers he sends are very beautiful.

en: “You don’t know his name, though,” said the lad harshly.
vi: “Mẹ còn chưa biết tên nó, dẫu gì,” chàng trai nói, cục cằn.
tr: Delikanlı, “Ama adını bilmiyorsun,” dedi sertçe.
es: —Pero no sabes cómo se llama —dijo el muchacho con aspereza.
vi_translation: “Mother doesn't even know its name yet, anyway,” the young man said, gruffly.
tr_translation: The young man said harshly, "But you don't know her name."
es_translation: —But you don't know what his name is —said the boy harshly.

en: “No,” answered his mother with a placid expression in her face. “He has not yet revealed his real name. I think it is quite romantic of him. He is probably a member of the aristocracy.”
vi: “Chưa,” mẹ cậu trả lời, với vẻ bình thản trên mặt. “Cậu ấy còn chưa để lộ tên thật. Mẹ nghĩ thế cũng khá là lãng mạn về phía cậu ấy. Cậu ấy chắc là một thành viên của tầng lớp quý tộc.”
tr: Annesi yüzünde dingin bir ifadeyle, “Hayır,” dedi. “Henüz adını açıklamış değil. Bence pek romantik bir şey bu. Aristokrasiden biri olsa gerek.
es: —No —respondió la señora Vane con una plácida expresión en el rostro—. No ha revelado aún su verdadero nombre. Y me parece muy romántico. Probablemente se trata de un aristócrata.
vi_translation: “Not yet,” his mother replied, with a calm expression on her face. “He hasn't revealed his real name yet. I think it's quite romantic of him. He must be a member of the nobility.”
tr_translation: With a serene expression on her face, his mother said, "No." "He hasn't revealed his name yet. I think it's quite a romantic thing. He must be someone from the aristocracy."
es_translation: —No —responded Mrs. Vane with a serene expression on her face—. He hasn't revealed his true name yet. And I find it very romantic. He is probably an aristocrat.

en: James Vane bit his lip. “Watch over Sibyl, Mother,” he cried, “watch over her.”
vi: James Vane cắn môi. “Bảo vệ Sibyl, mẹ nhé,” cậu kêu lên, “bảo vệ chị ấy.”
tr: James Vane dudağını ısırdı. Sonra, “Sibyl’e göz kulak ol anne,” dedi gene. “Gözünden sakın onu!
es: James Vane se mordió los labios. —Cuida de Sibyl, madre —exclamó—. ¡Cuídala!
vi_translation: James Vane bit his lip. "Protect Sibyl, mother," he cried, "protect her."
tr_translation: James Vane bit his lip. Then, he said again, "Look after Sibyl, mother." "Protect her with your life!"
es_translation: James Vane bit his lips. —Take care of Sibyl, mother —he exclaimed—. Take care of her!

en: “My son, you distress me very much. Sibyl is always under my special care. Of course, if this gentleman is wealthy, there is no reason why she should not contract an alliance with him. I trust he is one of the aristocracy. He has all the appearance of it, I must say. It might be a most brilliant marriage for Sibyl. They would make a charming couple. His good looks are really quite remarkable; everybody notices them.”
vi: “Con trai của mẹ, con làm mẹ buồn quá. Sibyl luôn được mẹ chăm nom đặc biệt. Dĩ nhiên nếu quý nhân đó giàu có thì chẳng vì lý do nào mà chị con lại không nên kết giao với cậu ta. Mẹ tin cậu ta là một người thuộc tầng lớp quý tộc. Cậu ta có mọi biểu hiện bề ngoài của họ, mẹ phải nói như vậy. Chắc sẽ có một đám cưới rực rỡ cho Sibyl. Chúng nó sẽ thành một đôi tuyệt sắc. Vẻ đẹp của cậu ta thật sự là phi thường; ai ai cũng để ý đến cậu ta.”
tr: “Oğlum, içimi karartıyorsun. Sibyl’e her zaman gözüm gibi bakmışımdır. Bu beyefendi varlıklıysa Sibyl’in onunla bir ilişkiye girmemesi için hiçbir neden yok demektir. Onun aristokrat olduğuna inanıyorum. Görünümü tamamen öyle, inan. Sibyl böylece göz kamaştıran bir evlilik yapabilir. Ne güzel bir çift oluştururlar: Çocuğun olağanüstü bir yakışıklılığı var. Herkesin dikkatini çekiyor.
es: —Hijo mío, me duelen mucho tus palabras. Siempre cuido de Sibyl de manera muy especial. Por supuesto, si ese caballero es rico, no hay razón para que no se case con él. Estoy segura de que se trata de un aristócrata. Tiene todo el aspecto, no hay la menor duda. Sería un matrimonio brillantísimo para Sibyl. Harían una pareja encantadora. Es un muchacho muy apuesto, todo el mundo lo advierte.
vi_translation: “My son, you make me very sad. Sibyl has always received special care from me. Of course, if that gentleman is wealthy, there is no reason why your sister shouldn't associate with him. I believe he belongs to the aristocratic class. He exhibits all the outward signs of it, I must say. There will surely be a splendid wedding for Sibyl. They will make a stunning couple. His beauty is truly extraordinary; everyone notices him.”
tr_translation: “My son, you are darkening my heart. I have always looked after Sibyl like the apple of my eye. If this gentleman is wealthy, there is no reason why Sibyl should not enter into a relationship with him. I believe he is an aristocrat. He completely looks the part, believe me. Thus, Sibyl can make a dazzling marriage. What a beautiful couple they would make: The boy is extraordinarily handsome. He attracts everyone's attention.”
es_translation: —My son, your words hurt me deeply. I always take special care of Sibyl. Of course, if that gentleman is wealthy, there is no reason why she shouldn't marry him. I am sure he is an aristocrat. He has all the appearance, there is no doubt about it. It would be a very brilliant marriage for Sibyl. They would make a charming couple. He is a very handsome young man, everyone notices it.

en: The lad muttered something to himself and drummed on the window-pane with his coarse fingers. He had just turned round to say something when the door opened and Sibyl ran in.
vi: Chàng trai lẩm bẩm gì đó với chính mình, và gõ các ngón tay thô lên ô kính cửa sổ. Cậu vừa mới quay lại định nói gì thì cửa mở, và Sibyl chạy vào.
tr: Delikanlı kendi kendine bir şeyler mırıldanarak o küt parmaklarıyla davul çalar gibi pencere camına vurdu. Tam bir şey söylemek için dönmüşken kapı açıldı, Sibyl koşarak içeri girdi.
es: El joven murmuró algo para sus adentros y tableteó sobre el cristal de la ventana con sus dedos de trabajador. Acababa de volverse para decir algo cuando se abrió la puerta y entró Sibyl.
vi_translation: The young man muttered something to himself and tapped his rough fingers on the windowpane. He had just turned around to say something when the door opened, and Sibyl ran in.
tr_translation: The young man, muttering something to himself, tapped on the windowpane with his blunt fingers as if playing a drum. Just as he was about to say something, the door opened, and Sibyl ran inside.
es_translation: The young man murmured something to himself and tapped on the window glass with his worker's fingers. He had just turned to say something when the door opened and Sibyl entered.

en: “How serious you both are!” she cried. “What is the matter?”
vi: “Sao cả hai người nghiêm túc thế!” nàng la lên. “Có chuyện gì không?”
tr: “Ne kadar ciddisiniz, ikiniz de!” dedi. “Neyiniz var?
es: —¡Qué serios estáis! —exclamó—. ¿Qué sucede?
vi_translation: “Why are both of you so serious!” she exclaimed. “Is something wrong?”
tr_translation: “How serious you both are!” he said. “What's wrong with you?”
es_translation: —How serious you all are! —he exclaimed—. What is happening?

en: “Nothing,” he answered. “I suppose one must be serious sometimes. Good-bye, Mother; I will have my dinner at five o’clock. Everything is packed, except my shirts, so you need not trouble.”
vi: “Không có gì,” cậu trả lời. “Em cho là ta thỉnh thoảng cũng nên sống nghiêm túc. Tạm biệt mẹ; con sẽ ăn tối lúc năm giờ. Mọi thứ đã đóng gói xong, ngoài sơ mi của con, nên mẹ không cần phải lo.”
tr: James Vane, “Hiçbir şey,” diye yanıtladı. “İnsan arada bir ciddi olamaz mı? Hoşça kal, anne. Akşam yemeğini saat beşte yiyeceğim. Gömleklerimden başka her şeyi bavuluma koydum, sen hiç zahmet etme.
es: —Nada —respondió su hermano—. Supongo que a veces hay que ponerse serio. Hasta luego, madre; cenaré a las cinco. El equipaje está hecho, a excepción de las camisas, así que no tienes que preocuparte.
vi_translation: “Nothing,” he replied. “I suppose we should live seriously from time to time. Goodbye mother; I will have dinner at five o'clock. Everything is packed, except for my shirt, so you don't need to worry.”
tr_translation: James Vane, "Nothing," he replied. "Can't a person be serious once in a while? Goodbye, mother. I will have dinner at five o'clock. I've packed everything in my suitcase except for my shirts, don't worry about it."
es_translation: —Nothing —replied his brother—. I suppose sometimes you have to get serious. See you later, mother; I will have dinner at five. The luggage is packed, except for the shirts, so you don't have to worry.

en: “Good-bye, my son,” she answered with a bow of strained stateliness.
vi: “Tạm biệt, con trai mẹ,” bà trả lời, với một cái cúi đầu trịnh trọng gượng gạo.
tr: Kadın, “Güle güle, oğlum,” diyerek soğuk ve resmî bir tavırla eğilir gibi yaptı.
es: —Hasta luego, hijo mío —respondió ella, con una inclinación resentidamente majestuosa.
vi_translation: “Goodbye, my son,” she replied, with an awkwardly formal bow.
tr_translation: The woman, saying "Goodbye, my son," made a gesture as if to bow with a cold and formal demeanor.
es_translation: —See you later, my son —she responded, with a resentfully majestic inclination.

en: She was extremely annoyed at the tone he had adopted with her, and there was something in his look that had made her feel afraid.
vi: Bà vô cùng khó chịu với cái tông giọng mà cậu đã bắt đầu áp dụng với bà, và có gì đó trong ánh mắt cậu khiến bà thấy sợ.
tr: Oğlunun onunla konuşurken kullandığı ses tonuna kızmıştı. Gencin bakışında da öyle bir şey vardı ki annesinin içine korku salıyordu.
es: Estaba muy molesta con el tono que su hijo había adoptado con ella, y había algo en su mirada que le hacía sentir miedo.
vi_translation: She was extremely uncomfortable with the tone of voice he had started using with her, and there was something in his eyes that made her feel scared.
tr_translation: She was angry at the tone of voice her son used when speaking to her. There was something in the young man's gaze that instilled fear in his mother.
es_translation: She was very upset with the tone her son had adopted with her, and there was something in his gaze that made her feel afraid.

en: “Kiss me, Mother,” said the girl. Her flowerlike lips touched the withered cheek and warmed its frost.
vi: “Hôn con nào, mẹ,” cô gái nói. Đôi môi như hoa của cô chạm vào cái má héo khô, và hâm nóng sương giá của nó.
tr: Sibyl, “Anneciğim, öp beni,” dedi. O gonca dudakları kadının solmuş yanaklarına dokundu, bu yanakların ayazını aldı.
es: —Bésame, madre —dijo Sibyl. Sus labios florales tocaron la marchita mejilla, entibiando su escarcha.
vi_translation: “Kiss me, mother,” the girl said. Her flower-like lips touched the withered cheek, warming its frost.
tr_translation: Sibyl said, "Mommy, kiss me." Her bud-like lips touched the woman's faded cheeks, taking away the chill from them.
es_translation: —Kiss me, mother —said Sibyl. Her floral lips touched the withered cheek, warming its frost.

en: “My child! my child!” cried Mrs. Vane, looking up to the ceiling in search of an imaginary gallery.
vi: “Con tôi! Con tôi!” bà Vane kêu to, ngước nhìn lên trần để tìm một hạng ghế chuồng gà tưởng tượng.
tr: ms Vane, “Yavrum benim! Yavrum!” diye hafifçe bağırdı ve tiyatronun balkonuna bakar gibi gözlerini tavana kaldırdı.
es: —¡Hija mía, hija mía! —exclamó la señora Vane, alzando los ojos al techo en busca de un imaginario anfiteatro.
vi_translation: “My child! My child!” Mrs. Vane cried out, looking up at the ceiling to find an imaginary gallery seat.
tr_translation: Ms. Vane, "My dear! My dear!" she cried softly and lifted her eyes to the ceiling as if looking at the balcony of a theater.
es_translation: —My daughter, my daughter! —exclaimed Mrs. Vane, raising her eyes to the ceiling in search of an imaginary amphitheater.

en: “Come, Sibyl,” said her brother impatiently. He hated his mother’s affectations.
vi: “Đi nào, Sibyl,” em nàng nói, nôn nóng. Cậu ghét các điệu bộ màu mè của mẹ.
tr: James, “Yürü, Sibyl,” dedi sabırsızlanarak. Annesinin yapmacıklıklarından, özentili davranışlarından nefret ederdi.
es: —Vamos, Sibyl —dijo su hermano con impaciencia. Le irritaba la teatralidad de su madre.
vi_translation: "Let's go, Sibyl," her brother said, impatiently. He hated his mother's pretentious mannerisms.
tr_translation: James said impatiently, "Come on, Sibyl." He hated his mother's affectations and pretentious behavior.
es_translation: —Come on, Sibyl —said her brother impatiently. Her mother's theatricality irritated him.

en: They went out into the flickering, wind-blown sunlight and strolled down the dreary Euston Road. The passersby glanced in wonder at the sullen heavy youth who, in coarse, ill-fitting clothes, was in the company of such a graceful, refined-looking girl. He was like a common gardener walking with a rose.
vi: Họ đi ra ngoài và vào trong ánh nắng lung linh lộng gió, tản bộ xuống đường Euston ảm đạm. Khách qua đường liếc nhìn đầy vẻ ngạc nhiên vào gã thanh niên rầu rĩ, thô kệch, ăn mặc tồi tàn, xộc xệch, đi cùng một thiếu nữ yêu kiều, nhìn rất tao nhã. Cậu giống như một gã làm vườn tầm thường đang bước đi với một bông hồng.
tr: Rüzgârla savrularak yanıp dönen güneş ışığına çıktılar, sıkıcı Euston Sokağı’ndan aşağı yürümeye başladılar. Kaba saba, biçimsiz giysileriyle böylesine zarif, kibar bir kızın yanında yürüyen bu hantal, somurtkan gence tuhaf tuhaf bakıyorlardı gelip geçenler. Sıradan bir bahçıvanın bir gülle kol kola yürümesi gibiydi bu.
es: Salieron a una luz de reflejos agitados por el viento y empezaron a caminar por la deprimente Euston Road. Los viandantes miraban con asombro al joven corpulento y hosco que, con ropa basta y nada favorecedora, iba acompañado de una joven tan atractiva y de aspecto refinado. Era como un vulgar jardinero paseando con una rosa.
vi_translation: They went outside and into the shimmering, breezy sunlight, strolling down the gloomy Euston Road. Passersby glanced with surprise at the gloomy, coarse, poorly dressed, and disheveled young man walking with a graceful young lady who looked very elegant. He looked like an ordinary gardener walking with a rose.
tr_translation: They stepped into the sunlight that flickered and turned with the wind, and began to walk down the dreary Euston Street. Passersby were giving strange looks to the hulking, sullen young man walking beside such an elegant, polite girl, with his coarse, shapeless clothes. It was like an ordinary gardener walking arm in arm with a rose.
es_translation: They went out into a light with reflections agitated by the wind and began to walk along the depressing Euston Road. The pedestrians looked in astonishment at the burly and sullen young man who, dressed in coarse and unflattering clothes, was accompanied by a young woman so attractive and refined in appearance. It was like a common gardener walking with a rose.

en: Jim frowned from time to time when he caught the inquisitive glance of some stranger. He had that dislike of being stared at, which comes on geniuses late in life and never leaves the commonplace. Sibyl, however, was quite unconscious of the effect she was producing. Her love was trembling in laughter on her lips. She was thinking of Prince Charming, and, that she might think of him all the more, she did not talk of him, but prattled on about the ship in which Jim was going to sail, about the gold he was certain to find, about the wonderful heiress whose life he was to save from the wicked, red-shirted bushrangers. For he was not to remain a sailor, or a supercargo, or whatever he was going to be. Oh, no! A sailor’s existence was dreadful. Fancy being cooped up in a horrid ship, with the hoarse, hump-backed waves trying to get in, and a black wind blowing the masts down and tearing the sails into long screaming ribands! He was to leave the vessel at Melbourne, bid a polite good-bye to the captain, and go off at once to the gold-fields. Before a week was over he was to come across a large nugget of pure gold, the largest nugget that had ever been discovered, and bring it down to the coast in a waggon guarded by six mounted policemen. The bushrangers were to attack them three times, and be defeated with immense slaughter. Or, no. He was not to go to the gold-fields at all. They were horrid places, where men got intoxicated, and shot each other in bar-rooms, and used bad language. He was to be a nice sheep-farmer, and one evening, as he was riding home, he was to see the beautiful heiress being carried off by a robber on a black horse, and give chase, and rescue her. Of course, she would fall in love with him, and he with her, and they would get married, and come home, and live in an immense house in London. Yes, there were delightful things in store for him. But he must be very good, and not lose his temper, or spend his money foolishly. She was only a year older than he was, but she knew so much more of life. He must be sure, also, to write to her by every mail, and to say his prayers each night before he went to sleep. God was very good, and would watch over him. She would pray for him, too, and in a few years he would come back quite rich and happy.
vi: Jim thỉnh thoảng lại nhăn mặt khi cậu bắt gặp ánh mắt tò mò của người lạ nào đó. Cậu có cái tính không ưa bị nhòm ngó vẫn phát ra ở các thiên tài vào những năm cuối đời, và chẳng bao giờ từ bỏ người thường. Sibyl, tuy nhiên, lại hoàn toàn không ý thức được về ấn tượng nàng gây ra. Tình yêu của nàng đang run rẩy trong nụ cười trên môi. Nàng đang nghĩ về Hoàng tử Quyến rũ, và, để nàng có thể nghĩ về anh ấy nhiều hơn nữa, nàng không nói về anh mà tiếp tục líu lo về con tàu mà Jim sẽ đi trên nó ra biển khơi, về số vàng mà cậu chắc chắn sẽ tìm thấy, về cô tiểu thư thừa kế tuyệt vời được cậu cứu mạng từ tay bọn lục lâm thảo khấu độc ác, bận sơ mi đỏ. Vì cậu không còn làm thủy thủ, hay người bán và áp tải hàng, hay bất cứ ai mà cậu sắp làm. Ôi, không! Cảnh sống của thủy thủ thật kinh khiếp. Cứ tưởng tượng bị nhốt lại trong một con tàu kinh khủng, với những con sóng gù lưng, gầm gào khàn đục, cứ cố chui vào, và một làn gió đen thổi gục các cột buồm, xé các cánh buồm thành những mảnh dài rú rít! Cậu đã rời tàu thủy tại Melbourne, lễ phép chào tạm biệt thuyền trưởng, và lập tức chuồn thẳng ra bãi vàng. Chưa đến một tuần trôi qua thì cậu đã bắt gặp một quặng vàng ròng cực to, quặng vàng to nhất từng được phát hiện ra, và mang nó xuống bờ biển trong một xe hàng được bảo vệ bởi sáu anh cảnh sát cưỡi ngựa. Bọn lục lâm thảo khấu tấn công họ ba lần, và bị đánh bại bằng cuộc tàn sát cực kỳ dã man. Ôi, không. Cậu sẽ không đến bãi vàng làm gì cả. Chúng là những địa điểm kinh khủng, nơi người ta say xỉn, bắn nhau trong quán rượu, dùng từ ngữ thô tục. Cậu sẽ thành một người nuôi cừu tốt bụng, và một chiều nọ, khi đang cưỡi ngựa về nhà, cậu thấy một tiểu thư thừa kế xinh đẹp bị một tên cướp cưỡi ngựa đen bắt cóc, rồi cậu đuổi theo, cứu được cô ấy. Dĩ nhiên cô ấy sẽ phải lòng cậu, và cậu phải lòng cô ấy, rồi họ sẽ cưới nhau, về lại quê hương, sống trong một tòa nhà rộng bao la ở London. Phải rồi, ở đó có sẵn những thứ thú vị dành cho cậu. Nhưng cậu phải rất ngoan, không được mất bình tĩnh hoặc tiêu pha dại dột. Chị chỉ lớn hơn cậu có một tuổi thôi, nhưng chị hiểu đời hơn rất nhiều. Cậu cũng phải chắc chắn là sẽ viết cho chị theo mọi chuyến thư, và đọc kinh mỗi đêm trước khi cậu đi ngủ. Chúa rất nhân từ, sẽ che chở cậu. Chị cũng sẽ cầu nguyện cho cậu, và sau vài năm cậu sẽ quay về, giàu có và hạnh phúc.
tr: James arada bir yabancının meraklı bir bakışını yakaladığı zaman yüzünü asıyordu. Kendine bakılmasını hiç sevmezdi, bu, dâhilere ileri yaşlarında gelen, olağan insanlarınsa hiç yakalarını bırakmayan bir şeydir. Oysa Sibyl çevresinde uyandırdığı etkinin hiç ayırdında değildi. Gönlündeki aşk dudaklarında kahkaha olup titreşiyordu. Genç kız Tatlı Prensini düşünüyordu. Onu daha da rahat düşünebilmek için ondan hiç söz etmiyor, James’in binip gideceği gemi, gideceği yerde mutlaka bulacağı altınlar, kötü yerlilerin elinden kurtaracağı zengin ve şahane kız üstüne çene çalıp duruyordu. Çünkü Jim tayfa olarak kalacak değildi. Ne münasebet! Tayfaların yaşantısı feciydi. Düşünsene, pis bir gemiye tıkılıp kalmışsın, dışarıda uğultulu, kambur dalgalar içeri girmeye savaşıyor, kapkara bir rüzgâr direkleri alaşağı ederek yelkenleri uzun uzun, çığlık çığlık şeritler halinde biçiyor! Yok, James, Melbourne’a gelince gemiden ayrılacak, kaptana nazikçe veda edecek, sonra dosdoğru altın madenlerinin yolunu tutacaktı. Daha bir hafta olmadan, kocaman, katıksız bir altın külçesi bulacaktı, şimdiye değin bulunmuş külçelerin en büyüğü ve bunu, altı atlı polisin korumasındaki kapalı bir arabayla kıyıya getirecekti. Yerliler onlara üç saldırıda bulunacak ve müthiş kanlar dökülerek püskürtüleceklerdi. Ama yok, James altın madenlerine falan da gitmeyecekti. Adamların içip içip sarhoş olarak barlarda birbirlerini vurdukları, kötü dil kullandıkları iğrenç yerlerdi oraları. James akıllı uslu bir koyun çiftliği işletecekti. Bir akşamüzeri at sırtında evine dönerken o güzel, zengin kızın siyah ata binmiş bir haydut tarafından kaçırıldığını görecek, hemen peşlerine düşüp kızı kurtaracaktı. Kız ona, o da kıza gönül vereceklerdi doğallıkla; evlenecekler, sonra buraya dönüp Londra’da, koskocaman bir evde yaşayacaklardı. Evet, James’i çok güzel şeyler bekliyordu. Ne var ki başlangıçta çok uslu davranması gerekti; öfkeye kapılmamalı, parasını çarçur etmemeliydi. Sibyl ondan yalnızca bir yaş büyüktü, gene de hayatı çok daha iyi tanıyordu. Sonra James ona mutlaka her postayla yazmalı, her akşam yatınca dualarını okumalıydı. Tanrı çok iyi yürekliydi, ona mutlaka göz kulak olacaktı. Sibyl de onun için dua edecekti ve birkaç yıl sonra James eni konu zengin ve mutlu durumda dönüp gelecekti.
es: Jim fruncía el ceño de cuando en cuando al sorprender la mirada inquisitiva de algún desconocido. Sentía, ante las miradas insistentes, el desagrado que los genios sólo conocen ya tarde en la vida, y que siempre acompaña a las personas corrientes. Sibyl, sin embargo, no se daba cuenta en absoluto del efecto que causaba. El amor le temblaba en los labios en forma de risa. Pensaba en el príncipe azul y, para poder hacerlo con mayor libertad, se lanzó a parlotear sobre el barco en el que Jim iba a hacerse a la mar, sobre el oro que sin duda encontraría, sobre la maravillosa heredera cuya vida salvaría de los malvados bandidos de camisa roja. Porque no seguiría siendo marinero, o sobrecargo, o lo que fuese que hiciera a bordo. ¡No, no! La existencia de un marinero era espantosa. Qué absurdo encerrarse en un horrible barco que las grupas monstruosas de las olas trataban de invadir, mientras un viento aciago derribaba mástiles y rasgaba velas hasta convertirlas en largos colgajos desmelenados y rugientes. Sin duda, Jim abandonaría la nave en Melbourne, se despediría cortésmente del capitán y se pondría en camino hacia las explotaciones auríferas. Antes de que transcurriese una semana habría encontrado una enorme pepita, la mayor jamás descubierta, y la transportaría hasta la costa en una carreta protegida por seis policías a caballo. Los salteadores los atacarían tres veces, y serían rechazados con inmensas pérdidas. O mejor, no. No iría a las explotaciones auríferas, que eran unos sitios horribles, donde los hombres se emborrachaban y se peleaban a tiros en los bares y decían palabras malsonantes. Se dedicaría a criar ovejas y, una noche, cuando regresara a su casa a caballo, al ver a la bella heredera, raptada por un ladrón con un caballo negro, los daría caza y la rescataría. Por supuesto la muchacha se enamoraría de él, y él de ella, se casarían, volverían a Inglaterra y vivirían en una inmensa casa londinense. Sí, le esperaban aventuras maravillosas. Pero tenía que ser muy bueno, y no enfadarse, ni gastarse el dinero tontamente. Sibyl sólo era un año mayor que Jim, pero sabía mucho más sobre la vida. También tenía que escribirle siempre que hubiera correo, y decir sus oraciones todas las noches antes de acostarse. Dios era muy bueno y cuidaría de él. También ella rezaría por él, y al cabo de muy pocos años regresaría, muy rico ya y muy feliz.
vi_translation: Jim occasionally grimaced when he caught the curious gaze of some stranger. He had that trait of disliking being stared at, which often emerges in geniuses in their later years, and never abandons ordinary people. Sibyl, however, was completely unaware of the impression she made. Her love was trembling in the smile on her lips. She was thinking about Prince Charming, and, so that she could think about him even more, she didn't talk about him but continued to chatter about the ship Jim would sail on to the open sea, the gold he was sure to find, the wonderful heiress he would save from the hands of the evil brigands, dressed in red shirts. For he was no longer a sailor, or a seller and transporter of goods, or whatever he was about to become. Oh, no! The life of a sailor was truly dreadful. Just imagine being confined in a dreadful ship, with the hunchbacked waves, roaring hoarsely, trying to break in, and a black wind toppling the masts, tearing the sails into long, howling shreds! He had left the ship in Melbourne, politely bid farewell to the captain, and immediately dashed off to the goldfields. Less than a week had passed before he found an enormous gold nugget, the largest nugget ever discovered, and brought it down to the coast in a wagon guarded by six mounted policemen. The brigands attacked them three times and were defeated in an extremely brutal massacre. Oh, no. He would not go to the goldfields at all. They were dreadful places, where people got drunk, shot each other in saloons, and used foul language. He would become a kind shepherd, and one afternoon, while riding home, he would see a beautiful heiress being kidnapped by a bandit on a black horse, and he would chase after and rescue her. Of course, she would fall in love with him, and he with her, and then they would marry, return to their homeland, and live in a vast mansion in London. Yes, there were interesting things awaiting him there. But he had to be very good, not lose his temper or spend foolishly. She was only one year older than him, but she understood life much better. He also had to make sure to write to her with every mail, and say his prayers every night before he went to sleep. God was very merciful and would protect him. She would also pray for him, and after a few years, he would return, rich and happy.
tr_translation: James would frown whenever he caught the curious gaze of a stranger. He never liked being looked at; this is something that comes to geniuses in their later years, but never leaves ordinary people alone. However, Sibyl was completely unaware of the effect she had on those around her. The love in her heart trembled on her lips as laughter. The young girl was thinking about her Sweet Prince. To think of him more comfortably, she never spoke of him, instead chattering about the ship James would board, the gold he would surely find at his destination, and the rich and magnificent girl he would rescue from the hands of bad natives. Because Jim was not going to remain a sailor. No way! The life of sailors was terrible. Just think, you're stuck on a filthy ship, outside the roaring, humped waves are trying to break in, a pitch-black wind is toppling the masts and tearing the sails into long, screaming strips! No, when James arrived in Melbourne, he would leave the ship, bid the captain a polite farewell, and then head straight for the gold mines. Within a week, he would find a huge, pure gold nugget, the largest nugget ever found, and he would bring it to the shore in a closed carriage protected by six mounted policemen. The natives would attack them three times and be repelled with great bloodshed. But no, James would not go to the gold mines either. Those were disgusting places where men got drunk and shot each other in bars, using foul language. James would run a sensible and well-behaved sheep farm. One evening, while returning home on horseback, he would see that beautiful, rich girl being kidnapped by a bandit on a black horse, and he would immediately chase after them and rescue the girl. Of course, the girl would fall in love with him, and he with her; they would get married, then return here and live in a huge house in London. Yes, very beautiful things awaited James. However, at the beginning, he had to behave very well; he should not get angry or squander his money. Sibyl was only a year older than him, yet she knew life much better. Then James had to write to her with every mail, and say his prayers every night before bed. God was very kind-hearted and would surely watch over him. Sibyl would also pray for him and a few years later, James would return very rich and happy.
es_translation: Jim frowned from time to time when he caught the inquisitive gaze of a stranger. He felt, in the face of the insistent stares, the displeasure that geniuses only know late in life, and that always accompanies ordinary people. Sibyl, however, was completely unaware of the effect she caused. Love trembled on her lips in the form of laughter. She thought of the blue prince and, to be able to do so more freely, she started to chatter about the ship on which Jim was going to set sail, about the gold he would undoubtedly find, about the wonderful heiress whose life he would save from the evil red-shirted bandits. Because he would not remain a sailor, or a purser, or whatever it was he did on board. No, no! The life of a sailor was dreadful. How absurd to be confined in a horrible ship that the monstrous crests of the waves tried to invade, while a sinister wind knocked down masts and tore sails until they became long, disheveled, roaring rags. Without a doubt, Jim would leave the ship in Melbourne, politely bid farewell to the captain, and set off for the goldfields. Before a week had passed, he would have found a huge nugget, the largest ever discovered, and he would transport it to the coast in a cart protected by six mounted policemen. The robbers would attack them three times, and they would be repelled with immense losses. Or better yet, no. He would not go to the goldfields, which were horrible places where men got drunk and fought with guns in the bars and said foul words. He would raise sheep and, one night, when he returned home on horseback, upon seeing the beautiful heiress, kidnapped by a thief on a black horse, he would chase them and rescue her. Of course, the girl would fall in love with him, and he with her, they would marry, return to England, and live in a huge London house. Yes, wonderful adventures awaited him. But he had to be very good, and not get angry, nor spend his money foolishly. Sibyl was only a year older than Jim, but she knew much more about life. He also had to write to her whenever there was mail, and say his prayers every night before going to bed. God was very good and would take care of him. She would also pray for him, and in a very few years, he would return, very rich and very happy.

en: The lad listened sulkily to her and made no answer. He was heart-sick at leaving home.
vi: Chàng trai rầu rĩ nghe nàng, không đáp lại. Cậu đang chán vì phải xa nhà.
tr: James onu asık yüzle dinliyor, karşılık vermiyordu. Evinden, memleketinden ayrılacağı için yüreği yanıyordu.
es: El muchacho la escuchó hoscamente y no hizo ningún comentario. Se le partía el corazón al pensar en abandonar su hogar.
vi_translation: The young man listened to her gloomily, not responding. He was feeling down because he had to be away from home.
tr_translation: James was listening with a sullen face, not responding. His heart was aching because he was going to leave his home and homeland.
es_translation: The boy listened to her sullenly and made no comment. His heart broke at the thought of leaving his home.

en: Yet it was not this alone that made him gloomy and morose. Inexperienced though he was, he had still a strong sense of the danger of Sibyl’s position. This young dandy who was making love to her could mean her no good. He was a gentleman, and he hated him for that, hated him through some curious race-instinct for which he could not account, and which for that reason was all the more dominant within him. He was conscious also of the shallowness and vanity of his mother’s nature, and in that saw infinite peril for Sibyl and Sibyl’s happiness. Children begin by loving their parents; as they grow older they judge them; sometimes they forgive them.
vi: Tuy nhiên không phải chỉ riêng chuyện này khiến cậu buồn rầu. Dẫu thiếu kinh nghiệm, nhưng cậu vẫn có cảm giác rất bất an về sự nguy hiểm trong tình thế của Sibyl. Gã công tử bột này, kẻ đang tán tỉnh chị ấy, có thể có ý định không tốt với chị ấy. Gã là một quý nhân, và cậu ghét gã vì điều ấy, ghét gã do một bản năng đẳng cấp lạ lùng nào đó mà cậu không thể nào biện giải, và vì lẽ đó nên nó lại càng chi phối cậu. Cậu cũng nhận thức được về tính nông cạn và phù phiếm trong bản chất mẹ cậu, và trong ấy cậu thấy hiểm họa vô tận với Sibyl và hạnh phúc của Sibyl. Trẻ con bắt đầu bằng việc yêu cha mẹ; lúc chúng lớn lên thì chúng phán xét họ; đôi khi chúng tha thứ cho họ.
tr: Onu böyle keyifsiz, asık suratlı yapan yalnızca bu değildi. Henüz toy olmakla birlikte Sibyl’in içinde bulunduğu tehlikenin farkındaydı. Sibyl’in peşinden koşan şu genç sosyete züppesi iyi niyetli olamazdı. Kibar bir beyefendiydi ve James ona bu yüzden diş biliyor, aklının ermediği, bu yüzden daha şiddetli hissettiği tuhaf bir içgüdüyle kin besliyordu. Delikanlı aynı zamanda annesinin doğasındaki sığlıkla kibrin de ayırdındaydı; bunda Sibyl için, Sibyl’in mutluluğu için büyük bir tehlike görüyordu. Çocuklar başlangıçta ana babalarını severler, büyüdükçe yargılarlar ve kimileyin bağışlarlar.
es: Pero no era sólo eso lo que le deprimía y ponía de mal humor. Pese a su falta de experiencia, se daba cuenta con toda claridad de los peligros de la situación de Sibyl. Aquel joven dandi que le hacía la corte no le traería la felicidad. Era un caballero y lo aborrecía por eso, con una extraña repugnancia instintiva que no sabía explicar y que, por esa misma razón, resultaba aún más imperiosa. Tampoco se le ocultaba la superficialidad y vanidad de su madre, y advertía en ello un peligro infinito para Sibyl y para su felicidad. Los hijos comienzan la vida amando a sus padres; al hacerse mayores, los juzgan, y en ocasiones los perdonan.
vi_translation: However, it was not just this matter that made him troubled. Despite his lack of experience, he still had a very uneasy feeling about the danger in Sibyl's situation. This dandy, who was courting her, might have bad intentions towards her. He was a nobleman, and he hated him for that, hated him due to some strange class instinct that he could not explain, and for that reason, it dominated him even more. He was also aware of the shallowness and frivolity in his mother's nature, and in that he saw endless danger for Sibyl and Sibyl's happiness. Children begin by loving their parents; as they grow older, they judge them; sometimes they forgive them.
tr_translation: It wasn't just this that made him so joyless and sullen. Although still inexperienced, he was aware of the danger Sibyl was in. The young society dandy chasing after Sibyl couldn't have good intentions. He was a polite gentleman, and James resented him for this, harboring a strange instinctive grudge that he didn't fully understand, which made him feel it more intensely. The young man was also aware of the shallowness and arrogance in his mother's nature; he saw great danger in this for Sibyl, for Sibyl's happiness. Children initially love their parents, as they grow, they judge them, and sometimes they forgive them.
es_translation: But it was not just that which depressed him and put him in a bad mood. Despite his lack of experience, he was fully aware of the dangers of Sibyl's situation. That young dandy who was courting her would not bring her happiness. He was a gentleman and he loathed him for that, with a strange instinctive repugnance that he could not explain and which, for that very reason, was even more compelling. He was also not blind to the superficiality and vanity of her mother, and he saw in that an infinite danger for Sibyl and her happiness. Children begin life loving their parents; as they grow older, they judge them, and sometimes they forgive them.

en: His mother! He had something on his mind to ask of her, something that he had brooded on for many months of silence. A chance phrase that he had heard at the theatre, a whispered sneer that had reached his ears one night as he waited at the stage-door, had set loose a train of horrible thoughts. He remembered it as if it had been the lash of a hunting-crop across his face. His brows knit together into a wedge-like furrow, and with a twitch of pain he bit his underlip.
vi: Mẹ cậu! Trong lòng cậu có điều này muốn hỏi mẹ, một điều mà cậu đã ấp ủ suốt nhiều tháng im lặng. Một câu nói tình cờ mà cậu nghe thấy trong nhà hát, mội lời xì xào chế nhạo vang đến tai cậu một đêm nọ lúc cậu đợi ở cửa vào sân khấu, đã giải phóng một dòng suy tư khủng khiếp. Cậu nhớ nó như thể nó từng là cú quất roi ngựa ngang mặt cậu. Cặp lông mày cậu nhíu lại với nhau thành một nếp nhăn như chiếc nêm, và với một cú co rúm đau đớn, cậu cắn lên môi dưới.
tr: Annesi! James’in aklında annesine sormak istediği bir şey vardı, aylardır sessiz sedasız kafasını kurcalamakta olan bir şey. Tiyatroda kulağına çalınan birkaç söz, bir gece kulis kapısında beklerken duyduğu birkaç küçümser alay, zihninde korkunç bir düşünceler zinciri başlatmıştı. Delikanlı bunu, yüzüne inmiş bir kırbaç vuruşuymuş gibi hatırlıyordu. Kaşlarını çatınca alnının ortasında iki derin çizgi oluştu ve James bir acı ifadesiyle dudağını dişledi.
es: ¡Su madre! Había algo que quería preguntarle y que le obsesionaba, algo sobre lo que llevaba muchos meses cavilando en silencio. Una frase casual que había oído en el teatro, un susurro burlón, que llegó una noche hasta sus oídos mientras esperaba junto a la salida de artistas, habían puesto en marcha una horrible cadena de pensamientos. Lo recordaba como un golpe de fusta en pleno rostro. Frunció el ceño formando un surco muy profundo y con un estremecimiento doloroso se mordió los labios.
vi_translation: Mom! In your heart, you have something you want to ask your mom, something you have been holding onto for many months in silence. A casual remark you overheard in the theater, a mocking whisper that reached your ears one night while you were waiting at the stage door, unleashed a terrible stream of thoughts. You remember it as if it were a whip lash across your face. Your eyebrows furrowed together into a wedge-shaped wrinkle, and with a painful grimace, you bit your lower lip.
tr_translation: Mother! There was something James wanted to ask his mother, something that had been quietly bothering him for months. A few words overheard in the theater, a few mocking remarks he heard while waiting at the backstage door one night, had started a terrible chain of thoughts in his mind. The young man remembered it as if it were a whip strike across his face. When he frowned, two deep lines formed in the middle of his forehead, and James bit his lip with an expression of pain.
es_translation: His mother! There was something he wanted to ask her that obsessed him, something he had been pondering in silence for many months. A casual phrase he had heard at the theater, a mocking whisper that reached his ears one night while he waited by the artists' exit, had set off a horrible chain of thoughts. He remembered it like a whip strike across his face. He frowned deeply, forming a very deep furrow, and with a painful shudder, he bit his lips.

en: “You are not listening to a word I am saying, Jim,” cried Sibyl, “and I am making the most delightful plans for your future. Do say something.”
vi: “Em chẳng chịu nghe lời nào chị nói, Jim,” Sibyl la lên, “mà chị đang lập các kế hoạch thú vị nhất cho tương lai em đấy. Nói gì đi chứ.”
tr: Sibyl, “Söylediklerimin tek kelimesini bile dinlemiyorsun!” diye sızlandı. “Oysa ben senin geleceğine ilişkin ne parlak tasarımlar kuruyorum! Ne olur, bir şey söyle.
es: —No escuchas una sola palabra de lo que digo, Jim —exclamó Sibyl—, a pesar de que hago los planes más maravillosos para tu futuro. Haz el favor de hablarme.
vi_translation: "You don't listen to anything I say, Jim," Sibyl cried, "and I'm making the most exciting plans for your future." "Say something."
tr_translation: Sibyl complained, "You are not listening to a single word I say!" "Yet I am making such brilliant plans for your future! Please, say something."
es_translation: —You don't listen to a single word I say, Jim —exclaimed Sibyl—, even though I make the most wonderful plans for your future. Please do me the favor of talking to me.

en: “What do you want me to say?”
vi: “Chị muốn em nói gì?”
tr: “Ne söyleyeyim istiyorsun?
es: —¿Qué quieres que diga?
vi_translation: “What do you want me to say?” “Oh!
tr_translation: “What do you want me to say?”
es_translation: —What do you want me to say?

en: “Oh! that you will be a good boy and not forget us,” she answered, smiling at him.
vi: “Ôi! Rằng em sẽ là một cậu bé ngoan, và không quên cả nhà,” nàng trả lời, cười với cậu.
tr: Sibyl kardeşine bakıp gülümseyerek, “Hiç, uslu duracağını, bizi unutmayacağını söyle,” diye yanıtladı.
es: —Pues que vas a ser un buen chico y que no te olvidarás de nosotras —respondió su hermana, sonriéndole.
vi_translation: That you will be a good boy, and not forget the whole family,” she replied, smiling at him.
tr_translation: Sibyl looked at her brother and smiled, "Just tell him to behave and not forget us," she replied.
es_translation: —Well, you're going to be a good boy and you won't forget about us —replied his sister, smiling at him.

en: He shrugged his shoulders. “You are more likely to forget me than I am to forget you, Sibyl.”
vi: Cậu nhún vai. “Chắc chị quên em thì đúng hơn là em quên chị, Sibyl.”
tr: Sibyl kardeşine bakıp gülümseyerek, “Hiç, uslu duracağını, bizi unutmayacağını söyle,” diye yanıtladı. James omuz silkti. “Benim seni unutmamamdan çok, sen beni unutursun, Sibyl.
es: Jim se encogió de hombros. —Será más fácil que tú te olvides de mí que yo de ti.
vi_translation: He shrugged. “It's more likely that you forgot me than I forgot you, Sibyl.”
tr_translation: James shrugged his shoulders. "It's more likely that you will forget me than I will forget you, Sibyl."
es_translation: Jim shrugged. —It will be easier for you to forget me than for me to forget you.

en: She flushed. “What do you mean, Jim?” she asked.
vi: Nàng đỏ mặt. “Em có ý gì, Jim?” nàng hỏi.
tr: Genç kız pespembe kesildi. “Ne demek yani, Jim?
es: Sibyl se ruborizó. —¿Qué quieres decir? —preguntó.
vi_translation: She blushed. "What do you mean, Jim?" she asked.
tr_translation: The young girl turned bright pink. “What do you mean, Jim?””
es_translation: Sibyl blushed. —What do you mean? —he asked.

en: “You have a new friend, I hear. Who is he? Why have you not told me about him? He means you no good.”
vi: “Chị có bạn mới rồi, em nghe thế. Anh ta là ai? Sao chị không kể cho em về anh ta? Anh ta không có ý tốt với chị.”
tr: “Yeni bir arkadaşın varmış diye duydum. Kimdir bu?.. Neden bana hiç anlatmadın onu? Onun sana karşı olan niyetleri hiç iyi değil.
es: —Tienes un nuevo amigo, según he oído. ¿Quién es? ¿Por qué no me has hablado de él? No te hará ningún bien.
vi_translation: "You have a new friend, I heard that." "Who is he? Why didn't you tell me about him?" "He doesn't have good intentions towards you."
tr_translation: “I heard you have a new friend. Who is this?.. Why have you never told me about them? Their intentions towards you are not good at all.”
es_translation: —You have a new friend, according to what I've heard. Who is it? Why haven't you told me about him? He won't do you any good.

en: “Stop, Jim!” she exclaimed. “You must not say anything against him. I love him.”
vi: “Thôi, Jim!” nàng la lên. “Em không nên nói gì chống lại anh ấy. Chị yêu anh ấy.”
tr: Kız, “Dur, Jim!” dedi. “Onu kötüleyen hiçbir şey söyleme. Onu seviyorum.
es: —¡No sigas, Jim! —exclamó—. No digas nada contra él. Lo quiero.
vi_translation: “Stop, Jim!” she exclaimed. “I shouldn't say anything against him. I love him.”
tr_translation: The girl said, "Stop, Jim!" "Don't say anything bad about him. I love him."
es_translation: —Don't continue, Jim! —he exclaimed—. Don't say anything against him. I love him.

en: “Why, you don’t even know his name,” answered the lad. “Who is he? I have a right to know.”
vi: “Tại sao, thậm chí chị còn chưa biết tên anh ta,” chàng trai trả lời. “Anh ta là ai? Em có quyền được biết.”
tr: Çocuk, “Kuzum, adını bile bilmiyorsun onun,” diye karşılık verdi. “Kimdir bu adam? Bilmek benim hakkım.
es: —¡Cómo es posible! Ni siquiera sabes su nombre —respondió el muchacho—. ¿Quién es? Tengo derecho a saberlo.
vi_translation: “Why, you don't even know his name yet,” the young man replied. “Who is he? I have the right to know.”
tr_translation: The child replied, "My dear, you don't even know his name." "Who is this man? It's my right to know."
es_translation: —How is it possible! You don't even know his name —the boy replied—. Who is he? I have the right to know.

en: “He is called Prince Charming. Don’t you like the name. Oh! you silly boy! you should never forget it. If you only saw him, you would think him the most wonderful person in the world. Some day you will meet him—when you come back from Australia. You will like him so much. Everybody likes him, and I ... love him. I wish you could come to the theatre to-night. He is going to be there, and I am to play Juliet. Oh! how I shall play it! Fancy, Jim, to be in love and play Juliet! To have him sitting there! To play for his delight! I am afraid I may frighten the company, frighten or enthrall them. To be in love is to surpass one’s self. Poor dreadful Mr. Isaacs will be shouting ‘genius’ to his loafers at the bar. He has preached me as a dogma; to-night he will announce me as a revelation. I feel it. And it is all his, his only, Prince Charming, my wonderful lover, my god of graces. But I am poor beside him. Poor? What does that matter? When poverty creeps in at the door, love flies in through the window. Our proverbs want rewriting. They were made in winter, and it is summer now; spring-time for me, I think, a very dance of blossoms in blue skies.”
vi: “Anh ấy tên là Hoàng tử Quyến rũ. Em có thích cái tên ấy không? Ôi! Em là cậu bé ngốc nghếch! Em không bao giờ được quên nó. Chỉ cần em thấy anh ấy thôi, em sẽ nghĩ anh ấy là người tuyệt nhất trên đời. Một ngày nào đó em sẽ gặp anh ấy: khi em quay về từ Úc. Em sẽ thích anh ấy lắm. Ai ai cũng thích anh ấy, và chị… yêu anh ấy. Chị mong em có thể đến nhà hát đêm nay. Anh ấy sẽ đến đó, và chị sẽ đóng vai Juliet. Ôi! Sao chị có thể đóng vai ấy được đây! Tưởng tượng xem, Jim, đang yêu mà đóng vai Juliet! Có anh ấy ngồi đó! Đóng cho anh ấy vui! Chị sợ là chị có thể làm khách sợ, làm họ sợ hoặc mê hoặc họ. Yêu là vượt qua chính mình. Mít-tơ Isaacs đáng thương dễ sợ ấy sẽ hét lên ‘thiên tài’ với bọn vô công rồi nghề ở quán rượu. Anh ấy đã ca tụng chị như một tín điều; đêm nay anh ấy sẽ tuyên bố chị như một sự thiên khải. Chị cảm thấy điều ấy. Và điều ấy là của anh ấy hết, chỉ của anh ấy thôi, Hoàng tử Quyến rũ, người tình tuyệt vời của chị, vị thần sắc đẹp của chị. Nhưng chị quá nghèo so với anh ấy. Nghèo? Thì đã sao? Khi cái nghèo len lén vào đến cửa đi, thì tình yêu bay vào qua cửa sổ. Sách cách ngôn của ta cần viết lại. Chúng được tạo ra vào mùa đông, mà bây giờ là mùa hè; không, chị nghĩ với chị đang là mùa xuân, một vũ điệu hoa thực sự trên trời xanh.”
tr: “Adı Tatlı Prens. Sevmedin mi bu adı? Ay, saçma çocuk! Hiç unutma bunu. Bir görsen, sen de ona dünyanın en fevkalade insanı dersin. Bir gün tanışacaksın onunla. Avustralya’dan döndüğün zaman. Öyle seveceksin ki onu! Herkes bayılıyor ona, ben de... seviyorum. Keşke bu gece tiyatroya gelebilsen. O gelecek, ben de Juliet’i oynayacağım. Bilsen nasıl oynayacağım Juliet’i! Jim, bir düşünsene, âşık olmak ve Juliet’i oynamak! Onun da orada oturduğunu bilmek! Onu umutlandırmak için oynamak! Seyircileri ürküteceğimden korkuyorum: Ürküteceğim ya da büyüleyeceğim. Âşık olmak demek insanın kendi kendini aşması demek. O zavallı, çirkin mr Isaacs bardaki aylak arkadaşlarına benim dehamdan söz edecek. Benim üstüme ne vaazlar verdi, bir dogma imişim gibi! Bu gece bir sanrı olduğumu âleme ilan edecek! İliklerimde hissediyorum bunu. Hepsi de onun eseri, Tatlı Prensimin, şahane aşkım benim, bütün lütufların tanrısı. Onun yanında çok yoksulum ben. Yoksul mu? Ne önemi var? Yok kapıdan girince aşk pencereden kaçar. Özdeyişlerimizin yeniden yazılması gerekiyor. Kışın yazılmış bunlar, oysa şimdi yaz, hatta benim için hâlâ bahar, meyve çiçeklerinin mavi göğe karşı yaptıkları bir dans.
es: —Se llama príncipe azul. ¿No te gusta? ¡Vamos, no seas tonto! No debes olvidarlo nunca. Si lo vieras, te darías cuenta de que es la persona más maravillosa del mundo. Algún día lo conocerás, cuando vuelvas de Australia. Te gustará mucho. Le gusta a todo el mundo; y yo.... yo lo quiero. Ojalá pudieras venir esta noche al teatro. Estará allí, y yo voy a hacer de Julieta. ¡Ah, cómo interpretaré mi papel! ¡Imagínate, Jim! ¡Estar enamorada e interpretar a Julieta! ¡Tenerlo allí, viéndome! ¡Interpretar para darle gusto! Tengo miedo de asustar a la compañía, de asustarlos o de cautivarlos. Amar es superarse. Ese pobre y terrible señor Isaacs se hará lenguas de mi talento ante los holgazanes de su bar. Me ha predicado como un dogma; esta noche me anunciará como una revelación. Lo adivino. Y es todo suyo, únicamente suyo, de mi príncipe azul, mi enamorado maravilloso, mi dador divino de todas las gracias. Pero soy pobre a su lado. ¿Pobre? ¿Qué importa eso? Si la pobreza llama humildemente a la puerta, el amor entra por la ventana. Hay que volver a escribir nuestros refranes. Se hicieron en invierno, y ahora estamos en verano; primavera para mí, creo yo, un baile de botones de rosa en un cielo azul.
vi_translation: "His name is Prince Charming. Do you like that name? Oh! You are such a silly boy! You must never forget it. Just by seeing him, you will think he is the most wonderful person in the world. One day you will meet him: when you return from Australia. You will like him very much. Everyone likes him, and I... love him. I wish you could come to the theater tonight. He will be there, and I will play Juliet. Oh! How can I play that role! Imagine, Jim, being in love and playing Juliet! With him sitting there! Acting to please him! I fear I might frighten the audience, either scare them or enchant them. To love is to surpass oneself. Poor Mr. Isaacs will shout 'genius' to the idlers at the pub. He has praised me like a creed; tonight he will declare me a revelation. I feel it. And it is all for him, only for him, Prince Charming, my wonderful lover, my god of beauty. But I am too poor for him. Poor? So what? When poverty creeps in at the door, love flies in through the window. Our book of proverbs needs to be rewritten. They were made in winter, but now it is summer; no, I think for me it is spring, a true dance of flowers in the blue sky."
tr_translation: "His name is Sweet Prince. Didn't you like this name? Oh, silly child! Never forget this. If you saw him, you too would say he is the most extraordinary person in the world. One day you will meet him. When you return from Australia. You will love him so much! Everyone adores him, and I... love him too. I wish you could come to the theater tonight. He will come, and I will play Juliet. If only you knew how I will play Juliet! Jim, just think about it, being in love and playing Juliet! Knowing that he is sitting there! Acting to give him hope! I am afraid I will either scare or enchant the audience. Being in love means surpassing oneself. That poor, ugly Mr. Isaacs will talk about my genius to his idle friends at the bar. How many sermons he has given about me, as if I were a dogma! Tonight he will declare to the world that I am an illusion! I feel it in my bones. It is all because of him, my Sweet Prince, my magnificent love, the god of all graces. Next to him, I am very poor. Poor? What does it matter? When poverty enters through the door, love flies out the window. Our proverbs need to be rewritten. They were written in winter, but now it is summer, even still spring for me, a dance of fruit blossoms against the blue sky."
es_translation: —He's called Prince Charming. Don't you like him? Come on, don't be silly! You must never forget him. If you saw him, you would realize that he is the most wonderful person in the world. Someday you'll meet him, when you return from Australia. You will like him a lot. Everyone likes him; and I... I love him. I wish you could come to the theater tonight. He will be there, and I am going to play Juliet. Ah, how I will perform my role! Imagine, Jim! Being in love and playing Juliet! Having him there, watching me! Performing to please him! I'm afraid of scaring the company, of scaring them or captivating them. To love is to surpass oneself. That poor and terrible Mr. Isaacs will rave about my talent to the loafers in his bar. He has preached me as a dogma; tonight he will announce me as a revelation. I foresee it. And it is all his, only his, my Prince Charming, my wonderful lover, my divine giver of all graces. But I am poor beside him. Poor? What does that matter? If poverty humbly knocks at the door, love enters through the window. We need to rewrite our proverbs. They were made in winter, and now we are in summer; spring for me, I think, a dance of rosebuds in a blue sky.

en: “He is a gentleman,” said the lad sullenly.
vi: “Anh ta là quý nhân,” chàng trai nói, rầu rĩ.
tr: Kardeşi asık yüzle, “Bir beyefendiymiş,” dedi.
es: —Es un caballero —dijo el muchacho con resentimiento.
vi_translation: "He is a nobleman," the young man said, dejectedly.
tr_translation: His brother said with a sullen face, "He was a gentleman."
es_translation: —He is a gentleman —said the boy resentfully.

en: “A prince!” she cried musically. “What more do you want?”
vi: “Một hoàng tử!” nàng kêu lên, thánh thót. “Em còn muốn gì nữa nào?”
tr: Kız, “Bir prens!” diye bağırdı, şarkı gibi bir sesle. “Daha ne istiyorsun?
es: —¡Un príncipe! —exclamó ella, su voz llena de música—. ¿Qué más se necesita?
vi_translation: “A prince!” she exclaimed, melodiously. "What else do you want?"
tr_translation: The girl shouted, "A prince!" in a voice like a song. "What more do you want?"
es_translation: —A prince! —she exclaimed, her voice full of music—. What more is needed?

en: “He wants to enslave you.”
vi: “Anh ta muốn biến chị thành nô lệ.
tr: “Seni esir almak istiyor.
es: —Quiere esclavizarte.
vi_translation: “He wants to turn you into a slave.”
tr_translation: “He wants to capture you.”
es_translation: —He wants to enslave you.

en: “I shudder at the thought of being free.”
vi: “Chị rùng mình với ý nghĩ được tự do.”
tr: “Özgürlük düşüncesi ürpertiyor beni.
es: —Me estremece la idea de ser libre.
vi_translation: “She shuddered at the thought of being free.”
tr_translation: “The thought of freedom gives me chills.”
es_translation: —The idea of being free makes me shudder.

en: “I want you to beware of him.”
vi: “Em muốn chị cẩn thận với anh ta.”
tr: “Ondan sakınmanı istiyorum.
es: —Ten cuidado, te lo ruego.
vi_translation: “I want you to be careful with him.”
tr_translation: “I want you to stay away from him.”
es_translation: —Be careful, I beg you.

en: “To see him is to worship him; to know him is to trust him.”
vi: “Thấy anh là thờ anh, biết anh là tin anh.”
tr: “Onu görmek ona tapmak demektir, onu tanımak da ona güvenmek demek.
es: —Verlo es adorarlo, conocerlo es confiar en él.
vi_translation: “Seeing you is to worship you, knowing you is to trust you.”
tr_translation: “To see him is to worship him, and to know him is to trust him.”
es_translation: —To see him is to adore him, to know him is to trust him.

en: “Sibyl, you are mad about him.”
vi: “Sibyl, chị bị điên vì anh ta rồi.”
tr: “Sibyl, deli oluyorsun onun için.
es: —Has perdido la cabeza, Sibyl.
vi_translation: "Sibyl, you are crazy about him."
tr_translation: “Sibyl, you are going mad for him.”
es_translation: —You have lost your mind, Sibyl.

en: She laughed and took his arm. “You dear old Jim, you talk as if you were a hundred. Some day you will be in love yourself. Then you will know what it is. Don’t look so sulky. Surely you should be glad to think that, though you are going away, you leave me happier than I have ever been before. Life has been hard for us both, terribly hard and difficult. But it will be different now. You are going to a new world, and I have found one. Here are two chairs; let us sit down and see the smart people go by.”
vi: Nàng cười và nắm cánh tay cậu. “Jim già đáng yêu ơi, em nói như thể em đã trăm tuổi rồi. Một ngày nào đó chính em sẽ yêu. Lúc đó em sẽ biết nó thế nào. Đừng tỏ vẻ hờn dỗi như vậy. Chắc chắn em nên vui vì nghĩ là mặc dù em sắp đi xa, nhưng em để lại một người chị hạnh phúc hơn bao giờ hết. Cuộc đời từng khắc nghiệt với cả hai chị em mình, quá chừng khắc nghiệt và khó khăn. Nhưng giờ sẽ khác. Em đi đến một thế giới mới, và chị đã tìm được một thế giới. Ở đây có hai cái ghế; mình hãy ngồi xuống và nhìn dân ăn diện qua lại.”
tr: Sibyl gülerek onun koluna girdi. “Benim bir tanecik Jimim, yüz yaşındaymış gibi konuşuyorsun. Günün birinde sen de seveceksin. O zaman anlarsın nasıl olduğunu. Somurtup durma öyle. Sen gidiyorsun ama beni arkanda şimdiye kadar olmadığım kertede mutlu bırakıyorsun: Buna sevinmen gerekmez mi? İkimizin de hayatı çetin geçti, Jim; son derece çetin, zorlu. Ama bundan sonra başka türlü olacak. Sen yepyeni bir dünyaya gidiyorsun, ben de yepyeni bir dünya buldum. Bak, şurada iki yer var, gel oturalım da, şu şık kişilerin gelip geçişini seyredelim.
es: Su hermana se echó a reír y lo tomó del brazo. —Mi querido y maduro Jim, hablas como si tuvieras cien años. Algún día también tú te enamorarás. Entonces sabrás de qué se trata. No pongas ese gesto tan enfurruñado. Debe alegrarte pensar que, aunque tú te vayas, me dejas más feliz que nunca. La vida ha sido dura para nosotros dos, terriblemente dura y difícil. Pero a partir de ahora será diferente. Tú te vas a un mundo nuevo, y yo he descubierto uno. Aquí hay dos sillas libres; vamos a sentarnos y a ver pasar a la gente elegante.
vi_translation: She smiled and took his arm. “Dear old Jim, you talk as if you were a hundred years old. One day you will fall in love yourself. Then you will know what it's like. Don't act so sulky. You should certainly be happy thinking that even though I'm about to go far away, I'm leaving behind a sister who is happier than ever. Life has been harsh to both of us, so harsh and difficult. But now it will be different. I'm going to a new world, and I've found a world. There are two chairs here; let's sit down and watch the well-dressed people go by.”
tr_translation: Sibyl, laughing, took his arm. "My dear Jim, you talk as if you were a hundred years old. One day you will love too. Then you will understand how it is. Don't sulk like that. You are leaving, but you are leaving me happier than I have ever been before: Shouldn't you be glad about that? Both of our lives have been tough, Jim; extremely tough, challenging. But from now on, it will be different. You are going to a brand new world, and I have found a brand new world. Look, there are two seats over there, let's sit down and watch these elegant people passing by."
es_translation: His sister burst out laughing and took him by the arm. —My dear and mature Jim, you talk as if you were a hundred years old. Someday you too will fall in love. Then you will know what it's all about. Don't make that grumpy face. You should be happy to think that, even though you're leaving, you're leaving me happier than ever. Life has been hard for the two of us, terribly hard and difficult. But from now on it will be different. You are going to a new world, and I have discovered one. Here are two empty chairs; let's sit down and watch the elegant people go by.

en: They took their seats amidst a crowd of watchers. The tulip-beds across the road flamed like throbbing rings of fire. A white dust—tremulous cloud of orris-root it seemed—hung in the panting air. The brightly coloured parasols danced and dipped like monstrous butterflies.
vi: Họ ngồi giữa đám đông người ngắm cảnh. Các bồn hoa uất kim hương bên kia đường bừng lên như những chiếc nhẫn lửa rộn ràng. Bụi trắng, y như đám mây phấn rễ diên vĩ rung rinh, lơ lửng trong không khí khát khao. Những chiếc dù rực rỡ sắc màu bập bồng như những con bướm khổng lồ.
tr: Kalabalığın içinde yerlerini aldılar. Yolun karşısındaki lale yatakları ateş halkaları gibi yalazlanıyordu. Sıcaktan soluğu kesilmişe benzeyen havaya, süsen tozunu andıran titrek beyaz bir sis çökmüştü. Parlak renkli şemsiyeler dev kelebekler gibi inip kalkıyordu.
es: Se sentaron en medio de una multitud de ociosos. Los macizos de tulipanes al otro lado de la avenida ardían, convertidos en palpitantes anillos de fuego. Un polvo blanco, se diría una trémula nube de polvo de lirios, flotaba en el aire jadeante. Los parasoles de colores brillantes subían y bajaban como mariposas gigantes.
vi_translation: They sat amidst the crowd of people watching the scenery. The tulip flower beds across the street bloomed like lively rings of fire. White dust, like a cloud of iris root powder, swayed and hovered in the yearning air. The brightly colored umbrellas floated like giant butterflies.
tr_translation: They took their places in the crowd. The tulip beds across the road were flickering like rings of fire. A trembling white mist, resembling iris dust, had settled in the air, which seemed to have lost its breath from the heat. Brightly colored umbrellas were bobbing up and down like giant butterflies.
es_translation: They sat in the midst of a crowd of idlers. The tulip beds on the other side of the avenue burned, turned into throbbing rings of fire. A white dust, it seemed like a trembling cloud of lily dust, floated in the panting air. The bright-colored parasols rose and fell like giant butterflies.

en: She made her brother talk of himself, his hopes, his prospects. He spoke slowly and with effort. They passed words to each other as players at a game pass counters. Sibyl felt oppressed. She could not communicate her joy. A faint smile curving that sullen mouth was all the echo she could win. After some time she became silent. Suddenly she caught a glimpse of golden hair and laughing lips, and in an open carriage with two ladies Dorian Gray drove past.
vi: Nàng bắt em mình kể về bản thân, về những hy vọng, về những mong chờ. Cậu nói chậm và khá là cố gắng. Họ trao lời cho nhau như những người đánh bạc trao phỉnh trong một ván bài. Sibyl thấy nặng nề. Nàng không thể chia sẻ niềm vui của mình. Một nụ cười uể oải bẻ cong cái miệng rầu rĩ ấy là mọi ám hiệu mà nàng có thể nhận được. Một lúc sao, nàng bắt đầu im lặng. Bỗng nhiên nàng thấy loáng thoáng một mái tóc vàng với đôi môi cười, và trong cỗ xe ngựa mui trần, cùng hai quý cô, Dorian Gray chạy qua.
tr: Sibyl kardeşini, kendinden, umutlarından, beklentileriyle olanaklarından konuşmaya yöneltti. Oyuncuların bir maçta pas vermeleri gibi onlar da birbirlerine laf atıp tutuyorlardı. Sibyl’in içine bir ağırlık çökmüştü. Mutluluğunu kardeşine aşılayamıyordu ki! Elde edebildiği tek yankı o somurtuk dudakları büken belli belirsiz bir gülümseyişti. Bir süre sonra sustu. Derken birden, gözüne altın renkli saçlarla gülen dudaklar ilişti ve üstü açık bir arabada, yanında iki hanımla Dorian Gray geçti.
es: Sibyl hizo hablar a su hermano de sí mismo, de sus esperanzas, de sus proyectos. Jim se expresaba lentamente y con dificultad. Fueron pasándose palabras como los jugadores se pasan fichas. Sibyl empezó a deprimirse. No lograba comunicar su alegría. Todos sus esfuerzos no conseguían otro eco que una débil sonrisa en las comisuras de aquella boca adusta. Después de algún tiempo dejó de hablar. De repente vislumbró unos cabellos dorados y unos labios que reían: Dorian Gray pasaba en un coche abierto con dos damas.
vi_translation: She made her brother talk about himself, about his hopes, about his expectations. He spoke slowly and with considerable effort. They exchanged words like gamblers exchanging chips in a card game. Sibyl felt heavy-hearted. She couldn't share her joy. A weary smile that curved her gloomy mouth was the only sign she could give. After a while, she began to fall silent. Suddenly, she caught a glimpse of golden hair and smiling lips, and in an open carriage, along with two ladies, Dorian Gray passed by.
tr_translation: Sibyl directed her brother to talk about himself, his hopes, his expectations, and his possibilities. Like players passing the ball in a game, they were tossing words back and forth to each other. A heaviness settled within Sibyl. She couldn't instill her happiness in her brother! The only response she could get was a barely perceptible smile that curved those sullen lips. After a while, she fell silent. Then suddenly, she caught sight of golden hair and smiling lips, and Dorian Gray passed by in an open car, accompanied by two ladies.
es_translation: Sibyl made her brother talk about himself, his hopes, his plans. Jim expressed himself slowly and with difficulty. They passed words to each other like players pass chips. Sibyl began to feel depressed. She couldn't convey her joy. All her efforts only elicited a faint smile at the corners of that stern mouth. After some time, she stopped talking. Suddenly, she glimpsed some golden hair and laughing lips: Dorian Gray was passing by in an open carriage with two ladies.

en: She started to her feet. “There he is!” she cried.
vi: Nàng đứng phắt dậy. “Anh ấy đấy!” nàng kêu lên.
tr: Sibyl ayağa fırlamıştı. “İşte, o!” diye bağırdı.
es: Sibyl se puso en pie de un salto. —¡Ahí está! —exclamó.
vi_translation: She stood up abruptly. "It's him!" she exclaimed.
tr_translation: Sibyl had jumped to her feet. “There he is!” she shouted.
es_translation: Sibyl jumped to her feet. —There it is! —he exclaimed.

en: “Who?” said Jim Vane.
vi: “Ai?” Jim Vane nói.
tr: “Kim?
es: —¿Quién?
vi_translation: “What?” Jim Vane said.
tr_translation: "Kim?"
es_translation: —Who?

en: “Prince Charming,” she answered, looking after the victoria.
vi: “Hoàng tử Quyến rũ,” nàng trả lời, dõi theo cỗ xe bốn bánh mui xếp.
