tr: Kız, “Victoria” tipi arabanın ardından bakarak, “Tatlı Prens,” diye yanıtladı.
es: —Mi príncipe azul —respondió ella, siguiendo la victoria con la vista.
vi_translation: “Prince Charming,” she replied, watching the four-wheeled convertible carriage.
tr_translation: The girl, looking after the "Victoria" type car, responded, "Sweet Prince."
es_translation: —My Prince Charming —she replied, following the victory with her eyes.

en: He jumped up and seized her roughly by the arm. “Show him to me. Which is he? Point him out. I must see him!” he exclaimed; but at that moment the Duke of Berwick’s four-in-hand came between, and when it had left the space clear, the carriage had swept out of the park.
vi: Cậu nhảy lên, túm mạnh cánh tay nàng. “Chỉ anh ta cho em. Anh ta là người nào? Trỏ anh ta đi. Em phải thấy anh ta!” cậu la lên; nhưng đúng lúc ấy, cỗ xe tứ mã của công tước Berwick chạy xen vào giữa, và khi nó để lại khoảng trống thì cỗ mã xa mui trần kia đã lướt ra khỏi Công viên.
tr: Kardeşi de yerinden fırlayarak hoyratça onun kolunu kavradı. “Göster onu bana. Hangisi? İşaret et. Göreyim onu!” diye bağırdı, ama tam o sırada Berwick Dükü’nün dört atlı arabası araya girdi. Çekilip gittiğinde öbür araba da parktan çıkmış bulunuyordu.
es: También su hermano se puso en pie y la agarró bruscamente por el brazo. —Enséñamelo. ¿Quién es? Señálamelo. ¡Tengo que verlo! —exclamó; pero en aquel momento se interpuso el coche del duque de Berwick, tirado por cuatro caballos, y cuando de nuevo se despejó el horizonte, el otro vehículo había abandonado el parque.
vi_translation: He jumped up, grabbing her arm forcefully. "Show him to me. Who is he? Point him out. I must see him!" he shouted; but at that moment, the Duke of Berwick's four-horse carriage drove in between them, and by the time it left an opening, the open carriage had already glided out of the Park.
tr_translation: His brother also jumped up and roughly grabbed his arm. “Show it to me. Which one? Point it out. Let me see it!” he shouted, but just then the Duke of Berwick's four-horse carriage got in the way. By the time it moved away, the other carriage had already left the park.
es_translation: Her brother also stood up and grabbed her roughly by the arm. —Show it to me. Who is it? Point them out to me. I have to see them! —he exclaimed; but at that moment the Duke of Berwick's carriage, drawn by four horses, came between them, and when the horizon cleared again, the other vehicle had left the park.

en: “I wish I had, for as sure as there is a God in heaven, if he ever does you any wrong, I shall kill him.”
vi: “Em cũng ước gì em đã thấy, vì thề có Chúa trên trời, nếu hắn mà có khi nào làm hại chị thì em sẽ giết hắn.”
tr: “Ben de isterdim onu görmeyi, çünkü, gökteki Tanrı da biliyor ya, bu adam eğer günün birinde sana kötülük edecek olursa ben de onu öldüreceğim.
es: —A mí también me hubiera gustado, porque tan cierto como que hay un Dios en el cielo, si alguna vez te hace daño, lo mataré.
vi_translation: “I also wish I had seen it, because I swear to God in heaven, if he ever harms you, I will kill him.”
tr_translation: “I would also like to see him, because, as God in heaven knows, if this man ever harms you one day, I will kill him too.”
es_translation: —I would have liked it too, because as sure as there is a God in heaven, if he ever hurts you, I will kill him.

en: She looked at him in horror. He repeated his words. They cut the air like a dagger. The people round began to gape. A lady standing close to her tittered.
vi: Nàng sợ hãi nhìn cậu. Cậu nhắc lại lời mình. Chúng cắt không khí ngọt như dao. Mọi người xung quanh bắt đầu há mồm nhòm ngó. Một phụ nữ đứng sát vào nàng và cười khúc khích.
tr: Sibyl kardeşine dehşet içinde bakakaldı. James deminki sözlerini yineledi. Sözleri havayı hançer gibi doğradı sanki. Çevrelerindekiler onlara merakla bakmaya başladılar. Yakında duran bir hanım kıkırdayarak güldü.
es: Su hermana lo miró horrorizada. Jim repitió lo que había dicho, y sus palabras cortaron el aire como un puñal. La gente a su alrededor se quedó boquiabierta. Una señora que estaba muy cerca rió nerviosamente.
vi_translation: She looked at him fearfully. He repeated his words. They cut through the air sweetly like a knife. Everyone around began to gape and stare. A woman stood close to her and giggled.
tr_translation: Sibyl stared at her brother in horror. James repeated his earlier words. His words seemed to cut through the air like a dagger. Those around them began to look at them with curiosity. A lady standing nearby laughed with a giggle.
es_translation: His sister looked at him horrified. Jim repeated what he had said, and his words cut through the air like a dagger. The people around him were left open-mouthed. A lady who was very close by laughed nervously.

en: “Come away, Jim; come away,” she whispered. He followed her doggedly as she passed through the crowd. He felt glad at what he had said.
vi: “Đi nào, Jim; đi nào,” nàng thì thào. Cậu lì lợm bám theo nàng, trong lúc nàng đi xuyên qua đám đông. Cậu thấy vui vì những gì cậu vừa nói.
tr: Sibyl, “Yürü gidelim, Jim, yürü gidelim,” diye fısıldadı. Kalabalığın içinden yol açtı, James de onun ardından yürüdü. Deminki sözleri söylemiş olduğuna seviniyordu.
es: —Vámonos, Jim, vámonos -susurró Sibyl. Él la siguió, sin dejarse intimidar, a través de la multitud. Se alegraba de haber dicho lo que había dicho.
vi_translation: “Let's go, Jim; let's go,” she whispered. He stubbornly followed her as she moved through the crowd. He felt happy about what he had just said.
tr_translation: Sibyl whispered, "Let's go, Jim, let's go." He made his way through the crowd, and James followed him. He was glad he had said those words earlier.
es_translation: —Let's go, Jim, let's go - Sibyl whispered. He followed her, undaunted, through the crowd. He was glad he had said what he had said.

en: When they reached the Achilles Statue, she turned round. There was pity in her eyes that became laughter on her lips. She shook her head at him. “You are foolish, Jim, utterly foolish; a bad-tempered boy, that is all. How can you say such horrible things? You don’t know what you are talking about. You are simply jealous and unkind. Ah! I wish you would fall in love. Love makes people good, and what you said was wicked.”
vi: Khi họ đến chỗ tượng Achilles, nàng quay người lại. Sự thương hại trong mắt nàng chuyển thành tiếng cười trên môi nàng. Nàng lắc đầu với cậu. “Em ngốc lắm, Jim, quá ngốc đi; một cậu bé xấu tính, chỉ thế thôi. Sao em có thể nói những điều kinh khủng như vậy? Em không biết em đang nói về cái gì. Em chỉ biết ghen tị và cay nghiệt. Ôi! Chị mong em sẽ yêu. Tình yêu khiến cho con người trở nên tử tế hơn, và những gì em nói thật độc ác.”
tr: Akhilleus Heykeli’ne geldiklerinde Sibyl kardeşine doğru döndü. Gözlerindeki acıma, dudaklarında gülücüğe dönüşüyordu. Azarlarcasına başını salladı. “Saçmalıyorsun, Jim, resmen saçmalıyorsun. Huysuz çocuğun tekisin, hepsi bu. Nasıl söyleyebilirsin böyle korkunç şeyleri? Ne dediğinden haberin yok. Kıskançsın, hem de kırıcı. Ah, keşke sen de birilerine âşık olsan! Aşk kişiye iyilik aşılıyor, oysa senin söylediklerin hem kötü hem günah.
es: Cuando llegaron a la estatua de Aquiles, Sibyl se volvió hacia su hermano. La piedad de sus ojos se transformó en risa al llegar a los labios. —Estás loco, Jim, completamente loco —le dijo, moviendo la cabeza—; un chico con muy mal genio, eso es todo. ¿Cómo puedes imaginar cosas tan horribles? No sabes lo que dices. Sencillamente tienes celos y eres muy poco amable. ¡Ojalá te enamorases! El amor hace buenas a las personas, y eso que has dicho ha sido una maldad.
vi_translation: When they reached the statue of Achilles, she turned around. The pity in her eyes turned into laughter on her lips. She shook her head at him. "You are so silly, Jim, too silly; a naughty boy, that's all. How can you say such terrible things? You don't know what you're talking about. You are just jealous and bitter. Oh! I hope you will love. Love makes people kinder, and what you said is really cruel."
tr_translation: When they arrived at the Statue of Achilles, Sibyl turned to her brother. The pity in her eyes was turning into a smile on her lips. She shook her head as if scolding him. "You're talking nonsense, Jim, absolute nonsense. You're just a grumpy child, that's all. How can you say such horrible things? You have no idea what you're talking about. You're jealous and hurtful. Oh, I wish you would fall in love with someone! Love instills goodness in a person, whereas what you're saying is both bad and sinful."
es_translation: When they arrived at the statue of Achilles, Sibyl turned to her brother. The pity in her eyes turned into laughter as it reached her lips. —You are crazy, Jim, completely crazy —she said, shaking her head—; a boy with a very bad temper, that's all. How can you imagine such horrible things? You don't know what you're saying. You're simply jealous and very unkind. I wish you would fall in love! Love makes people good, and what you said was mean.

en: “I am sixteen,” he answered, “and I know what I am about. Mother is no help to you. She doesn’t understand how to look after you. I wish now that I was not going to Australia at all. I have a great mind to chuck the whole thing up. I would, if my articles hadn’t been signed.”
vi: “Em đã mười sáu tuổi,” cậu trả lời, “và em biết em nói gì. Mẹ chẳng giúp gì được chị. Mẹ không biết cách trông nom chị. Giờ đây em ước gì mình không đi Úc iếc gì hết. Em đang muốn bỏ tất. Chắc em sẽ làm thế nếu chưa ký các điều khoản hợp đồng.
tr: Kardeşi, “On altı yaşındayım, ne nedir biliyorum,” dedi. “Annemin sana faydası yok. Sana nasıl göz kulak olacağını bilmiyor o. Keşke hiç kalkışmasaydım Avustralya’ya gitmek için! Şeytan diyor tümden vazgeç. Hem de vazgeçerdim ya, kontratlarım imzalandı.
es: —Tengo dieciséis años —respondió Jim—, y sé lo que me digo. Nuestra madre no te ayuda en absoluto. No sabe cómo hay que cuidarte. Preferiría no tener que irme a Australia. Estoy por mandarlo todo a paseo. Lo haría si no hubiera firmado el contrato.
vi_translation: “I am sixteen years old,” he replied, “and I know what I'm saying. Mom can't help you. Mom doesn't know how to take care of you. Now I wish I hadn't gone to Australia at all. I want to quit everything. I would probably do that if I hadn't signed the contract terms.”
tr_translation: His brother said, "I'm sixteen years old, I know what things are." "My mother is of no use to you. She doesn't know how to look after you. I wish I had never tried to go to Australia! The devil says to give it all up. And I would give it up too, but my contracts are signed."
es_translation: —I am sixteen years old —Jim replied—, and I know what I'm talking about. Our mother doesn't help you at all. She doesn't know how to take care of you. I would rather not have to go to Australia. I'm about to throw it all away. I would do it if I hadn't signed the contract.

en: “Oh, don’t be so serious, Jim. You are like one of the heroes of those silly melodramas Mother used to be so fond of acting in. I am not going to quarrel with you. I have seen him, and oh! to see him is perfect happiness. We won’t quarrel. I know you would never harm any one I love, would you?”
vi: “Ôi, đừng quá nghiêm túc thế, Jim. Em như một trong các nhân vật của những vở kịch mê-lô ngây ngô mà mẹ thường thích diễn ấy. Chị sẽ không đi cãi nhau với em. Chị đã thấy anh ấy, và ôi chao! Được thấy anh là một hạnh phúc trọn vẹn. Ta sẽ không cãi nhau nữa. Chị biết em sẽ chẳng bao giờ làm hại bất cứ ai chị yêu, phải không em?”
tr: “Of, bu kadar ciddi olmasana Jim. Hani o aptal melodramlardaki kahramanlara benziyorsun. Hani annem oynamaya bayılırdı ya! Neyse, seninle kavga edecek değilim. Onu gördüm ya! Ah, bilsen, onu görmek katıksız mutluluk. Kavga etmeyeceğiz. Biliyorum, sen benim sevdiğim bir insana asla kötülük edemezsin, öyle değil mi?
es: —No te pongas tan serio, Jim. Eres como uno de los héroes de esos melodramas estúpidos que a nuestra madre tanto le gustaba representar. No me voy a pelear contigo. Lo he visto y verlo es la felicidad perfecta. No reñiremos. Sé que nunca harás daño a alguien a quien yo ame, ¿verdad que no?
vi_translation: “Oh, don't be so serious, Jim. You're like one of the characters in those naive melodramas that mother used to love performing. I won't argue with you. I've seen him, and oh my! Seeing him is a complete happiness. We won't argue anymore. I know you would never harm anyone I love, right?”
tr_translation: “Oh, don't be so serious, Jim. You look like those heroes in silly melodramas. You know, the ones my mother loved to act in! Anyway, I'm not going to fight with you. I saw him! Oh, if you only knew, seeing him is pure happiness. We won't fight. I know, you could never harm someone I love, right?”
es_translation: —Don't be so serious, Jim. You're like one of the heroes from those stupid melodramas that our mother loved to perform. I'm not going to fight with you. I've seen it and seeing it is perfect happiness. We won't quarrel. I know you'll never harm someone I love, will you?

en: “Not as long as you love him, I suppose,” was the sullen answer.
vi: “Chừng nào chị còn yêu hắn thì em cho rằng không,” là câu trả lời rầu rĩ.
tr: James somurtarak, “Sen onu sevdiğin sürece yapamam herhalde,” diye yanıtladı.
es: —No, mientras todavía lo quieras, imagino —fue su hosca respuesta.
vi_translation: “As long as you still love him, I don't think so,” was the gloomy reply.
tr_translation: James replied with a frown, "I guess I can't do it as long as you love him."
es_translation: —No, as long as you still want it, I suppose —was his gruff response.

en: “I shall love him for ever!” she cried.
vi: “Chị sẽ yêu anh ấy mãi!” nàng kêu lên.
tr: Sibyl, “Ben onu sonsuza dek seveceğim!” diye bağırdı.
es: —¡Le querré siempre! —exclamó Sibyl.
vi_translation: “I will love him forever!” she exclaimed.
tr_translation: Sibyl shouted, "I will love him forever!"
es_translation: —I will love him forever! —exclaimed Sibyl.

en: “And he?”
vi: “Còn hắn?”
tr: “Ya o?
es: —¿Y él?
vi_translation: “And him?”
tr_translation: “What about it?”
es_translation: —And him?

en: “For ever, too!”
vi: “Cũng thế, mãi mãi”
tr: “O da sonsuza dek!
es: —¡También siempre!
vi_translation: “The same, forever”
tr_translation: “Forever and ever!””
es_translation: —Always the same!

en: “He had better.”
vi: “Hắn nên thế thì hơn.”
tr: “Sevsin, yoksa kötü olur.
es: —Más le vale.
vi_translation: “He should be like that.”
tr_translation: “Love, or it will be bad.”
es_translation: —He better.

en: She shrank from him. Then she laughed and put her hand on his arm. He was merely a boy.
vi: Nàng lùi ra xa cậu. Rồi nàng cười và đặt bàn tay nàng lên cánh tay cậu. Cậu mới chỉ là đứa trẻ.
tr: Sibyl ondan biraz uzaklaştı. Sonra gülerek koluna girdi. James çocuktu daha.
es: Sibyl se apartó ligeramente de él. Luego se echó a reír y le puso la mano en el brazo. No era más que un niño.
vi_translation: She stepped back from him. Then she smiled and placed her hand on his arm. He was just a child.
tr_translation: Sibyl moved a little away from him. Then, laughing, she took his arm. James was still a child.
es_translation: Sibyl moved slightly away from him. Then she laughed and put her hand on his arm. He was nothing more than a child.

en: At the Marble Arch they hailed an omnibus, which left them close to their shabby home in the Euston Road. It was after five o’clock, and Sibyl had to lie down for a couple of hours before acting. Jim insisted that she should do so. He said that he would sooner part with her when their mother was not present. She would be sure to make a scene, and he detested scenes of every kind.
vi: Tại Cổng vòm Cẩm thạch, họ kêu một chiếc buýt, nó thả họ xuống sát ngôi nhà tồi tàn của họ ở đường Euston. Lúc đó là năm giờ hơn, và Sibyl phải nằm nghỉ đôi ba tiếng trước khi diễn. Jim cứ nhất định đòi nàng làm thế. Cậu bảo rằng cậu thích từ biệt nàng khi mẹ vắng mặt hơn. Mẹ chắc chắn sẽ dựng lên một sân khấu, mà cậu ghét mọi loại sân khấu.
tr: Mermer takın orada bir otobüse bindiler. Euston Sokağı’nda, o yoksul evlerinin yakınında indiler. Saat beşi geçmişti. Sibyl’in sahneye çıkmadan önce birkaç saat yatıp dinlenmesi gerekiyordu. Jim bunda diretti. Onunla annesinden uzakta vedalaşmak istiyordu. Annesi mutlaka bir olay çıkartırdı, Jim de bu tür sahnelerin hepsinden tiksiniyordu.
es: En Marble Arch tomaron un ómnibus que los dejó cerca de su modesto hogar. Eran más de las cinco, y Sibyl tenía que descansar echada un par de horas antes de la representación. Jim insistió en que lo hiciera. Dijo que prefería despedirse de ella cuando su madre no estuviera presente. Con toda seguridad haría una escena, y Jim detestaba cualquier clase de escena.
vi_translation: At the Marble Arch, they hailed a bus, which dropped them off right next to their shabby house on Euston Road. It was past five o'clock, and Sibyl had to rest for a few hours before performing. Jim insisted that she do so. He said that he preferred to say goodbye to her when their mother was absent. Their mother would surely create a scene, and he hated all kinds of scenes.
tr_translation: They took a marble there and boarded a bus. They got off near Euston Street, close to those poor houses. It was past five o'clock. Sibyl needed to lie down and rest for a few hours before going on stage. Jim insisted on this. He wanted to say goodbye to her away from their mother. Their mother would definitely cause a scene, and Jim was disgusted by all such scenes.
es_translation: At Marble Arch, they took a bus that left them near their modest home. It was past five, and Sibyl had to rest lying down for a couple of hours before the performance. Jim insisted that she do so. He said he preferred to say goodbye to her when their mother wasn't present. She would certainly make a scene, and Jim detested any kind of scene.

en: In Sybil’s own room they parted. There was jealousy in the lad’s heart, and a fierce murderous hatred of the stranger who, as it seemed to him, had come between them. Yet, when her arms were flung round his neck, and her fingers strayed through his hair, he softened and kissed her with real affection. There were tears in his eyes as he went downstairs.
vi: Họ từ biệt nhau trong phòng riêng của Sibyl. Có sự ghen tị trong trái tim chàng trai, và một nỗi căm ghét sôi sục, đầy sát khí với cái kẻ lạ, như cậu nhìn nhận, đã xen vào giữa họ. Ấy vậy mà, khi cánh tay nàng quàng quanh cổ cậu và các ngón tay nàng lang thang trong tóc cậu, cậu lại mềm lòng, và hôn nàng với tình thương thật sự. Lệ nhòa mắt cậu khi cậu xuống cầu thang.
tr: Sibyl’in odasında vedalaştılar. Delikanlının yüreği kıskançlıkla doluydu, ablasıyla arasına girmiş gözüyle baktığı yabancıya karşı kanlı bıçaklı bir kin. Gene de Sibyl’in kolları boynuna dolanıp parmakları saçlarında dolaştığı zaman James yumuşadı ve kızı gerçek bir sevgiyle öptü. Merdivenden aşağı inerken gözlerinde yaşlar vardı.
es: Se separaron en la habitación de Sibyl. El corazón del muchacho estaba dominado por los celos, y sentía un odio feroz, asesino, contra aquel extraño que, en su opinión, se había interpuesto entre ellos. Sin embargo, cuando Sibyl le echó los brazos al cuello y le acarició el cabello con los dedos, Jim se ablandó y la besó con sincero afecto. Tenía los ojos llenos de lágrimas mientras bajaba las escaleras.
vi_translation: They bid farewell to each other in Sibyl's private room. There was jealousy in the boy's heart, and a seething, murderous hatred towards the stranger, whom he perceived had come between them. Yet, when her arm wrapped around his neck and her fingers wandered through his hair, he softened, and kissed her with genuine affection. Tears blurred his vision as he descended the stairs.
tr_translation: They said goodbye in Sibyl's room. The young man's heart was filled with jealousy, a bloody and bitter hatred towards the stranger he saw as coming between him and his sister. Yet, when Sibyl's arms wrapped around his neck and her fingers ran through his hair, James softened and kissed the girl with genuine affection. There were tears in his eyes as he walked down the stairs.
es_translation: They parted in Sibyl's room. The boy's heart was dominated by jealousy, and he felt a fierce, murderous hatred against that stranger who, in his opinion, had come between them. However, when Sibyl threw her arms around his neck and caressed his hair with her fingers, Jim softened and kissed her with sincere affection. His eyes were full of tears as he went down the stairs.

en: His mother was waiting for him below. She grumbled at his unpunctuality, as he entered. He made no answer, but sat down to his meagre meal. The flies buzzed round the table and crawled over the stained cloth. Through the rumble of omnibuses, and the clatter of street-cabs, he could hear the droning voice devouring each minute that was left to him.
vi: Mẹ cậu đang chờ cậu bên dưới. Bà cằn nhằn cái tính không đúng giờ của cậu, lúc cậu bước vào. Cậu không trả lời, nhưng ngồi xuống ăn bữa ăn đạm bạc của mình. Ruồi vo ve quanh bàn và bò trên khăn bàn vấy bẩn. Xuyên qua tiếng ầm ầm của xe buýt và tiếng lạch cạch của xe ngựa thuê, cậu có thể nghe thấy giọng nói đều đều đang ngấu nghiến từng phút còn lại với cậu.
tr: Aşağıda annesi onu beklemekteydi. Geç kaldığı için mırıldandı. James karşılık vermeyerek yoksul sofrasının başına oturdu. Masanın çevresinde sinekler vızıldayarak uçuşuyor, lekeli sofra örtüsünün üstünde geziniyorlardı. Otobüslerin homurtusu, tramvayların tangırtısı arasında genç çocuk evindeki son dakikalarını yalayıp yutan mızıltılı sesi duyuyordu.
es: Su madre lo esperaba abajo. Se quejó de su falta de puntualidad al verlo entrar. Jim no respondió, pero se sentó para consumir su modesta cena. Las moscas zumbaban en torno a la mesa y corrían sobre el mantel poco limpio. Entre el ruido sordo de los ómnibus y el alboroto de los coches de punto, oía la voz monótona que devoraba cada uno de los minutos que le quedaban.
vi_translation: Your mother is waiting for you downstairs. She grumbles about your lack of punctuality as you walk in. You don't respond, but sit down to eat your meager meal. Flies buzz around the table and crawl on the stained tablecloth. Through the rumble of buses and the clatter of hired carriages, you can hear a monotonous voice devouring the remaining minutes with you.
tr_translation: His mother was waiting for him downstairs. She muttered because he was late. James sat down at the head of the poor table without responding. Flies were buzzing around the table, crawling on the stained tablecloth. Amid the growl of buses and the clatter of trams, the young boy heard the droning sound that swallowed up the last moments in his home.
es_translation: His mother was waiting for him downstairs. She complained about his lack of punctuality when she saw him come in. Jim did not respond, but he sat down to consume his modest dinner. Flies buzzed around the table and ran over the slightly dirty tablecloth. Amid the dull noise of the buses and the clamor of the horse-drawn carriages, he heard the monotonous voice that devoured each of the minutes he had left.

en: After some time, he thrust away his plate and put his head in his hands. He felt that he had a right to know. It should have been told to him before, if it was as he suspected. Leaden with fear, his mother watched him. Words dropped mechanically from her lips. A tattered lace handkerchief twitched in her fingers. When the clock struck six, he got up and went to the door. Then he turned back and looked at her. Their eyes met. In hers he saw a wild appeal for mercy. It enraged him.
vi: Một lát sau, cậu gạt đĩa qua bên, đặt đầu vào lòng bàn tay. Cậu cảm thấy là cậu có quyền được biết. Chuyện đó lẽ ra phải được nói cho cậu biết từ trước, nếu nó đúng như cậu nghi ngờ. Đần ra vì sợ, mẹ cậu theo dõi cậu. Các lời nói rớt ra khỏi môi bà một cách máy móc. Chiếc khăn ren tả tơi rúm ró trong các ngón tay bà. Khi đồng hồ điểm sáu giờ, cậu đứng dậy và đi ra cửa. Sau đó cậu quay lại, nhìn bà. Mắt họ gặp nhau. Trong mắt bà, cậu thấy lời cầu khẩn man dại cho sự dung thứ. Nó làm cậu giận điên lên.
tr: Bir süre sonra tabağını itti, başını elleri arasına aldı. Öğrenmeye hakkı olduğunu düşünüyordu. Durum kuşkulandığı gibiyse bunu ona daha önce söylemeleri gerekirdi. Annesi, korkudan içi kurşun gibi ağırlaşmış durumda, ona bakmaktaydı. Sözcükler dudaklarından makine gibi dökülüyor, ellerinin arasında yırtık bir dantel mendili büküp duruyordu. Saat altıyı vurunca James kalktı, kapıya yürüdü. Sonra dönüp annesine baktı. Bakışları karşılaştı. James annesinin gözlerinde belli belirsiz bir merhamet yakarısı okudu. Bu onu öfkeden kudurttu.
es: Al cabo de algún tiempo apartó el plato y ocultó la cabeza entre las manos. Estaba convencido de que tenía derecho a saber. Tendrían que habérselo dicho antes, si todo había sucedido como él sospechaba. Su madre lo observaba dominada por el miedo. Las palabras salían maquinalmente de sus labios. Con los dedos retorcía un pañuelo de encaje hecho jirones. Al darlas seis el reloj de pared, Jim se puso en pie y se dirigió hacia la puerta. Luego se volvió y sus miradas se encontraron. En los ojos maternos descubrió una desesperada solicitud de compasión que lo llenó de cólera.
vi_translation: A moment later, he pushed the plate aside and rested his head in his hands. He felt that he had the right to know. That matter should have been told to him earlier, if it was as he suspected. Stunned with fear, his mother watched him. Her words fell from her lips mechanically. The tattered lace handkerchief crumpled in her fingers. When the clock struck six, he stood up and walked to the door. Then he turned back and looked at her. Their eyes met. In her eyes, he saw a wild plea for forgiveness. It made him furious.
tr_translation: After a while, he pushed his plate away and put his head in his hands. He thought he had the right to know. If the situation was as he suspected, they should have told him earlier. His mother, her heart heavy with fear, was looking at him. Words were spilling from her lips like a machine, and she was twisting a torn lace handkerchief between her hands. When the clock struck six, James got up and walked to the door. Then he turned and looked at his mother. Their eyes met. James read a faint plea for mercy in his mother's eyes. This drove him mad with rage.
es_translation: After some time, he pushed the plate aside and hid his head in his hands. He was convinced that he had the right to know. They should have told him earlier if everything had happened as he suspected. His mother watched him, overcome with fear. The words came mechanically from her lips. With her fingers, she twisted a lace handkerchief that was in tatters. When the wall clock struck six, Jim stood up and headed for the door. Then he turned, and their eyes met. In his mother's eyes, he discovered a desperate plea for compassion that filled him with anger.

en: “Mother, I have something to ask you,” he said. Her eyes wandered vaguely about the room. She made no answer. “Tell me the truth. I have a right to know. Were you married to my father?”
vi: “Mẹ, con có điều này muốn hỏi mẹ,” cậu nói. Mắt bà lơ đãng dạo quanh phòng. Bà không đáp lại. “Cho con biết sự thật đi. Con có quyền được biết. Mẹ có cưới cha con không?”
tr: “Anne, sana sormak istediğim bir şey var,” dedi. ms Vane gözlerini amaçsızca odada dolaştırdı, karşılık vermedi. “Bana doğruyu söyle. Bilmek hakkım. Babamla sen evli miydiniz?
es: —Madre, hay algo que tengo que pedirte —dijo. Los ojos de la señora Vane deambularon sin rumbo por el cuarto, pero no contestó—. Dime la verdad. Tengo derecho a saber. ¿Estabas casada con mi padre?
vi_translation: “Mom, I have something to ask you,” he said. Her eyes wandered around the room absentmindedly. She did not respond. “Tell me the truth. I have the right to know. Did you marry my father?”
tr_translation: “Anne, there is something I want to ask you,” he said. Ms. Vane let her eyes wander aimlessly around the room, not responding. “Tell me the truth. I have the right to know. Were you married to my father?”
es_translation: —Mother, there is something I need to ask you —he said. Mrs. Vane's eyes wandered aimlessly around the room, but she did not reply—. Tell me the truth. I have the right to know. Were you married to my father?

en: She heaved a deep sigh. It was a sigh of relief. The terrible moment, the moment that night and day, for weeks and months, she had dreaded, had come at last, and yet she felt no terror. Indeed, in some measure it was a disappointment to her. The vulgar directness of the question called for a direct answer. The situation had not been gradually led up to. It was crude. It reminded her of a bad rehearsal.
vi: Bà thốt ra một tiếng thở sâu. Đó là dấu hiệu nhẹ nhõm. Khoảnh khắc khủng khiếp, cái khoảnh khắc mà hết ngày đến đêm, hết tuần này qua tháng nọ, bà từng khiếp sợ, rốt cuộc cũng đã đến, tuy nhiên bà không thấy sợ. Quả thật là ở mức nào đó thì nó là một sự thất vọng với bà. Sự thẳng thắn thô thiển của câu hỏi yêu cầu một câu trả lời trực tiếp. Tình huống không được dẫn dắt dần dần từng bước. Nó thật sống sượng. Nó nhắc bà nhớ đến một buổi diễn thử tồi tệ.
tr: ms Vane derin bir göğüs geçirdi. Bu bir rahatlama soluğuydu. O müthiş an, haftalar, aylardır her gün her gece ürküntüyle beklemiş olduğu an en sonunda gelip çatmıştı ama kadın korku duymuyordu. Gerçeği söylemek gerekirse bir dereceye kadar hayal kırıklığı olmuştu bu onun için. Sorunun böylece bayağı bir biçimde, doğrudan doğruya sorulması gene kestirme bir yanıt gerektiriyordu. Durum yavaş yavaş gelişmemişti ki! Kabalıktı doğrusu. ms Vane’e kötü giden bir provayı anımsatmıştı.
es: La señora Vane dejó escapar un hondo suspiro, un suspiro de alivio. El terrible momento, el momento que había temido de día y de noche, durante semanas y meses, había llegado al fin, pero no sentía terror. En cierta medida, de hecho, fue más bien una desilusión. Una pregunta tan vulgarmente directa exigía una respuesta igualmente directa. No era una situación a la que se hubiera llegado poco a poco. Era tosca. A la señora Vane le hizo pensar en un ensayo poco satisfactorio.
vi_translation: She let out a deep sigh. It was a sign of relief. The dreadful moment, the moment that she had feared day and night, week after week, month after month, had finally come, yet she did not feel afraid. Indeed, to some extent, it was a disappointment to her. The bluntness of the question demanded a direct answer. The situation was not gradually led step by step. It was really crude. It reminded her of a bad rehearsal.
tr_translation: Ms. Vane took a deep breath. It was a sigh of relief. That tremendous moment, the moment she had been waiting for with dread every day and night for weeks, months, had finally arrived, but the woman was not afraid. To tell the truth, it was somewhat disappointing for her. The question being asked so plainly and directly required a straightforward answer. The situation had not developed gradually! It was indeed rude. It reminded Ms. Vane of a poorly performed rehearsal.
es_translation: Mrs. Vane let out a deep sigh, a sigh of relief. The terrible moment, the moment she had feared day and night, for weeks and months, had finally arrived, but she did not feel terror. To some extent, in fact, it was rather a disappointment. Such a vulgarly direct question demanded an equally direct answer. It was not a situation that had been reached gradually. It was crude. It made Mrs. Vane think of an unsatisfactory rehearsal.

en: “No,” she answered, wondering at the harsh simplicity of life.
vi: “Không,” bà trả lời, kinh ngạc trước sự đơn giản tàn nhẫn của đời.
tr: Kadın, “Hayır,” diye karşılık verirken hayatın haşin yalınlığı karşısında şaşkınlık duyuyordu.
es: —No —respondió, maravillada de la dura simplicidad de la vida.
vi_translation: "No," she replied, astonished by the cruel simplicity of life.
tr_translation: The woman, while responding "No," was feeling astonished by the harsh simplicity of life.
es_translation: —No —she responded, amazed by the harsh simplicity of life.

en: “My father was a scoundrel then!” cried the lad, clenching his fists.
vi: “Vậy cha con là một thằng khốn?” chàng trai hét lên, nắm chặt hai bàn tay lại.
tr: Çocuk yumruklarını sıkarak, “Babam alçağın biriydi demek!” diye bağırdı.
es: —¡En ese caso mi padre era un sinvergüenza! —exclamó el muchacho, apretando los puños.
vi_translation: “So my father is a bastard?” the young man shouted, clenching his fists tightly.
tr_translation: The child clenched his fists and shouted, "So my father was a scoundrel!"
es_translation: —In that case, my father was a scoundrel! —exclaimed the boy, clenching his fists.

en: She shook her head. “I knew he was not free. We loved each other very much. If he had lived, he would have made provision for us. Don’t speak against him, my son. He was your father, and a gentleman. Indeed, he was highly connected.”
vi: Bà lắc đầu. “Mẹ biết ông ấy vướng bận. Cha mẹ rất yêu nhau. Nếu ông ấy còn sống, có lẽ ông ấy đã chu cấp cho chúng ta. Đứng phê phán ông ấy, con trai của mẹ. Ông ấy là cha con, và là một quý nhân. Quả thực là ông ấy có dòng dõi quyền quý.”
tr: Annesi başını sarstı. “Onun serbest olmadığını biliyordum. Birbirimizi çok seviyorduk. Yaşasaydı bizim geçimimizi sağlayacaktı. Onu kötüleme, evladım. O senin babandı ve bir centilmendi. İnan, çok yüksek bir ailedendi.
es: Su madre negó con la cabeza. —Yo sabía que no estaba libre. Nos queríamos mucho. Si hubiera vivido, habría atendido a nuestras necesidades. No lo condenes, hijo mío. Era tu padre y un caballero. Pertenecía a una excelente familia.
vi_translation: She shook her head. "I know he was preoccupied. Your father and I loved each other very much. If he were still alive, he would probably have provided for us. Do not criticize him, my son. He is your father, and a noble man. Indeed, he comes from a noble lineage."
tr_translation: His mother shook her head. “I knew he wasn't free. We loved each other very much. If he had lived, he would have provided for us. Don't speak ill of him, my child. He was your father and a gentleman. Believe me, he came from a very distinguished family.”
es_translation: His mother shook her head. —I knew he wasn't free. We loved each other very much. If he had lived, he would have attended to our needs. Do not condemn him, my son. He was your father and a gentleman. He belonged to an excellent family.

en: An oath broke from his lips. “I don’t care for myself,” he exclaimed, “but don’t let Sibyl.... It is a gentleman, isn’t it, who is in love with her, or says he is? Highly connected, too, I suppose.”
vi: Một lời nguyền rủa bật ra khỏi môi cậu. “Con không lo cho mình,” cậu la lên, “nhưng đừng để Sibyl… Chính cái gã quý nhân, phải không nhỉ, đang yêu chị ấy, hoặc bảo là gã đang thế? Cũng, con cho là, thuộc dòng dõi quyền quý đấy.”
tr: James’in dudaklarından bir sövgü sözü koptu. Çocuk, “Kendim için aldırdığım yok,” dedi. “Ama sakın Sibyl... Ona âşık olan adam da beyefendi değil mi ya da o iddiada. Belki o da çok yüksek bir ailedendir.
es: A Jim se le escapó un juramento. —A mí no me importa —exclamó—, pero no permitas que a Sibyl... Es un caballero, no es eso, el tipo que está enamorado de ella, ¿o dice que lo está? De una familia excelente, también, imagino.
vi_translation: A curse escaped his lips. "I don't care about myself," he shouted, "but don't let Sibyl... It's that nobleman, isn't it, who is in love with her, or says he is?" "Also, I suppose, he belongs to the nobility."
tr_translation: A curse word escaped from James's lips. The boy said, "I don't care for myself." "But don't you dare... The man who is in love with her is a gentleman, isn't he, or at least he claims to be. Maybe he is also from a very high family."
es_translation: A curse escaped Jim. —I don't care —he exclaimed—, but don't let anything happen to Sibyl... He's a gentleman, isn't he, the one who's in love with her, or says he is? From an excellent family, too, I imagine.

en: For a moment a hideous sense of humiliation came over the woman. Her head drooped. She wiped her eyes with shaking hands. “Sibyl has a mother,” she murmured; “I had none.”
vi: Trong khoảnh khắc, một cảm giác nhục nhã ghê gớm choán lấy người đàn bà ấy. Đầu bà gục xuống. Bà chùi mắt bằng đôi tay run lẩy bẩy. “Sibyl có một người mẹ,” bà thầm thì; “mẹ thì không.”
tr: Bir an için kadın yerin dibine batar gibi oldu. Başı önüne düştü. Titreyen elleriyle gözlerini sildi. “Sibyl’in annesi var,” diye mırıldandı. “Ben anasızdım.
es: Por un instante, la señora Vane se sintió terriblemente humillada. Inclinó la cabeza. Se limpió los ojos con manos temblorosas. —Sibyl tiene madre —murmuró—; yo no la tenía.
vi_translation: In an instant, an overwhelming sense of humiliation engulfed the woman. Her head drooped down. She wiped her eyes with trembling hands. “Sibyl has a mother,” she whispered; “a mother does not.”
tr_translation: For a moment, the woman felt as if she was sinking into the ground. Her head dropped forward. She wiped her eyes with trembling hands. “Sibyl has a mother,” she murmured. “I was motherless.”
es_translation: For an instant, Mrs. Vane felt terribly humiliated. She bowed her head. She wiped her eyes with trembling hands. —Sibyl has a mother —he murmured—; I did not have one.

en: The lad was touched. He went towards her, and stooping down, he kissed her. “I am sorry if I have pained you by asking about my father,” he said, “but I could not help it. I must go now. Good-bye. Don’t forget that you will have only one child now to look after, and believe me that if this man wrongs my sister, I will find out who he is, track him down, and kill him like a dog. I swear it.”
vi: Chàng trai động lòng. Cậu lại gần bà, cúi xuống hôn bà. “Con xin lỗi nếu con làm mẹ đau khổ vì đã hỏi về cha,” cậu nói, “nhưng con không thể nhịn được. Con phải đi đây. Tạm biệt. Đừng quên rằng từ giờ mẹ sẽ chỉ còn một đứa con duy nhất để trông nom, và hãy tin con đi, nếu người đàn ông này làm hại chị con, con sẽ tìm ra được gã là ai, lần theo vết để bắt được gã, và giết gã như giết một con chó. Con thề.”
tr: Çocuğun içi sızlamıştı. Gitti, eğilip annesini öptü. “Babamı sormakla seni üzdümse bağışla,” dedi. “Sormamak elimde değildi. Gitmem gerek artık. Hoşça kal. Unutma: Artık bakım isteyen bir tek evladın var. İnan bana, bu adam Sibyl’e kötülük ederse ben onun kim olduğunu öğrenir, izini bulur, köpek öldürürcesine gebertirim. Yemin ediyorum.
es: El muchacho se conmovió. Fue hacia ella, se inclinó y la besó. —Siento haberte apenado, preguntándote por mi padre —dijo—, pero no he podido evitarlo. He de irme ya. Adiós. No olvides que ahora sólo tienes que cuidar de Sibyl, y créeme cuando te digo que si ese hombre engaña a mi hermana, descubriré quién es, lo encontraré y lo mataré como a un perro, lo juro.
vi_translation: The young man was moved. He approached his mother, bent down, and kissed her. "I'm sorry if I caused you pain by asking about father," he said, "but I couldn't help it. I have to go now. Goodbye. Don't forget that from now on, you will only have one child to look after, and believe me, if that man harms my sister, I will find out who he is, track him down, and kill him like a dog. I swear."
tr_translation: The child's heart ached. He went and kissed his mother. “If I upset you by asking about my father, forgive me,” he said. “I couldn't help but ask. I have to go now. Goodbye. Remember: You now have only one child who needs care. Believe me, if this man harms Sibyl, I will find out who he is, track him down, and kill him like a dog. I swear it.”
es_translation: The boy was moved. He went towards her, leaned in, and kissed her. —I'm sorry for making you sad by asking about my father —he said—, but I couldn't help it. I have to go now. Goodbye. Don't forget that now you only have to take care of Sibyl, and believe me when I say that if that man deceives my sister, I will find out who he is, I will find him and I will kill him like a dog, I swear.

en: The exaggerated folly of the threat, the passionate gesture that accompanied it, the mad melodramatic words, made life seem more vivid to her. She was familiar with the atmosphere. She breathed more freely, and for the first time for many months she really admired her son. She would have liked to have continued the scene on the same emotional scale, but he cut her short. Trunks had to be carried down and mufflers looked for. The lodging-house drudge bustled in and out. There was the bargaining with the cabman. The moment was lost in vulgar details. It was with a renewed feeling of disappointment that she waved the tattered lace handkerchief from the window, as her son drove away. She was conscious that a great opportunity had been wasted. She consoled herself by telling Sibyl how desolate she felt her life would be, now that she had only one child to look after. She remembered the phrase. It had pleased her. Of the threat she said nothing. It was vividly and dramatically expressed. She felt that they would all laugh at it some day.
vi: Sự điên rồ cường điệu của lời hăm dọa, các điệu bộ sôi nổi kèm theo nó, những lời thống thiết cuồng nộ, khiến đời dường như sặc sỡ hơn với bà. Bà đã quen với bầu không khí này. Bà đã thở được thoải mái hơn, và lần đầu tiên sau nhiều tháng, bà thấy thật sự ngưỡng mộ con trai mình. Có lẽ bà còn muốn tiếp tục cảnh này với cùng gam cảm xúc như thế, nhưng cậu cắt ngắn nó lại. Phải mang va-li xuống, phải tìm khăn quàng cổ. Lao công nhà trọ hối hả ra vào. Mặc cả với xà ích. Khoảnh khắc ấy mất hút trong các chi tiết thông thường. Với cảm giác thất vọng vừa được làm mới, bà vẫy chiếc khăn ren tả tơi từ cửa sổ lúc con trai bà được đưa đi. Bà biết rõ rằng một cơ hội lớn đã bị phung phí. Bà tự an ủi mình bằng cách kể với Sibyl bà thấy đời bà lẻ loi biết mấy, vì bây giờ bà chỉ còn duy nhất một đứa con để trông nom. Bà nhớ câu ấy. Nó làm bà vừa lòng. Về lời đe dọa thì bà không nói gì. Nó được diễn đạt một cách sống động và bi thảm. Bà cảm thấy rằng cả nhà sẽ bật cười vì nó vào một ngày nào đó.
tr: Gözdağının abartılı çılgınlığı, çocuğun bunu söylerkenki ateşli davranışı, sözlerdeki gözü kara melodram, kadın açısından hayata canlılık katmıştı sanki. Bu havayı iyi bilirdi o. Şimdi daha rahat nefes alıyor ve aylardır ilk olarak oğluna karşı gerçek bir hayranlık duyuyordu. Bu sahneyi hep bu duygusallıkla uzatabilmek isterdi ama, oğlu kısa kesti. Aşağıya taşınacak sandıklar, aranıp bulunacak atkılar vardı. Pansiyon hizmetçileri koşuşturup duruyorlardı. Daha arabacıyla pazarlık edilecekti. Ayrılık dakikası adi ayrıntılar arasında yitip gitti. O yırtık dantel mendili pencereden, oğlunun ardından sallarken ms Vane içindeki hayal kırıklığının tazelendiğini duyumsuyordu. Büyük bir fırsatın boşa harcandığının ayırdındaydı. Avunmak için Sibyl’e, hayatının bundan böyle çok ıssızlaşacağını çünkü elinde bakım isteyen tek evladı kaldığını söyledi. Oğlunun sözlerini unutmamıştı. Ama verdiği gözdağına değinmedi. Çocuk çok canlı, dramatik bir biçimde savurmuştu bu korkutmacayı. ms Vane günün birinde üçünün de bunu anımsayıp güleceklerini düşünüyordu.
es: Lo desmedido de la amenaza, el gesto apasionado que la acompañó, las palabras melodramáticas, hicieron que por un momento la vida recuperase algo de su brillo para la actriz. Todo aquello recreaba un ambiente con el que estaba familiarizada. Respiró con mayor libertad y por primera vez en muchos meses sintió verdadera admiración por su hijo. Le hubiera gustado continuar la escena en el mismo nivel emocional, pero Jim se lo impidió. Había que bajar baúles, localizar alguna prenda de abrigo. El criado para todo de la pensión entraba y salía sin cesar. Era necesario ajustar el precio con el cochero. La intensidad del momento se perdió en detalles vulgares. Desde la ventana, la señora Vane agitó su maltrecho pañuelo de encaje con un renovado sentimiento de decepción mientras su hijo se alejaba. Se daba cuenta de que se había perdido una gran oportunidad. Se consoló diciendo a Sibyl cuán desolada sería su vida ahora que sólo tenía a una hija a quien cuidar. Recordaba la frase de Jim, que le había gustado. De sus amenazas no dijo nada. La manera de expresarla había sido vigorosa y dramática. La señora Vane tenía la impresión de que algún día todos la recordarían riendo.
vi_translation: The exaggerated madness of threats, the lively gestures accompanying them, the frantic and impassioned words made life seem more colorful to her. She had become accustomed to this atmosphere. She could breathe more comfortably, and for the first time in many months, she felt a genuine admiration for her son. Perhaps she even wanted to continue this scene with the same emotional intensity, but he cut it short. Suitcases had to be brought down, scarves had to be found. The boarding house staff hurried in and out. Bargaining with the coachman. That moment was lost in the usual details. With a renewed sense of disappointment, she waved a tattered lace handkerchief from the window as her son was taken away. She knew well that a great opportunity had been squandered. She consoled herself by telling Sibyl how lonely her life felt, as now she had only one child left to care for. She remembered that phrase. It pleased her. As for the threat, she said nothing. It had been expressed vividly and tragically. She felt that the whole family would laugh about it someday.
tr_translation: The exaggerated madness of the threat, the child's fiery behavior while saying it, the reckless melodrama in the words, seemed to have brought some liveliness to the woman's life. She knew this atmosphere well. Now she was breathing more easily and, for the first time in months, felt a genuine admiration for her son. She wished she could prolong this scene with such sentimentality, but her son cut it short. There were trunks to be moved downstairs, scarves to be found and packed. The boarding house servants were bustling about. There was still bargaining to be done with the coachman. The moment of departure got lost among trivial details. As she waved the torn lace handkerchief from the window after her son, Ms. Vane felt a fresh wave of disappointment within her. She was aware that a great opportunity had been wasted. To console herself, she told Sybil that her life would become much lonelier from now on because she had only one child left to care for. She had not forgotten her son's words. But she did not mention the threat he had made. The child had delivered this intimidation in a very lively, dramatic manner. Ms. Vane thought that one day all three of them would remember this and laugh.
es_translation: The excessive nature of the threat, the passionate gesture that accompanied it, the melodramatic words, made life regain some of its sparkle for the actress for a moment. All of that recreated an environment with which she was familiar. She breathed more freely and for the first time in many months felt true admiration for her son. She would have liked to continue the scene at the same emotional level, but Jim prevented her. Trunks had to be brought down, some warm clothing had to be found. The all-purpose servant of the boarding house was coming in and out incessantly. The price had to be negotiated with the coachman. The intensity of the moment was lost in vulgar details. From the window, Mrs. Vane waved her tattered lace handkerchief with a renewed feeling of disappointment as her son walked away. She realized that she had missed a great opportunity. She consoled herself by telling Sibyl how desolate her life would be now that she only had a daughter to care for. She remembered Jim's phrase, which she had liked. She said nothing about his threats. The way he had expressed it had been vigorous and dramatic. Mrs. Vane had the impression that someday everyone would remember her laughing.

en: “I suppose you have heard the news, Basil?” said Lord Henry that evening as Hallward was shown into a little private room at the Bristol where dinner had been laid for three.
vi: "Tôi cho là anh đã nghe tin rồi chứ, Basil?” huân tước Henry hỏi vào buổi chiều ấy, lúc Hallward xuất hiện tại một phòng riêng nhỏ ở Bristol, nơi bữa tối được bày biện cho ba người.
tr: O akşam Basil Hallward, Briston Oteli’nde, üç kişilik sofranın kurulmuş olduğu odaya alındığı zaman Lord Henry, “Haberi duymuşsundur sanırım, değil mi, Basil?” diye sordu.
es: —¿Has oído las noticias? —preguntó lord Henry aquella noche a Hallward cuando un camarero lo hizo entrar en el pequeño reservado del Bristol donde estaba preparada una cena para tres.
vi_translation: "I suppose you have already heard the news, Basil?" Lord Henry asked that afternoon, when Hallward appeared in a small private room at Bristol, where dinner was set for three people.
tr_translation: That evening, when Basil Hallward was shown into the room where a table for three had been set up at the Briston Hotel, Lord Henry asked, "You must have heard the news, haven't you, Basil?"
es_translation: —Have you heard the news? —asked Lord Henry that night to Hallward when a waiter showed him into the small private room at the Bristol where a dinner for three was prepared.

en: “No, Harry,” answered the artist, giving his hat and coat to the bowing waiter. “What is it? Nothing about politics, I hope! They don’t interest me. There is hardly a single person in the House of Commons worth painting, though many of them would be the better for a little whitewashing.”
vi: “Chưa, Harry,” nghệ sỹ trả lời, đưa mũ và áo khoác cho người hầu khom lưng. “Tin gì thế? Không phải về chính trị chứ, tôi hy vọng thế? Tôi chẳng quan tâm đến nó. Hầu như không có lấy một nhân vật nào trong Hạ viện đáng để vẽ; mặc dù nhiều kẻ trong số họ nên được quét cho chút sơn trắng.
tr: Ressam şapkasıyla paltosunu, karşısında eğilen garsona uzatarak, “Yoo,” dedi. “Ne olmuş? Siyasete ilişkin bir şey değildir ya, umarım? Siyaset beni hiç ilgilendirmez de. Avam Kamarası’nda resmini çizmeye değer tek kişi yok, ama birçoğunun üzerinden şöyle bir badana geçilse pek iyi olur.
es: —No —respondió el artista, entregando sombrero y abrigo al camarero, quien procedió a hacerle una reverencia—. ¿De qué se trata? Nada que tenga que ver con la política, espero. No me interesa. Apenas hay una sola persona en la Cámara de los Comunes que se merezca un retrato, aunque muchos de ellos mejorarían blanqueándolos un poco.
vi_translation: “Not yet, Harry,” the artist replied, handing his hat and coat to the bowing servant. “What news? It’s not about politics, I hope? I don’t care about it. There’s hardly a single figure in the House of Commons worth painting; although many of them should be whitewashed.”
tr_translation: Handing his painter's hat and coat to the bowing waiter in front of him, he said, "No." "What happened? I hope it isn't something related to politics? Politics doesn't interest me at all. There's not a single person in the House of Commons worth painting, but it would be great if many of them got a good whitewashing."
es_translation: —No —replied the artist, handing his hat and coat to the waiter, who proceeded to bow to him—. What is it about? Nothing to do with politics, I hope. I'm not interested. There is hardly a single person in the House of Commons who deserves a portrait, although many of them would improve by being whitewashed a bit.

en: “Dorian Gray is engaged to be married,” said Lord Henry, watching him as he spoke.
vi: “Dorian Gray đã hứa hẹn kết hôn,” huân tước Henry kể và theo dõi họa sỹ lúc y nói.
tr: Lord Henry ona dikkatle bakarak, “Dorian Gray nişanlanmış,” dedi.
es: —Dorian Gray se ha prometido —dijo lord Henry, examinando atentamente a su amigo mientras hablaba.
vi_translation: "Dorian Gray has promised to get married," Lord Henry said and watched the artist as he spoke.
tr_translation: Lord Henry, looking at him carefully, said, "Dorian Gray is engaged."
es_translation: —Dorian Gray is engaged —said Lord Henry, carefully examining his friend as he spoke.

en: Hallward started and then frowned. “Dorian engaged to be married!” he cried. “Impossible!”
vi: Hallward giật mình, rồi cau mày. “Dorian đã hứa hẹn kết hôn!” y kêu lên. “Không thể nào!”
tr: Ressam birden irkildi, sonra yüzünü astı. “Dorian nişanlanmış mı dedin? Olamaz!
es: Hallward se sobresaltó y luego frunció el entrecejo. —¡Dorian prometido! —exclamó—. ¡Imposible!
vi_translation: Hallward started, then frowned. "Dorian has promised to marry!" he exclaimed. "Impossible!"
tr_translation: The painter suddenly flinched, then frowned. “Did you say Dorian is engaged? Impossible!”
es_translation: Hallward started and then frowned. —Dorian engaged! —he exclaimed—. Impossible!

en: “It is perfectly true.”
vi: “Sự thật rành rành ra đấy.”
tr: “Olmuş işte.
es: —Es absolutamente cierto.
vi_translation: "The truth is plain to see."
tr_translation: "It has happened.""
es_translation: —It is absolutely true.

en: “To whom?”
vi: “Lấy ai?”
tr: “Kiminle?
es: —¿Con quién?
vi_translation: “Marry whom?”
tr_translation: “With whom?”
es_translation: —With whom?

en: “To some little actress or other.”
vi: “Lấy cô bé diễn viên nào đó không rõ.”
tr: “Aktrisçiğin biriyle.
es: —Con una actricilla de poco más o menos.
vi_translation: “Take some unknown little actress.”
tr_translation: “With some little actress.”
es_translation: —With a little-known actress.

en: “I can’t believe it. Dorian is far too sensible.”
vi: “Tôi không thể tin được chuyện ấy. Dorian quá khôn ngoan mà.”
tr: “İnanamam. Dorian böyle bir şey yapmayacak kadar aklı başındadır.
es: —No me lo puedo creer. Dorian es demasiado sensato.
vi_translation: "I can't believe that. Dorian is too clever for that."
tr_translation: “I can't believe it. Dorian is sensible enough not to do such a thing.”
es_translation: —I can't believe it. Dorian is too sensible.

en: “Dorian is far too wise not to do foolish things now and then, my dear Basil.”
vi: “Dorian quá từng trải để thỉnh thoảng không làm chuyện dại dột, Basil thân mến của tôi.”
tr: “Dorian arada bir budalalık yapmaktan kaçınmayacak kadar akıllıdır, azizim Basil.
es: —Dorian es demasiado prudente para no hacer alguna tontería de cuando en cuando, mi querido Basil.
vi_translation: “Dorian is too experienced to not occasionally do something foolish, my dear Basil.”
tr_translation: “Dorian is wise enough to occasionally avoid making foolish mistakes, my dear Basil.”
es_translation: —Dorian is too prudent not to do something foolish from time to time, my dear Basil.

en: “Marriage is hardly a thing that one can do now and then, Harry.”
vi: “Hôn nhân đâu phải chuyện mà người ta có thể thỉnh thoảng lại làm, Harry.”
tr: “Harry, evlilik insanın öyle arada bir yapacağı bir şey değildir, herhalde.
es: —Casarse es una cosa que difícilmente se puede hacer de cuando en cuando, Harry.
vi_translation: “Marriage isn't something that people can just do from time to time, Harry.”
tr_translation: “Harry, marriage is not something one does just occasionally, surely.”
es_translation: —Getting married is something that can hardly be done from time to time, Harry.

en: “Except in America,” rejoined Lord Henry languidly. “But I didn’t say he was married. I said he was engaged to be married. There is a great difference. I have a distinct remembrance of being married, but I have no recollection at all of being engaged. I am inclined to think that I never was engaged.”
vi: “Ngoài Mỹ ra,” huân tước Henry đáp lại, uể oải. “Nhưng tôi không nói cậu ấy đã kết hôn. Tôi nói cậu ấy đã hứa hẹn kết hôn. Sự khác biệt rất lớn. Tôi có một ký ức rất rõ nét về việc kết hôn, nhưng tôi không nhớ được gì cả về chuyện hứa hẹn. Tôi có khuynh hướng nghĩ là mình chưa bao giờ hứa hẹn gì cả.
tr: “Meğer ki Amerika’da olalım,” diye Lord Henry tembel tembel konuştu. “Ben sana onun evlendiğini söylemedim ki. Nişanlanmış, dedim. Arada büyük ayrım var. Ben evlendiğimi açıkça anımsarım da nişanlandığımı zerrece anımsayamam. Hiç nişanlanmadığıma inanacağım gelir çok zaman.
es: —Excepto en los Estados Unidos —replicó lánguidamente lord Henry—. Pero yo no he dicho que se haya casado. He dicho que se ha prometido. Hay una gran diferencia. Recuerdo con mucha claridad estar casado, pero no tengo recuerdo alguno de estar prometido. Me inclino a creer que nunca estuve prometido.
vi_translation: “Except for America,” Lord Henry replied, languidly. “But I did not say he was married. I said he was engaged to be married. There is a great difference. I have a very clear memory of being married, but I remember nothing at all about being engaged. I am inclined to think that I never was engaged.”
tr_translation: “Unless we are in America,” said Lord Henry lazily. “I didn't tell you that he got married. I said he got engaged. There is a big difference between the two. I clearly remember getting married but I can't remember getting engaged at all. Many times, I feel like I never got engaged.”
es_translation: —Except in the United States —replied Lord Henry languidly—. But I did not say that he got married. I said that he got engaged. There is a big difference. I clearly remember being married, but I have no recollection of being engaged. I am inclined to believe that I was never engaged.

en: “But think of Dorian’s birth, and position, and wealth. It would be absurd for him to marry so much beneath him.”
vi: “Nhưng hãy nghĩ về dòng dõi của Dorian, cả địa vị và của cải nữa. Lấy vợ thua kém quá nhiều như vậy rất dở hơi cho cậu ấy.”
tr: “Ama Dorian’ın ailesini, toplumdaki yeriyle servetini düşünsene. Kendinden böylesi aşağı seviyede bir kızla evlenmesi gülünç olur.
es: —Pero piensa en la cuna de Dorian, en su posición, en su riqueza. Sería absurdo que se casara tan por debajo de sus posibilidades.
vi_translation: “But think about Dorian's lineage, both his status and wealth. Marrying someone so much inferior is very foolish for him.”
tr_translation: “But think about Dorian’s family, his place in society, and his wealth. It would be ridiculous for him to marry a girl of such a lower status.”
es_translation: —But think of Dorian's cradle, his position, his wealth. It would be absurd for him to marry so far below his possibilities.

en: “If you want to make him marry this girl, tell him that, Basil. He is sure to do it, then. Whenever a man does a thoroughly stupid thing, it is always from the noblest motives.”
vi: “Nếu anh muốn làm cho cậu ấy cưới cô gái này thì hãy nói với cậu ấy điều ấy, Basil. Cậu ấy chắc chắn sẽ làm việc đó. Hễ khi nào con người làm chuyện gì đó cực kỳ ngớ ngẩn thì luôn vì những lý do cao quý nhất.”
tr: “Onun bu kızla ille evlenmesini istiyorsan koş, bunu söyle, Basil. O zaman kesin evlenir. Kişi her ne zaman tamamen budalaca bir şey yapsa mutlaka en yüce amaçlar içindir.
es: —Si de verdad quieres que se case con la chica, dile precisamente eso. Puedes estar seguro de que lo hará. Siempre que un hombre hace algo perfectamente estúpido, lo hace por el más noble de los motivos.
vi_translation: "If you want him to marry this girl, then tell him that, Basil. He will certainly do it. Whenever people do something extremely foolish, it is always for the noblest reasons."
tr_translation: “If you really want him to marry this girl, go and tell him that, Basil. Then he will definitely marry her. Whenever a person does something utterly foolish, it is always for the noblest of purposes.”
es_translation: —If you really want him to marry the girl, tell him exactly that. You can be sure that he will do it. Whenever a man does something perfectly stupid, he does it for the noblest of reasons.

en: “I hope the girl is good, Harry. I don’t want to see Dorian tied to some vile creature, who might degrade his nature and ruin his intellect.”
vi: “Tôi hy vọng cô gái ấy ngoan, Harry. Tôi không muốn thấy Dorian bị trói buộc vào một tạo vật kinh tởm nào đó, một kẻ có thể làm tha hóa bản chất và tàn phá trí tuệ cậu ấy.”
tr: “Umarım bu kız iyi bir insandır, Harry. Dorian’ın iğrenç bir yaratığa bağlanıp kalmasını istemem. O zaman onun kişiliği de alçalır, zihni körelir.
es: —Espero que la chica sea buena. No quisiera ver a Dorian atado a alguna horrenda criatura que pueda envilecer su cuerpo y destruir su inteligencia.
vi_translation: "I hope that girl is well-behaved, Harry. I don't want to see Dorian tied to some hideous creature, someone who could corrupt his nature and destroy his intellect."
tr_translation: “I hope this girl is a good person, Harry. I don't want Dorian to be tied to a disgusting creature. Then his personality would degrade, his mind would dull.”
es_translation: —I hope the girl is good. I would not want to see Dorian tied to some horrendous creature that could debase his body and destroy his intelligence.

en: “Oh, she is better than good—she is beautiful,” murmured Lord Henry, sipping a glass of vermouth and orange-bitters. “Dorian says she is beautiful, and he is not often wrong about things of that kind. Your portrait of him has quickened his appreciation of the personal appearance of other people. It has had that excellent effect, amongst others. We are to see her to-night, if that boy doesn’t forget his appointment.”
vi: “À, cô ấy còn hơn cả ngoan — cô ấy đẹp,” huân tước Henry thì thầm, nhắp một ly véc-mút pha rượu cam đắng. “Dorian nói cô ấy đẹp; và cậu ấy hiếm khi nhầm lẫn về các thứ kiểu này. Bức chân dung của anh về cậu ấy đã đẩy nhanh khả năng đánh giá của cậu ấy về diện mạo cá nhân người khác. Nó đã tạo được ảnh hưởng tuyệt vời ấy, trong số những cái khác nữa. Chúng ta sẽ thấy cô ấy tối nay, nếu cậu ấy không quên cuộc hẹn.
tr: Lord Henry elindeki bardaktan portakal esanslı vermut içerek, “Kız iyi olmaktan öte, güzelmiş,” diye mırıldandı. “Dorian güzel diyor ki böyle şeylerde pek yanılmaz. Senin çizdiğin o portre sayesinde, başkalarının görünümüne karşı daha duyarlı oldu. Böyle iyi bir etkisi oldu portrenin, başkaca yararları dışında. Eğer çocuk randevusunu unutmazsa, kızı bu gece görüyoruz.
es: —No, no; la chica es mejor que buena..., es hermosa —murmuró lord Henry, saboreando un vaso de vermut con zumo de naranjas amargas—. Dorian dice que es hermosa, y no suele equivocarse en ese tipo de cuestiones. Tu retrato ha afinado su apreciación de las personas. Ése ha sido, entre otros, uno de sus excelentes resultados. Vamos a conocerla esta noche, si es que ese muchacho no olvida su cita con nosotros.
vi_translation: “Ah, she is more than just well-behaved — she is beautiful,” Lord Henry whispered, sipping a glass of vermouth with bitters. “Dorian says she is beautiful; and he rarely makes mistakes about these sorts of things. His portrait of him has accelerated his ability to judge the personal appearance of others. It has had that wonderful effect, among other things. We will see her tonight, if he doesn't forget the appointment.”
tr_translation: Lord Henry, sipping vermouth with an orange essence from his glass, murmured, "The girl is not just good, she is beautiful." "Dorian says she is beautiful, and he is rarely wrong about such things. Thanks to the portrait you painted, he has become more sensitive to the appearance of others. The portrait had such a good effect, besides its other benefits. If the boy doesn't forget his appointment, we will see the girl tonight."
es_translation: —No, no; the girl is better than good..., she is beautiful —murmured Lord Henry, savoring a glass of vermouth with bitter orange juice—. Dorian says she is beautiful, and he is not usually wrong in such matters. Your portrait has refined his appreciation of people. That has been, among other things, one of its excellent results. We are going to meet her tonight, if that boy does not forget his appointment with us.

en: “Are you serious?”
vi: “Anh nghiêm túc chứ?”
tr: “Ciddi misin?
es: —¿Hablas en serio?
vi_translation: “Are you serious?”
tr_translation: “Are you serious?”
es_translation: —Are you serious?

en: “Quite serious, Basil. I should be miserable if I thought I should ever be more serious than I am at the present moment.”
vi: “Hoàn toàn nghiêm túc, Basil. Tôi sẽ bị bần cùng nếu tôi nghĩ là tôi sẽ có lúc nghiêm túc hơn bây giờ.”
tr: “Çok ciddiyim, Basil. Şu anda olduğumdan daha da ciddi olabileceğime inansaydım yas tutardım.
es: —Completamente en serio. Me sentiría terriblemente mal si creyera que alguna vez llegaré a hablar más seriamente que en este momento.
vi_translation: “Completely serious, Basil. I would be destitute if I thought I would ever be more serious than I am now.”
tr_translation: “I am very serious, Basil. If I believed I could be more serious than I am right now, I would mourn.”
es_translation: —Completely serious. I would feel terribly bad if I thought I would ever speak more seriously than I am right now.

en: “But do you approve of it, Harry?” asked the painter, walking up and down the room and biting his lip. “You can’t approve of it, possibly. It is some silly infatuation.”
vi: “Nhưng anh có tán thành chuyện này không, Harry?” họa sỹ hỏi, đi tới đi lui trong phòng, cắn môi. “Anh không thể tán thành chuyện này được, lẽ nào. Nó chỉ là sự mê muội dại khờ nào đó.”
tr: Ressam odada bir aşağı bir yukarı dolaşıp dudağını dişleyerek, “Peki, sen olumlu karşılıyor musun bunu, Harry?” diye sordu. “Onaylıyor olamazsın. Saçma, gelgeç bir heves bu.
es: —Pero, ¿tú lo apruebas, Harry? —preguntó el pintor, paseando por el reservado y mordiéndose los labios—. Es imposible que lo apruebes. Se trata sólo de un capricho.
vi_translation: “But do you agree with this, Harry?” the artist asked, pacing back and forth in the room, biting his lip. “You can't possibly agree with this. It's just some foolish infatuation.”
tr_translation: The painter paced up and down the room, biting his lip, and asked, "Well, do you approve of this, Harry?" "You can't possibly approve of it. It's a ridiculous, fleeting whim."
es_translation: —But do you approve of it, Harry? —asked the painter, pacing the room and biting his lips—. It's impossible for you to approve of it. It's just a whim.

en: “I never approve, or disapprove, of anything now. It is an absurd attitude to take towards life. We are not sent into the world to air our moral prejudices. I never take any notice of what common people say, and I never interfere with what charming people do. If a personality fascinates me, whatever mode of expression that personality selects is absolutely delightful to me. Dorian Gray falls in love with a beautiful girl who acts Juliet, and proposes to marry her. Why not? If he wedded Messalina, he would be none the less interesting. You know I am not a champion of marriage. The real drawback to marriage is that it makes one unselfish. And unselfish people are colourless. They lack individuality. Still, there are certain temperaments that marriage makes more complex. They retain their egotism, and add to it many other egos. They are forced to have more than one life. They become more highly organized, and to be highly organized is, I should fancy, the object of man’s existence. Besides, every experience is of value, and whatever one may say against marriage, it is certainly an experience. I hope that Dorian Gray will make this girl his wife, passionately adore her for six months, and then suddenly become fascinated by some one else. He would be a wonderful study.”
vi: “Tôi chẳng bao giờ tán thành hay không tán thành bất cứ chuyện gì lúc này. Đó là một thái độ quá lố bịch để mà cố giữ trước cuộc sống. Ta không được gửi đến thế giới này để truyền bá các định kiến đạo đức của ta. Tôi chẳng bao giờ để ý tí nào đến những gì người tầm thường nói, và tôi cũng chẳng bao giờ can thiệp vào những gì người dễ thương làm. Nếu một nhân vật nào đó đã quyến rũ được tôi rồi thì bất cứ kiểu biểu lộ nào mà nhân vật ấy lựa chọn cũng tuyệt đối thú vị với tôi. Dorian Gray phải lòng một mỹ nhân đóng vai Juliet, và cầu hôn cô ấy. Sao lại không được? Nếu cậu ấy lấy Messalina thì cậu ấy cũng sẽ chẳng kém thú vị đi tí nào. Anh biết tôi không phải là một chiến sỹ bảo vệ hôn nhân. Mặt hạn chế thực tế của hôn nhân là nó biến người ta thành kẻ bất vị kỷ. Mà những kẻ bất vị kỷ thì lại nhạt nhẽo. Họ thiếu cá tính. Tuy nhiên vẫn có những khí chất nào đó mà hôn nhân làm cho phức tạp hơn. Họ giữ được tính ngã mạn của mình và còn thêm vào nó khá nhiều bản ngã khác nữa. Họ buộc phải có nhiều hơn một cuộc sống, họ thành ra được tổ chức cao hơn, và được tổ chức cao hơn, tôi cho rằng, chính là mục đích sự tồn tại của con người. Ngoài ra, mỗi kinh nghiệm đều có giá trị, và, dẫu người ta có thể nói gì chống lại hôn nhân chăng nữa, nó chắc chắn vẫn là một kinh nghiệm. Tôi hy vọng rằng Dorian Gray sẽ lấy cô gái đó làm vợ, hết lòng tôn thờ cô ta trong sáu tháng, sau đó đột ngột bị quyến rũ bởi ai đó khác. Cậu ấy sẽ là một đối tượng nghiên cứu tuyệt vời.”
tr: “Ben artık hiçbir şeyi olumlu ya da olumsuz karşılamıyorum, dostum. Hayata karşı böyle tavır almak gülünç. Ahlak konusundaki önyargılarımızı açıklamak için gelmiyoruz ya dünyaya. Ben sıradan, basmakalıp kişilerin dediklerine hiç kulak vermem; sevimli, seçkin kişilerin yapıp ettiklerine de hiç karışmam. Birini çok mu çekici buluyorum, o kişi hangi ifade yöntemini seçerse seçsin beni mest eder. Dorian Gray sahnede Juliet’i oynayan dilber bir kıza tutuluyor, onunla evlenmeyi tasarlıyor. Neden olmasın? Dorian Messalina’yla da evlense ilginçliğinden bir şey yitirmez benim gözümde. Bilirsin ki ben evliliğin savunucularından değilimdir. Evlilikteki gerçek sakınca kişiyi evcil yapmasıdır. Evcil kişiler de renksiz olur. Bireysellikten yoksundurlar. Öte yandan evliliğin, tersine karmaşıklaştırdığı kişiler de vardır. Bu gibileri bencilliklerini korurlar da üstüne daha bir sürü başka benlikler eklerler. Birden çok yaşam sürmeye zorlanırlar. Daha iyi bir organizasyona kavuşurlar. Bana kalırsa bu, insanın varoluşunun amacıdır. Zaten her deneyim değer taşır. Evliliğin de kim ne derse desin, bir deneyim olduğu su götürmez. Benim umudum Dorian Gray’in bu kıza nikâh kıyıp, altı ay boyunca delice tapınması, sonra da durup dururken başka birinin büyüsüne kapılması. İncelemek için nefis bir konu olur.
es: —Yo ya no apruebo ni desapruebo nada. Es una actitud absurda ante la vida. No se nos pone en el mundo para airear nuestros prejuicios morales. Nunca doy la menor importancia a lo que dice la gente vulgar, y nunca interfiero con lo que hacen las personas encantadoras. Si una personalidad me fascina, cualquier modo de expresión que elija me parecerá delicioso. Dorian Gray se enamora de una hermosa muchacha que interpreta a Julieta y se propone casarse con ella. ¿Por qué no? Si contrajera matrimonio con Mesalina no me parecería menos interesante. Sabes perfectamente que no soy defensor del matrimonio. El verdadero inconveniente del matrimonio es que mata el egoísmo. Y las personas sin egoísmo son incoloras. Carecen de individualidad. De todos modos, hay algunos temperamentos que se hacen más complejos con el matrimonio. Conservan su egoísmo y le añaden otros muchos. Se ven forzados a vivir más de una vida. Se convierten en personas sumamente organizadas, y organizarse muy bien la vida, creo yo, es el objeto de la existencia humana. Además, toda experiencia tiene valor y, se diga lo que se quiera contra el matrimonio, no cabe duda de que es una experiencia. Espero que Dorian Gray haga de esa muchacha su esposa, que la adore apasionadamente por espacio de seis meses y que luego, de repente, quede fascinado por otra persona. Será un maravilloso tema de estudio.
vi_translation: “I never approve or disapprove of anything now. That is an absurd attitude to take towards life. We are not sent into the world to air our moral prejudices. I never take any notice of what common people say, and I never interfere with what charming people do. If a personality fascinates me, whatever mode of expression that personality chooses is absolutely delightful to me. Dorian Gray falls in love with an actress who plays Juliet, and proposes to her. Why not? If he married Messalina, he would be none the less interesting. You know I am not a champion of marriage. The real drawback to marriage is that it makes one unselfish. And unselfish people are colourless. They lack individuality. However, there are certain temperaments that marriage makes more complex. They retain their egotism, and add to it many other egos. They have to live more than one life, and they become more highly organized, and to be more highly organized I think is the object of man’s existence. Besides, every experience is of value, and, whatever one may say against marriage, it is certainly an experience. I hope that Dorian Gray will marry this girl, worship her for six months, and then suddenly be fascinated by someone else. He would be a wonderful study.”
tr_translation: “I no longer react to anything positively or negatively, my friend. Taking such an attitude towards life is ridiculous. We don't come into the world to explain our prejudices about morality. I never listen to what ordinary, stereotypical people say; nor do I interfere with the actions of charming, distinguished people. If I find someone very attractive, whatever method of expression they choose, it delights me. Dorian Gray is infatuated with a lovely girl who plays Juliet on stage and is planning to marry her. Why not? Even if Dorian married Messalina, he wouldn't lose any of his interest in my eyes. You know that I am not one of the defenders of marriage. The real drawback of marriage is that it makes a person domesticated. Domesticated people are also colorless. They lack individuality. On the other hand, there are those whom marriage complicates instead. Such people preserve their selfishness and add many other selves on top of it. They are forced to live multiple lives. They achieve better organization. In my opinion, this is the purpose of human existence. After all, every experience has value. No matter what anyone says, it is undeniable that marriage is an experience. My hope is that Dorian Gray marries this girl, worships her madly for six months, and then suddenly falls under the spell of someone else. It would be a delightful subject to study.”
es_translation: —I no longer approve or disapprove of anything. It is an absurd attitude towards life. We are not put in the world to air our moral prejudices. I never give the slightest importance to what ordinary people say, and I never interfere with what charming people do. If a personality fascinates me, any mode of expression they choose will seem delightful to me. Dorian Gray falls in love with a beautiful girl who plays Juliet and intends to marry her. Why not? If he were to marry Messalina, it would not seem less interesting to me. You know perfectly well that I am not a defender of marriage. The real drawback of marriage is that it kills selfishness. And people without selfishness are colorless. They lack individuality. Anyway, there are some temperaments that become more complex with marriage. They retain their selfishness and add many others to it. They are forced to live more than one life. They become highly organized people, and organizing one's life very well, I believe, is the object of human existence. Moreover, every experience has value and, say what you will against marriage, there is no doubt that it is an experience. I hope that Dorian Gray makes that girl his wife, adores her passionately for six months, and then, suddenly, becomes fascinated by someone else. It will be a wonderful subject of study.

en: “You don’t mean a single word of all that, Harry; you know you don’t. If Dorian Gray’s life were spoiled, no one would be sorrier than yourself. You are much better than you pretend to be.”
vi: “Anh không nói nghiêm túc được lấy một lời về mọi chuyện này, Harry; anh biết là anh như vậy. Nếu cuộc đời Dorian Gray bị làm hỏng, sẽ không ai buồn hơn chính anh. Anh tốt hơn nhiều so với anh cứ cố giả bộ.”
tr: “Bu söylediklerinin bir tanesinde bile ciddi değilsin, Harry. Değilsin, işte, sen de biliyorsun. Dorian Gray’in hayatı sönerse en çok üzülen sen olursun. Sen aslında takındığın pozlardan çok daha iyi yüreklisin.
es: —No crees ni una sola palabra de lo que dices; sabes perfectamente que no. Si Dorian Gray echara a perder su vida, nadie lo sentiría más que tú. Eres mucho mejor persona de lo que finges.
vi_translation: “You cannot speak seriously about any of this, Harry; you know that you are like that. If Dorian Gray's life is ruined, no one will be more upset than you. You are much better than you keep pretending to be.”
tr_translation: “You are not serious about a single thing you say, Harry. You are not, and you know it. If Dorian Gray's life were to fade, you would be the most upset. You are actually much kinder at heart than the poses you assume.”
es_translation: —You don't believe a single word of what you say; you know perfectly well that you don't. If Dorian Gray were to ruin his life, no one would feel it more than you. You are a much better person than you pretend to be.

en: Lord Henry laughed. “The reason we all like to think so well of others is that we are all afraid for ourselves. The basis of optimism is sheer terror. We think that we are generous because we credit our neighbour with the possession of those virtues that are likely to be a benefit to us. We praise the banker that we may overdraw our account, and find good qualities in the highwayman in the hope that he may spare our pockets. I mean everything that I have said. I have the greatest contempt for optimism. As for a spoiled life, no life is spoiled but one whose growth is arrested. If you want to mar a nature, you have merely to reform it. As for marriage, of course that would be silly, but there are other and more interesting bonds between men and women. I will certainly encourage them. They have the charm of being fashionable. But here is Dorian himself. He will tell you more than I can.”
vi: Huân tước Henry bật cười. “Lý do khiến tất cả chúng ta thích nghĩ tốt đến như vậy về người khác là bởi vì tất cả chúng ta đều sợ chính mình. Cơ sở của sự lạc quan chỉ là nỗi sợ thuần túy. Ta nghĩ rằng ta rộng lượng vì ta cho hàng xóm nợ quyền sở hữu những đức tính chắc là có lợi cho ta. Ta tán tụng ông chủ ngân hàng để ta có thể rút quá số tiền trong tài khoản của ta, và nhận ra các phẩm chất tốt đẹp ở kẻ cướp đường vì hy vọng rằng nó có thể tha cho cái túi của ta. Tôi rất nghiêm túc với mọi điều tôi nói. Tôi coi thường sự lạc quan hơn cả. Về phần một cuộc đời bị làm hỏng, không cuộc đời nào bị làm hỏng ngoài cái mà sự phát triển của nó bị kìm hãm. Nếu anh muốn làm hại tự nhiên, anh chỉ cần cải tạo nó. Về phần hôn nhân, dĩ nhiên là sẽ dớ dẩn, nhưng có những sự ràng buộc khác thú vị hơn nhiều giữa đàn ông và đàn bà. Tôi nhất định sẽ cổ vũ chúng. Chúng có sức hấp dẫn hợp thời. Nhưng đây lại chính là Dorian. Cậu ấy sẽ kể cho anh nhiều hơn là tôi có thể kể.”
tr: Lord Henry güldü. “Hepimiz başkalarına iyilik kondurmayı severiz, çünkü hepimiz de kendi kellemizden korkarız. İyimserliğin temeli katıksız korkudur. Bize yararı dokunabilecek erdemleri komşumuzda görebildiğimiz için kendimizi yüce gönüllü sanırız. Hesabımızdan daha çok para çekebilelim diye bankacıyı överiz, elini cebimize atmasın diye yol kesen haydutta iyi yönler buluruz. Söylediğim her şeyde ciddiydim. İyimserliği son derece hor görürüm ben. Hayatın sönmesine gelince; hiçbir hayat sönmez, yeter ki gelişimi yarıda kalmamış olsun. Bir kişiliği bozmak istiyorsan ıslah et, yeter! Evlilik dersen, elbet saçmalık olur, gelgelelim kadınlarla, erkekler arasında daha başka, daha ilginç bağlar var. Ben bunları özendirmekten geri kalmayacağım. Hepsi de son moda olmak çekiciliğine sahip. Ama bak, işte Dorian da geldi. Sana benden daha çok bilgi verecektir.
es: Lord Henry se echó a reír. —La razón de que nos guste pensar bien de los demás es que tenemos miedo a lo que pueda sucedernos. La base del optimismo es el terror.
