Hallward se dirigió solo hacia el teatro, como habían convenido, y estuvo contemplando las luces parpadeantes de la berlina que le precedía. Tuvo la extraña sensación de haber perdido algo. Sintió que Dorian Gray ya no sería nunca para él lo que había sido en el pasado. La vida se había interpuesto entre los dos... Los ojos se le llenaron de oscuridad y vio las calles, abarrotadas y centelleantes, a través de una niebla. Cuando el coche de punto se detuvo ante el teatro tuvo la sensación de haber envejecido varios años.
vi_translation: They stood up and put on their coats, drinking sips of coffee. The artist was silent and absent-minded. A melancholy ruled over him. He couldn't bear this marriage, but he felt it seemed much better than many other things that could possibly happen. After a few minutes, all of them went downstairs. He walked by himself, as arranged, and watched the twinkling lights of the small one-horse carriage in front of him. A different kind of sense of loss overwhelmed him. He felt that Dorian Gray would never again be to him what he had been in the past. Life had come between them... His eyes darkened, and the bustling, brightly lit streets blurred before him. When the carriage stopped in front of the theater, he felt as if he had aged many years.
tr_translation: They stood up, sipping their coffee while putting on their coats. The painter was lost in his own thoughts, silent. A sense of unease had settled over him. He couldn't bear the thought of this marriage, yet he still thought it was better than many other possibilities that came to mind. They went down a few minutes later. The painter, as agreed, got into a carriage alone and fixed his eyes on the gleaming lights of the small carriage ahead. A strange feeling of loss enveloped him. He sensed that he would never again find the old closeness he had with Dorian Gray. Life had come between them... His vision darkened, and those crowded, lit-up streets vanished before his eyes. When the carriage stopped in front of the theater, Basil Hallward felt as if he had aged years.
es_translation: They stood up to put on their coats, drinking their coffee while standing. The painter, worried, had fallen silent. Melancholy had overtaken him. He greatly disliked that marriage, although in reality, it seemed better to him than many other things that could have happened. Very shortly after, they went out into the street. Hallward headed alone towards the theater, as they had agreed, and was watching the flickering lights of the carriage ahead of him. He had the strange sensation of having lost something. He felt that Dorian Gray would never again be to him what he had been in the past. Life had come between them... His eyes filled with darkness, and he saw the crowded, glittering streets through a mist. When the cab stopped in front of the theater, he had the feeling of having aged several years.

en: CHAPTER VII.
vi: Chương 7
tr: Yedinci bölüm
es: Capítulo 7
vi_translation: Chapter 7
tr_translation: Seventh chapter
es_translation: Chapter 7

en: For some reason or other, the house was crowded that night, and the fat Jew manager who met them at the door was beaming from ear to ear with an oily tremulous smile. He escorted them to their box with a sort of pompous humility, waving his fat jewelled hands and talking at the top of his voice. Dorian Gray loathed him more than ever. He felt as if he had come to look for Miranda and had been met by Caliban. Lord Henry, upon the other hand, rather liked him. At least he declared he did, and insisted on shaking him by the hand and assuring him that he was proud to meet a man who had discovered a real genius and gone bankrupt over a poet. Hallward amused himself with watching the faces in the pit. The heat was terribly oppressive, and the huge sunlight flamed like a monstrous dahlia with petals of yellow fire. The youths in the gallery had taken off their coats and waistcoats and hung them over the side. They talked to each other across the theatre and shared their oranges with the tawdry girls who sat beside them. Some women were laughing in the pit. Their voices were horribly shrill and discordant. The sound of the popping of corks came from the bar.
vi: Vì lý do nào đó không rõ, nhà hát đông nghịt đêm ấy, và ông bầu Do Thái to béo gặp họ ở cửa thì ngoạc mồm đến tận mang tai với một nụ cười rạng rỡ, bợ đỡ, ngập ngừng. Lão hộ tống họ đến lô của họ với một kiểu thái độ nhún nhường khoa trương, vẫy bàn tay béo đeo đầy châu báu, và nói với giọng to nhất. Dorian Gray ghét lão hơn bao giờ hết. Cậu cảm thấy như thể cậu đến tìm Miranda và lại bị Caliban đón. Thế nhưng huân tước Henry thì lại khá là thích lão. Chí ít thì y cũng tuyên bố là y thích, và nhấn đi nhấn lại lúc bắt tay lão, và quả quyết với lão rằng y rất tự hào vì được gặp người đã khám phá ra một thiên tài thực sự và từng bị phá sản vì một nhà thơ. Hallward tự tiêu khiển bằng cách quan sát các mặt người ở khu hạng nhì. Hơi nóng ngột ngạt khủng khiếp, và vầng nắng khổng lồ sáng bừng bừng như bông thược dược vĩ đại với những cánh lửa vàng rực. Các thanh niên trong hạng ghế chuồng gà đã cởi áo khoác với gi-lê và vắt chúng qua bên. Họ nói chuyện với nhau từ bên này qua bên kia nhà hát, và chia cam với các cô gái lòe loẹt ngồi bên cạnh họ. Vài phụ nữ cười trong khu hạng nhì. Giọng họ lanh lảnh chói tai kinh khủng. Tiếng lốp bốp của các nút bần vọng đến từ quầy rượu.
tr: Her nedense tiyatro kalabalıktı o gece. Onları kapıda karşılayan şişman Yahudi menajer titrek, yıvışık bir gülüşle ağzı kulaklarına vararak sırıtıyordu. Onları gösteriş ve dalkavukluk karışımı bir tutumla, şişman, yüzüklü ellerini sallayarak ve sesinin son perdesiyle konuşarak, localarına götürdü. Dorian Gray ona karşı her zamankinden daha büyük bir tiksinti duydu. Sanki Miranda’yı almaya gelmiş de karşısına Caliban çıkmış gibi geliyordu. Oysa Lord Henry ondan eni konu hoşlanmıştı. Daha doğrusu hoşlandığını söylüyordu. Onunla tokalaşmakta ısrar etti ve gerçek bir deha keşfettiğini, hem de bir şair yüzünden iflasa sürüklenmiş olan bir adamla tanışmaktan gurur duyduğunu belirtti. Hallward salondakilerin yüzlerini seyrederek oyalanmaktaydı. Sıcak boğucuydu, büyük avize sarı ateş yapraklı dev bir yıldızçiçeği gibi alev alevdi. Balkondaki gençler ceketlerini, yeleklerini çıkartıp parmaklığa asmışlardı. Tiyatronun bir ucundan öbürüne birbirleriyle konuşuyor, ellerindeki portakalları yanlarında oturan kılıksız kızlarla paylaşıyorlardı. Kimi kadınlar gülüşüyorlardı. Sesleri pek tiz, pek kulak tırmalayıcıydı. Bardan patlayan mantarların sesi geliyordu.
es: Aquella noche, por alguna razón, el teatro estaba abarrotado, y el gordo empresario judío que los recibió en la puerta, sonriendo trémulamente de oreja a oreja con expresión untuosa, procedió a escoltarlos hasta el palco con pomposa humildad, agitando sus gruesas manos enjoyadas y hablando a voz en grito. Dorian Gray sintió que le desagradaba más que nunca. Le pareció que viniendo en busca de Miranda se había encontrado con Calibán. A lord Henry, por el contrario, más bien le gustó. Al menos eso fue lo que dijo, e insistió en estrecharle la mano, asegurándole que estaba orgulloso de conocer al hombre que había descubierto a una joya de la interpretación y que se había arruinado a causa de un poeta. Hallward se divirtió con los rostros del patio de butacas. El calor era insoportable, y la enorme lámpara ardía como una dalia monstruosa con pétalos de fuego amarillo. Los jóvenes del paraíso se habían quitado chaquetas y chalecos, colgándolos de las barandillas. Hablaban entre sí de un lado a otro del teatro y compartían sus naranjas con las llamativas chicas que los acompañaban. Algunas mujeres reían en el patio de butacas, con voces chillonas y discordantes. Desde el bar llegaba el ruido del descorchar de las botellas.
vi_translation: For some unknown reason, the theater was packed that night, and the fat Jewish manager who met them at the door had a wide, beaming, sycophantic, and hesitant smile. He escorted them to their box with an exaggeratedly humble attitude, waving his fat hand adorned with jewels, and speaking in the loudest voice. Dorian Gray hated him more than ever. He felt as if he had come to find Miranda only to be greeted by Caliban. However, Lord Henry rather liked him. At least he declared that he did, repeatedly shaking the manager's hand, and assuring him that he was very proud to meet the man who had discovered a true genius and had once gone bankrupt because of a poet. Hallward amused himself by observing the faces in the second-class section. The heat was terribly stifling, and the giant sun shone brightly like a massive dahlia with blazing golden petals. The young men in the gallery seats had taken off their coats and vests and draped them over the sides. They talked to each other across the theater and shared oranges with the garishly dressed girls sitting next to them. Some women laughed in the second-class section. Their voices were terribly shrill and piercing. The popping sounds of corks echoed from the bar.
tr_translation: For some reason, the theater was crowded that night. The fat Jewish manager who greeted them at the door was grinning from ear to ear with a shaky, slimy smile. He led them to their box seats with a mixture of ostentation and obsequiousness, waving his fat, ringed hands and speaking at the top of his voice. Dorian Gray felt a greater disgust for him than ever before. It was as if he had come to fetch Miranda and encountered Caliban instead. However, Lord Henry had taken quite a liking to him. Or rather, he said he had. He insisted on shaking his hand and remarked that he had discovered a true genius and was proud to meet a man who had been driven to bankruptcy because of a poet. Hallward was passing the time by observing the faces of the people in the hall. The heat was stifling, and the large chandelier blazed like a giant sunflower with yellow flames. The young men in the balcony had taken off their jackets and vests and hung them on the railing. They were talking to each other from one end of the theater to the other, sharing the oranges in their hands with the shabby-looking girls sitting next to them. Some women were laughing. Their voices were very shrill, very grating. The sound of popping corks was coming from the bar.
es_translation: That night, for some reason, the theater was packed, and the fat Jewish impresario who greeted them at the door, smiling tremulously from ear to ear with an unctuous expression, proceeded to escort them to the box with pompous humility, waving his thick bejeweled hands and speaking in a loud voice. Dorian Gray felt that he disliked him more than ever. It seemed to him that in coming to seek Miranda, he had encountered Caliban. Lord Henry, on the other hand, rather liked him. At least that’s what he said, and he insisted on shaking his hand, assuring him that he was proud to meet the man who had discovered a gem of acting and had ruined himself because of a poet. Hallward amused himself with the faces in the stalls. The heat was unbearable, and the enormous lamp burned like a monstrous dahlia with petals of yellow fire. The young men in the gallery had taken off their jackets and vests, hanging them from the railings. They talked to each other across the theater and shared their oranges with the flashy girls who accompanied them. Some women laughed in the stalls, with shrill and discordant voices. From the bar came the sound of bottles being uncorked.

en: “What a place to find one’s divinity in!” said Lord Henry.
vi: “Thật là một nơi ra gì để tìm thánh nữ!” huân tước Henry nói.
tr: Lord Henry, “Tam da kişinin tanrıçasını bulacağı yer!” dedi.
es: —¡Qué lugar para encontrar a una diosa! —dijo lord Henry.
vi_translation: “What a place to find a saint!” Lord Henry said.
tr_translation: Lord Henry, "Just the place where one would find their goddess!" he said.
es_translation: —What a place to find a goddess! —said Lord Henry.

en: “Yes!” answered Dorian Gray. “It was here I found her, and she is divine beyond all living things. When she acts, you will forget everything. These common rough people, with their coarse faces and brutal gestures, become quite different when she is on the stage. They sit silently and watch her. They weep and laugh as she wills them to do. She makes them as responsive as a violin. She spiritualizes them, and one feels that they are of the same flesh and blood as one’s self.”
vi: “Vâng!” Dorian Gray trả lời. “Đây là nơi tôi tìm thấy nàng, và nàng thần thánh vượt xa mọi sinh vật. Khi nàng diễn, anh sẽ quên hết. Những kẻ tầm thường, lỗ mãng, mặt mũi thô lậu và cử chỉ cục súc sẽ trở nên khác hẳn đi khi nàng ở trên sân khấu. Họ ngồi im xem nàng. Họ khóc cười những khi nàng muốn họ làm vậy. Nàng khiến họ bén nhạy như cây vĩ cầm. Nàng nâng tầm họ, và ta cảm thấy rằng họ cũng từ cùng thứ máu thịt như bản thân ta.”
tr: Dorian Gray, “Öyle,” diye yanıtladı. “İşte buracıkta buldum onu; tüm yaratıklardan daha göksel benim için. Hele bir oyununa başlasın, her şeyi unutacaksınız. Kaba saba yüzleri, hoyrat davranışlarıyla bütün bu bayağı, görgüsüz kişiler... O sahneye çıktığında bambaşka oluyorlar. Çıt çıkarmadan oturup onu seyrediyorlar. Onun iradesinin buyruğuna göre ağlıyor, gülüyorlar. Bu kişilerden keman gibi ses alıyor o. Tinselleştiriyor onları.
es: —¡Es cierto! —respondió Dorian Gray—. Pero fue aquí donde la encontré, y Sibyl es la encarnación de la divinidad. Cuando actúe, te olvidarás de todo. Esas gentes vulgares y toscas, de rostros primitivos y gestos brutales, se transforman cuando Sibyl está en el escenario. Callan y escuchan. Lloran y ríen cuando Sibyl quiere que lo hagan. Consigue que respondan como las cuerdas de un violín. Los espiritualiza, y se siente que están hechos de la misma carne y sangre que nosotros.
vi_translation: “Yes!” Dorian Gray replied. “This is where I found her, and she is divine, far surpassing any creature. When she performs, you will forget everything. The ordinary, rude, coarse-faced, and clumsy people will become entirely different when she is on stage. They sit still watching her. They laugh and cry whenever she wants them to. She makes them sensitive like a violin. She elevates them, and you feel that they are of the same flesh and blood as yourself.”
tr_translation: Dorian Gray replied, "Yes." "I found her right here; she is more heavenly to me than all other creatures. Once she starts her performance, you will forget everything. All these vulgar, uncouth people with their coarse faces and rough manners... They become completely different when she steps onto the stage. They sit silently and watch her. They cry and laugh according to her will. She draws sounds from them like a violin. She spiritualizes them.
es_translation: —It's true! —responded Dorian Gray—. But it was here where I found her, and Sibyl is the embodiment of divinity. When she performs, you will forget everything. Those vulgar and coarse people, with primitive faces and brutal gestures, transform when Sibyl is on stage. They fall silent and listen. They cry and laugh when Sibyl wants them to. She makes them respond like the strings of a violin. She spiritualizes them, and you feel that they are made of the same flesh and blood as us.

en: “The same flesh and blood as one’s self! Oh, I hope not!” exclaimed Lord Henry, who was scanning the occupants of the gallery through his opera-glass.
vi: “Cũng từ cùng thứ máu thịt như bản thân ta! Ôi, tôi mong là không!” huân tước Henry la lên, y đang dõi mắt nhìn các khách hạng chuồng gà qua chiếc ống nhòm nhà hát.
tr: Öyle ki insana onlar da bizimle aynı eti, aynı kanı taşıyorlarmış gibi geliyor. Dürbünüyle balkondakileri gözden geçirmekte olan Lord Henry, “Bizimle aynı et ve kan mı! Sakın ha!” diye bağırdı.
es: —¡La misma carne y sangre que nosotros! ¡Espero que no! —exclamó lord Henry, que observaba a los ocupantes del paraíso con sus gemelos de teatro.
vi_translation: “Also made of the same flesh and blood as myself! Oh, I hope not!” Lord Henry exclaimed, as he was watching the gallery patrons through the opera glasses.
tr_translation: So much so that it feels like they carry the same flesh and blood as us." Lord Henry, who was surveying the people on the balcony with his binoculars, exclaimed, "The same flesh and blood as us! Never!"
es_translation: —The same flesh and blood as us! I hope not! —exclaimed Lord Henry, who was observing the occupants of the paradise with his opera glasses.

en: “Don’t pay any attention to him, Dorian,” said the painter. “I understand what you mean, and I believe in this girl. Any one you love must be marvellous, and any girl who has the effect you describe must be fine and noble. To spiritualize one’s age—that is something worth doing. If this girl can give a soul to those who have lived without one, if she can create the sense of beauty in people whose lives have been sordid and ugly, if she can strip them of their selfishness and lend them tears for sorrows that are not their own, she is worthy of all your adoration, worthy of the adoration of the world. This marriage is quite right. I did not think so at first, but I admit it now. The gods made Sibyl Vane for you. Without her you would have been incomplete.”
vi: “Đừng để ý gì đến anh ấy, Dorian,” họa sỹ nói. “Tôi hiểu điều mà cậu muốn nói, và tôi tin cô gái này. Bất cứ ai được cậu yêu ắt là tuyệt diệu, và bất cứ cô gái nào tạo được sự ảnh hưởng mà cậu miêu tả ắt phải xinh đẹp và cao quý. Nâng tầm thời đại của ta — đó là việc rất đáng để làm. Nếu cô gái này có thể thổi hồn vào những kẻ đã sống thiếu nó, nếu cô ấy có thể tạo ra khả năng cảm thụ cái đẹp ở những kẻ mà đời họ từng hèn hạ và xấu xí, nếu cô ấy có thể vắt kiệt tính ích kỷ ra khỏi họ và rót thêm vào họ những giọt lệ cho các nỗi buồn không của riêng họ, thì cô ấy xứng đáng với mọi sự tôn thờ của cậu, xứng đáng với sự tôn thờ của cả thế giới. Cuộc hôn nhân này hoàn toàn đúng đắn. Lúc đầu thì tôi không nghĩ thế, nhưng bây giờ tôi thừa nhận nó. Các vị thần đã tạo ra Sibyl Vane cho anh. Thiếu cô ấy, anh sẽ bị khiếm khuyết.”
tr: Ressam, “Sen ona aldırma, Dorian,” dedi. “Ben senin ne demek istediğini anlıyorum, bu kıza da güvenim var. Senin sevdiğin kişi kim olursa olsun, fevkaladedir; şu senin anlattığın etkiyi yaratan kız da, kim olursa olsun üstün ve asil biridir. Kişinin çağını tinselleştirmesi... Gerçekten değerli bir uğraş bu. Eğer bu kız ruhsuz yaşamış olanlarda ruh yaratabiliyorsa, pis ve çirkin yaşamlar sürmüş olanlarda güzellik hissi uyandırabiliyorsa, onları bencilliklerinden sıyırıp başkalarının dertleri uğruna gözyaşı dökmelerini sağlayabiliyorsa... O zaman bu kız senin tapmana, dünyanın tapınmasına layık demektir. Bu evlilik pek yerinde bir şey olur. İlkin böyle düşünmedim ama şimdi uygunluğunu kabul ediyorum. Tanrılar Sibyl Vane’i senin için yaratmışlar. Onsuz sen eksik kalırdın.
es: —No le hagas caso, Dorian —dijo el pintor—. Yo sí entiendo lo que quieres decir y estoy convencido de que esa chica es como dices. La mujer a quien tú ames ha de ser maravillosa, y cualquier muchacha que consigue el efecto que describes ha de ser espléndida y noble. Espiritualizar a la propia época..., eso es algo que merece la pena. Si Sibyl es capaz de dar un alma a quienes han vivido sin ella, si crea un sentimiento de belleza en personas cuyas vidas han sido sórdidas y miserables, si los libera de su egoísmo y les presta lágrimas por sufrimientos que no son suyos, se merece toda tu adoración, se merece la adoración del mundo entero. Tu matrimonio con ella es un acierto. Al principio no lo creía así, pero ahora lo veo de otra manera. Los dioses han hecho a Sibyl Vane para ti. Sin ella hubieras quedado incompleto.
vi_translation: “Don't pay any attention to him, Dorian,” the artist said. “I understand what you mean, and I believe in this girl. Anyone you love must be wonderful, and any girl who can have the influence you describe must be beautiful and noble. Elevating our era — that is a very worthwhile endeavor. If this girl can breathe life into those who have lived without it, if she can create an appreciation for beauty in those whose lives have been mean and ugly, if she can drain selfishness from them and pour into them tears for sorrows that are not their own, then she deserves all your adoration, she deserves the adoration of the whole world. This marriage is entirely right. At first, I did not think so, but now I admit it. The gods have made Sibyl Vane for you. Without her, you would be incomplete.”
tr_translation: The painter said, "Don't mind him, Dorian." "I understand what you mean, and I trust this girl too. Whoever you love is extraordinary; the girl who creates the effect you described is, whoever she may be, superior and noble. To spiritualize one's age... That is truly a valuable endeavor. If this girl can create a soul in those who have lived soulless lives, can evoke a sense of beauty in those who have led dirty and ugly lives, can strip them of their selfishness and make them shed tears for the troubles of others... Then this girl is worthy of your worship, and the world's worship. This marriage would be very fitting. I didn't think so at first, but now I accept its suitability. The gods have created Sibyl Vane for you. Without her, you would be incomplete."
es_translation: —Don't pay attention to him, Dorian —said the painter—. I do understand what you mean and I am convinced that this girl is as you say. The woman you love must be wonderful, and any girl who achieves the effect you describe must be splendid and noble. To spiritualize one's own era..., that is something worthwhile. If Sibyl is capable of giving a soul to those who have lived without one, if she creates a sense of beauty in people whose lives have been sordid and miserable, if she frees them from their selfishness and lends them tears for sufferings that are not their own, she deserves all your adoration, she deserves the adoration of the entire world. Your marriage to her is a success. At first, I didn't believe so, but now I see it differently. The gods have made Sibyl Vane for you. Without her, you would have been incomplete.

en: “Thanks, Basil,” answered Dorian Gray, pressing his hand. “I knew that you would understand me. Harry is so cynical, he terrifies me. But here is the orchestra. It is quite dreadful, but it only lasts for about five minutes. Then the curtain rises, and you will see the girl to whom I am going to give all my life, to whom I have given everything that is good in me.”
vi: “Cảm ơn, Basil,” Dorian Gray trả lời, nắm chặt tay y. “Tôi biết là anh sẽ hiểu tôi. Harry mới hay giễu cợt làm sao, anh ấy làm tôi khiếp sợ. Nhưng đây là dàn nhạc. Nó đúng là dễ sợ, nhưng nó chỉ kéo dài độ năm phút thôi. Sau đó màn lên, và anh sẽ thấy cô gái mà tôi sắp hiến dâng cả đời mình, cô gái mà tôi đã hiến dâng mọi thứ tốt đẹp trong tôi.”
tr: Dorian Gray, “Sağ ol, Basil,” diyerek ressamın elini sıktı. “Biliyordum beni anlayacağını. Harry öylesine alaycı ki beni korkutuyor. Neyse, işte orkestra. Pek berbat bir orkestra, ama neyse ki ancak beş dakika sürüyor. Sonra perde açılacak... Siz de benim bütün hayatımı adadığım kızı göreceksiniz. Özümde iyi olan ne varsa hepsini ona adadım zaten.
es: —Gracias, Basil —respondió Dorian Gray, dándole un apretón de manos—. Sabía que me entenderías. Harry es tan cínico que me aterra. Pero aquí llega la orquesta. Aunque espantosa, sólo toca unos cinco minutos aproximadamente. Luego se levanta el telón, y veréis a la muchacha a quien voy a dar toda mi vida, y a la que ya he dado todo lo bueno que hay en mí.
vi_translation: “Thank you, Basil,” Dorian Gray replied, gripping his hand tightly. “I knew you would understand me. Harry is so mocking, he terrifies me. But this is the orchestra. It is indeed frightening, but it only lasts about five minutes. Then the curtain rises, and you will see the girl to whom I am about to dedicate my whole life, the girl to whom I have dedicated everything good in me.”
tr_translation: Dorian Gray, "Thank you, Basil," he said, shaking the painter's hand. "I knew you would understand me. Harry is so cynical that he scares me. Anyway, here's the orchestra. A rather terrible orchestra, but fortunately it only lasts five minutes. Then the curtain will rise... You will see the girl to whom I have dedicated my entire life. I have already dedicated everything good in me to her."
es_translation: —Thank you, Basil —replied Dorian Gray, shaking his hand—. I knew you would understand me. Harry is so cynical that he terrifies me. But here comes the orchestra. Although dreadful, it only plays for about five minutes. Then the curtain rises, and you will see the girl to whom I am going to give my whole life, and to whom I have already given all the good that is in me.

en: A quarter of an hour afterwards, amidst an extraordinary turmoil of applause, Sibyl Vane stepped on to the stage. Yes, she was certainly lovely to look at—one of the loveliest creatures, Lord Henry thought, that he had ever seen. There was something of the fawn in her shy grace and startled eyes. A faint blush, like the shadow of a rose in a mirror of silver, came to her cheeks as she glanced at the crowded enthusiastic house. She stepped back a few paces and her lips seemed to tremble. Basil Hallward leaped to his feet and began to applaud. Motionless, and as one in a dream, sat Dorian Gray, gazing at her. Lord Henry peered through his glasses, murmuring, “Charming! charming!”
vi: Một phần tư giờ sau đó, giữa tiếng vỗ tay náo động khác thường, Sibyl Vane bước ra sân khấu. Vâng, trông nàng đúng là đẹp thật — một trong những tạo vật đẹp nhất, huân tước Henry nghĩ, mà y từng nhìn thấy. Có gì đó rất nai tơ trong vẻ duyên dáng thẹn thùng và đôi mắt hoảng hốt của nàng. Một chút ửng đỏ e dè, như bóng bông hồng trong gương bạc, hiện lên má nàng lúc nàng liếc nhìn rạp hát chật ních, nhiệt tình. Nàng lùi lại vài bước, và môi nàng dường như run rẩy. Basil Hallward đứng phắt dậy và bắt đầu vỗ tay. Bất động, như người đang mơ, Dorian Gray ngồi, nhìn nàng chằm chằm. Huân tước Henry ngắm qua ống nhòm của mình, lẩm bẩm, “Duyên quá! duyên quá!”
tr: Bir çeyrek saat sonra, şaşılacak bir alkış tufanı arasında Sibyl Vane sahneye çıktı. Güzel olmasına güzeldi gerçekten; Lord Henry onun, ömründe gördüğü en güzel yaratıklardan biri olduğunu itiraf ediyordu. O utangaç zarifliğinde, ürkek gözlerinde ceylanları andırır bir şey vardı. Kız kalabalık, coşkulu salona baktıkça yanaklarına gümüş bir aynaya yansımış bir gülün gölgesini andırır bir pembelik vurdu. Genç kız bir iki adım geriledi; dudakları titriyordu sanki. Basil Hallward yerinden fırlayarak el çırpmaya başladı. Dorian Gray’se kıpırtısız oturduğu yerden bir düşte gibi gözlerini kıza dikmişti. Lord Henry dürbünüyle bakarak, “Çok hoş, çok hoş,” diye mırıldanıyordu.
es: Un cuarto de hora después, acompañada de unos aplausos estruendosos, Sibyl Vane apareció en el escenario. Sí, no había duda de su encanto; era, pensó lord Henry, una de las criaturas más encantadoras que había visto nunca. Había algo de gacela en su gracia tímida y en sus ojos sorprendidos. Un ligero arrebol, como la sombra de una rosa en un espejo de plata, se asomó a sus mejillas cuando vio el teatro abarrotado y entusiasta. Retrocedió unos pasos y pareció que le temblaban los labios. Basil Hallward se puso en pie y empezó a aplaudir. Inmóvil, como en un sueño, Dorian Gray siguió sentado, mirándola fijamente. Lord Henry la examinó con sus gemelos y murmuró: «Encantadora, encantadora».
vi_translation: A quarter of an hour later, amid unusually loud applause, Sibyl Vane stepped onto the stage. Yes, she truly looked beautiful — one of the most beautiful creations, Lord Henry thought, that he had ever seen. There was something very innocent in her shy grace and startled eyes. A slight blush of shyness, like the shadow of a rose in a silver mirror, appeared on her cheeks as she glanced at the packed, enthusiastic theater. She took a few steps back, and her lips seemed to tremble. Basil Hallward stood up abruptly and began to clap. Motionless, as if in a dream, Dorian Gray sat, staring at her. Lord Henry observed through his binoculars, muttering, “Charming! Charming!”
tr_translation: A quarter of an hour later, amidst an astonishing storm of applause, Sibyl Vane came on stage. She was indeed beautiful; Lord Henry admitted that she was one of the most beautiful creatures he had ever seen in his life. There was something in her shy elegance, in her timid eyes that resembled a deer. As the girl looked at the crowded, enthusiastic hall, a blush resembling the shadow of a rose reflected in a silver mirror appeared on her cheeks. The young girl took a couple of steps back; her lips seemed to be trembling. Basil Hallward jumped up from his seat and started clapping. Dorian Gray, however, sat motionless, staring at the girl as if in a dream. Lord Henry, looking through his binoculars, murmured, “Very nice, very nice.”
es_translation: A quarter of an hour later, accompanied by thunderous applause, Sibyl Vane appeared on the stage. Yes, there was no doubt about her charm; she was, thought Lord Henry, one of the most enchanting creatures he had ever seen. There was something of a gazelle in her shy grace and her surprised eyes. A slight blush, like the shadow of a rose in a silver mirror, appeared on her cheeks when she saw the crowded and enthusiastic theater. She took a few steps back and it seemed that her lips were trembling. Basil Hallward stood up and began to applaud. Motionless, as if in a dream, Dorian Gray remained seated, staring at her intently. Lord Henry examined her with his binoculars and murmured: "Charming, charming."

en: The scene was the hall of Capulet’s house, and Romeo in his pilgrim’s dress had entered with Mercutio and his other friends. The band, such as it was, struck up a few bars of music, and the dance began. Through the crowd of ungainly, shabbily dressed actors, Sibyl Vane moved like a creature from a finer world. Her body swayed, while she danced, as a plant sways in the water. The curves of her throat were the curves of a white lily. Her hands seemed to be made of cool ivory.
vi: Cảnh phông là sảnh nhà Capulet, và Romeo, mặc bộ đồ người hành hương, bước vào với Mercutio và các bạn khác của anh. Dàn nhạc, vẫn tệ như trước, bắt đầu cứ lên vài nhịp nhạc, và vũ điệu bắt đầu. Xuyên qua đám đông diễn viên vụng về, ăn mặc xoàng xĩnh, Sibyl Vane di chuyển như một tạo vật từ một thế giới cao quý hơn. Người nàng lắc lư, trong lúc nàng nhảy múa, như cái cây lắc lư trong nước. Những đường cong của cổ họng nàng là những đường cong của một đóa hoa loa kèn trắng. Tay nàng dường như được tạc từ ngà voi mát lạnh.
tr: Sahne Capuletlerin evinin holüydü. Yolcu kılığında Romeo, yanında Mercutio ve öbür arkadaşlarıyla birlikte içeri girmişti. Orkestra, elinden geldiğince bir şeyler çalmaya başladı ve dans başladı. Kötü giyimli, hantal oyuncuların oluşturduğu kalabalığın içinde Sibyl Vane daha üstün, daha güzel bir dünyadan gelme bir yaratığı andırıyordu. Dans ederken bedeni suda salınan sazlar gibi sallanıyordu. Boynunun yuvarlak çizgileri bir beyaz zambağın yuvarlak çizgileriydi. Elleri serin fildişinden yapılma gibiydi.
es: La acción transcurría en el vestíbulo de la casa de los Capuleto, y Romeo, vestido de peregrino, había entrado con Mercutio y sus amigos. Los músicos tocaron unos compases de acuerdo con sus posibilidades y comenzó la danza. Entre la multitud de actores desangelados y pobremente vestidos, Sibyl Vane se movía como una criatura de un mundo superior. Su cuerpo se agitaba, al bailar, como se mueve una planta dentro del agua. Las ondulaciones de su garganta eran las ondulaciones de un lirio blanco. Sus manos parecían hechas de sereno marfil.
vi_translation: The scene is the Capulet's hall, and Romeo, dressed as a pilgrim, enters with Mercutio and his other friends. The orchestra, still as bad as before, starts playing a few bars of music, and the dance begins. Through the crowd of clumsy, poorly dressed actors, Sibyl Vane moves like a creature from a nobler world. Her body sways, as she dances, like a tree swaying in the water. The curves of her throat are like the curves of a white lily flower. Her hands seem to be carved from cool ivory.
tr_translation: The scene was the hall of the Capulet house. Disguised as a traveler, Romeo had entered with Mercutio and his other friends. The orchestra began to play something as best as they could, and the dance began. In the crowd of poorly dressed, clumsy actors, Sibyl Vane resembled a creature from a superior, more beautiful world. As she danced, her body swayed like reeds in the water. The round lines of her neck were like the round lines of a white lily. Her hands seemed to be made of cool ivory.
es_translation: The action took place in the lobby of the Capulet house, and Romeo, dressed as a pilgrim, had entered with Mercutio and his friends. The musicians played a few bars to the best of their abilities and the dance began. Among the crowd of disheartened and poorly dressed actors, Sibyl Vane moved like a creature from a higher world. Her body swayed, as she danced, like a plant moves within water. The undulations of her throat were the undulations of a white lily. Her hands seemed made of serene ivory.

en: Yet she was curiously listless. She showed no sign of joy when her eyes rested on Romeo. The few words she had to speak—
vi: Song nàng lơ đãng lạ lùng. Nàng không thể hiện dấu hiệu vui mừng nào khi mắt nàng ngưng lại ở Romeo. Vài lời nàng phải nói…
tr: Ne var ki üzerinde tuhaf bir tutukluk vardı. Gözleri Romeo’ya takılınca hiçbir sevinç belirtisi göstermedi. Söylemesi gereken birkaç sözü:
es: Y, sin embargo, resultaba curiosamente apática. No manifestó signo alguno de alegría cuando sus ojos se posaron sobre Romeo. Las pocas palabras que tenía que decir:
vi_translation: But she was strangely absent-minded. She showed no sign of joy when her eyes rested on Romeo. A few words she had to say...
tr_translation: However, there was a strange awkwardness about him. When his eyes fell on Romeo, he showed no sign of joy. A few words he had to say:
es_translation: And yet, she appeared curiously apathetic. She showed no sign of joy when her eyes fell upon Romeo. The few words she had to say:

en: Good pilgrim, you do wrong your hand too much,
vi: Người hành hương tử tế ơi, đừng tự hại cánh tay phàm,
tr: “Aziz yolcu, haksızlık ediyorsun sen ellerine,
es: Buen peregrino, no reproches tanto
vi_translation: Kind pilgrim, do not harm your mortal arm,
tr_translation: "Dear traveler, you are being unfair to your hands,"
es_translation: Good pilgrim, do not reproach so much

en: For saints have hands that pilgrims’ hands do touch,
vi: Bởi các thiên thần có bàn tay mà chàng đã chạm,
tr: Azizler elleriyle kutsarlar yolcuları,
es: si juntan manos peregrino y santo,
vi_translation: By the angels' hands that he has touched,
tr_translation: The saints bless the travelers with their hands,
es_translation: if pilgrim and saint join hands,

en: And palm to palm is holy palmers’ kiss—
vi: Và lòng tay áp lòng tay là nụ hôn khách hành hương đất thánh...
tr: Avucun avuca değmesidir bacıların öpüşü...
es: palma con palma es beso de palmero...
vi_translation: And palm to palm is holy palmers' kiss...
tr_translation: The touching of palms is the kiss of sisters...”
es_translation: palm to palm is a kiss from a palm tree grower...

en: with the brief dialogue that follows, were spoken in a thoroughly artificial manner. The voice was exquisite, but from the point of view of tone it was absolutely false. It was wrong in colour. It took away all the life from the verse. It made the passion unreal.
vi: cùng đoạn đối thoại ngắn theo sau, đã được nói với một thái độ hết sức giả tạo. Giọng thì tuyệt, nhưng trên quan điểm về tông thì nó sai hoàn toàn. Nó cũng không ổn về sắc thái. Nó rút sạch sinh khí của đoạn thơ. Nó làm cho nỗi đam mê thành ra hão huyền.
tr: ve bunu izleyen kısa repliği baştan sona yapay bir tavırla söyledi. Sesi nefis olmakla birlikte tonlama yönünden tümüyle yapmacıktı, rengi yanlıştı. Okuduğu şiirin bütün canlılığını söndürüyordu. Aşkın ateşini asılsızlaştırıyordu.
es: junto con el breve diálogo que sigue, fueron pronunciadas de manera completamente artificial. La voz era exquisita, pero desde el punto de vista de tono, absolutamente falsa. La coloración era equivocada. Privaba de vida a los versos. Hacía que la pasión resultase irreal.
vi_translation: The short dialogue that followed was spoken with an extremely artificial attitude. The voice was great, but in terms of tone, it was completely wrong. It was also off in terms of nuance. It drained the life out of the poem. It made the passion seem hollow.
tr_translation: and then delivered the following short line with an entirely artificial demeanor. Although his voice was exquisite, his intonation was completely affected, the color was wrong. He was extinguishing all the vitality of the poem he read. He was rendering the fire of love insubstantial.
es_translation: together with the brief dialogue that follows, were pronounced in a completely artificial manner. The voice was exquisite, but from the point of view of tone, absolutely false. The coloration was wrong. It deprived the verses of life. It made the passion seem unreal.

en: Dorian Gray grew pale as he watched her. He was puzzled and anxious. Neither of his friends dared to say anything to him. She seemed to them to be absolutely incompetent. They were horribly disappointed.
vi: Dorian Gray tái mặt đi khi cậu theo dõi nàng. Cậu bối rối và băn khoăn. Cả hai người bạn cậu đều không dám nói gì với cậu. Họ thấy nàng hình như hoàn toàn bất tài. Họ thất vọng kinh khủng.
tr: Dorian Gray ona baktıkça sararmaktaydı. Şaşırmıştı, kaygılıydı. Arkadaşlarının ikisi de ona herhangi bir şey söylemeyi göze alamıyorlardı. Kız tamamen yetersiz görünmüştü gözlerine. Hayal kırıklığı içindeydiler.
es: Dorian Gray fue palideciendo mientras la contemplaba. Estaba desconcertado y lleno de ansiedad. Ninguno de sus dos amigos se atrevía a decir nada. Sibyl les parecía absolutamente incompetente. Se sentían horriblemente decepcionados.
vi_translation: Dorian Gray turned pale as he watched her. He was confused and anxious. Both of his friends did not dare to say anything to him. They found her seemingly completely incompetent. They were terribly disappointed.
tr_translation: Dorian Gray was turning pale as he looked at her. He was surprised, anxious. Neither of his friends dared to say anything to him. The girl had seemed completely inadequate in their eyes. They were disappointed.
es_translation: Dorian Gray grew pale as he watched her. He was bewildered and full of anxiety. Neither of his two friends dared to say anything. Sibyl seemed absolutely incompetent to them. They felt horribly disappointed.

en: Yet they felt that the true test of any Juliet is the balcony scene of the second act. They waited for that. If she failed there, there was nothing in her.
vi: Song họ cảm thấy rằng phép thử thực sự cho mọi Juliet là cảnh ban-công ở hồi hai. Họ chờ lúc ấy. Nếu nàng lại hỏng ở đấy, thì chẳng có tài năng gì ở nàng cả.
tr: Gene de bütün Julietlerin gerçek sınavının ikinci perdedeki balkon sahnesi olduğuna inanıyor, bunu bekliyorlardı. Kız bunda da başarısız olursa hiçbir yeteneği yok demekti.
es: De todos modos, comprendían que la verdadera prueba de cualquier Julieta es la escena del balcón en el segundo acto. Esperarían a que llegara. Si fallaba allí, todo habría acabado.
vi_translation: They felt that the true test for any Juliet was the balcony scene in act two. They waited for that moment. If she failed there, then she had no talent at all.
tr_translation: Gene believed that the real test for all Juliets was the balcony scene in the second act, and they were waiting for it. If the girl failed in this as well, it meant she had no talent at all.
es_translation: In any case, they understood that the true test for any Juliet is the balcony scene in the second act. They would wait for it to arrive. If she failed there, everything would be over.

en: She looked charming as she came out in the moonlight. That could not be denied. But the staginess of her acting was unbearable, and grew worse as she went on. Her gestures became absurdly artificial. She overemphasized everything that she had to say. The beautiful passage—
vi: Nàng trông rất duyên lúc nàng bước ra dưới ánh trăng. Điều ấy không thể phủ nhận được. Nhưng tính sân khấu trong diễn xuất của nàng thì không thể chấp nhận nổi, và tệ đi khi nàng tiếp tục. Các cử chỉ của nàng trở nên giả tạo một cách ngớ ngẩn. Nàng nhấn mạnh quá mức mọi thứ mà nàng phải nói. Đoạn thơ đẹp:
tr: Sibyl ay ışıklı sahneye çıktığı zaman göz okşuyordu. Bu yadsınamazdı. Gelgelelim oyununun yapmacıklığı dayanılır gibi değildi, giderek de kötüleşiyordu. Şimdi jestlerine de gülünç bir yapaylık sinmişti. Söylediği her şeyi aşırı vurguluyordu.
es: De nuevo estaba encantadora cuando reapareció al claro de luna. Eso no se podía negar. Pero lo forzado de su interpretación resultaba insoportable, y fue empeorando con el paso del tiempo. Sus gestos se hicieron absurdamente artificiales. Subrayaba excesivamente todo lo que tenía que decir. El hermoso pasaje:
vi_translation: She looked very charming as she stepped out under the moonlight. That cannot be denied. But the theatricality in her performance was unbearable, and it worsened as she continued. Her gestures became ridiculously artificial. She overemphasized everything she had to say. The beautiful verse:
tr_translation: When Sibyl stepped onto the moonlit stage, she was captivating. This was undeniable. However, the artificiality of her performance was unbearable, and it was getting worse. Now, a ridiculous artificiality had crept into her gestures as well. She was overemphasizing everything she said.
es_translation: She was charming again when she reappeared in the moonlight. That could not be denied. But the forced nature of her performance was unbearable, and it worsened over time. Her gestures became absurdly artificial. She excessively emphasized everything she had to say. The beautiful passage:

en: Thou knowest the mask of night is on my face,
vi: Chàng biết tấm mạng đêm đang che mặt em,
tr: “Biliyorsun, gecenin maskesi var yüzümde,
es: La noche me oculta con su velo;
vi_translation: He knows the night veil is covering your face,
tr_translation: "You know, the mask of the night is on my face,"
es_translation: The night hides me with its veil;

en: Else would a maiden blush bepaint my cheek
vi: Không thì sắc hồng thiếu nữ đã tô má em
tr: Yoksa genç kız pembesi boyardı yanağımı
es: si no, el rubor teñiría mis mejillas
vi_translation: Otherwise, the rosy hue of youth would have already colored your cheeks
tr_translation: Or would the young girl paint my cheek pink
es_translation: if not, the blush would tint my cheeks

en: was declaimed with the painful precision of a schoolgirl who has been taught to recite by some second-rate professor of elocution. When she leaned over the balcony and came to those wonderful lines—
vi: Bị ngâm nga với sự chính xác cực nhọc của một nữ sinh đã từng được dạy đọc thuộc lòng bởi một ông thầy diễn thuyết hạng hai nào đó. Khi nàng nghiêng mình qua ban-công và đến với những dòng tuyệt vời này:
tr: diyen o güzel bölüm, ikinci sınıf bir belagat hocasının yetiştirdiği bir okul çocuğunun gergin dikkatiyle okundu. Sibyl balkondan eğilip de sıra o şahane satırlara geldiği zamansa;
es: fue declamado con la penosa precisión de una colegiala a quien ha enseñado a recitar un profesor de elocución de tercera categoría. Y cuando se asomó al balcón y llegó a los maravillosos versos:
vi_translation: Recited with the laborious precision of a schoolgirl who had once been taught to memorize by some second-rate elocution teacher. When she leaned over the balcony and came to these wonderful lines:
tr_translation: that beautiful section was read with the tense attention of a school child trained by a second-rate rhetoric teacher. When Sibyl leaned over the balcony and it came to those magnificent lines;
es_translation: it was declaimed with the painful precision of a schoolgirl who has been taught to recite by a third-rate elocution teacher. And when she leaned out the balcony and reached the marvelous verses:

en: Although I joy in thee,
vi: Dẫu em vui sướng bên chàng,
tr: “Senin gelmene seviniyorum ama
es: Aunque seas mi alegría,
vi_translation: Even if you are happy beside him,
tr_translation: “I'm happy that you're coming, but
es_translation: Even though you are my joy,

en: I have no joy of this contract to-night:
vi: Em không vui với giao kèo đêm nay:
tr: Bu geceki anlaşma sevinç vermiyor bana.
es: no me alegra nuestro acuerdo de esta noche:
vi_translation: I'm not happy with tonight's deal:
tr_translation: This evening's agreement does not bring me joy.
es_translation: I am not pleased with our agreement tonight:

en: It is too rash, too unadvised, too sudden;
vi: Nó quá vội vàng, quá khinh suất, quá đường đột;
tr: Çünkü pek ani, pek çılgın, pek gözükara.
es: demasiado brusco, imprudente, repentino,
vi_translation: It was too hasty, too reckless, too abrupt;
tr_translation: Because very sudden, very crazy, very reckless.
es_translation: too abrupt, reckless, sudden,

en: Too like the lightning, which doth cease to be
vi: Quá giống với tia sét, thứ đã mất
tr: Tıpkı şimşek gibi, ‘çaktı’
es: igual que el relámpago, que cesa
vi_translation: Too similar to lightning, the thing that was lost
tr_translation: Just like lightning, it 'struck'
es_translation: just like the lightning, which ceases

en: Ere one can say, “It lightens.” Sweet, good-night!
vi: Trước khi ta kịp nói, “sét đánh.” Chàng ơi, hãy ngủ ngon!
tr: Sönüp giden... Tatlım, iyi geceler!
es: antes de poder nombrarlo. Amor, buenas noches.
vi_translation: Before I could speak, "lightning struck." My dear, sleep well!
tr_translation: Fading away... Sweetheart, good night!
es_translation: before being able to name it. Love, good night.

en: This bud of love by summer’s ripening breath
vi: Mong sao nụ tình này từ hơi thở chín mọng của mùa hạ
tr: Dilerim bu küçük aşk tomurcuğu Yazın sıcak soluğuyla serpilip büyüsün de
es: Con el aliento del verano, este brote amoroso
vi_translation: Wishing that this bud of love ripens from the lush breath of summer
tr_translation: I hope this small bud of love Let it flourish and grow with the warm breath of summer
es_translation: With the breath of summer, this budding love

en: May prove a beauteous flower when next we meet—
vi: Sẽ nở thành một bông hoa đẹp khi ta gặp lần sau…
tr: Dilber bir çiçek olsun, biz yeniden Buluşuncaya değin...
es: puede dar bella flor cuando volvamos a vernos...
vi_translation: It will bloom into a beautiful flower when we meet again...
tr_translation: Let Dilber be a flower, we start anew Until we meet again...”
es_translation: it can give a beautiful flower when we see each other again...

en: she spoke the words as though they conveyed no meaning to her. It was not nervousness. Indeed, so far from being nervous, she was absolutely self-contained. It was simply bad art. She was a complete failure.
vi: nàng nói các từ như thể chúng không chuyển tải được ý nghĩa nào đến với nàng. Đó không phải là sự bối rối. Quả thực, chẳng những không bị bối rối chút nào, nàng còn hoàn toàn tự chủ. Đó đơn giản là thứ nghệ thuật tồi tệ. Nàng là một kẻ thất bại toàn diện.
tr: bunları sanki onun için hiçbir anlam taşımıyormuş gibi okudu. Tedirginlik, ürküntü değildi bu. Tersine, genç kız tedirginlikten tümüyle uzak, tümüyle kendine hâkimdi, tek kelimeyle kötü oynuyordu. Tamamen başarısızdı.
es: dijo las palabras como si carecieran por completo de sentido. No era nerviosismo. De hecho, lejos de estar nerviosa, parecía absolutamente dueña de sí misma. Era sencillamente una mala interpretación, y Sibyl un completo desastre.
vi_translation: She spoke the words as if they conveyed no meaning to her. It was not confusion. In fact, far from being confused, she was completely in control. It was simply bad art. She was a complete failure.
tr_translation: He read these as if they meant nothing to him. This was not uneasiness or fear. On the contrary, the young woman was completely free from uneasiness, entirely in control of herself, in a word, she was acting poorly. She was completely unsuccessful.
es_translation: He said the words as if they were completely meaningless. It wasn't nervousness. In fact, far from being nervous, she seemed absolutely in control of herself. It was simply a misunderstanding, and Sibyl a complete disaster.

en: Even the common uneducated audience of the pit and gallery lost their interest in the play. They got restless, and began to talk loudly and to whistle. The Jew manager, who was standing at the back of the dress-circle, stamped and swore with rage. The only person unmoved was the girl herself.
vi: Thậm chí các khán giả bình dân, thất học ở hạng nhì và hạng chuồng gà cũng mất chú ý đến vở kịch. Họ động đậy không ngừng, bắt đầu nói to và huýt sáo. Ông bầu Do Thái, nãy giờ vẫn đứng sâu trong ban-công, dậm chân và chửi thề tức tối. Người duy nhất dửng dưng lại là chính cô gái.
tr: Salondaki, balkondaki sıradan, eğitimsiz seyirciler bile oyuna duydukları ilgiyi yitirdiler. Kıpırdanmaya, yüksek sesle konuşup ıslık çalmaya başladılar. Geride durmakta olan Yahudi menajer öfkeden tepiniyor, sövüp sayıyordu. Oralı olmayan tek kişi kızın kendisiydi.
es: Incluso el público del patio de butacas y del paraíso, vulgar y sin educación, había perdido interés por la obra. Incómodos, empezaban a hablar en voz alta y a silbar. El empresario judío, de pie tras los asientos del primer anfiteatro, golpeaba el suelo con los pies y protestaba indignado. Tan sólo Sibyl permanecía indiferente.
vi_translation: Even the common, uneducated audience members in the second tier and the chicken coop section lost interest in the play. They fidgeted constantly, started talking loudly, and whistling. The Jewish impresario, who had been standing deep in the balcony, stomped his feet and cursed angrily. The only person who remained indifferent was the girl herself.
tr_translation: Even the ordinary, uneducated spectators in the living room and on the balcony lost interest in the play. They started to fidget, talk loudly, and whistle. The Jewish manager standing in the back was stomping in anger, cursing and swearing. The only person who was indifferent was the girl herself.
es_translation: Even the audience in the stalls and the gallery, vulgar and uneducated, had lost interest in the play. Uncomfortable, they began to talk loudly and whistle. The Jewish impresario, standing behind the seats of the first amphitheater, was stamping his feet and protesting indignantly. Only Sibyl remained indifferent.

en: When the second act was over, there came a storm of hisses, and Lord Henry got up from his chair and put on his coat. “She is quite beautiful, Dorian,” he said, “but she can’t act. Let us go.”
vi: Khi hồi hai đã hết, một cơn bão huýt sáo nổi lên, còn huân tước Henry đứng dậy khỏi ghế và mặc áo khoác vào. “Cô ấy rất đẹp, Dorian,” y nói, “nhưng cô ấy không biết diễn. Ta đi nào.”
tr: İkinci perde inince yuhalamalar fırtına gibi esti, Lord Henry yerinden kalkarak paltosunu giydi. “Kız son derece güzel, Dorian, ama oyun yeteneği yok,” dedi. “Gidelim.
es: Al término del segundo acto se produjo una tormenta de silbidos. Lord Henry se levantó de su asiento y se puso el gabán. —Es muy hermosa, Dorian —dijo—, pero incapaz de interpretar. Vámonos.
vi_translation: When the second act ended, a whistling storm arose, and Lord Henry got up from his seat and put on his coat. “She is very beautiful, Dorian,” he said, “but she cannot act. Let's go.”
tr_translation: When the second act ended, boos erupted like a storm, and Lord Henry stood up and put on his coat. "The girl is extremely beautiful, Dorian, but she has no acting talent," he said. "Let's go."
es_translation: At the end of the second act, a storm of whistles erupted. Lord Henry rose from his seat and put on his overcoat. —She is very beautiful, Dorian —he said—, but incapable of acting. Let's go.

en: “I am going to see the play through,” answered the lad, in a hard bitter voice. “I am awfully sorry that I have made you waste an evening, Harry. I apologize to you both.”
vi: “Tôi sẽ xem cho đến hết vở,” chàng trai trả lời, bằng giọng nói gay gắt, cay đắng. “Tôi rất lấy làm tiếc vì tôi đã làm anh lãng phí cả buổi tối, Harry. Tôi xin lỗi cả hai anh.”
tr: Genç adam acı, sert bir sesle, “Ben sonuna kadar seyredeceğim,” dedi. “Geceni boşa geçirttiğim için çok üzgünüm, Harry. İkinizden de özür diliyorum.
es: —Voy a quedarme hasta el final —respondió el joven, con una voz crispada y llena de amargura—. Siento mucho baberos hecho perder la velada. Os pido disculpas a los dos.
vi_translation: “I will watch until the end of the play,” the young man replied, in a harsh, bitter voice. “I am very sorry that I made you waste the entire evening, Harry. I apologize to both of you.”
tr_translation: The young man said in a bitter, harsh voice, "I will watch until the end." "I am very sorry for wasting your night, Harry. I apologize to both of you."
es_translation: —I am going to stay until the end —replied the young man, with a tense and bitter voice—. I am very sorry to have ruined the evening for you. I apologize to both of you.

en: “My dear Dorian, I should think Miss Vane was ill,” interrupted Hallward. “We will come some other night.”
vi: “Dorian thân mến của tôi, tôi cho là cô Vane bị ốm,” Hallward ngắt lời. “Ta sẽ đến vào một đêm nào đó khác.”
tr: Hallward, “Sevgili Dorian, Miss Vane hastaydı sanırım,” dedi. “Bir başka gece gene geliriz.
es: —Mi querido Dorian, a mí me parece que la señorita Vane está enferma —interrumpió Hallward—. Vendremos otra noche.
vi_translation: “My dear Dorian, I suppose Miss Vane is ill,” Hallward interrupted. “We will come another night.”
tr_translation: Hallward said, "Dear Dorian, Miss Vane was probably ill." "We will come again another night."
es_translation: —My dear Dorian, it seems to me that Miss Vane is unwell —interrupted Hallward—. We will come another night.

en: “I wish she were ill,” he rejoined. “But she seems to me to be simply callous and cold. She has entirely altered. Last night she was a great artist. This evening she is merely a commonplace mediocre actress.”
vi: “Tôi cũng hy vọng cô ấy bị ốm,” cậu đáp lại. “Nhưng tôi thấy dường như cô ấy hoàn toàn chai sạn và lạnh lùng. Cô ấy đã thay đổi hoàn toàn. Đêm gần đây nhất cô ấy còn là một nghệ sỹ vĩ đại. Tối nay cô ấy chỉ là mà một diễn viên tầm thường, hạng xoàng.”
tr: Dorian, “Keşke hasta olsa,” diye yanıtladı. “Bana duygusuz, soğuk gözüktü. Kökten değişmiş. Dün gece büyük bir sanatçıydı. Bu gece sıradan, ortalama bir aktris.
es: —Ojalá estuviera enferma —replicó Dorian Gray—. Pero a mí me ha parecido sencillamente insensible y fría. Ha cambiado por completo. Anoche era una gran artista. Hoy es una actriz vulgar, mediocre.
vi_translation: “I also hope she is ill,” he replied. “But it seems to me that she is completely numb and cold. She has changed completely. Just the other night she was a great artist. Tonight she is just a mediocre, second-rate actress.”
tr_translation: Dorian replied, "I wish she were ill." "She seemed emotionless, cold to me. She has fundamentally changed. Last night, she was a great artist. Tonight, she is an ordinary, average actress."
es_translation: —I wish she were ill —replied Dorian Gray—. But to me, she simply seemed insensitive and cold. She has completely changed. Last night she was a great artist. Today she is a vulgar, mediocre actress.

en: “Don’t talk like that about any one you love, Dorian. Love is a more wonderful thing than art.”
vi: “Đừng nói như vậy về bất cứ ai cậu yêu, Dorian. Ái tình là điều diệu kỳ hơn Nghệ thuật.”
tr: “Sevdiklerin konusunda bu biçimde konuşma, Dorian. Sevgi sanattan daha üstün bir şeydir.
es: —No hables así de alguien a quien amas, Dorian. El amor es más maravilloso que el arte.
vi_translation: “Don't speak that way about anyone you love, Dorian. Love is a more wonderful thing than Art.”
tr_translation: "Don't talk about your loved ones in this manner, Dorian. Love is something superior to art."
es_translation: —Don't speak like that about someone you love, Dorian. Love is more wonderful than art.

en: “They are both simply forms of imitation,” remarked Lord Henry. “But do let us go. Dorian, you must not stay here any longer. It is not good for one’s morals to see bad acting. Besides, I don’t suppose you will want your wife to act, so what does it matter if she plays Juliet like a wooden doll? She is very lovely, and if she knows as little about life as she does about acting, she will be a delightful experience. There are only two kinds of people who are really fascinating—people who know absolutely everything, and people who know absolutely nothing. Good heavens, my dear boy, don’t look so tragic! The secret of remaining young is never to have an emotion that is unbecoming. Come to the club with Basil and myself. We will smoke cigarettes and drink to the beauty of Sibyl Vane. She is beautiful. What more can you want?”
vi: “Cả hai chỉ là các hình thức bắt chước,” huân tước Henry nhận xét. “Nhưng thôi ta đi nào. Dorian, cậu không nên ở lại đây lâu hơn. Xem diễn xuất dở không tốt cho tinh thần. Ngoài ra, tôi không tin là cậu sẽ muốn vợ cậu đi diễn. Vậy thì nếu cô ấy đóng vai Juliet như con búp bê gỗ thì cũng có gì quan trọng đâu? Cô ấy rất xinh, và giả dụ cô ấy biết về cuộc sống cũng ít như cô ấy biết về diễn xuất, thì cô ấy sẽ là một kinh nghiệm thú vị. Chỉ có hai kiểu người thật sự hấp dẫn — người biết hết, và người không biết gì hết. Trời ơi, cậu bé thân mến của tôi, đừng nhìn thảm thế! Bí quyết gìn giữ tuổi xuân là không bao giờ có cảm xúc nào không thích hợp. Đi đến câu lạc bộ với Basil và tôi nhé. Chúng ta sẽ hút thuốc lá và uống mừng sắc đẹp của Sibyl Vane. Cô ấy đẹp thật. Cậu còn có thể muốn gì hơn?”
tr: Lord Henry, “İkisi de birer öykünme tarzından başka bir şey değildir,” diye görüşünü belirtti. “Ama kuzum, gidelim. Dorian, sen de oyalanma burada. Kötü oyunculuk ahlak bozar. Hem zaten eşinin sahneye çıkmasını isteyeceğini sanmıyorum. Öyleyse Juliet’i tahtadan bebek gibi oynasa da ne çıkar? Kız bir içim su. Hayatta da sahnedeki kadar toysa, zevkli bir deneyim olur senin için. İlginç ve çekici olan topu topu iki tip insan vardır: her şeyi bilenler, hiçbir şey bilmeyenler. Vay canına, sevgili oğlum, bu kadar acıklı bakmasana! Genç kalmanın gizi, yüze yakışmayan duygulardan uzak durmaktır. Hadi, bizimle kulübe gel. Birer sigara yakar, Sibyl Vane’in güzelliğine kadeh kaldırırız. Kız gerçekten güzel. Daha ne istiyorsun?
es: —Los dos son formas de imitación —señaló lord Henry—. Pero será mejor que nos vayamos. No debes seguir aquí por más tiempo, Dorian. No es bueno para la moral ver una mala interpretación. Además, supongo que no querrás que tu esposa actúe en el teatro. En ese caso, ¿qué importa si interpreta Julieta como una muñeca de madera? Es encantadora, y si sabe tan poco de la vida como de actuar en el teatro, será una experiencia deliciosa. Sólo hay dos clases de personas realmente fascinantes: las que lo saben absolutamente todo y las que no saben absolutamente nada. Santo cielo, muchacho, ¡no pongas esa expresión tan trágica! El secreto para conservar la juventud es no permitirse ninguna emoción impropia. Ven al club con Basil y conmigo. Fumaremos cigarrillos y beberemos para celebrar la belleza de Sibyl Vane, que es muy hermosa. ¿Qué más puedes querer?
vi_translation: “Both are merely forms of imitation,” remarked Lord Henry. “But let's go now. Dorian, you shouldn't stay here any longer. Watching bad acting is not good for the spirit. Besides, I don't believe you would want your wife to act. So if she plays Juliet like a wooden doll, what does it matter? She is very beautiful, and assuming she knows as little about life as she does about acting, she will be an interesting experience. There are only two kinds of people who are really fascinating — those who know everything, and those who know nothing. Good heavens, my dear boy, don't look so tragic! The secret of remaining young is never to have an emotion that is unsuitable. Come to the club with Basil and me. We will smoke cigarettes and toast to the beauty of Sibyl Vane. She is truly beautiful. What more could you want?”
tr_translation: Lord Henry expressed his opinion, "Both are nothing more than forms of imitation." "But come on, let's go. Dorian, don't linger here. Bad acting corrupts morals. Besides, I don't think you would want your wife to be on stage. So what if she acts like a wooden doll as Juliet? The girl is a sight to behold. If she is as naive in life as she is on stage, it will be an enjoyable experience for you. There are only two types of people who are interesting and attractive: those who know everything and those who know nothing. Oh dear, my dear boy, don't look so tragic! The secret to staying young is to avoid emotions that don't suit your face. Come, join us at the club. We'll light a cigarette and toast to Sibyl Vane's beauty. The girl is truly beautiful. What more do you want?"
es_translation: —Both are forms of imitation —pointed out Lord Henry—. But it would be better if we leave. You shouldn't stay here any longer, Dorian. It's not good for the morale to see a bad performance. Besides, I suppose you wouldn't want your wife to act in the theater. In that case, what does it matter if she plays Juliet like a wooden doll? She is charming, and if she knows as little about life as she does about acting in the theater, it will be a delightful experience. There are only two kinds of people who are really fascinating: those who know absolutely everything and those who know absolutely nothing. Good heavens, boy, don't put on such a tragic expression! The secret to preserving youth is not to allow oneself any improper emotion. Come to the club with Basil and me. We will smoke cigarettes and drink to celebrate the beauty of Sibyl Vane, who is very beautiful. What more could you want?

en: “Go away, Harry,” cried the lad. “I want to be alone. Basil, you must go. Ah! can’t you see that my heart is breaking?” The hot tears came to his eyes. His lips trembled, and rushing to the back of the box, he leaned up against the wall, hiding his face in his hands.
vi: “Đi đi, Harry,” chàng trai kêu lên. “Tôi muốn được một mình. Basil, anh cũng nên đi. Ôi! Chẳng lẽ các anh không thể thấy là tim tôi đang vụn vỡ hay sao? Những giọt lệ nồng dâng lên trong mắt cậu. Môi cậu run run, và, lao vào sâu trong khoang lô, cậu tựa lên tường, giấu mặt trong tay.
tr: Delikanlı, “Harry, gitsene sen!” diye bağırdı. “Yalnız kalmak istiyorum. Basil, sen de git. Of, yüreğim paralanıyor, görmüyor musunuz? Gözlerine sıcak yaşlar dolmuştu, dudakları titriyordu. Koşup locaya girdi, duvara yaslanarak yüzünü elleri arasına gizledi.
es: —Vete, Harry —exclamó el joven—. Quiero estar solo. Y tú también, Basil. ¿Es que no veis que se me está rompiendo el corazón? Lágrimas ardientes le asomaron a los ojos. Le temblaban los labios y, dirigiéndose al fondo del palco, se apoyó contra la pared, escondiendo la cara entre las manos.
vi_translation: "Go away, Harry," the young man cried out. "I want to be alone. Basil, you should go too. Oh! Can't you see that my heart is breaking? Tears welled up in his eyes. His lips trembled, and, rushing deep into the box, he leaned against the wall, hiding his face in his hands.
tr_translation: The young man shouted, "Harry, go away!" "I want to be alone. Basil, you go too. Oh, my heart is breaking, can't you see?" Warm tears filled her eyes, her lips were trembling. She ran and entered the box, leaning against the wall and hiding her face in her hands.
es_translation: —Go away, Harry —exclaimed the young man—. I want to be alone. And you too, Basil. Can't you see that my heart is breaking? Burning tears welled up in his eyes. His lips trembled and, moving to the back of the box, he leaned against the wall, hiding his face in his hands.

en: “Let us go, Basil,” said Lord Henry with a strange tenderness in his voice, and the two young men passed out together.
vi: “Ta đi nào, Basil,” huân tước Henry nói, với sự dịu dàng khang khác trong giọng; và hai người đàn ông trẻ tuổi ấy đi ra ngoài cùng nhau.
tr: Lord Henry, “Gidelim, Basil,” dedi. Sesinde tuhaf bir yumuşaklık, bir şefkât vardı. İki genç erkek birlikte dışarı çıktılar.
es: —Vámonos, Basil —dijo lord Henry, con una extraña ternura en la voz.
vi_translation: "Let's go, Basil," Lord Henry said, with a different kind of gentleness in his voice; and the two young men went out together.
tr_translation: Lord Henry said, "Let's go, Basil." There was a strange softness, a tenderness in his voice. The two young men went out together.
es_translation: —Let's go, Basil —said Lord Henry, with a strange tenderness in his voice.

en: A few moments afterwards the footlights flared up and the curtain rose on the third act. Dorian Gray went back to his seat. He looked pale, and proud, and indifferent. The play dragged on, and seemed interminable. Half of the audience went out, tramping in heavy boots and laughing. The whole thing was a fiasco. The last act was played to almost empty benches. The curtain went down on a titter and some groans.
vi: Vài phút sau, đèn chiếu trước sân khấu bừng sáng, và màn lên cho hồi ba. Dorian Gray quay lại chỗ ngồi. Cậu trông có vẻ nhợt nhạt, kiêu căng, hờ hững. Vở kịch kéo dài dường như vô tận. Nửa khán phòng bỏ ra ngoài, lê những đôi chân đi giày nặng, và cười cợt. Toàn bộ vụ này là một sự thất bại. Hồi cuối được diễn trước các hàng ghế gần như trống không. Màn hạ trong một tiếng cười khúc khích và vài tiếng lầm bầm chê bai.
tr: Birkaç dakika sonra sahnenin dibindeki ışıklar yandı ve üçüncü perde açıldı. Dorian yerini aldı. Solgun, gururlu, umursamaz duruyordu. Oyun uzayıp gidiyor, hiç bitmeyeceğe benziyordu. Seyircilerin yarısı, kaba kunduralarını takırdatıp gülüşerek salondan çıktılar. Tam bir fiyaskoydu bu. Son bölüm neredeyse boşalmış bir salona oynandı. Perde kıkırdaşmalar, oflayıp poflamalar arasında indi.
es: Un instante después habían desaparecido. Casi enseguida se encendieron las candilejas y se alzó el telón para el tercer acto. Dorian Gray volvió a su asiento. Estaba pálido, pero orgulloso e indiferente. La obra se fue arrastrando, interminable. La mitad del público abandonó la sala, haciendo ruido con sus pesadas botas y riéndose. La representación había sido un fiasco total. El último acto se interpretó ante una sala casi vacía. Una risa contenida y algunas protestas saludaron la caída del último telón.
vi_translation: A few minutes later, the stage lights flared up, and the curtain rose for the third act. Dorian Gray returned to his seat. He looked pale, arrogant, indifferent. The play seemed to drag on endlessly. Half the audience left, dragging their heavy-shoed feet and laughing mockingly. The whole affair was a failure. The final act was performed before nearly empty rows of seats. The curtain fell amidst a few giggles and murmurs of disapproval.
tr_translation: A few minutes later, the lights at the bottom of the stage came on and the third act began. Dorian took his place. He stood pale, proud, and indifferent. The play dragged on and seemed like it would never end. Half of the audience, clattering their rough shoes, left the hall laughing. It was a complete fiasco. The last part was performed to an almost empty hall. The curtain fell amidst giggles and sighs.
es_translation: A moment later, they had disappeared. Almost immediately the footlights were lit and the curtain rose for the third act. Dorian Gray returned to his seat. He was pale, but proud and indifferent. The play dragged on, interminable. Half of the audience left the theater, making noise with their heavy boots and laughing. The performance had been a total fiasco. The last act was performed before an almost empty house. Suppressed laughter and some protests greeted the fall of the final curtain.

en: As soon as it was over, Dorian Gray rushed behind the scenes into the greenroom. The girl was standing there alone, with a look of triumph on her face. Her eyes were lit with an exquisite fire. There was a radiance about her. Her parted lips were smiling over some secret of their own.
vi: Ngay sau khi nó đã hết, Dorian Gray lao ra sau sân khấu, vào phòng giải lao. Cô gái đứng đó một mình, với vẻ mặt hân hoan. Mắt nàng sáng ngời ánh lửa tuyệt đẹp. Quanh nàng tỏa hào quang. Đôi môi hé mở của nàng cười với bí mật riêng tư nào đó.
tr: Oyun biter bitmez Dorian sahnenin arkasına, kulise koştu. Sibyl orda tek başına durmaktaydı, yüzünde zafer kazanmış gibi bir ifadeyle. Gözleri nefis bir ışıkla parlıyor, tüm varlığı sanki ışıldıyordu. Aralık duran dudakları yalnızca kendi bildiği bir gize gülümsemekteydi sanki.
es: Nada más terminar la obra, Dorian pasó entre bastidores, para dirigirse al camerino de la actriz. Encontró allí a Sibyl, con una expresión triunfal en el rostro y los ojos llenos de fuego. Estaba radiante. Sonreía, los labios ligeramente abiertos, a causa de un secreto muy personal.
vi_translation: Right after it was over, Dorian Gray rushed backstage, into the break room. The girl stood there alone, with a joyful expression. Her eyes shone with a beautiful fire. An aura surrounded her. Her slightly parted lips smiled with some private secret.
tr_translation: As soon as the play was over, Dorian ran backstage, to the dressing room. Sibyl was standing there alone, with an expression on her face as if she had won a victory. Her eyes were shining with a delightful light, her entire being seemed to be glowing. Her slightly parted lips were smiling as if at a secret only she knew.
es_translation: As soon as the play ended, Dorian went backstage to head to the actress's dressing room. He found Sibyl there, with a triumphant expression on her face and her eyes full of fire. She was radiant. She smiled, her lips slightly parted, because of a very personal secret.

en: When he entered, she looked at him, and an expression of infinite joy came over her. “How badly I acted to-night, Dorian!” she cried.
vi: Khi cậu vào, nàng nhìn cậu, và một vẻ mừng vui vô bờ bến hiện lên ở nàng. “Sao mà đêm nay em diễn dở đến thế, Dorian!” nàng la lên.
tr: Dorian içeri girince kız ona baktı, yüzüne sonsuz bir kıvanç yayıldı. “Dorian, ne kötü bir oyun çıkardım bu gece!
es: Al entrar Dorian, la muchacha lo miró y apareció en su rostro una expresión de infinita alegría. —¡Qué mal he actuado esta noche, Dorian! —exclamó.
vi_translation: When he entered, she looked at him, and an expression of boundless joy appeared on her face. “Why did you perform so poorly tonight, Dorian!” she exclaimed.
tr_translation: When Dorian entered, the girl looked at him, and an infinite joy spread across her face. "Dorian, I gave a terrible performance tonight!""
es_translation: As Dorian entered, the girl looked at him and an expression of infinite joy appeared on her face. —How badly I acted tonight, Dorian! —she exclaimed.

en: “Horribly!” he answered, gazing at her in amazement. “Horribly! It was dreadful. Are you ill? You have no idea what it was. You have no idea what I suffered.”
vi: “Kinh khủng!” cậu trả lời, nhìn cô sửng sốt — “kinh khủng! Thật hãi hùng. Em ốm à? Em không hình dung được nó thế nào đâu. Em không hình dung được những gì tôi phải chịu đựng đâu.”
tr: Dorian ona şaşkın şaşkın bakarak, “Feci!” dedi. “Feci! Berbattı. Hasta mısın sen? Nasıl kıvrandım, bilemezsin.
es: —¡Horriblemente mal! —respondió él, contemplándola asombrado—. ¡Espantoso! Ha sido terrible. ¿Estás enferma? No puedes hacerte idea de lo que ha sido. No te imaginas cómo he sufrido.
vi_translation: “Terrible!” he replied, looking at her in astonishment — “terrible! Truly horrifying. Are you sick? You can't imagine what it's like. You can't imagine what I have to endure.”
tr_translation: Dorian looked at him in astonishment and said, "Terrible!" "Terrible! It was awful. Are you sick? You can't imagine how I writhed."
es_translation: —Horribly bad! —he responded, looking at her amazed—. Awful! It was terrible. Are you sick? You can't imagine what it was like. You can't imagine how I suffered.

en: The girl smiled. “Dorian,” she answered, lingering over his name with long-drawn music in her voice, as though it were sweeter than honey to the red petals of her mouth. “Dorian, you should have understood. But you understand now, don’t you?”
vi: Cô gái cười. “Dorian,” nàng trả lời, nấn ná tên cậu với tiếng nhạc kéo dài trong giọng, như thể nó ngọt hơn mật ong với đôi cánh hoa đỏ thắm của miệng nàng — "Dorian, lẽ ra anh phải hiểu chứ. Nhưng giờ này anh đã hiểu, đúng không?”
tr: Sibyl gülümseyerek, “Dorian,” dedi. Sesinin baygın müziğiyle onun adını uzatıyordu, bu ad dudaklarının kırmızı gül yaprağına baldan daha tatlı geliyordu sanki. “Dorian, anlamalıydın. Neyse, şimdi anlıyorsun, değil mi?
es: La muchacha sonrió. —Dorian —respondió, acariciando el nombre del amado con la prolongada música de su voz, como si fuera más dulce que miel para los rojos pétalos de su boca—. Dorian, deberías haberlo entendido. Pero ahora lo entiendes ya, ¿no es cierto?
vi_translation: The girl laughed. “Dorian,” she replied, lingering on his name with a musical tone in her voice, as if it were sweeter than honey on the crimson petals of her lips — "Dorian, you should have understood. But now you do, don't you?”
tr_translation: Sibyl smiled and said, "Dorian." She elongated his name with the languid music of her voice, as if this name was sweeter than honey on the red rose petal of her lips. "Dorian, you should have understood. Anyway, you understand now, don't you?"
es_translation: The girl smiled. —Dorian —he replied, caressing the name of his beloved with the prolonged music of his voice, as if it were sweeter than honey to the red petals of his mouth—. Dorian, you should have understood it. But now you understand it already, don't you?

en: “Understand what?” he asked, angrily.
vi: “Hiểu gì?” cậu hỏi, tức giận.
tr: Dorian, “Neyi anlıyorum?” diye hırsla sordu.
es: —¿Entender qué? —preguntó él, colérico.
vi_translation: “Understand what?” he asked, angrily.
tr_translation: Dorian asked angrily, "What do I understand?"
es_translation: —Understand what? —he asked, angrily.

en: “Why I was so bad to-night. Why I shall always be bad. Why I shall never act well again.”
vi: “Tại sao em đã kém như vậy đêm nay. Tại sao em sẽ luôn kém. Tại sao em sẽ chẳng bao giờ còn diễn tốt được nữa.”
tr: “Bu gece neden öyle kötü oynadığımı. Neden bundan böyle hep kötü oynayacağımı. Neden artık bir daha hiç iyi bir oyun çıkarmayacağımı.
es: —El porqué de que lo haya hecho tan mal esta noche. El porqué de que de ahora en adelante lo haga siempre mal. El porqué de que no vuelva nunca a actuar bien.
vi_translation: “Why were you so bad tonight. Why will you always be bad. Why will you never be able to perform well again.”
tr_translation: “Why I played so badly tonight. Why I will always play badly from now on. Why I will never perform well again.”
es_translation: —The reason why I did so poorly tonight. The reason why from now on I will always do poorly. The reason why I will never perform well again.

en: He shrugged his shoulders. “You are ill, I suppose. When you are ill you shouldn’t act. You make yourself ridiculous. My friends were bored. I was bored.”
vi: Cậu nhún vai. “Em ốm rồi, tôi nghĩ vậy. Khi em ốm thì em không nên diễn. Em biến mình thành kẻ lố bịch. Các bạn tôi buồn. Tôi cũng buồn.”
tr: Genç adam omuz silkti. “Hasta olsan gerek. Hastayken sahneye çıkmamalısın. Gülünç düşürüyorsun kendini. Arkadaşlarımın canı sıkıldı. Benim de canım sıkıldı.
es: Dorian se encogió de hombros. —Supongo que estás enferma. Cuando estés enferma no deberías actuar. Te pones en ridículo. Mis amigos se han aburrido. Yo me he aburrido.
vi_translation: He shrugged. "You're sick, I think so. When you're sick, you shouldn't perform. You make yourself look ridiculous. My friends are sad. I'm sad too."
tr_translation: The young man shrugged. “You must be sick. You shouldn't go on stage when you're sick. You're making a fool of yourself. My friends got bored. I got bored too.”
es_translation: Dorian shrugged. —I suppose you are sick. When you are sick, you shouldn't act. You make a fool of yourself. My friends have gotten bored. I have gotten bored.

en: She seemed not to listen to him. She was transfigured with joy. An ecstasy of happiness dominated her.
vi: Nàng dường như không nghe anh. Nàng rạng rỡ vì vui. Một niềm hạnh phúc mê li thống trị nàng.
tr: Kız onu dinlemiyor gibiydi. Sevinçten değişime uğramıştı sanki. Bir mutluluk sarhoşluğu içindeydi.
es: Sibyl parecía no escucharlo. Estaba transfigurada por la alegría. Dominada por un éxtasis de felicidad.
vi_translation: She seemed not to hear him. She was radiant with joy. An enchanting happiness dominated her.
tr_translation: The girl seemed not to be listening to him. It was as if she had undergone a transformation from joy. She was in a state of euphoria.
es_translation: Sibyl seemed not to hear him. She was transfigured by joy. Overcome by an ecstasy of happiness.

en: “Dorian, Dorian,” she cried, “before I knew you, acting was the one reality of my life. It was only in the theatre that I lived. I thought that it was all true. I was Rosalind one night and Portia the other. The joy of Beatrice was my joy, and the sorrows of Cordelia were mine also. I believed in everything. The common people who acted with me seemed to me to be godlike. The painted scenes were my world. I knew nothing but shadows, and I thought them real. You came—oh, my beautiful love!—and you freed my soul from prison. You taught me what reality really is. To-night, for the first time in my life, I saw through the hollowness, the sham, the silliness of the empty pageant in which I had always played. To-night, for the first time, I became conscious that the Romeo was hideous, and old, and painted, that the moonlight in the orchard was false, that the scenery was vulgar, and that the words I had to speak were unreal, were not my words, were not what I wanted to say. You had brought me something higher, something of which all art is but a reflection. You had made me understand what love really is. My love! My love! Prince Charming! Prince of life! I have grown sick of shadows. You are more to me than all art can ever be. What have I to do with the puppets of a play? When I came on to-night, I could not understand how it was that everything had gone from me. I thought that I was going to be wonderful. I found that I could do nothing. Suddenly it dawned on my soul what it all meant. The knowledge was exquisite to me. I heard them hissing, and I smiled. What could they know of love such as ours? Take me away, Dorian—take me away with you, where we can be quite alone. I hate the stage. I might mimic a passion that I do not feel, but I cannot mimic one that burns me like fire. Oh, Dorian, Dorian, you understand now what it signifies? Even if I could do it, it would be profanation for me to play at being in love. You have made me see that.”
vi: “Dorian, Dorian,” nàng kêu lên, “trước khi em biết anh, diễn xuất là một thực tại của đời em. Chỉ trong nhà hát thì em mới sống. Em tưởng nó đúng cả. Em là Rosalind đêm này, là Portia đêm khác. Niềm vui của Beatrice là niềm vui của em, nỗi buồn của Cordelia cũng thuộc về em. Em tin hết. Em thấy dường như phàm nhân mà diễn với em đều giống thánh thần. Các cảnh phông sơn phết là thế giới của em. Em chẳng biết gì ngoài những chiếc bóng, và em nghĩ chúng là thật. Anh đến — ôi, tình yêu tuyệt mỹ của em! — và anh thả hồn em ra khỏi nhà ngục.
