tr: Dorian Gray ağır ağır döndü, gözyaşından sönükleşmiş gözlerle ressama baktı. “Artık çok geç, Basil,” diye kekeledi. “İş işten geçti.
es: Dorian Gray se volvió lentamente, mirándolo con ojos enturbiados por las lágrimas. —Es demasiado tarde -balbució.
vi_translation: Dorian Gray slowly turned around, looking at him with tear-filled eyes. "It's too late, Basil," he stammered.
tr_translation: Dorian Gray turned slowly and looked at the painter with eyes dimmed by tears. “It's too late now, Basil,” he stammered. “The deed is done.”
es_translation: Dorian Gray slowly turned, looking at him with eyes clouded by tears. —It's too late -he stammered.

en: “It is never too late, Dorian. Let us kneel down and try if we cannot remember a prayer. Isn’t there a verse somewhere, ‘Though your sins be as scarlet, yet I will make them as white as snow’?”
vi: “Chẳng bao giờ là quá muộn, Dorian. Ta hãy quỳ xuống và cố gắng nếu như ta không thể nhớ được lời cầu nguyện. Có một câu thơ thì phải, ‘Dù cho tội lỗi của con có như màu đỏ tươi; song ta vẫn sẽ làm chúng thành ra trắng như tuyết’?”
tr: “Hiçbir zaman iş işten geçmez, Dorian. Gel diz çökelim şurada; bakalım aklımıza bir dua geliyor mu? Hani şöyle bir dua yok muydu: Günahların kıpkızıl olsa da onları kar gibi beyazlatmak benim elimdedir, diye?
es: —Nunca es demasiado tarde. Arrodillémonos y tratemos juntos de recordar una oración. ¿No hay un versículo que dice: «Aunque vuestros pecados fuesen como la grana, quedarían blancos como la nieve[13] »?
vi_translation: “It is never too late, Dorian. Let us kneel down and try even if we cannot remember the prayer. There is a verse, isn’t there, ‘Though your sins be as scarlet, they shall be as white as snow’?”
tr_translation: “It is never too late, Dorian. Come, let us kneel here; let's see if we can think of a prayer. Wasn't there a prayer that went something like: Even if your sins are scarlet, I can make them white as snow?”
es_translation: —It is never too late. Let us kneel and try together to remember a prayer. Isn't there a verse that says: "Though your sins be as scarlet, they shall be as white as snow[13]"?

en: “Those words mean nothing to me now.”
vi: “Những lời ấy chẳng có ý nghĩa nào với tôi lúc này.”
tr: “Bu sözler bana hiçbir şey ifade etmiyor artık.
es: —Esas palabras ya nada significan para mí.
vi_translation: “Those words have no meaning to me at this moment.”
tr_translation: “These words mean nothing to me anymore.”
es_translation: —Those words mean nothing to me anymore.

en: “Hush! Don’t say that. You have done enough evil in your life. My God! Don’t you see that accursed thing leering at us?”
vi: “Suỵt! Đừng nói thế. Cậu đã làm đủ nhiều việc xấu trong đời rồi. Chúa ơi! Cậu có thấy rằng cái thứ đáng nguyền rủa đó đang liếc đểu ta không?”
tr: “Şşt, konuşma böyle. İşlediğin günahlar yetti. Ulu Tanrım! Görmüyor musun, şu lanet olası şey gözlerini nasıl bize dikmiş sırıtıyor?
es: —¡Calla! No digas eso. Ya has hecho suficientes maldades en tu vida. ¡Dios bendito! ¿No ves cómo esa odiosa criatura se ríe de nosotros?
vi_translation: "Shh! Don't say that. You've already done enough bad things in your life." "Oh God! Do you see that cursed thing giving me a dirty look?"
tr_translation: "Shh, don't talk like that. Your sins are enough. Oh my God! Can't you see, how that damned thing is staring at us and grinning?"
es_translation: —Quiet! Don't say that. You have already done enough evil in your life. Good heavens! Don't you see how that hateful creature is laughing at us?

en: Dorian Gray glanced at the picture, and suddenly an uncontrollable feeling of hatred for Basil Hallward came over him, as though it had been suggested to him by the image on the canvas, whispered into his ear by those grinning lips. The mad passions of a hunted animal stirred within him, and he loathed the man who was seated at the table, more than in his whole life he had ever loathed anything. He glanced wildly around. Something glimmered on the top of the painted chest that faced him. His eye fell on it. He knew what it was. It was a knife that he had brought up, some days before, to cut a piece of cord, and had forgotten to take away with him. He moved slowly towards it, passing Hallward as he did so. As soon as he got behind him, he seized it and turned round. Hallward stirred in his chair as if he was going to rise. He rushed at him and dug the knife into the great vein that is behind the ear, crushing the man’s head down on the table and stabbing again and again.
vi: Dorian Gray liếc nhìn bức tranh, và đột nhiên một cảm xúc căm ghét Basil đến độ không thể kiểm soát nổi ập đến với cậu, như thể nó bị hình ảnh trên tấm toan gợi ra cho cậu, bị đôi môi nhăn nhở ấy thì thào vào tai cậu. Những cơn điên giận của một con thú bị săn đuổi dấy lên trong cậu, và cậu căm ghét người đàn ông đang ngồi bên bàn, hơn nhiều so với cậu từng căm ghét bất cứ thứ gì trong cả cuộc đời mình. Cậu điên cuồng nhìn quanh. Có gì đó sáng lờ mờ trên nóc cái rương sơn trước mặt cậu. Mắt cậu để ý đến nó. Cậu biết nó là gì. Nó là con dao mà cậu đã mang lên, vài hôm trước, để cắt một mẩu dây, và quên mang nó đi cùng mình. Cậu chầm chậm nhích về phía nó, đi ngang qua Hallward khi cậu làm vậy. Ngay khi cậu đã ra được sau lưng y, cậu vồ lấy nó, quay lại. Hallward cựa quậy trên ghế như thể y sắp đứng dậy. Cậu lao vào y, thọc dao vào mạch máu lớn sau tai, đè đầu người đó xuống bàn, đâm hết nhát này đến nhát khác.
tr: Dorian Gray resme bir göz attı. İçini birden Basil Hallward’a karşı söz geçiremediği bir kin bürüdü. Sanki tuvalin üstündeki imge bunu ona aşılamış, o sırıtkan dudaklar kulağına fısıldamıştı. İçinde avcının kovaladığı bir hayvanın yabanıl duyguları karıncalanıyor, Dorian masa başındaki bu adama karşı, ömür boyu hiçbir şeye karşı duymadığı bir nefret duyuyordu. Deli gözlerle çevresine bakındı. Karşısındaki resimli sandığın üzerinde bir şey ışıldıyordu. Dorian’ın gözleri buna takıldı. Ne olduğunu biliyordu. Birkaç gün önce ip kesmek için getirdiği, sonra da aşağıya götürmeyi unuttuğu bir bıçak. Dorian ağır ağır, Hallward’ın yanından geçerek sandığa doğru yürüdü. Hallward’ın arkasına geçer geçmez bıçağı eline alarak döndü. Hallward, ayağa kalkmaya davranıyormuş gibi kıpırdanmıştı. Dorian onun üstüne atıldı, bıçağı kulağının ardındaki kalın damara saplayıp, başını masaya bastırarak bıçakla tekrar tekrar vurdu, vurdu.
es: Dorian Gray lanzó una ojeada al cuadro y, de repente, un odio incontrolable hacia Basil Hallward se apoderó de él, como si se lo hubiera sugerido la imagen del lienzo, como si se lo hubieran susurrado al oído aquellos labios burlones. Las pasiones salvajes de un animal acorralado se encendieron en su interior, y odió al hombre que estaba sentado a la mesa más de lo que había odiado a nada ni a nadie en toda su vida. Lanzó a su alrededor miradas extraviadas. Algo brillaba en lo alto de la cómoda pintada que tenía enfrente. Sus ojos se detuvieron sobre aquel objeto. Sabía de qué se trataba. Era un cuchillo que había traído unos días antes para cortar un trozo de cuerda y luego había olvidado llevarse. Se movió lentamente en su dirección, pasando junto a Hallward. Cuando estuvo tras él, lo empuñó y se dio la vuelta. Hallward se movió en la silla, como disponiéndose a levantarse. Arrojándose sobre él, le hundió el cuchillo en la gran vena que se halla detrás del oído, golpeándole la cabeza contra la mesa, y apuñalándolo después repetidas veces.
vi_translation: Dorian Gray glanced at the painting, and suddenly an uncontrollable hatred for Basil overwhelmed him, as if it was evoked by the image on the canvas, whispered into his ear by those sneering lips. The frenzied rage of a hunted animal rose within him, and he hated the man sitting by the table more than he had ever hated anything in his entire life. He looked around frantically. There was something faintly gleaming on top of the painted chest in front of him. His eyes caught sight of it. He knew what it was. It was the knife he had brought up a few days ago to cut a piece of string and had forgotten to take with him. He slowly edged towards it, passing by Hallward as he did so. As soon as he was behind him, he grabbed it and turned around. Hallward stirred in his chair as if he was about to stand up. He rushed at him, stabbing the large artery behind his ear, pressing the man's head down on the table, stabbing again and again.
tr_translation: Dorian Gray glanced at the painting. A sudden, uncontrollable hatred towards Basil Hallward filled his heart. It was as if the image on the canvas had instilled this in him, those grinning lips had whispered it into his ear. Inside him, the wild emotions of an animal being hunted tingled, and Dorian felt a hatred towards the man at the table that he had never felt towards anything in his life. He looked around with mad eyes. Something was gleaming on the chest with the pictures in front of him. Dorian's eyes fixed on it. He knew what it was. A knife he had brought a few days ago to cut a rope, and then forgotten to take downstairs. Dorian slowly walked towards the chest, passing by Hallward. As soon as he got behind Hallward, he turned, taking the knife in his hand. Hallward had stirred as if to get up. Dorian leapt upon him, drove the knife into the thick vein behind his ear, and pressing his head down onto the table, struck him again and again with the knife.
es_translation: Dorian Gray glanced at the picture and, suddenly, an uncontrollable hatred towards Basil Hallward seized him, as if it had been suggested by the image on the canvas, as if those mocking lips had whispered it into his ear. The wild passions of a cornered animal ignited within him, and he hated the man sitting at the table more than he had ever hated anything or anyone in his entire life. He cast frantic glances around. Something gleamed on top of the painted dresser in front of him. His eyes fixed on that object. He knew what it was. It was a knife he had brought a few days earlier to cut a piece of rope and then had forgotten to take away. He moved slowly in its direction, passing by Hallward. When he was behind him, he grasped it and turned around. Hallward shifted in his chair, as if preparing to stand up. Throwing himself upon him, he plunged the knife into the large vein behind his ear, banging his head against the table, and then stabbing him repeatedly.

en: There was a stifled groan and the horrible sound of some one choking with blood. Three times the outstretched arms shot up convulsively, waving grotesque, stiff-fingered hands in the air. He stabbed him twice more, but the man did not move. Something began to trickle on the floor. He waited for a moment, still pressing the head down. Then he threw the knife on the table, and listened.
vi: Một tiếng rên rỉ nghẹn ngào, và âm thanh khủng khiếp từ người bị tắc thở vì máu. Ba lần liền, hai cánh tay duỗi ra ấy cố giật lên, vẫy hai bàn tay kỳ cục với các ngón ngay đơ vào không khí. Cậu đâm y thêm hai lần, nhưng người ấy không còn nhúc nhích nữa. Có gì đó bắt đầu chảy nhỏ giọt lên sàn. Cậu chờ một lát, vẫn nhấn cái đầu xuống. Sau đó cậu ném dao lên bàn, lắng nghe.
tr: Boğuk bir inilti duyuldu, sonra kendi kanıyla soluksuz kalıp boğulan bir insanın çıkardığı korkunç ses. Ressamın uzanan kolları tam üç kez çırpınarak havaya kalktı, gerili parmaklarının pençeleştirdiği elleri havayı tırmaladı. Dorian bıçağı ona iki kez daha sapladı, ama adam kıpırdamıyordu artık. Yere damla damla bir şeyler akmaya başlamıştı. Dorian adamın başını hâlâ masaya bastırarak bir süre bekledi. Sonra bıçağı masanın üstüne attı, ortalığa kulak kabarttı.
es: Sólo se oyó un gemido sofocado, y el horrible ruido de alguien a quien ahoga su propia sangre. Tres veces los brazos extendidos se alzaron, convulsos, agitando en el aire grotescas manos de dedos rígidos. Dorian Gray aún clavó el cuchillo dos veces más, pero Basil no se movió. Algo empezó a gotear sobre el suelo. Dorian Gray esperó un momento, apretando todavía la cabeza contra la mesa. Luego soltó el arma y escuchó.
vi_translation: A choking moan, and the terrible sound of someone suffocating on their own blood. Three times in a row, those outstretched arms tried to jerk up, waving those bizarre hands with stiff fingers in the air. He stabbed him two more times, but the person no longer moved. Something began to drip onto the floor. He waited a moment, still pressing the head down. Then he threw the knife onto the table, listening.
tr_translation: A muffled moan was heard, then the terrifying sound made by a person suffocating and choking on their own blood. The painter's outstretched arms flailed in the air three times, his clawing fingers scratching at the air. Dorian stabbed him twice more, but the man was no longer moving. Something began to drip onto the floor. Dorian still held the man's head down on the table for a while. Then he threw the knife onto the table and listened intently.
es_translation: Only a muffled groan was heard, and the horrible sound of someone choking on their own blood. Three times the outstretched arms rose, convulsing, shaking grotesque hands with rigid fingers in the air. Dorian Gray stabbed the knife twice more, but Basil did not move. Something began to drip onto the floor. Dorian Gray waited a moment, still pressing the head against the table. Then he dropped the weapon and listened.

en: He could hear nothing, but the drip, drip on the threadbare carpet. He opened the door and went out on the landing. The house was absolutely quiet. No one was about. For a few seconds he stood bending over the balustrade and peering down into the black seething well of darkness. Then he took out the key and returned to the room, locking himself in as he did so.
vi: Cậu không thể nghe được gì ngoài tiếng chảy nhỏ giọt, nhỏ giọt lên tấm thảm mòn xơ chỉ. Cậu mở cửa và ra ngoài đầu cầu thang. Ngôi nhà lặng ngắt như tờ. Không một ai chung quanh. Cậu đứng vài giây, cúi người qua lan can, đăm đắm nhìn xuống cái giếng đen sục sôi của bóng tối. Sau đó cậu lấy chìa ra và quay lại phòng, nhốt mình vào trong.
tr: Eski püskü halının üstüne düşen damlaların pıtırtısından başka bir şey duymuyordu. Kapıyı açtı, sahanlığa çıktı. Evin içinde hiçbir ses, hiçbir ayak kıpırtısı yoktu. Dorian parmaklıktan eğilip aşağıdaki kaynaşan karanlık kuyuya baktı. Sonra anahtarını çıkarıp gene odaya girdi, kapıyı içerden kilitledi.
es: Sólo se oía el golpear de las gotas de sangre que caían sobre la raída alfombra. Abrió la puerta y salió al descansillo. La casa estaba en absoluto silencio. Nadie se había levantado. Durante unos segundos permaneció inclinado sobre la barandilla, intentando penetrar con la mirada el negro pozo de atormentada oscuridad. Luego se sacó la llave del bolsillo y regresó a la habitación del retrato, encerrándose dentro.
vi_translation: You can't hear anything except the dripping sound, dripping onto the worn-out carpet. You open the door and step out onto the landing. The house is as silent as a sheet. Not a single person around. You stand for a few seconds, leaning over the railing, staring down into the boiling black well of darkness. Then you take out the key and return to the room, locking yourself inside.
tr_translation: He heard nothing but the patter of drops falling on the shabby carpet. He opened the door and stepped out onto the landing. There was no sound, no movement of feet inside the house. Dorian leaned over the railing and looked down into the seething dark pit below. Then he took out his key, re-entered the room, and locked the door from the inside.
es_translation: Only the sound of blood drops hitting the worn-out carpet could be heard. He opened the door and stepped out onto the landing. The house was in absolute silence. No one had gotten up. For a few seconds, he remained leaning over the railing, trying to pierce the black well of tormented darkness with his gaze. Then he took the key out of his pocket and returned to the portrait room, locking himself inside.

en: The thing was still seated in the chair, straining over the table with bowed head, and humped back, and long fantastic arms. Had it not been for the red jagged tear in the neck and the clotted black pool that was slowly widening on the table, one would have said that the man was simply asleep.
vi: Thứ ấy vẫn ngồi trên ghế, duỗi qua bàn với cái đầu cúi gục, lưng gù, đôi tay dài quái dị. Nếu không vì có vết rách lởm chởm đỏ trên cổ, và vũng đen sền sệt chầm chậm lan rộng trên bàn, người ta có thể nói rằng người ấy chỉ là đang ngủ.
tr: O şey hâlâ iskemlede oturmuş, masaya abanmış duruyordu, eğik başı, kamburlaşmış sırtı, upuzun, inanılmaz kollarıyla. Boynundaki kıpkırmızı yırtıkla masanın üstünde gitgide büyüyen pıhtılı siyah gölcük olmasa adamın uyuyakalmış olduğunu sanabilirdiniz.
es: El cuerpo seguía sentado en la silla, tumbado en parte sobre la mesa, la cabeza inclinada, la espalda doblada y los brazo caídos, extrañamente largos. De no ser por el irregular desgarrón rojo en el cuello, y el charco oscuro casi coagulado que se ensanchaba lentamente sobre la mesa, se podría haber pensado que la figura recostada no hacía otra cosa que dormir.
vi_translation: That person was still sitting on the chair, stretching across the table with their head bowed, hunchbacked, and with grotesquely long arms. If it weren't for the jagged red tear on their neck and the thick black puddle slowly spreading across the table, one might say that they were just sleeping.
tr_translation: That thing was still sitting on the chair, leaning on the table, with its bent head, hunched back, and incredibly long arms. If it weren't for the bright red tear on its neck and the growing pool of clotted black on the table, you might have thought the man had fallen asleep.
es_translation: The body remained seated in the chair, partly slumped over the table, head tilted, back bent, and arms hanging down, strangely long. If it weren't for the irregular red gash on the neck, and the dark, almost coagulated pool slowly spreading over the table, one might have thought that the reclining figure was merely sleeping.

en: How quickly it had all been done! He felt strangely calm, and walking over to the window, opened it and stepped out on the balcony. The wind had blown the fog away, and the sky was like a monstrous peacock’s tail, starred with myriads of golden eyes. He looked down and saw the policeman going his rounds and flashing the long beam of his lantern on the doors of the silent houses. The crimson spot of a prowling hansom gleamed at the corner and then vanished. A woman in a fluttering shawl was creeping slowly by the railings, staggering as she went. Now and then she stopped and peered back. Once, she began to sing in a hoarse voice. The policeman strolled over and said something to her. She stumbled away, laughing. A bitter blast swept across the square. The gas-lamps flickered and became blue, and the leafless trees shook their black iron branches to and fro. He shivered and went back, closing the window behind him.
vi: Mọi việc xong mới nhanh làm sao! Cậu cảm thấy bình tĩnh lạ lùng, và, lại gần cửa sổ, mở nó, bước ra ngoài ban-công. Gió đã thổi sương mù đi, và bầu trời như một đuôi công khổng lồ, điểm ngàn vạn mắt vàng. Cậu nhìn xuống và thấy một viên cảnh sát đi tuần đang chiếu một tia sáng dài từ cái đèn lồng của y lên cửa những ngôi nhà yên lặng. Đốm đỏ của một chiếc xe ngựa hai bánh lảng vảng chạy quanh phát sáng lập lòe tại góc phố, rồi biến mất. Một phụ nữ quấn chiếc khăn san phấp phới đang rón rén đi bên cạnh hàng rào, loạng choạng khi cô bước. Thỉnh thoảng cô dừng lại và ngoái nhìn ra sau. Một lần, cô bắt đầu hát bằng giọng khàn đặc. Viên cảnh sát lững thững lại gần và nói gì đó với cô. Cô vừa lảo đảo đi khỏi vừa cười. Một luồng gió rét buốt quét ngang qua quảng trường. Các ngọn đèn ga bập bùng, xanh đi, còn những cái cây trụi lá thì lắc những cái cành sắt đen tới lui. Cậu rùng mình và quay lại, đóng cửa sổ sau lưng.
tr: Nasıl da çarçabuk olup bitmişti her şey! Dorian tuhaf bir serinkanlılık içindeydi. Gitti, balkon kapısını açıp balkona çıktı. Rüzgâr sisi dağıtmış, gökyüzü sayısız altın gözlerin beneklediği dev bir tavus kuyruğunu andırıyordu. Dorian aşağıya bakınca devriye gezen polisin, fenerinin uzun ışınını sessiz evlerin kapılarına tuta tuta geçtiğini gördü. Sessiz ve sanki sinsice ilerleyen bir faytonun kırmızı ışığı bir köşede ışıldadı, sonra görünmez oldu. Şalı rüzgârda dalgalanan bir kadın parmaklık boyunca, sarsak adımlarla, sürünür gibi ilerlemekteydi. Arada bir durup başını çevirerek arkaya bakıyordu. Bir kez boğuk, tarazlı bir sesle bir şarkı tutturdu. Polis gelip bir şey söyledi ona. Kadın gülerek, sendeleye sendeleye uzaklaştı. Keskin bir rüzgâr soluğu meydanı yalayıp geçti. Gaz fenerlerinin alevleri titreşerek masmavi kesildi ve çıplak ağaçlar o kapkara, demirden kollarını salladılar. Dorian ürperdi, gene içeri girerek kapıyı kapadı.
es: ¡Qué deprisa había sucedido todo! Sintió una extraña tranquilidad y, acercándose al balcón, lo abrió para salir al exterior. El viento se había llevado la niebla, y el cielo era como la rueda de un monstruoso pavo real, tachonado de innumerables ojos dorados. Al mirar hacia la calle vio al policía del barrio haciendo su ronda y dirigiendo el largo rayo de su linterna sorda hacia puertas de casas silenciosas. La mancha carmesí de un coche de punto brilló en la esquina para desaparecer un instante después. Una mujer con un chal agitado por el viento avanzaba despacio, con paso inseguro, apoyándose en las rejas de los jardines. De cuando en cuando se detenía y volvía la vista atrás. En una ocasión empezó a cantar con voz ronca. El policía se le acercó y le dijo algo. La mujer se alejó a trompicones, riendo. Una ráfaga de viento muy frío azotó la plaza. Las luces de gas parpadearon, azuleando, y los árboles desnudos agitaron sus negras ramas de hierro. Dorian Gray se estremeció y regresó a la habitación, cerrando el balcón.
vi_translation: Everything was done so quickly! He felt strangely calm, and, approaching the window, opened it, and stepped out onto the balcony. The wind had blown the fog away, and the sky was like a giant peacock tail, dotted with countless golden eyes. He looked down and saw a patrolling policeman casting a long beam of light from his lantern onto the doors of the silent houses. The red dot of a two-wheeled carriage wandered around, flickering at the corner of the street, then disappeared. A woman wrapped in a fluttering shawl was stealthily walking beside the fence, staggering as she stepped. Occasionally, she stopped and looked back. Once, she began to sing in a hoarse voice. The policeman leisurely approached and said something to her. She staggered away, laughing. A cold gust of wind swept across the square. The gas lamps flickered, turned blue, and the leafless trees shook their black iron branches back and forth. He shivered and turned back, closing the window behind him.
tr_translation: How quickly everything had happened! Dorian was in a strange state of calmness. He went, opened the balcony door, and stepped out onto the balcony. The wind had dispersed the mist, and the sky resembled a giant peacock tail dotted with countless golden eyes. When Dorian looked down, he saw the patrolling policeman passing by, shining the long beam of his lantern on the doors of the silent houses. The red light of a silently and seemingly stealthily advancing carriage glimmered at a corner, then disappeared. A woman, with her shawl fluttering in the wind, was moving along the railing with unsteady steps, almost crawling. Every now and then, she would stop and look back over her shoulder. Once, she started singing a song in a hoarse, rough voice. The policeman came and said something to her. The woman laughed and staggered away. A sharp gust of wind swept across the square. The flames of the gas lamps flickered and turned a deep blue, and the bare trees waved their pitch-black, iron-like branches. Dorian shivered, went back inside, and closed the door.
es_translation: How quickly everything had happened! He felt a strange calmness and, approaching the balcony, opened it to step outside. The wind had carried away the fog, and the sky was like the wheel of a monstrous peacock, studded with countless golden eyes. Looking down at the street, he saw the neighborhood policeman making his rounds and directing the long beam of his dim flashlight towards the doors of silent houses. The crimson stain of a cab glowed at the corner only to disappear a moment later. A woman with a shawl fluttering in the wind was advancing slowly, with an unsteady step, leaning on the garden railings. From time to time she would stop and look back. On one occasion she began to sing in a hoarse voice. The policeman approached her and said something to her. The woman staggered away, laughing. A very cold gust of wind swept through the square. The gas lights flickered, turning blue, and the bare trees shook their black iron branches. Dorian Gray shivered and returned to the room, closing the balcony.

en: Having reached the door, he turned the key and opened it. He did not even glance at the murdered man. He felt that the secret of the whole thing was not to realize the situation. The friend who had painted the fatal portrait to which all his misery had been due had gone out of his life. That was enough.
vi: Đến cửa rồi, cậu xoay chìa, mở nó ra. Cậu thậm chí không để mắt đến người bị giết. Cậu cảm thấy rằng bí mật của cả chuyện này là không nhận thức được tình cảnh. Người bạn đã vẽ bức chân dung tai hại mà mọi nỗi khổ của cậu là do nó ra, đã biến khỏi đời cậu. Thế là đủ.
tr: Yürüdü, anahtarı çevirip oda kapısını açtı. Öldürmüş olduğu adama bakmadı bile. Bu durumun püf noktasının, olayların bilincine varmamak olduğunu hissediyordu. Çektiği bütün acıların kaynağı olan o uğursuz portreyi çizen dost, hayatından çıkıp gitmişti. Bu kadarı yeterliydi.
es: Al llegar a la puerta hizo girar la llave y la abrió. Ni siquiera se volvió para lanzar una ojeada al cadáver. Comprendía que el secreto del éxito consistía en no darse cuenta de lo sucedido. El amigo que había pintado el retrato fatal, causante de todos sus sufrimientos, había desaparecido de su vida. Eso era suficiente.
vi_translation: Reaching the door, he turned the key and opened it. He didn't even glance at the person who had been killed. He felt that the secret to the whole affair was not being aware of the situation. The friend who had painted the disastrous portrait, which was the cause of all his suffering, had vanished from his life. That was enough.
tr_translation: He walked, turned the key, and opened the room door. He didn't even look at the man he had killed. He felt that the key to this situation was not becoming aware of the events. The friend who had drawn that cursed portrait, the source of all his suffering, had left his life. This was enough.
es_translation: Upon reaching the door, he turned the key and opened it. He didn't even turn around to glance at the corpse. He understood that the secret of success was to not acknowledge what had happened. The friend who had painted the fateful portrait, the cause of all his suffering, had disappeared from his life. That was enough.

en: Then he remembered the lamp. It was a rather curious one of Moorish workmanship, made of dull silver inlaid with arabesques of burnished steel, and studded with coarse turquoises. Perhaps it might be missed by his servant, and questions would be asked. He hesitated for a moment, then he turned back and took it from the table. He could not help seeing the dead thing. How still it was! How horribly white the long hands looked! It was like a dreadful wax image.
vi: Sau đó cậu nhớ ra cái đèn. Nó là một vật khá lạ từ tay nghề Ma-rốc, làm từ bạc xỉn khảm với các họa tiết Ả-rập bằng thép đánh bóng, đính đầy ngọc lam thô. Không chừng gia nhân của cậu có thể lại nhớ ra nó, và sẽ hỏi. Cậu lưỡng lự một lát, rồi quay lại và lấy nó từ trên bàn. Cậu không thể không nhìn cái thứ đã chết ấy. Nó yên lặng làm sao! Đôi tay dài ấy nhìn mới trắng kinh khủng làm sao. Nó như một tượng sáp dễ sợ.
tr: Birden aklına lamba geldi. Mağribi işi, değişik bir şeydi bu: Parlak çelik arabesklerle kaplamalı donuk gümüşten yapılma, kök firuzelerle kakmalı. Uşağı lambanın yokluğunun farkına varabilir, bu da sorular sorulmasına yol açabilirdi. Dorian biraz duraksadı, sonra döndü, lambayı masanın üstünden aldı. O ölmüş şeye ister istemez gözü takıldı. Nasıl da kıpırtısızdı bu şey! O uzun uzun ellerin ne feci bir beyazlığı vardı! Balmumundan yapılma korkunç bir yontuya benziyordu.
es: Fue entonces cuando se acordó de la lámpara. Era un ejemplo más bien curioso de artesanía musulmana, labrada en plata mate con incrustaciones de arabescos de acero bruñido, tachonada de turquesas sin pulimentar. Quizás su criado la echara de menos e hiciera preguntas. Vaciló un momento, pero acabó entrando de nuevo y recuperándola. Esta vez no pudo por menos que ver el cadáver. ¡Qué inmóvil estaba! ¡Qué horriblemente blancas y largas parecían las manos! Era como una espantosa figura de cera.
vi_translation: Then he remembered the lamp. It was a rather strange object from Moroccan craftsmanship, made of tarnished silver inlaid with polished steel Arabic motifs, studded with raw turquoise. Perhaps his servant might remember it again and would ask about it. He hesitated for a moment, then turned back and took it from the table. He couldn't help but look at that dead thing. How silent it was! How terribly white those long hands looked. It was like a dreadful wax figure.
tr_translation: Suddenly, he thought of the lamp. It was a Moorish piece, something unusual: made of dull silver covered with bright steel arabesques, inlaid with turquoise roots. His servant might notice the absence of the lamp, which could lead to questions being asked. Dorian hesitated a bit, then turned and took the lamp from the table. His eyes involuntarily fell on the dead thing. How motionless it was! How dreadful was the whiteness of those long hands! It looked like a terrible sculpture made of wax.
es_translation: It was then that he remembered the lamp. It was a rather curious example of Muslim craftsmanship, wrought in matte silver with inlays of burnished steel arabesques, studded with unpolished turquoise. Perhaps his servant would miss it and ask questions. He hesitated for a moment, but eventually went back in and retrieved it. This time he couldn't help but see the corpse. How still it was! How horribly white and long its hands seemed! It was like a ghastly wax figure.

en: Having locked the door behind him, he crept quietly downstairs. The woodwork creaked and seemed to cry out as if in pain. He stopped several times and waited. No: everything was still. It was merely the sound of his own footsteps.
vi: Sau khi khóa cửa sau lưng, cậu lặng lẽ lẻn xuống cầu thang. Món đồ gỗ ấy kêu cọt kẹt, và dường như khóc lên như thể bị đau. Cậu dừng lại vài lần, chờ đợi. Không: mọi thứ đều yên. Đó chỉ là tiếng bước chân cậu.
tr: Dorian kapıyı ardından kilitleyerek usul usul alt kata indi. Tahtalar gıcırdıyor, sanki can acısıyla çığlıklar atıyorlardı. Dorian kaç kez durup bekledi. Ama yok, ne bir ses vardı, ne de bir kıpırtı. Duyduğu yalnızca kendi adımlarının sesiydi.
es: Después de cerrar nuevamente la puerta con llave, Dorian Gray bajó en silencio la escalera. Los crujidos de algunos escalones le parecieron ayes de dolor. Se detuvo varias veces y esperó. No: todo estaba en silencio. Era tan sólo el ruido de sus pasos.
vi_translation: After locking the door behind him, he quietly sneaked down the stairs. The wooden item creaked, and seemed to cry out as if in pain. He stopped a few times, waiting. No: everything was quiet. It was just his footsteps.
tr_translation: Dorian locked the door behind him and quietly descended to the lower floor. The floorboards creaked, as if they were screaming in pain. Dorian stopped and waited several times. But no, there was neither a sound nor a movement. The only thing he heard was the sound of his own footsteps.
es_translation: After locking the door again, Dorian Gray silently descended the staircase. The creaking of some steps seemed like cries of pain to him. He stopped several times and waited. No: everything was silent. It was just the sound of his footsteps.

en: When he reached the library, he saw the bag and coat in the corner. They must be hidden away somewhere. He unlocked a secret press that was in the wainscoting, a press in which he kept his own curious disguises, and put them into it. He could easily burn them afterwards. Then he pulled out his watch. It was twenty minutes to two.
vi: Khi cậu về đến thư viện, cậu thấy cái túi và chiếc áo khoác trong góc. Chúng phải được giấu đi đâu đó. Cậu mở cái tủ âm tường bí mật trong ván ốp chân tường, một cái tủ âm tường mà trong đó cậu giữ những bộ đồ cải trang kỳ lạ của mình, và để nó vào trong. Cậu có thể dễ dàng đốt chúng đi sau này. Sau đó cậu kéo đồng hồ ra. Lúc ấy là hai giờ kém hai mươi.
tr: Kitaplığa varınca köşede duran çantayla paltoyu gördü. Bunların bir yere gizlenmesi gerekiyordu. Dorian duvar kaplamasının ardındaki gizli bir gözü açtı. Kılık değiştirmek istediğinde kullandığı değişik, ilginç giysileri sakladığı bu göze çantayla paltoyu yerleştirdi. Bunları sonradan yakmak işten bile değildi. Dorian cep saatine bakarak ikiye yirmi kala olduğunu gördü.
es: Al llegar a la biblioteca, vio en un rincón el abrigo, la gorra y el maletín. Había que esconderlos en algún sitio. Abrió un ropero secreto, oculto en el revestimiento de madera, donde ocultaba sus curiosos disfraces, y los dejó allí. Podría quemarlos sin problemas más adelante. Luego sacó el reloj. Eran las dos menos veinte.
vi_translation: When he returned to the library, he saw the bag and the coat in the corner. They had to be hidden somewhere. He opened the secret closet in the baseboard paneling, a closet where he kept his strange disguises, and put it inside. He could easily burn them later. Then he pulled out the watch. It was twenty to two.
tr_translation: When he reached the bookshelf, he saw the bag and coat standing in the corner. These needed to be hidden somewhere. Dorian opened a secret compartment behind the wall paneling. He placed the bag and coat in this compartment where he stored various, interesting clothes he used when he wanted to disguise himself. It was no big deal to burn them later. Dorian looked at his pocket watch and saw that it was twenty to two.
es_translation: Upon arriving at the library, he saw the coat, cap, and briefcase in a corner. They needed to be hidden somewhere. He opened a secret wardrobe, concealed in the wood paneling, where he hid his curious costumes, and left them there. He could burn them without any problems later. Then he took out the watch. It was twenty to two.

en: He sat down and began to think. Every year—every month, almost—men were strangled in England for what he had done. There had been a madness of murder in the air. Some red star had come too close to the earth.... And yet, what evidence was there against him? Basil Hallward had left the house at eleven. No one had seen him come in again. Most of the servants were at Selby Royal. His valet had gone to bed.... Paris! Yes. It was to Paris that Basil had gone, and by the midnight train, as he had intended. With his curious reserved habits, it would be months before any suspicions would be roused. Months! Everything could be destroyed long before then.
vi: Cậu ngồi xuống, và bắt đầu nghĩ. Mỗi năm — gần như mỗi tháng — nhiều người bị siết cổ ở Anh vì những gì họ làm. Chứng cuồng sát ở trong không khí. Ngôi sao đỏ nào đó đã đến quá gần trái đất… Tuy nhiên làm gì có bằng chứng nào chống lại cậu đâu? Basil Hallward đã rời khỏi nhà cậu lúc mười một giờ. Không ai nhìn thấy y vào lại. Phần lớn gia nhân ở Selby Royal. Người hầu của cậu đã đi ngủ… Paris! Đúng rồi. Paris là nơi mà Basil đến, bằng chuyến tàu nửa đêm, như y đã định. Với những thói quen dè dặt kỳ lạ của y, thì phải nhiều tháng trôi qua trước khi có sự ngờ vực nào dấy lên. Hàng tháng! Mọi thứ có thể bị hủy đi rất lâu trước lúc đó.
tr: Dorian oturdu, düşünmeye başladı. İngiltere’de her yıl, neredeyse her ay, onun yaptığı bu iş yüzünden adam asılıyordu. Bir cinayet çılgınlığı esmekteydi havada. Kızıl bir yıldız dünyamıza aşırı mı yaklaşmıştı ne... Öte yandan onu suçlu çıkartacak ne gibi bir kanıt vardı ki? Basil Hallward saat on birde onun evinden ayrılmıştı. İkinci kez geldiğini gören yoktu. Hizmetçilerin çoğu taşradaki Selby Royal malikânesindeydi. Özel uşağı yatıp uyumuştu... Paris! Evet, evet. Basil Paris’e gitmişti ya işte, gece yarısı treniyle, tasarlanmış olduğu gibi. İçine kapalı biri olduğu için yokluğunun kuşku uyandırması aylar sürerdi. Aylar! O zamana değin de her şey ortadan kaldırılmış olurdu.
es: Se sentó y empezó a pensar. Todos los años —todos los meses casi— se ahorcaba a alguien en Inglaterra por un crimen similar al que acababa de cometer. Se diría que había surgido en el aire una locura asesina. Alguna roja estrella se había acercado demasiado a la Tierra... Si bien, ¿qué pruebas había en contra suya? Basil Hallward abandonó la casa a las once. Nadie lo había visto entrar de nuevo. La mayoría de los criados estaban en Selby Royal. Su ayuda de cámara se había acostado... ¡París! Sí. Basil se había marchado a París en el tren de medianoche, tal como se proponía hacer. Habida cuenta de la curiosa reserva que lo caracterizaba, pasarían meses antes de que surgieran las primeras sospechas. ¡Meses! Todo podía estar destruido mucho antes.
vi_translation: You sat down and began to think. Every year — almost every month — many people are hanged in England for what they have done. The madness of murder is in the air. Some red star has come too close to the earth... However, what evidence is there against you? Basil Hallward had left your house at eleven o'clock. No one saw him come back. Most of the servants are at Selby Royal. Your valet had gone to bed... Paris! That's right. Paris is where Basil went, by the midnight train, as he had planned. With his strange, cautious habits, it would be many months before any suspicion arose. Months! Everything could be destroyed long before then.
tr_translation: Dorian sat down and began to think. In England, every year, almost every month, people were being hanged because of what he had done. A madness of murder was in the air. Had a red star come too close to our world or what... On the other hand, what evidence was there to incriminate him? Basil Hallward had left his house at eleven o'clock. No one had seen him come a second time. Most of the servants were at the Selby Royal estate in the countryside. His personal valet had gone to bed and fallen asleep... Paris! Yes, yes. Basil had gone to Paris, after all, by the midnight train, as planned. Being a reserved person, it would take months for his absence to arouse suspicion. Months! By then, everything would have been disposed of.
es_translation: He sat down and began to think. Every year —almost every month— someone was hanged in England for a crime similar to the one he had just committed. It seemed as if a murderous madness had arisen in the air. Some red star had come too close to the Earth... But then, what evidence was there against him? Basil Hallward left the house at eleven. No one had seen him re-enter. Most of the servants were at Selby Royal. His valet had gone to bed... Paris! Yes. Basil had gone to Paris on the midnight train, just as he had planned to do. Given the curious reserve that characterized him, it would be months before the first suspicions arose. Months! Everything could be destroyed long before that.

en: A sudden thought struck him. He put on his fur coat and hat and went out into the hall. There he paused, hearing the slow heavy tread of the policeman on the pavement outside and seeing the flash of the bull’s-eye reflected in the window. He waited and held his breath.
vi: Một ý nghĩ bất ngờ lóe lên với cậu. Cậu mặc áo lông và đội mũ, rồi đi ra sảnh. Cậu dừng lại ở đó, lắng nghe tiếng chân chậm và nặng của viên cảnh sát trên vỉa hè bên ngoài, và thấy ánh sáng từ mắt-trâu phản chiếu trên cửa sổ. Cậu chờ, và nín thở.
tr: Birden Dorian’ın aklına bir şey geldi. Genç adam kürk paltosuyla şapkasını giyerek hole çıktı. Burada duralayarak nöbetçi polisin kaldırımda yankılanan ağır, yavaş ayak seslerini dinledi, fener ışığının pencerelere vuran yansımasını gördü. Soluk almaktan bile çekinerek bekledi.
es: Una idea se le pasó de repente por la cabeza. Se puso el abrigo de piel y el sombrero y salió al vestíbulo. Luego se detuvo, al oír en la acera los pasos lentos y pesados del policía y ver en la ventana el reflejo de la linterna sorda. Esperó, conteniendo la respiración.
vi_translation: An unexpected thought flashed through his mind. He put on his fur coat and hat, then went out to the hall. He stopped there, listening to the slow and heavy footsteps of the policeman on the sidewalk outside, and saw the light from the bull's-eye lantern reflecting on the window. He waited, holding his breath.
tr_translation: Suddenly, something occurred to Dorian. The young man put on his fur coat and hat and stepped into the hall. Here, he paused to listen to the heavy, slow footsteps of the watchman echoing on the pavement and saw the reflection of the lantern light on the windows. He waited, barely daring to breathe.
es_translation: An idea suddenly crossed his mind. He put on his fur coat and hat and went out to the hallway. Then he stopped, hearing the slow, heavy steps of the policeman on the sidewalk and seeing the reflection of the dim lantern in the window. He waited, holding his breath.

en: After a few moments he drew back the latch and slipped out, shutting the door very gently behind him. Then he began ringing the bell. In about five minutes his valet appeared, half-dressed and looking very drowsy.
vi: Lát sau, cậu kéo then cửa lại, lỏn ra ngoài, đóng rất nhẹ cái cửa lại sau lưng mình. Sau đó cậu bắt đầu rung chuông. Độ năm phút sau, người hầu của cậu xuất hiện, quần áo dở dang, trông có vẻ rất buồn ngủ.
tr: Birkaç dakika sonra sürgüyü açıp dışarı çıkarak kapıyı ardından usulca kapattı. Sonra çıngırağı çalmaya başladı. Beş dakikaya kalmadan uşağı, yarı giyimli, gözlerinden uyku akar durumda eşikte göründü.
es: Al cabo de unos momentos descorrió el cerrojo y salió sigilosamente, cerrando después la puerta con gran suavidad. Luego empezó a tocar la campanilla de la entrada. Unos cinco minutos después apareció su ayuda de cámara, vestido a medias y con aire somnoliento.
vi_translation: Moments later, he pulled the latch, slipped outside, and closed the door very quietly behind him. Then he began to ring the bell. About five minutes later, his servant appeared, half-dressed, looking very sleepy.
tr_translation: A few minutes later, he unlocked the bolt, stepped outside, and gently closed the door behind him. Then he started ringing the bell. Within five minutes, his servant appeared at the threshold, half-dressed, with sleep streaming from his eyes.
es_translation: After a few moments, he slid back the bolt and slipped out stealthily, closing the door very gently behind him. Then he began to ring the front doorbell. About five minutes later, his valet appeared, half-dressed and looking sleepy.

en: “I am sorry to have had to wake you up, Francis,” he said, stepping in; “but I had forgotten my latch-key. What time is it?”
vi: “Tôi xin lỗi vì đã phải đánh thức anh, Francis,” cậu nói, bước vào nhà; “nhưng tôi quên chìa khóa. Mấy giờ rồi?”
tr: Dorian, “Özür dilerim, Francis, seni uyandırmak zorunda kaldım,” dedi. “Anahtarımı unutmuşum da. Saat kaç, kuzum?
es: —Siento haber tenido que despertarle, Francis —dijo Dorian Gray, entrando en la casa—, pero me olvidé de las llaves. ¿Qué hora es?
vi_translation: “I'm sorry for having to wake you up, Francis,” he said, stepping into the house; “but I forgot the key. What time is it?”
tr_translation: Dorian said, "I'm sorry, Francis, I had to wake you up." "I forgot my key. What time is it, dear?"
es_translation: —I am sorry to have had to wake you, Francis —said Dorian Gray, entering the house—, but I forgot the keys. What time is it?

en: “Ten minutes past two, sir,” answered the man, looking at the clock and blinking.
vi: “Hai giờ kém mười, thưa ngài,” người hầu trả lời, nhìn đồng hồ và hấp háy mắt. “Hai giờ kém mười?
tr: Adam saate bakıp gözlerini kırpıştırarak, “İkiyi on geçiyor, efendim,” dedi.
es: —Las dos y diez —respondió el criado, mirando el reloj y parpadeando. —¿Las dos y diez?
vi_translation: “Ten minutes to two, sir,” the servant replied, looking at the clock and blinking.
tr_translation: Adam, blinking his eyes as he looked at the clock, said, "It's ten past two, sir."
es_translation: —Two ten —replied the servant, looking at the clock and blinking.

en: “Ten minutes past two? How horribly late! You must wake me at nine to-morrow. I have some work to do.”
vi: “Hai giờ kém mười? Sao đã muộn kinh thế nhỉ! Anh phải gọi tôi dậy lúc chín giờ sáng. Tôi có chút việc phải làm.
tr: “İkiyi on mu geçiyor? Amma geç olmuş ha! Yarın saat dokuzda uyandıracaksın beni. İşlerim var da.
es: —¿Las dos y diez? ¡Horriblemente tarde! Despiérteme mañana a las nueve. Tengo que hacer un trabajo urgente.
vi_translation: "Ten minutes to two? Why is it so late already! You should have woken me up at nine in the morning. I have some things to do."
tr_translation: “Is it ten past two? It's quite late! You'll wake me up at nine tomorrow. I have things to do.”
es_translation: —Two ten? Horribly late! Wake me up tomorrow at nine. I have to do an urgent job.

en: “All right, sir.”
vi: “Vâng, thưa ngài.”
tr: “Baş üstüne, efendim.
es: —Sí, señor.
vi_translation: "Yes, sir."
tr_translation: "At your service, sir."
es_translation: —Yes, sir.

en: “Did any one call this evening?”
vi: “Tối nay có ai ghé qua không?”
tr: “Arayan soran oldu mu akşamleyin?
es: —¿Ha venido alguna visita esta tarde?
vi_translation: "Is anyone coming over tonight?"
tr_translation: “Did anyone call or ask about me in the evening?”
es_translation: —Has any visitor come this afternoon?

en: “Mr. Hallward, sir. He stayed here till eleven, and then he went away to catch his train.”
vi: “Có mít-tơ Hallward, thưa ngài. Ông ấy ở lại đây đến mười một giờ, rồi ông ấy đi cho kịp tàu.”
tr: “mr Hallward, efendim. Saat on bire kadar bekledi, sonra gitti; trene yetişecekmiş.
es: —El señor Hallward. Estuvo aquí hasta las once, y luego se marchó para tomar el tren.
vi_translation: "There is Mr. Hallward, sir. He stayed here until eleven o'clock, then he left to catch the train."
tr_translation: "Mr. Hallward, sir." "He waited until eleven o'clock, then he left; he had to catch a train.""
es_translation: —Mr. Hallward. He was here until eleven, and then he left to catch the train.

en: “Oh! I am sorry I didn’t see him. Did he leave any message?”
vi: “Ôi! Tôi lấy làm tiếc vì đã không gặp được ông ta. Ông ta có để lại tin nhắn gì không?”
tr: “Ya! Onu kaçırdığıma üzüldüm doğrusu. Bir mesaj falan bıraktı mı?
es: —¡Ah! Siento no haberlo visto. ¿Dejó algún mensaje?
vi_translation: "Oh! I'm sorry I didn't get to meet him." "Did he leave any message?"
tr_translation: “Oh! I'm really sorry I missed him. Did he leave any message or something?”
es_translation: —Ah! I'm sorry I missed him. Did he leave any message?

en: “No, sir, except that he would write to you from Paris, if he did not find you at the club.”
vi: “Không, thưa ngài, ngoài việc là ông ấy sẽ biên thư cho ngài từ Paris, nếu ông ấy không tìm được ngài ở câu lạc bộ.”
tr: “Hayır, efendim. Sizi kulübünüzde bulamazsa Paris’ ten mektup yazacağını söyledi yalnızca.
es: —No, señor, excepto que le escribiría desde París, si no lo encontraba en el club.
vi_translation: "No, sir, except that he will write to you from Paris if he does not find you at the club."
tr_translation: “No, sir. He only said that if he couldn't find you at your club, he would write a letter from Paris.”
es_translation: —No, sir, except that he would write to you from Paris if he didn't find you at the club.

en: “That will do, Francis. Don’t forget to call me at nine to-morrow.”
vi: “Được rồi, Francis. Đừng quên gọi tôi lúc chín giờ sáng.
tr: “Peki, Francis, teşekkür ederim. Yarın sabah dokuzda uyandırmayı sakın unutma.
es: —Nada más, Francis. No se olvide de llamarme mañana a las nueve.
vi_translation: "Alright, Francis. Don't forget to call me at nine in the morning."
tr_translation: “Well, Francis, thank you. Don't forget to wake me up at nine tomorrow morning.”
es_translation: —Nothing else, Francis. Don't forget to call me tomorrow at nine.

en: “No, sir.”
vi: “Dạ, thưa ngài.”
tr: “Unutmam, efendim.
es: —Sí, señor.
vi_translation: “Yes, sir.”
tr_translation: “I won't forget, sir.”
es_translation: —Yes, sir.

en: The man shambled down the passage in his slippers.
vi: Người hầu lết đôi dép lê dọc theo hành lang.
tr: Adam terliklerini sürüyerek koridorda yürüyüp gitti.
es: El criado se alejó por el corredor, arrastrando ligeramente las zapatillas.
vi_translation: The servant shuffled along the hallway in slippers.
tr_translation: Adam shuffled down the corridor in his slippers.
es_translation: The servant walked away down the corridor, slightly dragging his slippers.

en: Dorian Gray threw his hat and coat upon the table and passed into the library. For a quarter of an hour he walked up and down the room, biting his lip and thinking. Then he took down the Blue Book from one of the shelves and began to turn over the leaves. “Alan Campbell, 152, Hertford Street, Mayfair.” Yes; that was the man he wanted.
vi: Dorian Gray ném mũ và áo khoác lên bàn, rồi đi vào thư viện. Trong một phần tư giờ, cậu bước tới bước lui trong phòng, cắn môi, suy nghĩ. Sau đó cậu lấy cuốn Sách Xanh xuống từ trên một trong các ngăn sách, và bắt đầu lật qua các tờ giấy. "Alan Campbell, 152, phố Hertford, Mayfair." Đúng rồi; đó là người cậu cần.
tr: Dorian Gray paltosuyla şapkasını masaya bıraktı, kitaplığa geçti. Bir çeyrek saat boyunca, dudağını dişleyip kafasını işleterek odanın içinde döndü, dolaştı. Sonra rafların birinde duran Mavi Kitap’ı indirip aldı, sayfaları çevirmeye girişti. “Alan Campbell, Hetford Sokağı No. 152, Mayfair.” Evet, aradığı adam buydu.
es: Dorian Gray arrojó sombrero y abrigo sobre la mesa y entró en la biblioteca. Durante un cuarto de hora estuvo paseando, mordiéndose los labios y pensando. Luego tomó un anuario de una de las estanterías y empezó a pasar páginas. «Alan Campbell, 152 Hertford Street, Mayfair». Sí; era el hombre que necesitaba.
vi_translation: Dorian Gray threw his hat and coat onto the table, then went into the library. For a quarter of an hour, he paced back and forth in the room, biting his lip, thinking. Then he took the Blue Book down from one of the shelves and began flipping through the pages. "Alan Campbell, 152 Hertford Street, Mayfair." Yes; that was the person he needed.
tr_translation: Dorian Gray placed his coat and hat on the table and went to the bookshelf. For a quarter of an hour, he wandered around the room, biting his lip and racking his brain. Then he took down the Blue Book that was on one of the shelves and started flipping through the pages. “Alan Campbell, No. 152, Hetford Street, Mayfair.” Yes, this was the man he was looking for.
es_translation: Dorian Gray threw his hat and coat onto the table and entered the library. For a quarter of an hour, he paced, biting his lips and thinking. Then he took a directory from one of the shelves and began to flip through the pages. “Alan Campbell, 152 Hertford Street, Mayfair.” Yes; he was the man he needed.

en: CHAPTER XIV.
vi: Chương 14
tr: On dördüncü bölüm
es: Capítulo 14
vi_translation: Chapter 14
tr_translation: Chapter Fourteen
es_translation: Chapter 14

en: At nine o’clock the next morning his servant came in with a cup of chocolate on a tray and opened the shutters. Dorian was sleeping quite peacefully, lying on his right side, with one hand underneath his cheek. He looked like a boy who had been tired out with play, or study.
vi: Lúc 9 giờ sáng, gia nhân của cậu vào với cốc sô-cô-la trên khay, và mở cửa chớp. Dorian đang ngủ rất ngon, nằm nghiêng bên phải, với một tay kê dưới má. Trông cậu như một chú bé mệt lả vì mải chơi hoặc chăm học.
tr: Ertesi sabah saat dokuzda Dorian’ın uşağı tepsi üzerinde bir bardak kakaoyla odaya girdi, panjurları açtı. Dorian sağına yatmış, bir eli yanağının altında, rahat uykulardaydı. Oyun oynamaktan ya da ders çalışmaktan yorulmuş bir çocuğu andırıyordu.
es: Alas nueve de la mañana del día siguiente, el criado entró con una taza de chocolate en una bandeja y abrió las contraventanas. Dorian dormía apaciblemente, tumbado sobre el lado derecho, con una mano bajo la mejilla. Parecía un adolescente agotado por el juego o el estudio.
vi_translation: At 9 o'clock in the morning, his servant came in with a cup of chocolate on a tray and opened the shutters. Dorian was sleeping very soundly, lying on his right side, with one hand under his cheek. He looked like a little boy exhausted from playing too much or studying hard.
tr_translation: The next morning at nine o'clock, Dorian's servant entered the room with a tray holding a glass of cocoa and opened the shutters. Dorian was lying on his right side, one hand under his cheek, sleeping comfortably. He resembled a child tired from playing games or studying.
es_translation: At nine o'clock in the morning the next day, the servant entered with a cup of chocolate on a tray and opened the shutters. Dorian was sleeping peacefully, lying on his right side, with one hand under his cheek. He looked like a teenager exhausted from play or study.

en: The man had to touch him twice on the shoulder before he woke, and as he opened his eyes a faint smile passed across his lips, as though he had been lost in some delightful dream. Yet he had not dreamed at all. His night had been untroubled by any images of pleasure or of pain. But youth smiles without any reason. It is one of its chiefest charms.
vi: Người hầu phải chạm vào vai cậu hai lần trước khi cậu tỉnh dậy, và lúc cậu mở mắt ra, một nụ cười nhút nhát thoáng qua môi cậu, như thể cậu vừa bị lạc vào giấc mộng thú vị nào đó. Tuy nhiên cậu tuyệt nhiên chẳng mơ thấy gì. Đêm của cậu không bị quấy rối bởi bất cứ hình ảnh sung sướng hoặc đau đớn nào. Nhưng tuổi xuân có thể cười mà chẳng cần bất cứ lý do nào. Đó là một trong những sự quyến rũ chủ yếu của nó.
tr: Adam onu uyandırmak için omzunu iki kez sarsmak zorunda kaldı. Dorian uyandığı sırada, tatlı bir düşteymiş gibi dudaklarında hafif bir gülümseyiş titredi. Oysa hiç düş görmemiş, gecesini hiçbir tatlı ya da acı imge tedirgin etmemişti. Ne var ki gençlik hiç neden olmadan da gülümser. Onun en çekici yönlerinden biridir bu.
es: El ayuda de cámara tuvo que tocarle dos veces en el hombro para despertarlo, y mientras abría los ojos la sombra de una sonrisa cruzó por sus labios, como si hubiera estado perdido en algún sueño placentero. En realidad no había soñado en absoluto. Ninguna imagen, ni agradable ni dolorosa, había turbado su descanso. Pero la juventud sonríe sin motivo. Es uno de sus mayores encantos.
vi_translation: The servant had to touch his shoulder twice before he woke up, and when he opened his eyes, a shy smile flickered across his lips, as if he had just been lost in some delightful dream. However, he absolutely did not dream of anything. His night was not disturbed by any joyful or painful images. But youth can smile without any reason. That is one of its main charms.
tr_translation: Adam had to shake his shoulder twice to wake him up. As Dorian woke up, a slight smile trembled on his lips as if he were in a sweet dream. Yet he had not dreamed at all, no sweet or bitter image had disturbed his night. However, youth smiles for no reason. This is one of its most charming aspects.
es_translation: The valet had to tap him twice on the shoulder to wake him, and as he opened his eyes, the shadow of a smile crossed his lips, as if he had been lost in some pleasant dream. In reality, he had not dreamed at all. No image, neither pleasant nor painful, had disturbed his rest. But youth smiles without reason. It is one of its greatest charms.

en: He turned round, and leaning upon his elbow, began to sip his chocolate. The mellow November sun came streaming into the room. The sky was bright, and there was a genial warmth in the air. It was almost like a morning in May.
vi: Cậu quay lại, và, tựa lên khuỷu tay, bắt đầu nhấm nháp sô-cô-la. Nắng tháng Mười một ngọt ngào ùa vào phòng. Bầu trời sáng chói và trong không khí có hơi ấm dễ chịu. Cứ như đang là một sáng tháng Năm.
tr: Dorian döndü, dirseğine dayanarak kakaosunu yudumlamaya başladı. Yumuşak kasım ışığı odaya oluk oluk akıyordu. Gökyüzü pırıl pırıl, havada dost bir ılıklık vardı. Neredeyse bir mayıs sabahı.
es: Volviéndose, Dorian Gray empezó a tomar a sorbos el chocolate, apoyándose en el codo. El dulce sol de noviembre entraba a raudales en el cuarto. El cielo resplandecía y había en el aire una tibieza reconfortante. Era casi como una mañana de mayo.
vi_translation: He turned around, and, leaning on his elbow, began to nibble on chocolate. The sweet November sunlight poured into the room. The sky was bright, and there was a pleasant warmth in the air. It felt like a morning in May.
tr_translation: Dorian turned and began sipping his cocoa while leaning on his elbow. The soft November light was pouring into the room. The sky was sparkling, and there was a friendly warmth in the air. Almost like a May morning.
es_translation: Turning around, Dorian Gray began to sip the chocolate, leaning on his elbow. The sweet November sun poured into the room. The sky was radiant, and there was a comforting warmth in the air. It was almost like a May morning.

en: Gradually the events of the preceding night crept with silent, blood-stained feet into his brain and reconstructed themselves there with terrible distinctness. He winced at the memory of all that he had suffered, and for a moment the same curious feeling of loathing for Basil Hallward that had made him kill him as he sat in the chair came back to him, and he grew cold with passion. The dead man was still sitting there, too, and in the sunlight now. How horrible that was! Such hideous things were for the darkness, not for the day.
vi: Từ từ, các sự việc đêm trước rón rén đi những bước chân dính máu âm thầm vào não cậu, và tự diễn lại ở đó với sự rõ ràng khủng khiếp. Cậu co rúm lại trước ký ức về mọi chuyện mà cậu đã phải chịu đựng, và trong khoảnh khắc, đúng cái cảm xúc căm thù kỳ lạ với Basil Hallward mà đã từng khiến cậu sát hại y lúc y ngồi trên ghế, lại quay về với cậu, và lạnh đi vì giận. Người chết cũng hãy còn ngồi đấy, giờ thì trong nắng. Việc ấy mới kinh khủng làm sao! Những thứ gớm guốc như vậy là cho bóng tối, chứ không phải cho ban ngày.
tr: Zamanla, geceki olaylar kan lekeli, sessiz adımlarla gelip beyninin içine yürüdüler, burada müthiş bir belirginlikte bütünleşip biçime girdiler. Onca çektiği aklına geldikçe Dorian ürperdi. Basil Hallward’ı, sandalyede oturduğu yerde öldürmesine yol açan o tuhaf nefret bir an için yeniden içini bürüdü ve Dorian hınçlı bir kinle buz kesti. Ölü hâlâ o sandalyede oturuyordu hem de; üstüne şimdi güneş vurmuş olsa gerekti. Ne feci bir şeydi bu! Öyle iğrenç çirkinlikler geceye yaraşırdı, gün ışığına değil.
es: Poco a poco, los acontecimientos de la noche anterior penetraron en su cerebro, avanzando a pasos furtivos con los pies manchados de sangre, hasta recobrar su forma con terrible claridad. En su rostro apareció una mueca de dolor al recordar todo lo que había sufrido y, por un momento, volvió a apoderarse de él, llenándolo de una cólera glacial, el extraño sentimiento de odio que le había obligado a matar a Basil Hallward. El muerto seguía sin duda sentado en la silla, iluminado ahora por el sol. ¡Qué horrible imagen! Cosas tan espantosas como aquélla eran para la oscuridad de la noche, no para la luz del día.
vi_translation: Slowly, the events of the previous night stealthily crept with blood-stained steps into his brain, and replayed there with terrible clarity. He recoiled at the memory of everything he had endured, and for a moment, that same strange hatred for Basil Hallward that had driven him to murder while he sat in the chair returned to him, chilling him with anger. The dead man was still sitting there, now in the sunlight. How horrifying that was! Such ghastly things are meant for the dark, not for the daylight.
tr_translation: Over time, the events of the night, blood-stained and with silent steps, walked into his brain, where they coalesced and took shape with a terrible clarity. Dorian shuddered as he recalled all that he had endured. For a moment, that strange hatred that had led him to kill Basil Hallward as he sat in the chair enveloped him again, and Dorian froze with a vengeful fury. The dead man was still sitting in that chair; the sunlight must have been shining on him by now. What a dreadful thing this was! Such hideous ugliness belonged to the night, not to the daylight.
es_translation: Little by little, the events of the previous night penetrated his brain, advancing stealthily with blood-stained feet, until they regained their shape with terrible clarity. A grimace of pain appeared on his face as he remembered all he had suffered and, for a moment, the strange feeling of hatred that had compelled him to kill Basil Hallward took hold of him again, filling him with an icy rage. The dead man was undoubtedly still sitting in the chair, now illuminated by the sun. What a horrible image! Such dreadful things were meant for the darkness of night, not for the light of day.

en: He felt that if he brooded on what he had gone through he would sicken or grow mad. There were sins whose fascination was more in the memory than in the doing of them, strange triumphs that gratified the pride more than the passions, and gave to the intellect a quickened sense of joy, greater than any joy they brought, or could ever bring, to the senses. But this was not one of them. It was a thing to be driven out of the mind, to be drugged with poppies, to be strangled lest it might strangle one itself.
vi: Cậu thấy rằng nếu cậu cứ nghiền ngẫm về những gì cậu đã trải qua thì cậu sẽ đổ bệnh hoặc phát điên. Có những tội lỗi mà sự mê hoặc của chúng nằm ở sự nhớ nhiều hơn ở sự làm; những chiến thắng kỳ lạ làm thỏa mãn lòng kiêu hãnh hơn là niềm đam mê, và đem cho trí tuệ một cảm xúc vui sướng sôi nổi, mạnh mẽ hơn bất cứ niềm vui nào mà nó mang lại, hoặc có thể mang lại một lúc nào đó, cho các giác quan. Nhưng đây không phải là một trong số chúng. Nó là thứ bị đuổi ra khỏi tâm hồn, bị chích thuốc phiện, bị bóp cổ để nó không thể tự bóp cổ chính mình.
tr: Dorian’a öyle geliyordu ki dün gece çektiklerini zihnine sardırırsa ya hasta olacak ya da delirecekti. Çekiciliği işlenmesinde değil sonradan anımsanmasında olan günahlar vardı: Duyguların ateşini köreltmekten çok gururu okşayan acayip zaferler ki insanın zihnine bir kıvanç ivmesi verirlerdi ve bu da, duygulara verdikleri kıvançla boy ölçüşemeyecek kadar büyük, canlı olurdu. Gelgelelim bu olay böyle günahlardan biri değildi. Zihinden kovulması, haşhaşla uyuşturulması gereken bir şeydi. Boğulmalıydı, yoksa o adamı boğabilirdi.
es: Sintió que si meditaba sobre lo que le había sucedido se exponía a enfermar o a volverse loco. Había pecados cuya fascinación residía más en la memoria que en su misma realización; extraños triunfos más gratificantes para el orgullo que para las pasiones, y que daban a la inteligencia un sentimiento de alegría más vivo, superior al gozo que procuran o podrían jamás procurar a los sentidos. Pero este último no pertenecía a esa categoría. Se trataba de algo que era necesario expulsar de la mente, adormecerlo con opio, estrangularlo antes de que pudiera estrangularlo a uno.
vi_translation: You find that if you keep brooding over what you have gone through, you will fall ill or go mad. There are sins whose allure lies more in the memory than in the act; strange victories that satisfy pride more than passion, and give the intellect a lively, intense joy greater than any pleasure it brings, or could ever bring, to the senses. But this was not one of them. It is something to be driven out of the soul, drugged with opium, strangled so that it cannot strangle itself.
tr_translation: It seemed to Dorian that if he let the torments of last night replay in his mind, he would either fall ill or go mad. There were sins whose allure lay not in their commission but in their recollection: strange victories that flattered one's pride more than they dulled the fire of emotions, giving a surge of pride to the mind that was far greater and more vivid than the pleasure they gave to the senses. However, this event was not one of those sins. It was something that needed to be banished from the mind, numbed with opium. It had to be drowned, or else it could drown the man.
es_translation: He felt that if he meditated on what had happened to him, he risked falling ill or going mad. There were sins whose fascination lay more in memory than in their actual commission; strange triumphs more gratifying to pride than to passions, and which gave the intellect a livelier feeling of joy, superior to the pleasure that they procure or could ever procure for the senses. But this last one did not belong to that category. It was something that needed to be expelled from the mind, lulled with opium, strangled before it could strangle you.

en: When the half-hour struck, he passed his hand across his forehead, and then got up hastily and dressed himself with even more than his usual care, giving a good deal of attention to the choice of his necktie and scarf-pin and changing his rings more than once. He spent a long time also over breakfast, tasting the various dishes, talking to his valet about some new liveries that he was thinking of getting made for the servants at Selby, and going through his correspondence. At some of the letters, he smiled. Three of them bored him. One he read several times over and then tore up with a slight look of annoyance in his face. “That awful thing, a woman’s memory!” as Lord Henry had once said.
vi: Khi đồng hồ điểm chuông nửa giờ, cậu quệt tay ngang trán, sau đó vội vã đứng dậy, tự mặc quần áo với sự cẩn thận còn hơn bình thường, để ý nhiều đến việc lựa chọn cà-vạt với kim cài khăn quàng, và thay nhẫn hơn một lần. Cậu cũng bỏ rất nhiều thời gian cho bữa sáng, nếm các món khác nhau, nói chuyện với gia nhân về vài bộ chế phục mới mà cậu đang nghĩ là sẽ sai đi may cho gia nhân ở Selby, rồi xem qua thư từ. Cậu cười với vài lá thư. Ba cái trong số chúng làm phiền cậu. Một lá được cậu đọc lại vài lần, và xé tan với vẻ hơi khó chịu trên mặt. “Cái thứ khủng khiếp ấy, ký ức đàn bà!” như huân tước Henry có lần nói.
tr: Saat buçuğu çalınca Dorian elini alnından geçirerek çarçabuk kalktı, kravatıyla kravat iğnesini dikkatle seçip yüzüklerini birkaç kez değiştirerek her zamankinden daha özenle giyindi. Kahvaltı başında da uzun uzun oyalanarak sofradaki çeşitli yiyeceklerin tadına baktı, Selby’ deki hizmetçiler için yaptırtmayı tasarladığı yeni üniformaları uşağıyla konuştu, postadan çıkan mektupları gözden geçirdi. Mektuplardan kimileri gülümsetti onu. Üç tanesi içine sıkıntı verdi. Birini ise birçok kereler baştan sona okuduktan sonra yüzünde hafif bir kızgınlıkla yırttı. Lord Henry’nin bir keresinde dediği gibi: “Kadın belleği denen şu feci şey!
es: Cuando el reloj dio la media, Dorian Gray se pasó la mano por la frente, se levantó con decisión, y se vistió con más cuidado incluso del habitual, prestando gran atención a la elección de la corbata y del alfiler, y cambiando más de una vez de sortijas. También dedicó mucho tiempo al desayuno, probando los diferentes platos, hablando con su ayuda de cámara sobre las nuevas libreas que estaba pensando encargar para los criados de Selby, y revisando la correspondencia. Algunas de las cartas le hicieron sonreír. Tres le aburrieron. Una la leyó varias veces y luego la rasgó con un ligero gesto de irritación en el rostro. «¡Qué calamidad, los recuerdos de una mujer!», como lord Henry había dicho en una ocasión.
vi_translation: When the clock struck the half-hour, he wiped his hand across his forehead, then hurriedly stood up, dressed himself with more care than usual, paid much attention to choosing a tie with a pin for his scarf, and changed rings more than once. He also spent a lot of time on breakfast, tasting different dishes, talking to the servants about some new uniforms he was thinking of having made for the staff at Selby, and then went through the correspondence. He smiled at a few letters. Three of them bothered him. One letter he read several times and tore up with a slightly annoyed look on his face. “That terrible thing, a woman's memory!” as Lord Henry once said.
tr_translation: When the clock struck half-past seven, Dorian quickly got up, passing his hand over his forehead, carefully selected his tie and tie pin, and dressed more meticulously than usual, changing his rings several times. He lingered at the breakfast table for a long time, tasting the various foods on the table, talked with his servant about the new uniforms he planned to have made for the servants at Selby, and reviewed the letters that had arrived in the mail. Some of the letters made him smile. Three of them gave him a sense of unease. One of them, after reading it from start to finish many times, he tore up with a slight anger on his face. As Lord Henry once said: “That dreadful thing called women's memory!”
es_translation: When the clock struck half past, Dorian Gray ran his hand over his forehead, stood up decisively, and dressed with even more care than usual, paying great attention to the choice of tie and pin, and changing his rings more than once. He also spent a lot of time on breakfast, trying the different dishes, talking with his valet about the new liveries he was thinking of ordering for the servants at Selby, and going through his correspondence. Some of the letters made him smile. Three bored him. One he read several times and then tore up with a slight gesture of irritation on his face. "What a calamity, a woman's memories!" as Lord Henry had said on one occasion.

en: After he had drunk his cup of black coffee, he wiped his lips slowly with a napkin, motioned to his servant to wait, and going over to the table, sat down and wrote two letters. One he put in his pocket, the other he handed to the valet.
vi: Sau khi uống xong ly cà phê đen, cậu thong thả lau môi bằng khăn ăn, ra hiệu cho gia nhân chờ, và qua bàn, ngồi xuống viết hai lá thư. Một lá nhét túi, còn lá kia cậu đưa cho người hầu.
tr: Dorian fincandaki sade kahvesini içtikten sonra dudağını peçetesiyle sildi, uşağına beklesin diye işaret ederek masa başına gidip iki mektup yazdı. Bunlardan birini cebine koydu, öbürünü uşağına uzattı.
es: Después de beber la taza de café solo, se limpió lentamente los labios con la servilleta, hizo un gesto a su cría-do para que esperase y, dirigiéndose hacia su escritorio, se sentó y redactó dos cartas. Guardó una en el bolsillo y tendió la otra al criado.
vi_translation: After finishing his black coffee, he leisurely wiped his mouth with a napkin, signaled for the servant to wait, and went to the table to write two letters. He put one letter in his pocket and gave the other to the servant.
tr_translation: After drinking his plain coffee from the cup, Dorian wiped his lips with a napkin, signaled his servant to wait, and went to the desk to write two letters. He put one of them in his pocket and handed the other to his servant.
es_translation: After drinking the cup of black coffee, he slowly wiped his lips with the napkin, gestured to his servant to wait, and, heading towards his desk, sat down and wrote two letters. He put one in his pocket and handed the other to the servant.

en: “Take this round to 152, Hertford Street, Francis, and if Mr. Campbell is out of town, get his address.”
vi: “Cầm cái này đến nhà số 152, phố Hertford, Francis nhé, và nếu mít-tơ Campbell ra ngoài thành phố, hãy lấy địa chỉ ông ấy.”
tr: “Francis, bunu Hertford Sokak, 152 numaraya götür. mr Campbell kent dışında bir yerdeyse adresini al.
es: —Llévela al 152 de Hertford Street, Francis, y si el señor Campbell ha salido de Londres, pida que le den su dirección.
vi_translation: "Take this to house number 152, Hertford Street, Francis, and if Mr. Campbell is out of town, get his address."
tr_translation: "Francis, take this to 152 Hertford Street. If Mr. Campbell is out of town, get his address."
es_translation: —Take her to 152 Hertford Street, Francis, and if Mr. Campbell has left London, ask for his address.

en: As soon as he was alone, he lit a cigarette and began sketching upon a piece of paper, drawing first flowers and bits of architecture, and then human faces. Suddenly he remarked that every face that he drew seemed to have a fantastic likeness to Basil Hallward. He frowned, and getting up, went over to the book-case and took out a volume at hazard. He was determined that he would not think about what had happened until it became absolutely necessary that he should do so.
vi: Ngay khi còn một mình, cậu châm một điếu thuốc, và bắt đầu phác lên một mảnh giấy, thoạt đầu vẽ hoa, rồi những mảng cấu trúc, rồi các mặt người. Đột nhiên cậu để ý thấy là mọi bộ mặt mà cậu vẽ dường như đều có nét giống quái dị với Basil Hallward. Cậu nhăn mặt, và, nhỏm dậy, lại gần tủ sách, lấy đại ra một cuốn. Cậu quyết định là sẽ không nghĩ về chuyện đã xảy ra cho đến khi nào tất yếu phải làm vậy.
tr: Dorian tek başına kalır kalmaz bir sigara yaktı, bir kâğıt parçasının üzerine bir şeyler çizmeye girişti. İlkin çiçek resimleri yaptı, sonra insan yüzleri. Birden çizdiği her yüzle Basil Hallward’ın yüzünün arasında müthiş bir benzerlik bulunduğunu ayrımsadı. Yüzünü buruşturarak yerinden kalkıp kitap dolabına gitti, rastgele bir kitap seçti. Geceki olayı, düşünmek kaçınılmaz oluncaya dek düşünmemeye kararlıydı.
es: Cuando se quedó solo encendió un cigarrillo y empezó a hacer dibujos en un trozo de papel: primero flores, luego detalles arquitectónicos y, finalmente, rostros. De repente advirtió que todas las caras que dibujaba parecían tener un extraño parecido con Basil Hallward. Frunció el ceño y, poniéndose en pie, se acercó a una estantería y tomó un volumen al azar. Estaba decidido a no pensar en lo que había sucedido hasta que fuese absolutamente necesario hacerlo.
vi_translation: As soon as he was alone, he lit a cigarette and began sketching on a piece of paper, first drawing flowers, then structural patterns, and then faces. Suddenly, he noticed that every face he drew seemed to bear a strange resemblance to Basil Hallward. He frowned, stood up, went to the bookshelf, and randomly took out a book. He decided that he would not think about what had happened until it was absolutely necessary to do so.
tr_translation: As soon as Dorian was alone, he lit a cigarette and started sketching something on a piece of paper. At first, he drew pictures of flowers, then human faces. Suddenly, he noticed that every face he drew bore a striking resemblance to Basil Hallward's face. Frowning, he got up and went to the bookshelf, picking a book at random. He was determined not to think about the night's event until it became unavoidable.
es_translation: When he was left alone, he lit a cigarette and began to draw on a piece of paper: first flowers, then architectural details, and finally, faces. Suddenly, he noticed that all the faces he drew seemed to have a strange resemblance to Basil Hallward. He frowned and, standing up, walked over to a shelf and took a volume at random. He was determined not to think about what had happened until it was absolutely necessary to do so.

en: When he had stretched himself on the sofa, he looked at the title-page of the book. It was Gautier’s “Émaux et Camées”, Charpentier’s Japanese-paper edition, with the Jacquemart etching. The binding was of citron-green leather, with a design of gilt trellis-work and dotted pomegranates. It had been given to him by Adrian Singleton. As he turned over the pages, his eye fell on the poem about the hand of Lacenaire, the cold yellow hand “du supplice encore mal lavée,” with its downy red hairs and its “doigts de faune.” He glanced at his own white taper fingers, shuddering slightly in spite of himself, and passed on, till he came to those lovely stanzas upon Venice:
vi: Khi cậu duỗi người trên xô-pha, cậu nhìn trang tiêu đề cuốn sách. Nó là cuốn Émaux et Camées, của Gautier, phiên bản giấy Nhật của Charpentier, với bản khắc a-xít của Jacquemart. Bìa sách bằng da xanh vỏ chanh, với mẫu lưới mắt cáo mạ vàng và các quả lựu lấm chấm. Adrian Singleton đã tặng nó cho cậu. Khi cậu dở trang, mắt cậu để ý thấy bài thơ về bàn tay của Lacenaire, bàn tay vàng lạnh “du supplice encore mal lavée1," với lông tơ đỏ và "doigts de faune2.” Cậu liếc nhìn các ngón tay thon trắng của mình, bất giác rùng mình, và đọc tiếp, cho đến khi tới các khổ thơ đáng yêu ấy về Venice:
tr: Kanepeye uzandığında elindeki kitabın adına baktı. Gautier’nin Émaux et Camées’siydi bu, Charpentier’nin Jacquemart gravürleriyle süslü Japon kâğıdından baskısı. Cilt limon yeşili meşindendi, üzerinde yaldızlı kafesler, benekli nar desenleri vardı. Bu kitabı ona Adrian Singleton vermişti. Dorian sayfaları çevirirken gözü Lacenaire’ in eli hakkındaki şiire takıldı: ince kırmızı tüyleri ve “orman tanrısına benzeyen” parmaklarıyla o soğuk sarı el: “du supplice encore mal lavée” –işkence izlerinden henüz arınmamış–. Dorian kendi uzun parmaklı bembeyaz ellerine baktı ve ister istemez hafifçe ürpererek sayfayı çevirdi. Biraz sonra Venedik üstüne yazılmış olan o güzelim dörtlükleri buldu:
es: Después de tumbarse en el sofá miró el título del libro. Se trataba de Émaux et Camées[14] , la edición de Charpentier en papel japón, con un grabado de Jacquemart[15] . La encuadernación era de cuero verde limón, con un enrejado en oro, salpicado de granadas. Se lo había regalado Adrian Singleton. Al pasar las páginas, sus ojos se detuvieron en un poema sobre la mano de Lacenaire[16] , la helada mano amarillenta «du supplice encore mal lavée», con su vello rojo y sus «doigts de faune». Dorian Gray se miró los dedos, blancos como la cera, tuvo un estremecimiento a su pesar, y siguió adelante, hasta que llegó a las espléndidas estrofas dedicadas a Venecia:
vi_translation: As he stretched out on the sofa, he looked at the title page of the book. It was the book Émaux et Camées, by Gautier, the Japanese paper edition by Charpentier, with acid engravings by Jacquemart. The cover was of lemon-green leather, with a gold lattice pattern and speckled pomegranates. Adrian Singleton had given it to him. As he turned the page, his eyes noticed the poem about Lacenaire's hand, the cold golden hand “du supplice encore mal lavée1," with red down and "doigts de faune2.” He glanced at his own slender white fingers, shuddered involuntarily, and read on, until he came to those lovely stanzas about Venice:
tr_translation: When he lay down on the couch, he looked at the title of the book in his hand. It was Gautier's Émaux et Camées, the Charpentier edition adorned with Jacquemart engravings on Japanese paper. The binding was of lemon-green morocco, with gilt latticework and speckled pomegranate designs. Adrian Singleton had given him this book. As Dorian turned the pages, his eye caught a poem about Lacenaire's hand: that cold yellow hand with fine red hairs and fingers "like those of a forest god": "du supplice encore mal lavée" –still unwashed from the torture–.
