Y recuerda que es la única prueba contra mí. Si se descubre, estoy perdido; y se sabrá sin duda, a menos que tú me ayudes.
vi_translation: “You have to get involved in it to some extent. Wait, wait a moment; listen to me. Just listen, Alan. All I ask of you is to conduct some scientific experiment. You go to the hospital and the morgue, and the gruesome things you do there don't affect you. If in some ghastly operating room or some stinking laboratory, you see this person lying on a lead table with red channels draining blood through it, you would only look at him as an admirable subject. You wouldn't even blink. You wouldn't think you were doing anything wrong. On the contrary, you would probably feel that you are helping humanity, or increasing the total sum of worldly knowledge, or satisfying intellectual curiosity, or something of that sort. What I need you to do is just what you have always done before. In fact, destroying a corpse must be much less horrible than what you are used to doing. And, remember, it is the only evidence against me. If it is discovered, I lose; and it will certainly be discovered unless you help me.”
tr_translation: “Even if you don't want to, you'll get involved, Alan. Wait, hold on a minute, listen to me. Just listen, Alan. All I want from you is to conduct a scientific experiment. You go to hospitals, morgues, and such places, and the disgusting things you do there don't shake you. If you saw this man in a creepy autopsy room, in a laboratory reeking of stench... If you found him on a lead table with grooves for the blood to flow, you would see it as an interesting subject for examination. You wouldn't even flinch. You wouldn't think what you were doing was a bad thing. On the contrary, you would think you were working for the benefit of humanity, contributing to the world's knowledge, satisfying an intellectual curiosity, and such things. What I want from you is something you've done countless times before. In fact, disposing of a corpse should be much less horrifying than the things you usually do! And don't forget that this corpse is the only evidence that can be used against me. If it's found, it will be the day I'm ruined. And if you don't help me, it will definitely be found.”
es_translation: —You will have to do it. Wait, wait a moment; listen to me. You just have to hear me out. All I ask is that you carry out a certain scientific experiment. You go to hospitals and morgues, and the horrors you see there do not affect you. If in a ghastly dissection room or a foul-smelling laboratory you found a human being on a lead table with red incisions made to let the blood out, you would look at it as something admirable. You wouldn't flinch. You wouldn't think you were doing anything reprehensible. On the contrary, you would consider that you were working for the benefit of the human race, or increasing its store of knowledge, or satisfying its intellectual curiosity, or something of the sort. What I want you to do is simply something you have done many times before. To tell the truth, destroying a corpse must be much less horrible than what you are used to doing. And remember that it is the only evidence against me. If it is discovered, I am lost; and it will undoubtedly be known, unless you help me.

en: “I have no desire to help you. You forget that. I am simply indifferent to the whole thing. It has nothing to do with me.”
vi: “Tôi không muốn giúp anh. Anh quên à. Tôi đơn giản là dửng dưng với toàn bộ chuyện này. Nó chẳng liên quan gì đến tôi.”
tr: “Sana yardım etmek için zerrece istek duymuyorum. Sen bunu unutuyorsun. Olay bana tümden vız geliyor. Benimle hiç ilişkisi yok.
es: —No tengo el menor deseo de ayudarte. Eso es algo que olvidas. Lo único que me inspira todo este asunto es indiferencia. No tiene nada que ver conmigo.
vi_translation: “I don't want to help you. Did you forget? I'm simply indifferent to this whole thing. It has nothing to do with me.”
tr_translation: “I have absolutely no desire to help you. You forget this. The matter is completely irrelevant to me. It has nothing to do with me.”
es_translation: —I have no desire whatsoever to help you. That is something you forget. The only thing this whole matter inspires in me is indifference. It has nothing to do with me.

en: “Alan, I entreat you. Think of the position I am in. Just before you came I almost fainted with terror. You may know terror yourself some day. No! don’t think of that. Look at the matter purely from the scientific point of view. You don’t inquire where the dead things on which you experiment come from. Don’t inquire now. I have told you too much as it is. But I beg of you to do this. We were friends once, Alan.”
vi: “Alan, tôi van anh. Hãy nghĩ về tình thế mà tôi rơi vào. Ngay trước khi anh đến, tôi gần như ngất đi vì sợ. Ngày nào đó, có thể chính anh sẽ biết đến sự khiếp sợ ấy. Không! Đừng nghĩ thế. Hãy nhìn vấn đề thuần túy từ quan điểm khoa học. Anh đã không hỏi những thứ chết chóc mà anh vẫn thí nghiệm trên chúng đã đến từ đâu. Cũng đừng hỏi bây giờ. Tôi đã kể cho anh vậy là quá nhiều rồi. Nhưng tôi xin anh làm việc này. Trước kia ta từng là bạn mà, Alan.”
tr: “Alan sana yalvarıyorum. Toplum içindeki konumumu düşünsene. Sen gelmeden az önce dehşetten neredeyse bayılıyordum. Gün olur, böyle bir dehşeti belki sen de tadarsın. Yok, bu yanını düşünme. Konuya salt biçimsel açıdan bak. Üstünde deneyler yaptığın ölmüş şeylerin nereden geldiğini arayıp sormuyorsun. Şimdi de soru sorma. Sana fazla bile bilgi verdim. Bu işi yapman için yalvarıyorum. Bir zamanlar dosttuk, Alan.
es: —Alan, te lo suplico. Piensa en qué situación me encuentro. Unos instantes antes de que llegaras el terror casi ha hecho que me desmayara. Quizá tú también conozcas el terror algún día. ¡No! No pienses en eso. Míralo desde una perspectiva estrictamente científica. Tú no preguntas de dónde proceden los cadáveres con los que experimentas. Tampoco es necesario que lo investigues ahora. Ya te he contado demasiado. Pero te suplico que lo hagas. Fuimos amigos en otro tiempo, Alan.
vi_translation: “Alan, I beg you. Think about the situation I am in. Just before you arrived, I almost fainted from fear. Someday, you might know that terror yourself. No! Don’t think that. Look at the issue purely from a scientific perspective. You never asked where the deadly things you experiment on came from. And don’t ask now. I’ve already told you too much. But I ask you to do this. We were friends once, Alan.”
tr_translation: “Alan, I beg you. Think about my position in society. Just before you arrived, I was almost fainting from terror. One day, you might experience such terror yourself. No, don't think about that side of it. Look at the matter purely from a formal perspective. You don't ask where the dead things you experiment on come from. Don't ask questions now either. I've already given you too much information. I beg you to do this job. We were once friends, Alan.”
es_translation: —Alan, I beg you. Think about the situation I am in. A few moments before you arrived, the terror almost made me faint. Perhaps you too will know terror someday. No! Don't think about that. Look at it from a strictly scientific perspective. You don't ask where the corpses you experiment on come from. Nor is it necessary for you to investigate it now. I've already told you too much. But I beg you to do it. We were friends once, Alan.

en: “Don’t speak about those days, Dorian—they are dead.”
vi: “Đừng nói về những ngày đó nữa, Dorian: chúng đã chết rồi.”
tr: “O günleri anma, Dorian. Öldü onlar.
es: —No hables de eso. Aquellos días están muertos.
vi_translation: “Don't talk about those days anymore, Dorian: they are dead.”
tr_translation: “Don't remember those days, Dorian. They are dead.”
es_translation: —Don't talk about that. Those days are dead.

en: “The dead linger sometimes. The man upstairs will not go away. He is sitting at the table with bowed head and outstretched arms. Alan! Alan! If you don’t come to my assistance, I am ruined. Why, they will hang me, Alan! Don’t you understand? They will hang me for what I have done.”
vi: “Cái chết đôi khi lần lữa. Người trên gác sẽ không đi đâu xa. Nó ngồi bên bàn với cái đầu cúi gục và đôi tay duỗi ra. Alan! Alan! Nếu anh không giúp tôi thì tôi sẽ tiêu. Vì sao, vì họ sẽ treo cổ tôi, Alan! Anh có hiểu không? Họ sẽ treo cổ tôi vì những gì tôi đã làm.”
tr: “Ölüler bazen aramızda oyalanırlar, Alan. İşte, yukarıdaki adam ortadan yitmiyor. Başı eğik, kollarını uzatmış, masa başında oturuyor. Alan! Alan, sen imdadıma koşmazsan ben mahvoldum demektir. Beni asarlar, Alan! Anlamıyor musun? Bu yaptığım yüzünden sallandıracaklar beni.
es: —A veces lo que está muerto perdura. El individuo del ático no desaparecerá. Está sentado en la mesa con la cabeza caída y los brazos colgando. ¡Alan, por favor! Si no vienes en mi ayuda, estoy perdido. ¡Me ahorcarán! ¿Es que no lo entiendes? Me ahorcarán por lo que he hecho.
vi_translation: "Death sometimes delays." "The person upstairs will not go far." "He sits by the table with his head bowed and his arms outstretched." "Alan! Alan!" "If you don't help me, I am doomed." "Why, because they will hang me, Alan! Do you understand?" "They will hang me for what I have done."
tr_translation: “The dead sometimes linger among us, Alan. Look, the man upstairs isn't disappearing. His head is bowed, his arms are outstretched, he's sitting at the table. Alan! Alan, if you don't come to my rescue, I'm doomed. They'll hang me, Alan! Don't you understand? They'll string me up for what I've done.”
es_translation: —Sometimes what is dead endures. The individual in the attic will not disappear. He is sitting at the table with his head down and his arms hanging. Alan, please! If you don't come to my aid, I am lost. They will hang me! Don't you understand? They will hang me for what I have done.

en: “There is no good in prolonging this scene. I absolutely refuse to do anything in the matter. It is insane of you to ask me.”
vi: “Chẳng có gì hay ho trong việc kéo dài cảnh này. Tôi nhất quyết từ chối làm bất cứ việc gì trong vụ này. Anh thật điên rồ khi nhờ tôi.”
tr: “Bu sahneyi uzatıp gitmenin anlamı yok. Bu işe karışmayı kesinlikle reddediyorum. Bana başvurman zırdelilik zaten.
es: —No sirve de nada que prolongues esta escena. Me niego categóricamente a intervenir en este asunto. Tienes que estar loco para pedirme una cosa así.
vi_translation: “There is nothing good about prolonging this scene. I am determined to refuse to do anything in this matter. You are really crazy to ask me.”
tr_translation: “There is no point in prolonging this scene and leaving. I absolutely refuse to get involved in this matter. It's already madness to consult me.”
es_translation: —It is useless to prolong this scene. I categorically refuse to intervene in this matter. You must be crazy to ask me such a thing.

en: “You refuse?”
vi: “Anh từ chối?” “Đúng.”
tr: “Reddediyorsun ha?
es: —¿Te niegas?
vi_translation: "You refuse?" "Correct."
tr_translation: “You are refusing, huh?”
es_translation: —Do you refuse?

en: “I entreat you, Alan.”
vi: “Tôi năn nỉ anh đấy, Alan.”
tr: “Yalvarırım, Alan.
es: —Te lo suplico, Alan.
vi_translation: “I beg you, Alan.”
tr_translation: “I beg you, Alan.””
es_translation: —I beg you, Alan.

en: “It is useless.”
vi: “Vô ích thôi.”
tr: “Boşuna.
es: —Es inútil.
vi_translation: "It's useless."
tr_translation: “In vain.”
es_translation: —It's useless.

en: The same look of pity came into Dorian Gray’s eyes. Then he stretched out his hand, took a piece of paper, and wrote something on it. He read it over twice, folded it carefully, and pushed it across the table. Having done this, he got up and went over to the window.
vi: Vẻ thương hại ấy lại xuất hiện trong mắt Dorian Gray. Sau đó cậu duỗi tay ra, lấy một mảnh giấy, viết gì đó lên nó. Cậu đọc nó lại hai lần, gấp cẩn thận, rồi đẩy nó ngang bàn. Làm xong việc này, cậu đứng dậy, lại gần cửa sổ.
tr: Dorian Gray’in gözlerinde gene biraz önceki acıyan bakış belirmişti. Sonra genç adam elini uzatıp bir sayfa kâğıt aldı. Bir şeyler yazdı. Yazdıklarını iki kez okudu, kâğıdı özenle katladı, masanın üstünden konuğuna doğru itti. Sonra ayağa kalkarak pencere başına gitti.
es: La misma expresión compasiva apareció de nuevo en los ojos de Dorian Gray. Luego extendió el brazo, tomó un trozo de papel y escribió algo en él. Lo releyó dos veces, lo dobló cuidadosamente y lo empujó hasta el otro lado de la mesa. Después se levantó, acercándose a la ventana.
vi_translation: That look of pity reappeared in Dorian Gray's eyes. Then he reached out, took a piece of paper, and wrote something on it. He read it twice, folded it carefully, and pushed it across the table. After finishing this task, he stood up and approached the window.
tr_translation: The same pained look appeared in Dorian Gray's eyes again. Then the young man reached out and took a sheet of paper. He wrote something. He read what he had written twice, carefully folded the paper, and pushed it towards his guest from across the table. Then he stood up and went to the window.
es_translation: The same compassionate expression appeared again in Dorian Gray's eyes. Then he extended his arm, took a piece of paper, and wrote something on it. He reread it twice, folded it carefully, and pushed it to the other side of the table. Afterwards, he got up and approached the window.

en: Campbell looked at him in surprise, and then took up the paper, and opened it. As he read it, his face became ghastly pale and he fell back in his chair. A horrible sense of sickness came over him. He felt as if his heart was beating itself to death in some empty hollow.
vi: Campbell nhìn cậu ngạc nhiên, rồi cầm tờ giấy lên, mở nó ra. Lúc y đọc nó, mặt y trở nên tái mét như xác chết, và y rơi ngược lại ghế. Một cảm giác buồn nôn khủng khiếp ập đến với y. Y thấy như thể tim y đang đập chính nó đến chết trong hõm sâu trống rỗng nào đó.
tr: Campbell hayretler içinde ona bakıyordu. Kâğıdı aldı, açtı. Okudukça yüzü ölü gibi sarararak yaslandı kaldı. İçini müthiş bir baygınlık bürümüştü, yüreği, boşlukta çatlayıp gidecekmişçesine çarpıyordu.
es: Campbell le miró sorprendido, y luego recogió el papel y lo abrió. Mientras lo leía su rostro adquirió una palidez cenicienta y tuvo que recostarse en el respaldo de la silla. Le invadió una sensación de náusea infinita. Sintió que el corazón le latía en una vacía premonición de muerte.
vi_translation: Campbell looked at him in surprise, then picked up the piece of paper and opened it. As he read it, his face turned as pale as a corpse, and he fell back into his chair. A terrible feeling of nausea overwhelmed him. He felt as if his heart was beating itself to death in some deep, empty void.
tr_translation: Campbell was staring at him in amazement. He took the paper and opened it. As he read, his face turned as pale as a dead man's and he leaned back. A terrible faintness enveloped him, and his heart was pounding as if it would burst in the void.
es_translation: Campbell looked at him surprised, and then picked up the paper and opened it. As he read it, his face turned an ashen pallor and he had to lean back in his chair. A sensation of infinite nausea overcame him. He felt his heart beating with an empty premonition of death.

en: After two or three minutes of terrible silence, Dorian turned round and came and stood behind him, putting his hand upon his shoulder.
vi: Sau đôi ba phút im lặng đáng sợ, Dorian quay lại, đến đứng sau lưng y, đặt tay lên vai y.
tr: Korkunç bir sessizlikle dolu birkaç dakikanın sonunda Dorian döndü, geldi konuğunun yanında durdu, elini onun omzuna koydu.
es: Al cabo de dos o tres minutos de terrible silencio, Dorian, abandonando la ventana, se situó tras él y le puso una mano en el hombro.
vi_translation: After a few terrifying minutes of silence, Dorian turned around, stood behind him, and placed his hand on his shoulder.
tr_translation: After a few minutes filled with a dreadful silence, Dorian turned, came to stand beside his guest, and placed his hand on his shoulder.
es_translation: After two or three minutes of terrible silence, Dorian, leaving the window, positioned himself behind him and placed a hand on his shoulder.

en: “I am so sorry for you, Alan,” he murmured, “but you leave me no alternative. I have a letter written already. Here it is. You see the address. If you don’t help me, I must send it. If you don’t help me, I will send it. You know what the result will be. But you are going to help me. It is impossible for you to refuse now. I tried to spare you. You will do me the justice to admit that. You were stern, harsh, offensive. You treated me as no man has ever dared to treat me—no living man, at any rate. I bore it all. Now it is for me to dictate terms.”
vi: “Tôi rất lấy làm tiếc cho anh, Alan,” cậu lẩm bẩm, “nhưng anh không để cho tôi còn sự lựa chọn nào khác. Tôi có một lá thư đã viết sẵn. Nó đây. Anh nhìn thấy địa chỉ rồi đấy. Nếu anh không giúp tôi, tôi phải gửi nó đi. Nếu anh không giúp tôi, tôi sẽ gửi nó đi. Anh biết hậu quả sẽ là gì rồi. Nhưng anh sắp giúp tôi. Bây giờ thì anh không thể từ chối tôi nữa. Tôi đã cố tha anh. Anh sẽ phải công bằng với tôi mà thừa nhận điều ấy. Anh đã nghiêm khắc, cay nghiệt, công kích. Anh đã đối xử với tôi theo cách mà chưa ai từng dám đối xử với tôi — không người sống nào, dẫu sao đi nữa. Tôi đã chịu đựng hết. Giờ là lúc tôi ra điều kiện.”
tr: “Sana acıyorum, ne var ki bana başka bir seçenek bırakmıyorsun, Alan,” dedi. “Mektubu yazıp hazırladım. İşte bak. Adresi de görüyorsun. Bana yardım etmezsen bunu yollamaktan başka çıkar yolum kalmıyor. Bana yardım etmezsen bunu sahiden yollayacağım. Sonuç ne olacak, biliyorsun. Ama sen yardım edeceksin bana. Artık, olmaz demenin yolu yok. Seni kollamaya çalıştım. Bunu itiraf etmezsen bana haksızlık yapmış olursun. Katı, haşin davrandın, bana hakaret ettin. Bana böyle davranmaya kimse cesaret edememiştir, Alan. Yani hayatta olan hiçbir kimse, demek istiyorum, en azından. Hepsine katlandım. Şimdi de koşul ileri sürmek sırası bende.
es: —Lo siento por ti, Alan —murmuró—, pero no me has dado otra opción. La carta está escrita. La tengo aquí. Ya ves a quién va dirigida. Si no me ayudas, la enviaré. Sabes cuáles serán las consecuencias. Pero me vas a ayudar. Es imposible que te niegues. He tratado de evitártelo. Has de reconocerlo. Te has mostrado inflexible, duro, ofensivo. Me has tratado como nadie se ha atrevido a tratarme nunca; nadie que esté vivo, al menos. Lo he soportado todo. Pero ahora soy yo quien impone las condiciones.
vi_translation: “I am very sorry for you, Alan,” he murmured, “but you have left me no other choice. I have a letter already written. Here it is. You see the address. If you don't help me, I have to send it. If you don't help me, I will send it. You know what the consequences will be. But you are going to help me. Now you can't refuse me anymore. I tried to spare you. You will have to be fair to me and admit that. You have been strict, harsh, aggressive. You have treated me in a way that no one has ever dared to treat me — no living person, anyway. I have endured it all. Now it's my turn to set the terms.”
tr_translation: “I pity you, but you leave me no other choice, Alan,” she said. “I wrote and prepared the letter. Here, look. You see the address too. If you don't help me, I have no other way but to send this. If you don't help me, I will really send this. You know what the outcome will be. But you will help me. There's no way to say no anymore. I tried to protect you. If you don't admit this, you will be unfair to me. You acted harshly, treated me cruelly, insulted me. No one has ever dared to treat me like this, Alan. I mean no one alive, at least. I endured it all. Now it's my turn to set conditions.”
es_translation: —I'm sorry for you, Alan —he murmured—, but you haven't given me another choice. The letter is written. I have it here. You see who it is addressed to. If you don't help me, I will send it. You know what the consequences will be. But you are going to help me. It is impossible for you to refuse. I have tried to avoid this for you. You must acknowledge it. You have shown yourself to be inflexible, harsh, offensive. You have treated me like no one has ever dared to treat me; no one who is alive, at least. I have endured it all. But now it is I who sets the conditions.

en: Campbell buried his face in his hands, and a shudder passed through him.
vi: Campbell vùi mặt vào tay, một cơn rùng mình chạy qua y.
tr: Campbell yüzünü ellerine gömdü ve tepeden tırnağa ürperdi.
es: Campbell ocultó el rostro entre las manos, recorrido el cuerpo por un estremecimiento.
vi_translation: Campbell buried his face in his hands, a shiver ran through him.
tr_translation: Campbell buried his face in his hands and shivered from head to toe.
es_translation: Campbell hid his face in his hands, his body shaken by a tremor.

en: “Yes, it is my turn to dictate terms, Alan. You know what they are. The thing is quite simple. Come, don’t work yourself into this fever. The thing has to be done. Face it, and do it.”
vi: “Vâng, đến lượt tôi ra điều kiện, Alan. Anh biết chúng là gì rồi. Việc ấy rất đơn giản. Nào, đừng làm mình làm mẩy nữa. Việc ấy phải được làm cho xong. Đương đầu với nó, xử lý nó đi.”
tr: “Evet, koşulları ileri sürmek sırası bende, Alan. Biliyorsun bunların ne olduğunu. Sorun son derece basit. Hadi, kendini gereksiz yere kahretme. Ortada yapılacak bir iş var. Kabullen ve yap.
es: —Sí; soy yo quien pone las condiciones, Alan. Ya sabes cuáles son. Se trata de hacer algo muy sencillo. Vamos, no te desesperes. Es inevitable. Acéptalo, y haz lo que tienes que hacer.
vi_translation: "Yes, it's my turn to set the conditions, Alan. You already know what they are. It's very simple. Come on, stop making a fuss. It needs to be done. Face it, deal with it."
tr_translation: “Yes, it's my turn to set the conditions, Alan. You know what they are. The issue is extremely simple. Come on, don't torment yourself unnecessarily. There is a job to be done. Accept it and do it.”
es_translation: —Yes; I am the one who sets the conditions, Alan. You already know what they are. It's about doing something very simple. Come on, don't despair. It's inevitable. Accept it, and do what you have to do.

en: A groan broke from Campbell’s lips and he shivered all over. The ticking of the clock on the mantelpiece seemed to him to be dividing time into separate atoms of agony, each of which was too terrible to be borne. He felt as if an iron ring was being slowly tightened round his forehead, as if the disgrace with which he was threatened had already come upon him. The hand upon his shoulder weighed like a hand of lead. It was intolerable. It seemed to crush him.
vi: Một tiếng rên rỉ bật ra khỏi môi Campbell, y run khắp người. Y thấy tiếng đồng hồ tích tắc trên giá lò sưởi dường như phân thời gian ra thành các nguyên tử khổ đau, từng cái trong chúng đều quá khủng khiếp để mà chịu đựng. Y thấy như thể một vòng sắt đang chầm chậm siết chặt quanh trán, như thể sự nhục nhã mà y bị hăm dọa đã ập đến với y rồi. Bàn tay trên vai y nặng như bàn tay chì. Không thể chịu đựng nổi nó. Dường như nó sắp đè bẹp y.
tr: Campbell hafifçe inledi; her yanı titriyordu. Şöminenin üstündeki saatin tıkırtısı zamanı, her birine katlanması öbüründen daha korkunç olan işkence atomlarına böler gibiydi. Demirden bir çember alnını kuşatmış, yavaştan sıkar gibiydi; karşı karşıya bulunduğu rezillik korkutmacası sanki daha şimdiden gerçekleşmişti. Omzundaki el kurşundan bir el ağırlığındaydı. Dayanılır gibi değildi. Eziyordu sanki.
es: A Campbell se le escapó un gemido, y empezó a temblar de pies a cabeza. Le pareció que el tictac del reloj situado en la repisa de la chimenea dividía el tiempo en átomos de dolor, cada uno de ellos demasiado terrible para soportarlo. Sentía como si un anillo de hierro, lentamente, se estrechara en torno a su frente, como si el deshonor con que se le amenazaba hubiera descendido ya sobre él. La mano posada sobre su hombro parecía hecha de plomo.
vi_translation: A groan escaped Campbell's lips, and he trembled all over. He felt the ticking of the clock on the mantelpiece seemed to divide time into atoms of agony, each one too terrible to endure. He felt as if an iron band was slowly tightening around his forehead, as if the humiliation he was threatened with had already descended upon him. The hand on his shoulder was as heavy as a leaden hand. He couldn't bear it. It seemed as if it was about to crush him.
tr_translation: Campbell groaned softly; his whole body was trembling. The ticking of the clock above the fireplace seemed to divide time into atoms of torture, each one more dreadful to endure than the last. An iron band encircled his forehead, tightening slowly; the disgrace he faced seemed as if it had already come to pass. The hand on his shoulder felt as heavy as a hand of lead. It was unbearable. It was crushing him.
es_translation: A moan escaped from Campbell, and he began to tremble from head to toe. It seemed to him that the ticking of the clock on the mantelpiece was dividing time into atoms of pain, each one too terrible to bear. He felt as if an iron ring was slowly tightening around his forehead, as if the dishonor he was being threatened with had already descended upon him. The hand resting on his shoulder felt like it was made of lead.

en: “Come, Alan, you must decide at once.”
vi: “Nào, Alan, anh phải quyết ngay đi.”
tr: “Haydi, Alan, şimdi hemen bir karar vermen gerek.
es: —Vamos, Alan; tienes que decidirte ya.
vi_translation: "Come on, Alan, you have to decide right now."
tr_translation: “Come on, Alan, you need to make a decision right now.”
es_translation: —Come on, Alan; you have to make up your mind now.

en: “I cannot do it,” he said, mechanically, as though words could alter things.
vi: “Tôi không thể làm việc này,” y nói, máy móc, như thể lời nói có thể thay đổi mọi sự.
tr: Genç adam kurgulu makine gibi, “Yapamam,” dedi sözlerin durumu değiştirebileceğini sanıyordu sanki.
es: —No lo puedo hacer —dijo maquinalmente, como si las palabras pudieran alterar la realidad.
vi_translation: "I can't do this," he said mechanically, as if words could change everything.
tr_translation: Like a programmed machine, the young man said, "I can't," as if he thought words could change the situation.
es_translation: —I can't do it —he said mechanically, as if the words could alter reality.

en: “You must. You have no choice. Don’t delay.”
vi: “Anh phải làm. Anh không có lựa chọn. Đừng trì hoãn.
tr: “Yapacaksın. Başka çaren yok. Oyalanma.
es: —Has de hacerlo. No tienes elección. No te empeñes en retrasarlo.
vi_translation: “You have to do it. You have no choice. Don't delay.”
tr_translation: “You will do it. You have no other choice. Don't dawdle.”
es_translation: —You have to do it. You have no choice. Don't insist on delaying it.

en: He hesitated a moment. “Is there a fire in the room upstairs?”
vi: Y lưỡng lự một lát. “Trong phòng trên gác có lò sưởi không?”
tr: Campbell bir an duraladı. “Yukarıdaki odada ateş var mı? “Evet.
es: Campbell vaciló un momento. —¿Hay un fuego en la habitación del ático?
vi_translation: He hesitated for a moment. "Is there a fireplace in the room upstairs?"
tr_translation: Campbell paused for a moment. "Is there a fire in the room upstairs?" “Yes.
es_translation: Campbell hesitated for a moment. —Is there a fire in the attic room?

en: “Yes, there is a gas-fire with asbestos.”
vi: “Có, có lò sưởi ga với a-mi-ăng.
tr: Asbestli gazocağı var.
es: —Sí; una toma de gas con placas de amianto.
vi_translation: “Yes, there is a gas heater with asbestos.”
tr_translation: There is an asbestos stove.”
es_translation: —Yes; a gas fixture with asbestos plates.

en: “I shall have to go home and get some things from the laboratory.”
vi: “Tôi phải về nhà lấy vài thứ từ phòng thí nghiệm.
tr: “Eve gidip laboratuvardan bir şeyler almam gerek.
es: —Tendré que ir a mi casa y recoger algunas cosas del laboratorio.
vi_translation: “I have to go home to get a few things from the laboratory.”
tr_translation: “I need to go home and get some things from the laboratory.”
es_translation: —I will have to go to my house and pick up some things from the laboratory.

en: “No, Alan, you must not leave the house. Write out on a sheet of notepaper what you want and my servant will take a cab and bring the things back to you.”
vi: “Không, Alan, anh không được rời khỏi nhà này. Biên ra một tờ giấy viết thư những gì anh cần, và gia nhân tôi sẽ lấy xe mang những thứ ấy về cho anh.”
tr: “Hayır, Alan, buradan ayrılamazsın; istediklerini bir kâğıda yaz. Uşağım bir arabaya atlar, hepsini alıp sana getirir.
es: —No, Alan; no puedes salir de esta casa. Escribe en un papel lo que quieres y mi criado irá en un coche a buscarlo.
vi_translation: "No, Alan, you must not leave this house." "Write down on a piece of paper what you need, and my servant will take the car to get those things for you."
tr_translation: “No, Alan, you cannot leave here; write down what you want on a piece of paper. My servant will hop into a carriage, get everything, and bring it to you.”
es_translation: —No, Alan; you cannot leave this house. Write on a piece of paper what you want, and my servant will go by carriage to fetch it.

en: Campbell scrawled a few lines, blotted them, and addressed an envelope to his assistant. Dorian took the note up and read it carefully. Then he rang the bell and gave it to his valet, with orders to return as soon as possible and to bring the things with him.
vi: Campbell viết nguệch ngoạc vài dòng, thấm chúng, rồi đề địa chỉ vào một phong bì cho phụ tá của y. Dorian cầm thư lên và đọc nó rất kỹ. Sau đó cậu rung chuông, đưa nó cho gia nhân, ra lệnh phải về càng sớm càng tốt, và mang các thứ về cùng hắn.
tr: Campbell birkaç satır karaladı, zarfın üstüne asistanının adını yazdı. Dorian pusulayı alıp dikkatle okudu. Sonra çıngırağı çaldı; pusulayı verdiği uşağına, istenilenleri alarak bir an önce gelmesini tembihledi.
es: Campbell garrapateó unas líneas, secó la tinta, y escribió en un sobre el nombre de su ayudante. Dorian tomó la nota y la leyó cuidadosamente. Luego tocó la campanilla y entregó la carta a su ayuda de cámara, ordenándole que volviera cuanto antes con las cosas solicitadas.
vi_translation: Campbell scribbled a few lines, blotted them, and then addressed an envelope for his assistant. Dorian picked up the letter and read it very carefully. Then he rang the bell, handed it to the servant, ordered him to return as soon as possible, and to bring the items back with him.
tr_translation: Campbell scribbled a few lines and wrote his assistant's name on the envelope. Dorian took the note and read it carefully. Then he rang the bell; he instructed his servant, to whom he had given the list, to return as soon as possible with the requested items.
es_translation: Campbell scribbled a few lines, dried the ink, and wrote his assistant's name on an envelope. Dorian took the note and read it carefully. Then he rang the bell and handed the letter to his valet, instructing him to return as soon as possible with the requested items.

en: As the hall door shut, Campbell started nervously, and having got up from the chair, went over to the chimney-piece. He was shivering with a kind of ague. For nearly twenty minutes, neither of the men spoke. A fly buzzed noisily about the room, and the ticking of the clock was like the beat of a hammer.
vi: Lúc cửa ngoài sảnh đóng lại, Campbell giật bắn mình lo lắng, và, đứng lên khỏi ghế, đi đến gần mặt lò sưởi. Y run như thể bị sốt rét. Suốt gần hai chục phút, không ai nói gì. Một con ruồi bay vo ve ồn ào quanh phòng, tiếng tích tắc của đồng hồ như tiếng gõ búa.
tr: Kapı kapandığı sırada Campbell ürkerek şöyle bir irkildi, sonra yerinden kalkarak şömine başına gitti. Sıtması varmış gibi titriyordu. Yirmi dakika kadar ikisi de konuşmadılar. Odanın içinde, vızıldayarak dolaşan bir sinek vardı. Saatin tıklaması çekiç vuruşu gibiydi.
es: Al cerrarse la puerta principal, Campbell tuvo un sobresalto y, levantándose de la silla, se acercó a la chimenea. Temblaba como atacado por la fiebre. Durante cerca de veinte minutos nadie habló. Una mosca zumbó ruidosamente por el cuarto y el tictac del reloj era como el golpear de un martillo.
vi_translation: When the outer hall door closed, Campbell started in worry, and, standing up from his chair, went near the fireplace. He shivered as if he had malaria. For nearly twenty minutes, no one said anything. A fly buzzed noisily around the room, the ticking of the clock sounded like hammer blows.
tr_translation: As the door closed, Campbell flinched in fright, then got up and went to the fireplace. He was trembling as if he had malaria. For about twenty minutes, neither of them spoke. There was a fly buzzing around the room. The ticking of the clock was like the strike of a hammer.
es_translation: When the front door closed, Campbell was startled and, getting up from the chair, he approached the fireplace. He was trembling as if struck by a fever. For about twenty minutes, no one spoke. A fly buzzed loudly around the room and the ticking of the clock was like the pounding of a hammer.

en: As the chime struck one, Campbell turned round, and looking at Dorian Gray, saw that his eyes were filled with tears. There was something in the purity and refinement of that sad face that seemed to enrage him. “You are infamous, absolutely infamous!” he muttered.
vi: Lúc chuông điểm một giờ, Campbell quay lại, và, nhìn Dorian Gray, thấy là mắt cậu đầy lệ. Có gì đó trong sự thuần khiết và tao nhã của gương mặt buồn bã ấy dường như làm y nổi điên. “Anh thật bỉ ổi, cực kỳ bỉ ổi!” y lẩm bẩm.
tr: Saat biri çalarken Campbell dönüp Dorian’a baktı, onun gözlerinin yaş içinde olduğunu gördü. Bu yüzün tertemizliğindeki, kibarlığındaki bir şey tepesini attırmış gibiydi. “Aşağılık herifin birisin sen!” diye söylendi. “Kepazenin tekisin.
es: Cuando el carillón dio la una, Campbell se volvió y, al mirar a Dorian Gray, vio que tenía los ojos llenos de lágrimas. Había algo en la pureza y el refinamiento de aquel rostro lleno de tristeza que pareció enfurecerlo. —¡Eres un infame! ¡Un ser absolutamente repugnante! —murmuró.
vi_translation: When the clock struck one, Campbell returned, and, looking at Dorian Gray, saw that his eyes were full of tears. There was something in the purity and elegance of that sorrowful face that seemed to drive him mad. "You are vile, utterly vile!" he muttered.
tr_translation: As one o'clock struck, Campbell turned and looked at Dorian, seeing that his eyes were filled with tears. Something about the purity and gentleness of that face seemed to have infuriated him. “You are a despicable bastard!” he muttered. “You are a disgrace.”
es_translation: When the chimes struck one, Campbell turned around and, upon looking at Dorian Gray, saw that his eyes were filled with tears. There was something in the purity and refinement of that sorrowful face that seemed to enrage him. —You are despicable! An absolutely repugnant being! —she murmured.

en: “Hush, Alan. You have saved my life,” said Dorian.
vi: “Suỵt, Alan: anh đã cứu đời tôi,” Dorian nói.
tr: “Sus, Alan. Hayatımı kurtardın.
es: —Calla, Alan: me has salvado la vida —dijo Dorian Gray.
vi_translation: "Shh, Alan: you saved my life," Dorian said.
tr_translation: “Stop, Alan. You saved my life.”
es_translation: —Hush, Alan: you have saved my life —said Dorian Gray.

en: “Your life? Good heavens! what a life that is! You have gone from corruption to corruption, and now you have culminated in crime. In doing what I am going to do—what you force me to do—it is not of your life that I am thinking.”
vi: “Đời anh? Chúa ơi! Đời gì vậy! Anh đi từ sự thối nát này đến sự thối nát khác, giờ thì anh đã đến đỉnh bằng một tội ác. Để làm những gì mà tôi sắp làm, những gì mà anh ép tôi làm, thì tôi không nghĩ về đời anh.”
tr: “Hayatını ha? Ulu Tanrım! Ama ne hayat ha! Pislikten pisliğe geçerek işi sonunda adam öldürmeye vardırdın. Bu yapacağım işi, yani senin zorunla yapmak durumunda olduğum şeyi yapıyorsam, seni düşündüğüm için değildir.
es: —¿La vida? ¡Cielo santo! ¿Qué vida es ésa? Has ido de corrupción en corrupción y ahora has coronado tus hazañas con un asesinato. Al hacer lo que voy a hacer, lo que me obligas a hacer, no es en tu vida en lo que estoy pensando.
vi_translation: “Your life? Oh God! What kind of life is this! You go from one corruption to another, now you have reached the peak with a crime. To do what I am about to do, what you force me to do, I do not think about your life.”
tr_translation: “Your life, huh? Oh my God! But what a life, huh! You went from filth to filth and finally ended up committing murder. If I am doing this thing, that is, the thing I am forced to do because of you, it is not because I am thinking of you.”
es_translation: —My life? Good heavens! What kind of life is that? You have gone from corruption to corruption and now you have crowned your exploits with a murder. In doing what I am about to do, what you force me to do, it is not your life that I am thinking of.

en: “Ah, Alan,” murmured Dorian with a sigh, “I wish you had a thousandth part of the pity for me that I have for you.” He turned away as he spoke and stood looking out at the garden. Campbell made no answer.
vi: “Ôi, Alan,” Dorian lẩm bẩm, với tiếng thở dài, “tôi mong anh dành cho tôi dẫu chỉ một phần nghìn nỗi thương xót mà tôi dành cho anh.” Cậu quay đi lúc cậu nói, đứng nhìn ra vườn. Campbell không trả lời.
tr: Dorian, “Ah, Alan,” diye içini çekti. “Benim sana acıdığımın binde biri kadar sen bana acıyabilseydin keşke!” Döndü, gözlerini bahçeye dikti. Campbell karşılık vermedi.
es: —Atan, Alan —murmuró Dorian Gray con un suspiro—, quisiera que sintieras por mí una milésima parte de la compasión que me inspiras —se volvió mientras hablaba y se quedó mirando el jardín. Campbell no respondió.
vi_translation: "Oh, Alan," Dorian murmured with a sigh, "I wish you would show me even one-thousandth of the compassion I have for you." He turned away as he spoke, looking out into the garden. Campbell did not reply.
tr_translation: Dorian sighed, "Ah, Alan." "I wish you could pity me even a thousandth as much as I pity you!" He turned and fixed his gaze on the garden. Campbell did not respond.
es_translation: —Stay, Alan —murmured Dorian Gray with a sigh—, I wish you could feel for me a thousandth part of the compassion you inspire in me —he turned as he spoke and stood looking at the garden. Campbell did not respond.

en: After about ten minutes a knock came to the door, and the servant entered, carrying a large mahogany chest of chemicals, with a long coil of steel and platinum wire and two rather curiously shaped iron clamps.
vi: Chục phút sau, một tiếng gõ cửa vang lên, và gia nhân bước vào, xách một rương gỗ gụ lớn đựng hóa chất, một cuộn dây thép và bạch kim rất dài với hai cái kẹp sắt hình thù khá lạ.
tr: On dakika sonra kapıya vuruldu, uşak içeri girdi. Elinde büyük, maun bir ecza sandığı, bir kangal çelik halatla, bir kangal platin teli ve oldukça garip biçimli iki demir mengene vardı.
es: Al cabo de unos diez minutos se oyó llamar a la puerta, y entró el criado con una gran caja de caoba llena de productos químicos, junto con un rollo de hilo de acero y platino, así como dos pinzas de hierro de forma bastante extraña.
vi_translation: A few minutes later, a knock on the door echoed, and a servant entered, carrying a large mahogany chest containing chemicals, a long coil of steel and platinum wire with two rather oddly shaped iron clamps.
tr_translation: Ten minutes later, there was a knock on the door, and the servant entered. In his hand, he had a large mahogany medicine chest, a coil of steel cable, a coil of platinum wire, and two rather oddly shaped iron vices.
es_translation: After about ten minutes, there was a knock at the door, and the servant entered with a large mahogany box full of chemical products, along with a roll of steel and platinum wire, as well as two rather strangely shaped iron tongs.

en: “Shall I leave the things here, sir?” he asked Campbell.
vi: “Tôi có thể để đồ lại đây không, thưa ngài?” hắn hỏi Campbell.
tr: Uşak, “Bunları buraya mı bırakayım, efendim?” diye Campbell’e sordu.
es: —¿He de dejar aquí estas cosas? —le preguntó a Campbell.
vi_translation: "May I leave my things here, sir?" he asked Campbell.
tr_translation: "Shall I leave these here, sir?" the servant asked Campbell.
es_translation: —Should I leave these things here? —he asked Campbell.

en: “Yes,” said Dorian. “And I am afraid, Francis, that I have another errand for you. What is the name of the man at Richmond who supplies Selby with orchids?”
vi: “Được,” Dorian nói. “Và tôi e là, Francis, tôi có việc vặt khác cho anh. Tên cái người ở Richmond mà vẫn cung cấp hoa phong lan cho Selby là gì nhỉ?”
tr: Dorian, “Evet,” diye onu yanıtladı. “Ha, Francis, korkarım bir işim daha var. Hani Selby’ye orkide yollayan Richmond’daki adamın adı neydi?
es: —Sí —respondió Dorian—. Y mucho me temo, Francis, que aún tengo otro encargo para usted.
vi_translation: “Alright,” Dorian said. “And I’m afraid, Francis, I have another errand for you. What’s the name of that person in Richmond who still supplies orchids to Selby?”
tr_translation: Dorian replied, "Yes." "Ah, Francis, I'm afraid I have one more task. What was the name of the man in Richmond who sent orchids to Selby?"
es_translation: —Yes —replied Dorian—. And I'm very much afraid, Francis, that I have another task for you. What is the name of that person from Richmond who brings orchids to Selby?

en: “Yes—Harden. You must go down to Richmond at once, see Harden personally, and tell him to send twice as many orchids as I ordered, and to have as few white ones as possible. In fact, I don’t want any white ones. It is a lovely day, Francis, and Richmond is a very pretty place—otherwise I wouldn’t bother you about it.”
vi: “Đúng rồi — Harden. Anh phải xuống Richmond ngay, đích thân gặp Harden, bảo ông ta gửi gấp đôi số phong lan tôi đã đặt, cho màu trắng ít nhất có thể. Thực ra, tôi không muốn một bông trắng nào cả. Hôm nay đẹp ngày, Francis, và Richmond là một nơi rất xinh, không thì tôi đã không phiền đến anh việc này.”
tr: “Öyle ya. Harden. Şimdi sen hemen Richmond’a gidip bu Harden’i kendin göreceksin. Ismarladığımın iki katı orkide yollasın oraya; beyazları da elinden geldiğince az olsun. Daha doğrusu hiç beyaz istemiyorum. Hava çok güzel, Francis. Richmond da çok şirin bir semttir, yoksa seni bu iş için zahmete sokmazdım.
es: —Eso es, Harden. Tiene usted que ir a Richmond de inmediato, ver a Harden en persona y decirle que mande el doble de orquídeas de las que había encargado, y que de las blancas ponga el menor número posible. De hecho, dígale que no quiero ninguna blanca. Hace muy buen día, Francis, y Richmond es un sitio muy bonito, de lo contrario no le diría que fuese.
vi_translation: “That's right — Harden. You need to go down to Richmond immediately, meet Harden in person, and tell him to send double the number of orchids I ordered, with as few white ones as possible. In fact, I don't want any white ones at all. It's a beautiful day today, Francis, and Richmond is a very lovely place, otherwise, I wouldn't trouble you with this.”
tr_translation: “Indeed. Harden. Now you will immediately go to Richmond and see this Harden for yourself. Have him send twice the amount of orchids I ordered there; and as few white ones as possible. In fact, I don't want any white ones at all. The weather is very nice, Francis. Richmond is a very charming neighborhood, otherwise I wouldn't trouble you with this task.”
es_translation: —That's right, Harden. You need to go to Richmond immediately, see Harden in person and tell him to send double the orchids that were ordered, and to include as few white ones as possible. In fact, tell him I don't want any white ones. It's a very nice day, Francis, and Richmond is a very beautiful place, otherwise I wouldn't tell you to go.

en: “No trouble, sir. At what time shall I be back?”
vi: “Không sao ạ, thưa ngài. Lúc nào tôi phải về?”
tr: “Zahmet falan değil, efendim. Ne zaman döneyim?
es: —No es ninguna molestia, señor. ¿A qué hora debo estar de vuelta?
vi_translation: "It's alright, sir. When do I have to return?"
tr_translation: "It's no trouble at all, sir. When should I return?"
es_translation: —It is no trouble at all, sir. What time should I be back?

en: Dorian looked at Campbell. “How long will your experiment take, Alan?” he said in a calm indifferent voice. The presence of a third person in the room seemed to give him extraordinary courage.
vi: Dorian nhìn Campbell. “Thí nghiệm của anh sẽ mất bao lâu, Alan?” cậu nói, bằng giọng điềm tĩnh, dửng dưng. Sự hiện diện của người thứ ba trong phòng dường như cho cậu sự can đảm khác thường.
tr: Dorian dönüp Campbell’e baktı. Sakin, umursamaz bir sesle, “Alan, senin deney ne kadar sürer?” diye sordu. Odada bir üçüncü kişinin bulunması ona olağanüstü bir cesaret verir gibiydi.
es: Dorian miró a Campbell. —¿Cuánto durará tu experimento, Alan? —preguntó con voz tranquila, indiferente. La presencia de una tercera persona en la habitación parecía darle un valor extraordinario.
vi_translation: Dorian looked at Campbell. "How long will your experiment take, Alan?" he said, in a calm, indifferent voice. The presence of a third person in the room seemed to give him unusual courage.
tr_translation: Dorian turned and looked at Campbell. In a calm, indifferent voice, he asked, "Alan, how long will your experiment take?" The presence of a third person in the room seemed to give him extraordinary courage.
es_translation: Dorian looked at Campbell. —How long will your experiment last, Alan? —she asked in a calm, indifferent voice. The presence of a third person in the room seemed to give it extraordinary value.

en: Campbell frowned and bit his lip. “It will take about five hours,” he answered.
vi: Campbell cau mày, cắn môi. “Nó sẽ mất độ năm tiếng,” y trả lời.
tr: Campbell kaşlarını çatarak dudağını dişledi. “Aşağı yukarı beş saat.
es: Campbell frunció el entrecejo y se mordió los labios. —Unas cinco horas —respondió.
vi_translation: Campbell frowned, biting his lip. “It will take about five hours,” he replied.
tr_translation: Campbell frowned and bit his lip. "About five hours."
es_translation: Campbell frowned and bit his lips. —About five hours —he replied.

en: “It will be time enough, then, if you are back at half-past seven, Francis. Or stay: just leave my things out for dressing. You can have the evening to yourself. I am not dining at home, so I shall not want you.”
vi: “Vậy nếu anh về lúc bảy rưỡi là đủ thời gian, Francis. Hoặc cứ ở lại đó: chỉ cần soạn sẵn quần áo của tôi ra ngoài. Anh có một buổi chiều tự do cho mình. Tôi không ăn tối ở nhà, nên tôi sẽ không cần anh.”
tr: “Öyleyse sen yedi buçukta falan dönebilirsen olur, Francis. Ama dur: Sen benim giyeceğim şeyleri çıkar; akşama izinli olabilirsin. Yemeği evde yemeyeceğime göre sana ihtiyacım olmayacak.
es: —Bastará, entonces, con que esté de vuelta para las siete y media. Mejor, quédese allí: deje las cosas preparadas para que pueda vestirme. Tómese la tarde libre. No cenaré en casa, de manera que no voy a necesitarlo.
vi_translation: “So if you come back at seven-thirty, that will be enough time, Francis. Or just stay there: just have my clothes prepared and laid out. You have a free afternoon for yourself. I'm not having dinner at home, so I won't need you.”
tr_translation: "Then it would be fine if you could return around half-past seven, Francis. But wait: You can take out the clothes I'll be wearing; you can have the evening off. Since I won't be eating at home, I won't need you."
es_translation: —It will be enough, then, if you are back by seven-thirty. Better yet, stay there: get things ready so I can get dressed. Take the afternoon off. I won't be dining at home, so I won't need you.

en: “Thank you, sir,” said the man, leaving the room.
vi: “Cảm ơn ngài,” người hầu nói, ra khỏi phòng.
tr: Adam, “Sağ olun, efendim,” diyerek dışarı çıktı.
es: —Muchas gracias, señor —dijo el ayuda de cámara, abandonando la habitación.
vi_translation: “Thank you, sir,” the servant said, leaving the room.
tr_translation: Adam said, "Thank you, sir," and went outside.
es_translation: —Thank you very much, sir —said the valet, leaving the room.

en: “Now, Alan, there is not a moment to be lost. How heavy this chest is! I’ll take it for you. You bring the other things.” He spoke rapidly and in an authoritative manner. Campbell felt dominated by him. They left the room together.
vi: “Giờ thì, Alan, không nên lãng phí phút giây nào. Sao mà cái rương này nặng thế! Tôi sẽ mang nó cho anh. Anh bưng mấy thứ kia.” Cậu nói nhanh, ra lối hách dịch. Campbell cảm thấy bị cậu thống trị. Họ rời phòng cùng nhau.
tr: “Hadi bakalım, Alan, boşa geçirecek tek dakikamız yok. Bu sandık da amma ağır ha! Ben taşırım sana. Sen öbür şeyleri getir.” Dorian otoriter bir sesle, çabuk çabuk konuşuyordu. Campbell onun buyruğu altına girmiş gibiydi. Odadan birlikte çıktılar.
es: —Bien, Alan, no hay un momento que perder. ¡Cuánto pesa esta caja! Yo te la llevaré. Encárgate tú de lo demás —hablaba rápidamente y con acento autoritario. Campbell se sintió dominado por él. Juntos salieron de la habitación.
vi_translation: “Now then, Alan, we shouldn't waste a moment. Why is this chest so heavy! I'll carry it for you. You carry those other things.” He said quickly, in a commanding tone. Campbell felt dominated by him. They left the room together.
tr_translation: “Come on, Alan, we don't have a single minute to waste. This chest is really heavy! I'll carry it for you. You bring the other things.” Dorian was speaking quickly and authoritatively. It was as if Campbell had come under his command. They left the room together.
es_translation: —Well, Alan, there's no time to lose. This box is so heavy! I'll carry it for you. You take care of the rest —he spoke quickly and with an authoritative tone. Campbell felt dominated by him. Together they left the room.

en: When they reached the top landing, Dorian took out the key and turned it in the lock. Then he stopped, and a troubled look came into his eyes. He shuddered. “I don’t think I can go in, Alan,” he murmured.
vi: Khi họ lên đến đầu cầu thang trên cùng, Dorian lấy chìa khóa ra và xoay nó trong ổ. Sau đó cậu dừng lại, một nét lo lắng xuất hiện trong mắt cậu. Cậu rùng mình. “Tôi không nghĩ là tôi có thể vào trong được, Alan,” cậu lẩm bẩm.
tr: Üst katın sahanlığına vardıklarında, Dorian anahtarı çıkarıp kilide soktu. Sonra durdu, gözlerinde tedirgin bir bakış belirdi. “Alan, içeri giremeyeceğim galiba.
es: Cuando llegaron al descansillo del ático, Dorian sacó la llave y la hizo girar en la cerradura. Luego se detuvo, una mirada de incertidumbre en los ojos. Se estremeció. —Me parece que no soy capaz de entrar —murmuró.
vi_translation: When they reached the top of the stairs, Dorian took out a key and turned it in the lock. Then he stopped, a look of worry appearing in his eyes. He shuddered. "I don't think I can go in, Alan," he muttered.
tr_translation: When they reached the landing of the upper floor, Dorian took out the key and inserted it into the lock. Then he stopped, a worried look appeared in his eyes. "Alan, I don't think I can go inside."
es_translation: When they reached the attic landing, Dorian took out the key and turned it in the lock. Then he paused, a look of uncertainty in his eyes. He shuddered. —I don't think I can go in —he murmured.

en: “It is nothing to me. I don’t require you,” said Campbell coldly.
vi: “Chuyện vặt với tôi. Tôi không cần đến anh,” Campbell nói, lạnh nhạt.
tr: “Alan, içeri giremeyeceğim galiba. Campbell soğuk soğuk, “Bence hava hoş,” dedi. “Sana ihtiyacım yok.
es: —No importa. No te necesito para nada —respondió Campbell con frialdad.
vi_translation: "A trivial matter to me. I don't need you," Campbell said coldly.
tr_translation: "Alan, I don't think I can go inside." Campbell said coolly, "I think the weather is nice." "I don't need you."
es_translation: —It doesn't matter. I don't need you for anything —replied Campbell coldly.

en: Dorian half opened the door. As he did so, he saw the face of his portrait leering in the sunlight. On the floor in front of it the torn curtain was lying. He remembered that the night before he had forgotten, for the first time in his life, to hide the fatal canvas, and was about to rush forward, when he drew back with a shudder.
vi: Dorian mở hé cửa. Khi làm vậy, cậu thấy mặt bức chân dung cậu liếc đểu cậu trong nắng. Trên sàn, đối diện nó, tấm màn rách đang nằm. Cậu nhớ ra là, đêm trước, lần đầu trong đời, cậu quên che tấm toan tai hại ấy, và đã gần như lao về phía trước, khi bị kéo giật lại bởi một cơn rùng mình.
tr: Dorian kapıyı araladı. Bu sırada portresinin gün ışığında pis pis sırıtan suratını gördü. Dibinde, yerde yırtılmış perde duruyordu. Dorian ilk kez dün gece uğursuz resmi örtmediğini anımsadı. Tam ileri atılacakken bir ürpertiyle sarsılarak geri çekildi.
es: Dorian Gray abrió a medias la puerta. Al hacerlo, vio el rostro del retrato, mirándolo, socarrón, iluminado por la luz del sol. En el suelo, delante, se hallaba la cortina rasgada. Recordó que la noche anterior había olvidado, por primera vez en su vida, esconder el lienzo maldito, y se disponía a abalanzarse, cuando retrocedió, estremecido.
vi_translation: Dorian slightly opened the door. As he did so, he saw the face of his portrait sneering at him in the sunlight. On the floor, opposite it, the torn curtain was lying. He remembered that, the night before, for the first time in his life, he had forgotten to cover the cursed canvas, and had almost rushed forward, when he was pulled back by a shudder.
tr_translation: Dorian slightly opened the door. At that moment, he saw the sneering face of his portrait in the daylight. At the bottom, the torn curtain lay on the floor. Dorian remembered for the first time that he hadn't covered the ominous painting last night. Just as he was about to move forward, he recoiled with a shudder.
es_translation: Dorian Gray half-opened the door. As he did so, he saw the face of the portrait, mocking, illuminated by the sunlight. On the floor in front of it lay the torn curtain. He remembered that the night before he had forgotten, for the first time in his life, to hide the cursed canvas, and he was about to pounce when he recoiled, trembling.

en: What was that loathsome red dew that gleamed, wet and glistening, on one of the hands, as though the canvas had sweated blood? How horrible it was!—more horrible, it seemed to him for the moment, than the silent thing that he knew was stretched across the table, the thing whose grotesque misshapen shadow on the spotted carpet showed him that it had not stirred, but was still there, as he had left it.
vi: Đâu ra cái giọt sương đỏ ghê tởm, lấp lánh ướt, sáng lên trên một bàn tay ấy, như thể tấm toan toát mồ hôi máu? Nó mới kinh khủng làm sao! — kinh khủng hơn, như cậu cảm thấy vào lúc ấy, so với cái thứ im lặng mà cậu biết đang duỗi ngang bàn, thứ mà cái bóng dị dạng của nó trên tấm thảm ố bẩn cho cậu thấy là nó không nhúc nhích, nhưng vẫn còn nguyên đó, như lúc cậu bỏ nó lại.
tr: Ellerden birinin üzerinde ışıldayan o iğrenç kızıl leke de neydi, tuvalden kan sızmış gibi? Nasıl da feciydi! Masa başına yığılıp kalmış olan o sessiz şeyden de daha feciymiş gibi geldi Dorian’a bir an için. Lekeli halıya vurmuş olan eğri büğrü ürkütücü gölge gibi o şeyin kıpırdamamış, hâlâ orada, onun bıraktığı yerde olduğunu gösteriyordu.
es: ¿Qué era aquel repugnante rocío rojo que brillaba, reluciente y húmedo, sobre una de sus manos, como si el lienzo hubiera sudado sangre? ¡Qué cosa tan espantosa! Por un momento le pareció más espantosa aún que la presencia silenciosa derrumbada sobre la mesa, la presencia cuya grotesca sombra en la alfombra manchada de sangre le indicaba que seguía sin moverse, que seguía allí, en el mismo sitio donde él la había dejado.
vi_translation: Where did that disgusting red drop of dew come from, glistening wet, shining on that hand, like a canvas sweating blood? How horrifying it was! — more horrifying, as you felt at that moment, compared to the silence that you knew was stretching across the table, the thing whose misshapen shadow on the stained carpet showed you that it wasn't moving, but still there, just as you left it.
tr_translation: What was that disgusting red stain shining on one of the hands, as if blood had seeped from the canvas? How horrible it was! For a moment, it seemed to Dorian even more horrible than that silent thing slumped over the table. Like the crooked, terrifying shadow cast on the stained carpet, it showed that the thing had not moved and was still there, where he had left it.
es_translation: What was that repugnant red dew that shone, gleaming and wet, on one of his hands, as if the canvas had sweated blood? What a horrifying thing! For a moment it seemed even more horrifying than the silent presence collapsed on the table, the presence whose grotesque shadow on the blood-stained carpet indicated that it remained unmoved, still there, in the same place where he had left it.

en: He heaved a deep breath, opened the door a little wider, and with half-closed eyes and averted head, walked quickly in, determined that he would not look even once upon the dead man. Then, stooping down and taking up the gold-and-purple hanging, he flung it right over the picture.
vi: Cậu thốt ra một hơi thở sâu, mở cửa rộng hơn một chút, và với đôi mắt nhắm hờ cùng cái đầu ngoảnh đi, bước nhanh vào, kiên quyết là cậu sẽ không nhìn thậm chí một lần vào người chết. Sau đó, cúi xuống, lấy tấm trướng vàng và tía ấy lên, cậu quăng nó thẳng lên trên bức tranh.
tr: Dorian derin bir göğüs geçirdi, kapıyı biraz daha açtı, sonra başını çevirip gözlerini yarı yumarak içeri daldı. Ölüye bir kez bile bakmamaya kararlıydı. Yere eğildi, sırmalı mor örtüyü kaldırdı, resmin üzerine fırlattı.
es: Respiró hondo, abrió un poco más la puerta y, con los ojos medio cerrados y la cabeza vuelta, entró rápidamente, decidido a no mirar ni siquiera una vez al muerto. Luego, agachándose, recogió la tela morada y oro y la arrojó directamente sobre el cuadro.
vi_translation: He let out a deep breath, opened the door a bit wider, and with half-closed eyes and a turned-away head, quickly stepped in, determined not to look even once at the dead person. Then, bending down, he picked up the golden and purple curtain and threw it straight over the painting.
tr_translation: Dorian took a deep breath, opened the door a bit more, then turned his head and darted inside, half-closing his eyes. He was determined not to look at the dead body even once. He bent down, lifted the embroidered purple cloth, and threw it over the painting.
es_translation: He took a deep breath, opened the door a bit wider, and, with his eyes half-closed and his head turned away, quickly entered, determined not to look at the dead man even once. Then, bending down, he picked up the purple and gold cloth and threw it directly over the painting.

en: There he stopped, feeling afraid to turn round, and his eyes fixed themselves on the intricacies of the pattern before him. He heard Campbell bringing in the heavy chest, and the irons, and the other things that he had required for his dreadful work. He began to wonder if he and Basil Hallward had ever met, and, if so, what they had thought of each other.
vi: Cậu dừng lại ở đó, cảm thấy sợ phải quay người lại, và mắt cậu dồn vào những hoa văn phức tạp trước mặt. Cậu nghe thấy Campbell bưng vào cái rương nặng trĩu, các món đồ sắt, và các thứ khác mà y đòi hỏi cho công việc rùng rợn của y. Cậu bắt đầu tự hỏi không hiểu y với Basil Hallward có khi nào gặp gỡ chưa, và, nếu thế thì, họ đã nghĩ gì về nhau?
tr: Çevresine bakınmaktan korkarak oracıkta duraladı; gözleri karşısındaki karmaşık şeylere dikilmişti. Campbell’in, yapacağı ürkünç işte kullanacağı ağır sandığı, mengeneleri ve öbür araç gereci içeri alışını izledi. O anda Basil Hallward’la tanışmış olduklarına bile inanası gelmiyordu. Tanıştılarsa birbirlerini nasıl bulmuşlardı acaba?
es: A continuación se inmovilizó, temiendo volverse, y sus ojos se concentraron en las complejidades del motivo decorativo que tenía delante. Oyó cómo Campbell entraba en el cuarto con la pesada caja de caoba, así como con los hierros y las otras cosas que había pedido para su espantoso trabajo. Empezó a preguntarse si Basil Hallward y Alan se habrían visto alguna vez y, en ese caso, qué habrían pensado el uno del otro.
vi_translation: He stopped there, feeling afraid to turn around, and his eyes were fixed on the intricate patterns in front of him. He heard Campbell bringing in the heavy chest, the iron items, and other things he required for his gruesome work. He began to wonder if he and Basil Hallward had ever met, and, if so, what they thought of each other?
tr_translation: He hesitated there, afraid to look around; his eyes were fixed on the complicated things in front of him. He watched as Campbell brought in the heavy chest, clamps, and other tools he would use for the dreadful task. At that moment, he could hardly believe that they had even met Basil Hallward. If they had met, how had they found each other?
es_translation: Then he froze, fearing to turn around, and his eyes focused on the complexities of the decorative motif in front of him. He heard Campbell enter the room with the heavy mahogany box, as well as the irons and other things he had requested for his dreadful work. He began to wonder if Basil Hallward and Alan had ever met and, if so, what they would have thought of each other.

en: “Leave me now,” said a stern voice behind him.
vi: “Giờ thì mặc kệ tôi đi,” giọng nói nghiêm khắc cất lên sau cậu.
tr: Arkasından yükselen sert bir ses, “Beni yalnız bırak artık,” dedi.
es: —Ahora déjame —dijo tras él una voz severa.
vi_translation: "Now just leave me alone," a stern voice spoke up behind him.
tr_translation: A harsh voice rising from behind said, "Leave me alone now."
es_translation: —Now leave me —said a stern voice behind him.

en: He turned and hurried out, just conscious that the dead man had been thrust back into the chair and that Campbell was gazing into a glistening yellow face. As he was going downstairs, he heard the key being turned in the lock.
vi: Cậu quay lại và vội vã đi ra, chỉ kịp nhận ra là người chết đã bị đẩy ngược lại ghế, còn Campbell đang nhìn vào bộ mặt vàng bóng lưỡng. Lúc xuống thang, cậu nghe tiếng chìa quay trong ổ.
tr: Dorian döndü, hızla dışarı çıktı. Ölünün arkaya doğru itildiğini, Campbell’in o nemden ışıldayan sapsarı yüze gözlerini dikmiş olduğunu şöyle bir gördü. Merdivenden aşağı inerken anahtarın kilitte döndüğünü duydu.
es: Dorian Gray dio media vuelta y salió precipitadamente, no sin advertir que el muerto había vuelto a apoyar la espalda contra la silla y que Campbell contemplaba un rostro amarillento que brillaba. Mientras descendía las escaleras oyó cómo la llave giraba por dentro en la cerradura.
vi_translation: He turned around and hurried out, only realizing that the dead person had been pushed back into the chair, while Campbell was staring at the shiny yellow face. As he descended the stairs, he heard the sound of a key turning in the lock.
tr_translation: Dorian turned and quickly went outside. He caught a glimpse of the dead body being pushed backward, and Campbell staring at that moist, glistening, pale yellow face. As he descended the stairs, he heard the key turning in the lock.
es_translation: Dorian Gray turned around and left hastily, not without noticing that the dead man had leaned back against the chair again and that Campbell was gazing at a yellowish face that was shining. As he descended the stairs, he heard the key turn in the lock from the inside.

en: It was long after seven when Campbell came back into the library. He was pale, but absolutely calm. “I have done what you asked me to do,” he muttered. “And now, good-bye. Let us never see each other again.”
vi: Lúc Campbell quay lại thư viện thì đã hơn bảy giờ khá lâu. Y tái nhợt, nhưng hoàn toàn điềm tĩnh. “Tôi đã làm xong những gì anh yêu cầu tôi làm,” y lẩm bẩm. “Và giờ thì tạm biệt. Chúng ta sẽ không bao giờ gặp nhau nữa.”
tr: Campbell yeniden kitaplığa geldiğinde saat yediyi çoktan geçmişti. Genç adam solgun ama son derece serinkanlıydı. “Benden istediğini yaptım,” dedi. “Şimdi artık elveda. Bir daha hiç görüşmeyelim.
es: Hacía tiempo que habían dado las siete cuando Campbell se presentó de nuevo en la biblioteca. Estaba pálido, pero muy tranquilo. —He hecho lo que me habías pedido que hiciera —murmuró—. Y ahora, adiós. Espero que no volvamos a vernos nunca.
vi_translation: When Campbell returned to the library, it was well past seven o'clock. He was pale, but completely calm. “I have done what you asked me to do,” he muttered. “And now, goodbye. We will never see each other again.”
tr_translation: When Campbell returned to the library, it was already past seven o'clock. The young man was pale but extremely calm. "I did what you asked of me," he said. "Now it's goodbye. Let's never see each other again."
es_translation: It had been a while since seven o'clock had struck when Campbell appeared again in the library. He was pale, but very calm. —I have done what you asked me to do —he murmured—. And now, goodbye. I hope we never see each other again.

en: “You have saved me from ruin, Alan. I cannot forget that,” said Dorian simply.
vi: “Anh đã cứu tôi không là tôi tiêu rồi, Alan. Tôi không thể quên việc ấy,” Dorian nói, giản đơn.
tr: Dorian kısaca, “Beni mahvolmaktan kurtardın, Alan. Ben bunu unutamam,” dedi.
es: —Me has salvado del desastre, Alan. Eso no lo puedo olvidar—dijo Dorian Gray con sencillez.
vi_translation: "You saved me, otherwise I would have been done for, Alan. I can't forget that," Dorian said simply.
tr_translation: Dorian briefly said, "You saved me from ruin, Alan. I cannot forget this," he said.
es_translation: —You have saved me from disaster, Alan. That I cannot forget—said Dorian Gray simply.

en: As soon as Campbell had left, he went upstairs. There was a horrible smell of nitric acid in the room. But the thing that had been sitting at the table was gone.
vi: Ngay khi Campbell vừa về, cậu lên gác luôn. Trong phòng có mùi khủng khiếp của a-xít nit-ric. Nhưng cái thứ từng ngồi bên bàn đã biến mất.
tr: Campbell gider gitmez Dorian yukarı çıktı. Odada iğrenç bir kezzap kokusu vardı. Ama daha önce masa başında oturmakta olan o şeyin yerinde yeller esiyordu.
es: Tan pronto como Campbell salió de la casa, subió al ático. En la habitación había un horrible olor a ácido nítrico. Pero la cosa sentada ante la mesa había desaparecido.
vi_translation: As soon as Campbell got back, he went straight upstairs. There was a terrible smell of nitric acid in the room. But the thing that had been sitting at the table was gone.
tr_translation: As soon as Campbell left, Dorian went upstairs. There was a disgusting smell of acid in the room. But the thing that had been sitting at the desk earlier was nowhere to be seen.
es_translation: As soon as Campbell left the house, he went up to the attic. In the room, there was a horrible smell of nitric acid. But the thing sitting at the table had disappeared.

en: CHAPTER XV.
vi: Chương 15
tr: On beşinci bölüm
es: Capítulo 15
vi_translation: Chapter 15
tr_translation: Fifteenth chapter
es_translation: Chapter 15

en: That evening, at eight-thirty, exquisitely dressed and wearing a large button-hole of Parma violets, Dorian Gray was ushered into Lady Narborough’s drawing-room by bowing servants. His forehead was throbbing with maddened nerves, and he felt wildly excited, but his manner as he bent over his hostess’s hand was as easy and graceful as ever. Perhaps one never seems so much at one’s ease as when one has to play a part. Certainly no one looking at Dorian Gray that night could have believed that he had passed through a tragedy as horrible as any tragedy of our age. Those finely shaped fingers could never have clutched a knife for sin, nor those smiling lips have cried out on God and goodness. He himself could not help wondering at the calm of his demeanour, and for a moment felt keenly the terrible pleasure of a double life.
vi: Chiều hôm ấy, lúc tám rưỡi, ăn bận trang nhã và cài một chùm hoa phi yến Parma rất lớn trên khuyết áo, Dorian Gray được các gia nhân khom lưng đưa vào phòng khách nhà bà Narborough. Trán cậu đang nhoi nhói các dây thần kinh điên giận, và cậu cảm thấy bị kích động dữ dội, nhưng bộ dạng cậu lúc cậu cúi xuống bàn tay bà chủ nhà thì vẫn ung dung và duyên dáng như từ trước đến giờ. Không chừng người ta chẳng bao giờ có vẻ ung dung tự tại được như khi người ta phải đóng một vai. Chắc chắn không ai nhìn thấy Dorian Gray đêm ấy lại có thể tin là cậu vừa trải qua một thảm kịch cũng kinh khủng như bất cứ thảm kịch nào của thời đại chúng ta. Những ngón tay hình dáng đẹp đẽ ấy chẳng bao giờ có thể chộp lấy một con dao để phạm tội, và đôi môi tươi cười ấy cũng chẳng thể nào thóa mạ Chúa và sự nhân từ. Chính cậu cũng không thể không kinh ngạc với thái độ điềm tĩnh của mình, và trong khoảnh khắc, cảm thấy niềm vui sâu sắc khủng khiếp của cuộc sống hai mặt.
tr: O akşam sekiz buçukta son derece şık giyinmiş, yakasında Parma menekşelerinden iri bir demet olan Dorian Gray, önünde saygıyla eğilen uşaklar tarafından Leydi Narborough’nun salonuna götürüldü. Şakaklarında gerilimden çıldırmış damarlar atıyordu ve içi coşkun bir heyecanla doluydu. Ama ev sahibesinin eline eğilirken davranışı her zamanki gibi rahat ve kibardı. Belki de insan rol yapmak zorundayken, olduğundan da rahat görünür. Gerçekten de o gece Dorian Gray’e bakanlardan hiçbiri onun –çağımızın herhangi bir trajedisiyle boy ölçüşebilecek kadar– korkunç bir trajediyi yaşamış olduğuna inanmazdı. O biçimli parmaklar günah işlemek amacıyla bıçak tutmuş, o gülümser dudaklar Tanrı’ya, iyiliğe sövmüş olamazdı. Davranışının sakinliğine kendisi bile şaşıyordu. Çifte yaşam sürmenin müthiş zevkini bir an olanca keskinliğiyle tattı.
es: Alas ocho y media, unos criados que prodigaban reverencias hicieron entrar en el salón de lady Narborough a Dorian Gray, vestido de punta en blanco y con un ramillete de violetas de Parma en el ojal de la chaqueta. Le latían las sienes con violencia, y se sentía presa de una extraordinaria agitación nerviosa, pero sus modales, cuando se inclinó sobre la mano de su anfitriona, tenían la misma elegancia y naturalidad de siempre. Quizá uno nunca se muestra tan natural como cuando representa un papel. Desde luego, nadie que observara aquella noche a Dorian Gray podría haber creído que acababa de vivir una tragedia comparable a las más horribles de nuestra época. Imposible que aquellos dedos tan delicadamente cincelados hubieran empuñado un cuchillo con intención pecaminosa o que aquellos labios sonrientes hubieran podido blasfemar y burlarse de la bondad. Él mismo no podía por menos de asombrarse ante su propia calma y, por unos momentos, sintió intensamente el terrible júbilo de quien lleva con éxito una doble vida.
vi_translation: That evening, at half-past eight, dressed elegantly and with a large bunch of Parma larkspur pinned to his lapel, Dorian Gray was ushered into Mrs. Narborough's drawing-room by the bowing servants. His forehead was throbbing with furious nerves, and he felt intensely agitated, but his demeanor as he bowed over the hostess's hand remained as composed and graceful as ever. Perhaps one never seems so at ease as when one is playing a part. Surely no one who saw Dorian Gray that night could have believed that he had just gone through a tragedy as terrible as any of our age. Those beautifully shaped fingers could never have clutched a knife to commit a crime, and those smiling lips could never have uttered blasphemies against God and goodness. Even he could not help but be amazed at his own calm demeanor, and for a moment, he felt the terrible deep joy of living a double life.
tr_translation: That evening at half-past eight, dressed extremely elegantly with a large bouquet of Parma violets on his lapel, Dorian Gray was taken to Lady Narborough's drawing room by the servants who bowed respectfully before him. The veins in his temples throbbed with tension, and he was filled with a fervent excitement. But as he bowed to kiss the hostess's hand, his demeanor was as relaxed and courteous as ever. Perhaps when one has to play a role, they appear even more at ease than they are. Indeed, none of those who looked at Dorian Gray that night would have believed that he had experienced a tragedy so dreadful it could rival any tragedy of our age. Those well-shaped fingers could not have held a knife with the intent to sin, those smiling lips could not have cursed God and goodness. Even he was surprised by the calmness of his behavior. For a moment, he savored the intense pleasure of leading a double life with all its sharpness.
es_translation: At half past eight, some servants who were lavish with their bows showed Dorian Gray into Lady Narborough's drawing room, dressed to the nines and with a bouquet of Parma violets in the buttonhole of his jacket. His temples throbbed violently, and he felt seized by an extraordinary nervous agitation, but his manners, when he bowed over his hostess's hand, had the same elegance and naturalness as always. Perhaps one is never so natural as when playing a role. Certainly, no one observing Dorian Gray that night could have believed that he had just lived through a tragedy comparable to the most horrible of our time. It was impossible that those delicately chiseled fingers could have wielded a knife with sinful intent or that those smiling lips could have blasphemed and mocked goodness. He himself could not help but be amazed at his own calmness and, for a few moments, intensely felt the terrible joy of someone successfully leading a double life.

en: It was a small party, got up rather in a hurry by Lady Narborough, who was a very clever woman with what Lord Henry used to describe as the remains of really remarkable ugliness. She had proved an excellent wife to one of our most tedious ambassadors, and having buried her husband properly in a marble mausoleum, which she had herself designed, and married off her daughters to some rich, rather elderly men, she devoted herself now to the pleasures of French fiction, French cookery, and French esprit when she could get it.
vi: Đó là một buổi tiệc nhỏ, được chuẩn bị khá vội vàng bởi bà Narborough, một phụ nữ rất thông minh, với những cái mà huân tước Henry thường mô tả như các tàn tích của sự xấu xí thật sự khác thường. Bà đã tỏ ra là một phu nhân tuyệt vời của một trong các đại sứ nhạt nhẽo nhất của chúng ta, và sau khi chôn cất chu đáo chồng mình trong một lăng tẩm cẩm thạch, mà bà tự tay thiết kế, và gả các con gái mình cho vài người đàn ông giàu có, khá già, thì bây giờ bà hiến mình cho những niềm vui ở tiểu thuyết Pháp, nghệ thuật ẩm thực Pháp, và tính dí dỏm Pháp khi bà có thể nắm được nó.
tr: Leydi Narborough’nun biraz aceleye getirmiş olduğu ufak bir toplantıydı. Lord Henry’nin tanımıyla, gerçekte olağanüstü bir çirkinliğin hâlâ izlerini taşıyan Leydi çok zeki bir kadındı. Ülkemizin en can sıkıcı büyükelçilerinden biriyle evlenip mükemmel bir eş olmuştu. Kocasını, çizimini kendi yaptığı mermer bir gömüte gömdükten ve kızlarını biraz yaşlıca ama zengin adamlarla evlendirdikten sonra, şimdi kendini Fransız romanlarının, Fransız yemeklerinin ve –bulabildiği zaman– Fransız esprisinin keyfine adamıştı.
es: Se trataba de una cena con pocos invitados, reunidos de manera más bien precipitada por lady Narborough, mujer muy inteligente, poseedora de lo que lord Henry solía describir como restos de una fealdad realmente notable, que había resultado ser una excelente esposa para uno de los más tediosos embajadores de la corona británica, y que, después de enterrar a su marido con todos los honores en un mausoleo de mármol, diseñado por ella misma, y de casar a sus hijas con hombres ricos y de edad más bien avanzada, se había dedicado a los placeres de la narrativa francesa, de la cocina francesa e incluso del esprit francés cuando se ponía a su alcance.
vi_translation: It was a small party, hastily prepared by Mrs. Narborough, a very intelligent woman, with what Lord Henry often described as the remnants of truly extraordinary ugliness. She had proven to be a wonderful lady of one of our most insipid ambassadors, and after carefully burying her husband in a marble tomb, which she designed herself, and marrying off her daughters to several wealthy, rather old men, she now devoted herself to the pleasures of French novels, French culinary arts, and French wit whenever she could grasp it.
tr_translation: It was a small gathering that Lady Narborough had hastily organized. According to Lord Henry's description, the Lady, who still bore traces of an extraordinary ugliness, was a very intelligent woman. She had married one of the most tedious ambassadors of our country and had become a perfect wife. After burying her husband in a marble tomb, which she had designed herself, and marrying off her daughters to somewhat older but wealthy men, she now devoted herself to the pleasures of French novels, French cuisine, and –when she could find it– French wit.
es_translation: It was a dinner with few guests, hastily gathered by Lady Narborough, a very intelligent woman, who possessed what Lord Henry used to describe as the remnants of a truly remarkable ugliness, who had turned out to be an excellent wife for one of the most tedious ambassadors of the British crown, and who, after burying her husband with all honors in a marble mausoleum designed by herself, and marrying off her daughters to rich and rather elderly men, had dedicated herself to the pleasures of French narrative, French cuisine, and even French esprit when it was within her reach.

en: Dorian was one of her especial favourites, and she always told him that she was extremely glad she had not met him in early life. “I know, my dear, I should have fallen madly in love with you,” she used to say, “and thrown my bonnet right over the mills for your sake. It is most fortunate that you were not thought of at the time. As it was, our bonnets were so unbecoming, and the mills were so occupied in trying to raise the wind, that I never had even a flirtation with anybody. However, that was all Narborough’s fault. He was dreadfully short-sighted, and there is no pleasure in taking in a husband who never sees anything.”
vi: Dorian là một trong những người bà đặc biệt quý mến, và bà luôn bảo cậu là bà vô cùng sung sướng vì đã không quen cậu thời mới lớn. “Tôi biết, cậu ơi, là có lẽ tôi đã mê cậu phát cuồng,” bà hay nói, “và quăng ngay áo qua cầu cho cậu. May nhất là hồi ấy cậu chưa được nghĩ đến. Vả lại, áo chúng tôi thì quá xấu, còn cầu thì quá lặng gió, đến nỗi tôi chưa hề có ngay cả là một lần chim chuột với ai. Tuy nhiên, đó hoàn toàn là lỗi của Narborough. Ông ấy cận lòi, và chẳng có gì vui trong việc đi lừa một ông chồng chẳng bao giờ nhìn thấy gì.”
tr: Dorian onun gözdelerinden biriydi. Leydi Narborough genç adama her zaman, onunla gençliğinde tanışmadığına şükrettiğini söyler dururdu. “Biliyorum, hayatım, sana deliler gibi tutulurdum,” derdi. “Senin uğruna her şeyi feda ederdim. İyi ki o sıralar sen daha ana-babanın aklında bile yoktun. Aslında ben de kimseyle fingirdemeye bile kalkışmadım ya. Ama Narborough’nun suçuydu bu. Öyle miyoptu ki! Burnunun ucunu bile göremeyen bir kocayı aldatmanın ne keyfi var?
