It is the feet of clay that make the gold of the image precious. Her feet are very pretty, but they are not feet of clay. White porcelain feet, if you like. They have been through the fire, and what fire does not destroy, it hardens. She has had experiences.”
vi: “Y làm tôi chán phát kinh, cũng nhiều gần bằng y làm cô ấy chán. Cô ấy rất thông minh, quá thông minh với một phụ nữ. Cô ấy thiếu cái duyên không thể định nghĩa của sự yếu đuối. Chính đôi chân đất sét làm cho bức tượng vàng thành ra quý giá. Chân cô ấy rất đẹp, nhưng chúng không phải chân đất sét. Chân sứ trắng, nếu anh thích. Chúng từng qua lửa, mà những gì lửa không hủy hoại được thì nó sẽ làm cho cứng lại. Cô ấy từng trải đấy.”
tr: “O adam sıkıntıdan patlatıyor beni, en az karısını sıktığı kadar! Düşes çok zeki, bir kadın için fazla zeki. Zayıf olmanın o anlatıma sığmaz çekiciliğinden yoksun. Altın yontuları değerli kılan şey içlerindeki çamur karışımıdır. Düşesimizin bileşimindeyse çamur yok. Olsa olsa beyaz porselen. Kendisi ateşle sınanmış! Ateş de yakıp kül etmediğini sertleştirir. Görmüş geçirmiş bir kadın bu.
es: —Me aburre terriblemente, casi tanto como la aburre a ella. Mi prima es muy inteligente, demasiado inteligente para una mujer. Le falta el encanto indefinible de la debilidad. Los pies de barro dan todo su valor a la imagen de oro. Tiene unos pies preciosos, pero no son de barro. Blancos pies de porcelana, si quieres. Han pasado por el fuego, y lo que el fuego no destruye, lo endurece. Ha tenido experiencias.
vi_translation: “He bores me to death, almost as much as he bores her. She is very intelligent, too intelligent for a woman. She lacks the indefinable charm of weakness. It is the feet of clay that make the golden statue precious. Her feet are very beautiful, but they are not feet of clay. Porcelain feet, if you like. They have been through the fire, and what the fire does not destroy, it hardens. She is experienced.”
tr_translation: “That man is driving me crazy, at least as much as he annoys his wife! The Duchess is very intelligent, too intelligent for a woman. She lacks that indescribable charm of being delicate. What makes golden sculptures valuable is the mixture of clay inside them. In the composition of our Duchess, there is no clay. At most, she is white porcelain. She has been tested by fire! Fire hardens what it does not burn to ashes. This is a woman who has seen and experienced much.”
es_translation: —It bores me terribly, almost as much as it bores her. My cousin is very intelligent, too intelligent for a woman. She lacks the indefinable charm of weakness. The feet of clay give all their value to the golden image. She has beautiful feet, but they are not made of clay. White porcelain feet, if you like. They have passed through the fire, and what the fire does not destroy, it hardens. She has had experiences.

en: “How long has she been married?” asked Dorian.
vi: “Cô ấy lấy chồng bao lâu rồi?” Dorian hỏi.
tr: Dorian, “Ne kadar süredir evli?” diye sordu.
es: —¿Cuánto tiempo lleva casada? —preguntó Dorian.
vi_translation: “How long has she been married?” Dorian asked.
tr_translation: Dorian asked, "How long have you been married?"
es_translation: —How long have you been married? —asked Dorian.

en: “An eternity, she tells me. I believe, according to the peerage, it is ten years, but ten years with Monmouth must have been like eternity, with time thrown in. Who else is coming?”
vi: “Một thời gian vô tận, cô ấy bảo tôi thế. Tôi nghĩ, theo cuốn phả hệ quý tộc, là mười năm, nhưng mười năm với Monmouth hẳn là như vô tận, với thời gian bị ném vào đó. Còn ai khác đến không?”
tr: “Ezelden beri, kendi söylediğine bakılırsa. Soylular almanağına göreyse on yıl, sanıyorum. Gelgelelim Monmouth’la geçirilen on yıl sonsuzluktan bile daha uzun gelmiştir, herhalde. Başka kimler geliyor?
es: —Una eternidad, me dice. Según el libro nobiliario, creo que diez años, pero diez años con Monmouth pueden ser una eternidad e incluso un poco más. ¿Quiénes son los otros invitados?
vi_translation: “An endless amount of time, she told me so. I think, according to the noble genealogy book, it is ten years, but ten years with Monmouth must feel like an eternity, with time thrown into it. Did anyone else come?”
tr_translation: “Since time immemorial, according to what he says. According to the almanac of the nobles, it's ten years, I believe. However, ten years spent with Monmouth must have felt longer than eternity. Who else is coming?”
es_translation: —An eternity, she tells me. According to the peerage book, I believe ten years, but ten years with Monmouth can be an eternity and even a bit more. Who are the other guests?

en: “Oh, the Willoughbys, Lord Rugby and his wife, our hostess, Geoffrey Clouston, the usual set. I have asked Lord Grotrian.”
vi: “Ồ, nhà Willoughby, huân tước Rugby với vợ, bà chủ tiệc của chúng ta, Geoffrey Clouston, một nhóm như mọi khi. Tôi đã hỏi huân tước Grotrian rồi.”
tr: “İşte, Willoughbyler, Lord Rugby ile karısı, ev sahibemiz, Geofreyy Clouston, her zamanki takım. Lord Grotrian’ı da çağırdım.
es: —Los Willoughby, lord Rugby y su esposa, nuestra anfitriona, Geoffrey Clouston, los habituales. Le he pedido a lord Grotrian que vaya.
vi_translation: “Oh, the Willoughbys, Lord Rugby with his wife, our hostess, Geoffrey Clouston, a group as always. I have already asked Lord Grotrian.”
tr_translation: “Here are the Willoughbys, Lord Rugby and his wife, our hostess, Geofreyy Clouston, the usual team. I also invited Lord Grotrian.”
es_translation: —The Willoughbys, Lord Rugby and his wife, our hostess, Geoffrey Clouston, the usual ones. I have asked Lord Grotrian to go.

en: “I like him,” said Lord Henry. “A great many people don’t, but I find him charming. He atones for being occasionally somewhat overdressed by being always absolutely over-educated. He is a very modern type.”
vi: “Tôi thích y,” huân tước Henry nói. “Rất nhiều người không thích, nhưng tôi thấy y quyến rũ. Y chuộc cái lỗi thỉnh thoảng ăn diện hơi quá đà bằng cách luôn có học vấn quá cao. Y là một mẫu người rất hiện đại.”
tr: “Hoşlanıyorum ondan,” dedi Lord Henry. “Birçokları sevmez, ama bana pek sevimli geliyor. Ara sıra biraz aşırı giyimli olmanın kusurunu, her zaman aşırı kültürlü olmasıyla kapatıyor. Çok çağdaş bir tip.
es: —Me gusta —dijo lord Henry—. Hay mucha gente que no está de acuerdo, pero yo lo encuentro encantador. Compensa sus ocasionales excesos en el vestir con una educación siempre ultrarrefinada. Es una persona muy moderna.
vi_translation: "I like him," Lord Henry said. "Many people don't, but I find him charming. He compensates for the occasional overdressing by always being highly educated. He is a very modern type of person."
tr_translation: “I like him,” said Lord Henry. “Many do not, but I find him quite charming. He makes up for the occasional fault of being overdressed by always being overly cultured. A very contemporary type.”
es_translation: —I like him —said Lord Henry—. There are many people who disagree, but I find him charming. He compensates for his occasional excesses in dressing with an always ultra-refined education. He is a very modern person.

en: “I don’t know if he will be able to come, Harry. He may have to go to Monte Carlo with his father.”
vi: “Tôi không biết y có thể đến được không, Harry. Y có thể phải đi Monte Carlo với cha.”
tr: “Gelip gelmeyeceğini bilemiyorum, Harry. Babasıyla Monte Carlo’ya gitmesi gerekebilir.
es: —No sé si podrá formar parte del grupo, Harry. Quizá tenga que ir a Montecarlo con su padre.
vi_translation: “I don't know if he can come, Harry. He might have to go to Monte Carlo with his father.”
tr_translation: "I don't know if he will come or not, Harry. He might have to go to Monte Carlo with his father."
es_translation: —I don't know if he will be able to join the group, Harry. He might have to go to Monte Carlo with his father.

en: “Ah! what a nuisance people’s people are! Try and make him come. By the way, Dorian, you ran off very early last night. You left before eleven. What did you do afterwards? Did you go straight home?”
vi: “Ôi! Những người của công chúng mới phiền toái làm sao! Cố mời y đến đi. Nhân thể, Dorian, đêm qua cậu bỏ về quá sớm. Cậu về trước mười một giờ. Sau đó cậu làm gì? Cậu có về thẳng nhà không?”
tr: “Öf, dostların aileleri de amma baş belası ha! Zorla da gelsin, Dorian. Ha, dün gece çok erken kaçtın. On birden önce kalkıverdin. Sonradan ne yaptın ki? Dosdoğru eve mi döndün?
es: —¡Ah! ¡Qué molestas son las familias! Procura que vaya. Por cierto, Dorian, anoche desapareciste muy pronto. ¿Qué hiciste después? ¿Volver directamente a casa?
vi_translation: “Oh! How troublesome public figures are! Try to invite him over. By the way, Dorian, you left too early last night. You left before eleven o'clock. What did you do after that? Did you go straight home?”
tr_translation: “Ugh, friends' families are such a headache, huh! Come on, Dorian, come by force if you must. Hey, you left very early last night. You got up before eleven. What did you do afterwards? Did you go straight home?”
es_translation: —Ah! How annoying families are! Make sure she goes. By the way, Dorian, you disappeared very early last night. What did you do afterwards? Go straight home?

en: Dorian glanced at him hurriedly and frowned.
vi: Dorian hấp tấp nhìn y, và cau mày. “Không, Harry,” rốt cuộc cậu nói, “tôi không về nhà cho đến lúc gần ba giờ.”
tr: Dorian ondan yana çarçabuk bir baktı, sonra kaşlarını çatarak, “Yoo, eve döndüğümde saat üçe geliyordu,” dedi.
es: Dorian lo miró un momento y frunció el entrecejo.
vi_translation: Dorian hastily looked at him and frowned.
tr_translation: Dorian gave him a quick glance, then frowned and said, "No, it was almost three o'clock when I got home."
es_translation: Dorian looked at him for a moment and frowned.

en: “No, Harry,” he said at last, “I did not get home till nearly three.”
vi: Dorian hấp tấp nhìn y, và cau mày. “Không, Harry,” rốt cuộc cậu nói, “tôi không về nhà cho đến lúc gần ba giờ.”
tr: Dorian ondan yana çarçabuk bir baktı, sonra kaşlarını çatarak, “Yoo, eve döndüğümde saat üçe geliyordu,” dedi.
es: —No, Harry —dijo finalmente—. No volví a casa hasta cerca de las tres.
vi_translation: "No, Harry," he finally said, "I didn't get home until nearly three o'clock."
tr_translation: Dorian gave him a quick glance, then frowned and said, "No, it was almost three o'clock when I got home."
es_translation: "No, Harry," he said finally. "I didn't return home until around three."

en: “Did you go to the club?”
vi: “Cậu đến câu lạc bộ à?”
tr: “Kulübe mi gittin?
es: —¿Fuiste al club?
vi_translation: "Are you going to the club?"
tr_translation: “Did you go to the cabin?”
es_translation: —Did you go to the club?

en: “Yes,” he answered. Then he bit his lip. “No, I don’t mean that. I didn’t go to the club. I walked about. I forget what I did.... How inquisitive you are, Harry! You always want to know what one has been doing. I always want to forget what I have been doing. I came in at half-past two, if you wish to know the exact time. I had left my latch-key at home, and my servant had to let me in. If you want any corroborative evidence on the subject, you can ask him.”
vi: “Vâng,” cậu trả lời. Sau đó cậu cắn môi. “Không, tôi không định nói vậy. Tôi không đến câu lạc bộ. Tôi đi loanh quanh. Tôi quên là mình đã làm gì rồi… Sao anh tò mò thế, Harry! Anh luôn muốn biết người ta đã làm gì. Tôi luôn muốn quên những gì tôi đã làm. Tôi về đến nhà lúc hai rưỡi, nếu anh mong được biết chính xác thời gian. Tôi đã bỏ quên chìa khóa ở nhà, nên gia nhân tôi phải mở cửa cho tôi vào. Nếu anh cần bất cứ bằng chứng xác thực nào về vấn đề này thì anh có thể hỏi hắn.”
tr: “Kulübe mi gittin? Dorian, “Evet,” diye yanıtladı, sonra dudağını ısırdı. “Yok canım, öyle demek istemedim, kulübe gitmedim. Biraz dolaştım. Ne yaptığım aklımda değil şimdi. Amma meraklısın, Harry! İnsanın neler yapıp ettiğini bilmek istersin hep. Bense ne yapıp ettiğimi hep unutmak isterim. Tam saatini bilmek istiyorsan eve saat iki buçukta döndüm. Anahtarımı içeride unutmuşum, kapıyı adamıma açtırdım. Bu konuda destekleyici kanıt istiyorsan ona sor artık.
es: —Sí —respondió. Luego se mordió los labios—. No; no era eso lo que quería decir. No fui al club. Estuve paseando. No recuerdo lo que hice... ¡Qué inquisitivo eres, Harry! Siempre quieres saber lo que uno hace. Yo siempre quiero olvidarlo. Regresé a casa a las dos y media, si quieres saber la hora exacta. Me había dejado la llave, y Francis tuvo que abrirme la puerta. Si necesitas confirmación sobre ese punto, puedes preguntárselo.
vi_translation: "Yes," he replied. Then he bit his lip. "No, I didn't mean to say that. I didn't go to the club. I wandered around. I forgot what I did... Why are you so curious, Harry! You always want to know what people have done. I always want to forget what I've done. I got home at half past two, if you want to know the exact time. I forgot my keys at home, so my servant had to open the door for me. If you need any concrete proof of this, you can ask him."
tr_translation: “Did you go to the cabin?” Dorian replied, "Yes," then bit his lip. "No, I didn't mean it that way, I didn't go to the club. I walked around a bit. I can't remember what I did now. You're so curious, Harry! You always want to know what people are doing. But I always want to forget what I've done. If you want to know the exact time, I came home at two-thirty. I had forgotten my key inside, so I had my man open the door. If you want corroborative evidence on this, you can ask him."
es_translation: —Yes —he replied. Then he bit his lips—. No; that wasn't what I meant to say. I didn't go to the club. I was out walking. I don't remember what I did... How inquisitive you are, Harry! You always want to know what one does. I always want to forget it. I got home at half past two, if you want to know the exact time. I had left my key, and Francis had to open the door for me. If you need confirmation on that point, you can ask him.

en: Lord Henry shrugged his shoulders. “My dear fellow, as if I cared! Let us go up to the drawing-room. No sherry, thank you, Mr. Chapman. Something has happened to you, Dorian. Tell me what it is. You are not yourself to-night.”
vi: Huân tước Henry nhún vai. “Bạn ơi, cứ làm như tôi quan tâm lắm! Ta lên phòng khách nào. Tôi không uống xê-rét, cảm ơn, mít-tơ Chapman. Có chuyện gì đó đã xảy ra với cậu, Dorian. Kể tôi nghe xem nó là gì. Cậu không còn là mình đêm nay.”
tr: Lord Henry omuz silkti. “Aman dostum, sanki umurumdaydı! Hadi salona geçelim. Teşekkürler, mr Chapman; şeri almayayım. Dorian, sende bir şey var. Ne oldu, söyle bana. Bu gece hiç kendinde değilsin.
es: Lord Henry se encogió de hombros. —¡Mi querido amigo, como si a mí me importara! Subamos al salón. No, muchas gracias, señor Chapman, no quiero jerez. A ti te ha sucedido algo, Dorian. Dime qué ha sido. Te encuentro distinto esta noche.
vi_translation: Lord Henry shrugged. "My friend, as if I care! Let's go to the drawing room." I don't drink sherry, thank you, Mr. Chapman. Something has happened to you, Dorian. Tell me what it is. You are not yourself tonight."
tr_translation: Lord Henry shrugged his shoulders. “Oh my friend, as if I cared! Let's go to the living room. Thank you, Mr. Chapman; I won't have any sherry. Dorian, there's something about you. What happened, tell me. You're not yourself at all tonight.”
es_translation: Lord Henry shrugged his shoulders. —My dear friend, as if I cared! Let's go up to the living room. No, thank you very much, Mr. Chapman, I don't want sherry. Something has happened to you, Dorian. Tell me what it is. You seem different tonight.

en: “Don’t mind me, Harry. I am irritable, and out of temper. I shall come round and see you to-morrow, or next day. Make my excuses to Lady Narborough. I shan’t go upstairs. I shall go home. I must go home.”
vi: “Đừng để tâm đến tôi, Harry. Tôi đang dễ cáu và mất bình tĩnh. Tôi sẽ đến gặp anh ngày mai hoặc ngày kia. Cho tôi gửi lời xin lỗi bà Narborough. Tôi không lên gác được. Tôi sẽ về nhà. Tôi phải về nhà.”
tr: “Sen bana aldırma, Harry. Sinirlerim bozuk. Huysuzluğum üzerimde. Yarın ya da yarından sonra gelir kapını çalarım. Kuzum, Leydi Narborough’dan tarafımdan özür dileyiver. Yukarı çıkmak istemiyorum. Evime gideceğim. Evime gitmem şart.
es: —No lo tomes a mal, Harry. Estoy nervioso y de mal humor. Iré mañana o pasado mañana a verte. Presenta mis excusas a lady Narborough. No voy a subir a reunirme con las señoras. Tengo que ir a casa. Debo ir a casa.
vi_translation: "Don't mind me, Harry. I'm irritable and losing my temper. I'll come see you tomorrow or the day after. Give my apologies to Mrs. Narborough. I can't go upstairs. I'll go home. I must go home."
tr_translation: “Don't mind me, Harry. My nerves are frayed. I'm in a bad mood. I'll come knocking on your door tomorrow or the day after. Dear, please apologize to Lady Narborough on my behalf. I don't want to go upstairs. I'm going home. I must go home.”
es_translation: —Don't take it the wrong way, Harry. I'm nervous and in a bad mood. I'll come see you tomorrow or the day after tomorrow. Give my apologies to Lady Narborough. I'm not going upstairs to join the ladies. I have to go home. I must go home.

en: “All right, Dorian. I dare say I shall see you to-morrow at tea-time. The duchess is coming.”
vi: “Được rồi, Dorian. Tôi tin là tôi sẽ gặp cậu ngày mai vào thời điểm uống trà chiều. Nữ công tước sẽ đến.”
tr: “Peki, Dorian. Yarın çay saatinde görüşürüz, herhalde. Düşes de geliyor.
es: —Muy bien. Espero verte mañana a la hora del té. Vendrá la duquesa.
vi_translation: "Alright, Dorian. I believe I will see you tomorrow at tea time. The Duchess will be coming."
tr_translation: “Alright, Dorian. We'll see each other at tea time tomorrow, I suppose. The Duchess is coming too.”
es_translation: —Very well. I hope to see you tomorrow at tea time. The duchess will come.

en: “I will try to be there, Harry,” he said, leaving the room. As he drove back to his own house, he was conscious that the sense of terror he thought he had strangled had come back to him. Lord Henry’s casual questioning had made him lose his nerve for the moment, and he wanted his nerve still. Things that were dangerous had to be destroyed. He winced. He hated the idea of even touching them.
vi: “Tôi sẽ cố gắng đến đó, Harry,” cậu nói và ra khỏi phòng. Lúc cậu chạy về nhà mình, cậu nhận ra rằng cái cảm xúc sợ hãi mà cậu nghĩ cậu đã kìm nén được ấy lại đang quay về với cậu. Sự dò hỏi vô tình của huân tước Henry đã khiến cậu mất tinh thần một lúc, và cậu cần ổn định lại tinh thần. Những thứ nguy hiểm phải bị phá hủy. Cậu co rúm lại. Cậu ghét ngay cả cái ý nghĩ về việc đụng đến chúng.
tr: Dorian, “Gelmeye çalışırım,” diyerek odadan çıktı. Dorian arabayla evine dönerken, yenmiş olduğunu sandığı o dehşet duygusunun içinde yeniden canlandığını fark ediyordu. Lord Henry’nin laf olsun diye sorduğu sorular onu titretmiş, sinirini oynatmıştı. Oysa serinkanlı olmaya hâlâ ihtiyacı vardı. Kuşku uyandıracak bir iki şeyin ortadan kaldırılması gerekiyordu. Dorian ürpererek yüzünü buruşturdu. Onlara el sürmenin düşüncesi bile içini bulandırıyordu.
es: —Procuraré estar allí —dijo Dorian Gray, abandonando la habitación. Mientras regresaba a su casa se dio cuenta de que el sentimiento de terror que creía haber sofocado volvía a hacer acto de presencia. Las preguntas intrascendentes de lord Henry le habían hecho perder la calma unos instantes, y debía conservarla a toda costa. Había que destruir objetos peligrosos. Su rostro se crispó. Aborrecía hasta la idea de tocarlos.
vi_translation: "I will try to get there, Harry," he said and left the room. As he ran back to his house, he realized that the feeling of fear he thought he had suppressed was returning to him. The unintentional inquiry of Lord Henry had unnerved him for a moment, and he needed to regain his composure. Dangerous things must be destroyed. He cringed. He hated even the thought of touching them.
tr_translation: Dorian said, "I'll try to come," and left the room. As Dorian was driving home, he noticed that the feeling of horror he thought he had overcome was reviving within him. Lord Henry's casual questions had made him shiver and unnerved him. Yet he still needed to remain calm. A couple of things that might arouse suspicion needed to be eliminated. Dorian shuddered and grimaced. The very thought of touching them made him feel sick.
es_translation: —I will try to be there —said Dorian Gray, leaving the room. As he returned home, he realized that the feeling of terror he thought he had suppressed was resurfacing. Lord Henry's trivial questions had unsettled him for a moment, and he had to keep his composure at all costs. Dangerous objects had to be destroyed. His face contorted. He loathed even the idea of touching them.

en: Yet it had to be done. He realized that, and when he had locked the door of his library, he opened the secret press into which he had thrust Basil Hallward’s coat and bag. A huge fire was blazing. He piled another log on it. The smell of the singeing clothes and burning leather was horrible. It took him three-quarters of an hour to consume everything. At the end he felt faint and sick, and having lit some Algerian pastilles in a pierced copper brazier, he bathed his hands and forehead with a cool musk-scented vinegar.
vi: Tuy nhiên việc ấy vẫn phải làm xong. Cậu thấy thế, và khi cậu đã khóa cửa thư viện của mình lại, thì cậu mở cái tủ âm tường bí mật mà trong đó cậu đã nhét áo choàng và túi của Basil Hallward vào. Một lò sưởi lớn đang cháy rừng rực. Cậu chất thêm khúc gỗ khác vào nó. Mùi quần áo cháy sém và da thui bốc lên thật khủng khiếp. Cậu mất độ bốn lăm phút để thiêu sạch mọi thứ. Lúc kết thúc, cậu thấy chóng mặt buồn nôn, và sau khi đốt vài thỏi hương An-giê-ri trong một lư đồng khoét lỗ, cậu rửa tay và trán với giấm mát mùi xạ hương.
tr: Gel gör ki bu işin yapılması zorunluydu. Dorian ayırdındaydı bunun. Kitaplığının kapısını içeriden kilitledikten sonra Basil Hallward’ın paltosuyla çantasını tıkıştırdığı gizli gözü açtı. Ocakta gürül gürül bir ateş yanmaktaydı. Dorian bunun üstüne bir kütük daha attı. Dağlanmış kumaş, kavrulmuş deri kokusu tiksindiriciydi. Her şeyi yakıp kül etmek üç çeyrek saatini aldı. İşi bittiğinde içi bulanıyordu, bayılacak gibiydi. Delikli bir bakır mangalda birkaç Cezayir tütsüsü yaktı; elleriyle alnını içine misk karıştırılmış serinletici bir sirkeyle yıkadı.
es: Pero había que hacerlo. Lo comprendía perfectamente y, después de cerrar con llave la puerta de la biblioteca, abrió el armario secreto en cuyo interior arrojara el abrigo y el maletín de Basil. En la chimenea ardía un fuego muy vivo. Añadió un tronco más. El olor de la ropa y del cuero al quemarse era horrible. Fueron necesarios tres cuartos de hora para que todo se consumiera. Al acabar se sentía débil y mareado y, después de quemar algunas pastillas argelinas en un pebetero de cobre, se mojó las manos y la frente con vinagre aromatizado al almizcle.
vi_translation: However, that task still had to be completed. He realized this, and after he had locked his library door, he opened the secret closet where he had stuffed Basil Hallward's cloak and bag. A large fireplace was blazing fiercely. He added another log to it. The smell of burning clothes and singed leather was truly awful. It took him about forty-five minutes to burn everything completely. At the end, he felt dizzy and nauseous, and after burning a few sticks of Algerian incense in a perforated bronze censer, he washed his hands and forehead with cool musk-scented vinegar.
tr_translation: But see, this task had to be done. Dorian was aware of this. After locking the door of his library from the inside, he opened the secret compartment where he had stashed Basil Hallward's coat and bag. A roaring fire was burning in the fireplace. Dorian threw another log onto it. The smell of scorched fabric and charred leather was nauseating. It took him three-quarters of an hour to burn everything to ashes. When he was done, he felt nauseous, almost faint. He burned some Algerian incense in a perforated copper brazier; he washed his forehead with a cooling vinegar mixed with musk.
es_translation: But it had to be done. He understood it perfectly and, after locking the library door, he opened the secret closet into which he had thrown Basil's coat and briefcase. A very lively fire was burning in the fireplace. He added another log. The smell of burning clothes and leather was horrible. It took three quarters of an hour for everything to be consumed. When he finished, he felt weak and dizzy, and after burning some Algerian tablets in a copper censer, he moistened his hands and forehead with musk-scented vinegar.

en: Suddenly he started. His eyes grew strangely bright, and he gnawed nervously at his underlip. Between two of the windows stood a large Florentine cabinet, made out of ebony and inlaid with ivory and blue lapis. He watched it as though it were a thing that could fascinate and make afraid, as though it held something that he longed for and yet almost loathed. His breath quickened. A mad craving came over him. He lit a cigarette and then threw it away. His eyelids drooped till the long fringed lashes almost touched his cheek. But he still watched the cabinet. At last he got up from the sofa on which he had been lying, went over to it, and having unlocked it, touched some hidden spring. A triangular drawer passed slowly out. His fingers moved instinctively towards it, dipped in, and closed on something. It was a small Chinese box of black and gold-dust lacquer, elaborately wrought, the sides patterned with curved waves, and the silken cords hung with round crystals and tasselled in plaited metal threads. He opened it. Inside was a green paste, waxy in lustre, the odour curiously heavy and persistent.
vi: Đột nhiên cậu giật mình. Mắt cậu sáng rực lên một cách kỳ lạ, và cậu bồn chồn gặm môi dưới. Giữa hai cửa sổ có để một cái tủ Florence lớn, làm từ gỗ mun, khảm ngà voi và ngọc lưu li. Cậu nhìn nó như thể nó là một thứ có thể thôi miên hoặc gây ra nỗi sợ, như thể nó giữ cái gì đó mà cậu ước ao tuy nhiên lại gần như ghê tởm. Hơi thở cậu gấp gáp hơn. Một khát khao điên dại ập đến với cậu. Cậu châm một điếu thuốc rồi ném nó đi. Mi mắt cậu rủ xuống cho đến khi hàng lông mi tua rua dài ấy gần như chạm vào má. Nhưng cậu vẫn nhìn cái tủ. Cuối cùng cậu đứng dậy khỏi chiếc xô-pha mà cậu đang nằm trên đó, lại gần nó, và, sau khi mở nó ra, chạm vào cái lò xo ngầm nào đó. Một ngăn kéo tam giác chầm chậm chạy ra. Các ngón tay cậu mò mẫm theo bản năng về phía nó, thò vào trong, đến sát thứ gì đó. Nó là một cái hộp sơn mài đen và bụi vàng của Trung Quốc, chế tác công phu, các mặt được trang trí các làn sóng uốn lượn, với các sợi dây lụa treo pha lê tròn và có núm tua bằng chỉ kim loại bện. Cậu mở nó ra. Bên trong có một cục bột xanh lục, bóng như sáp, mùi bền và nặng lạ lùng.
tr: Sonunda uzanmış olduğu kanepeden kalkarak dolabın başına gitti, kapısını açarak içindeki gizli bir yaya bastı. Yavaş yavaş üçgen bir çekmece ortaya çıktı. Dorian’ın parmakları sanki kendiliklerinden çekmeceye yanaştı, içeri daldı, bir şey bulup kavradı. Altın tozu serpmeli siyah lake bir Çin kutusuydu bu. Yanları yuvarlak, dalga biçimi olukluydu, ipek kordonlarına yuvarlak cam boncuklar geçmiş, püskülleri metal ipliklerden örülmüştü. Dorian kutuyu açtı. İçinde balmumu solgunluğunda yeşil bir macun duruyordu, kokusu tuhaf, ağır ve kalıcıydı.
es: De repente tuvo un sobresalto. Sus ojos se iluminaron extrañamente y empezó a mordisquearse el labio inferior. Entre dos de las ventanas de la biblioteca había un voluminoso bargueño florentino de caoba, con incrustaciones de marfil y lapislázuli. Lo contempló como si fuera algo terrible y fascinante al mismo tiempo, como si contuviera algo que anhelaba y que, sin embargo, casi aborrecía. Su respiración se aceleró. Un deseo furioso se apoderó de él. Encendió un cigarrillo que tiró instantes después. Dejó caer los párpados hasta que las largas pestañas casi le tocaban la mejilla. Pero seguía mirando al bargueño. Finalmente se levantó del sofá donde había estado tumbado, se acercó a él y, después de descorrer el pestillo, tocó un resorte escondido. Lentamente apareció un cajón triangular. Sus dedos se movieron instintivamente hacia su interior y se apoderaron de algo. Era una cajita china de laca negra recubierta de polvo de oro, delicadamente trabajada; sus paredes estaban decoradas con sinuosas ondulaciones, y de los cordoncillos de seda colgaban cristales redondos y borlas tejidas con hilos metálicos. Dorian Gray la abrió. Dentro había una pasta verde que tenía el brillo de la cera y que desprendía un olor peculiar, denso y persistente.
vi_translation: Suddenly, he was startled. His eyes lit up in a strange way, and he nervously bit his lower lip. Between the two windows stood a large Florence cabinet, made of ebony, inlaid with ivory and lapis lazuli. He looked at it as if it could hypnotize or cause fear, as if it held something he desired yet almost detested. His breath quickened. A mad desire overwhelmed him. He lit a cigarette and then threw it away. His eyelids drooped until those long fringed lashes almost touched his cheeks. But he still looked at the cabinet. Finally, he got up from the sofa he was lying on, approached it, and, after opening it, touched some hidden spring. A triangular drawer slowly slid out. His fingers instinctively fumbled towards it, reaching inside, close to something. It was a Chinese lacquer box with black and gold dust, intricately crafted, the sides decorated with undulating waves, with silk cords hanging round crystals and tassels braided with metallic threads. He opened it. Inside was a greenish-blue lump, shiny like wax, with a strangely persistent and heavy scent.
tr_translation: Finally, he got up from the couch he had been lying on and went to the cabinet, opened its door, and pressed a hidden spring inside. Slowly, a triangular drawer emerged. Dorian's fingers seemed to move towards the drawer on their own, plunged inside, found something, and grasped it. It was a black lacquered Chinese box sprinkled with gold dust. Its sides were rounded and wave-shaped, with round glass beads threaded onto its silk cords, and its tassels were woven from metallic threads. Dorian opened the box. Inside was a green paste with the pallor of wax, its scent strange, heavy, and lingering.
es_translation: Suddenly, he had a start. His eyes lit up strangely and he began to nibble on his lower lip. Between two of the library windows, there was a large Florentine mahogany cabinet, inlaid with ivory and lapis lazuli. He gazed at it as if it were something terrible and fascinating at the same time, as if it contained something he longed for and yet almost loathed. His breathing quickened. A furious desire took hold of him. He lit a cigarette which he discarded moments later. He let his eyelids drop until his long lashes almost touched his cheek. But he kept looking at the cabinet. Finally, he got up from the sofa where he had been lying, approached it, and, after sliding back the latch, touched a hidden spring. A triangular drawer slowly appeared. His fingers instinctively moved inside and seized something. It was a Chinese box of black lacquer covered in gold dust, delicately crafted; its walls were decorated with sinuous undulations, and round crystals and tassels woven with metallic threads hung from the silk cords. Dorian Gray opened it. Inside, there was a green paste that had the sheen of wax and emitted a peculiar, dense, and persistent odor.

en: He hesitated for some moments, with a strangely immobile smile upon his face. Then shivering, though the atmosphere of the room was terribly hot, he drew himself up and glanced at the clock. It was twenty minutes to twelve. He put the box back, shutting the cabinet doors as he did so, and went into his bedroom.
vi: Cậu lưỡng lự một lúc, với nụ cười bất động kỳ lạ trên mặt. Sau đó cậu rùng mình, mặc dù không khí trong phòng nóng không chịu nổi, cậu thẳng người dậy, liếc nhìn đồng hồ. Lúc ấy là mười hai giờ kém hai mươi. Cậu đẩy cái hộp lại, đóng cửa tủ lúc làm vậy, và vào trong phòng ngủ.
tr: Dorian, yüzünde garip, donuk bir gülüşle biraz duraksadı. Sonra, odanın son derece sıcak olmasına karşın ürpererek şöyle bir doğrulup duvar saatine göz attı. On ikiye yirmi dakika vardı. Dorian kutuyu yerli yerine koyup dolap kapısını kapatarak yatak odasına geçti.
es: Vaciló unos momentos, con una extraña sonrisa inmóvil en el rostro. Luego, tiritando, aunque en la biblioteca hacía muchísimo calor, se irguió y miró el reloj. Faltaban veinte minutos para las doce. Devolvió la cajita china al bargueño, cerró la puerta y pasó a su dormitorio.
vi_translation: He hesitated for a moment, with a strange, motionless smile on his face. Then he shivered, even though the air in the room was unbearably hot, he straightened up, glanced at the clock. It was twenty to twelve. He pushed the box back, closed the cabinet door as he did so, and went into the bedroom.
tr_translation: Dorian paused for a moment with a strange, dull smile on his face. Then, despite the room being extremely warm, he shivered, straightened up, and glanced at the wall clock. It was twenty minutes to twelve. Dorian put the box back in its place, closed the closet door, and went to the bedroom.
es_translation: He hesitated for a few moments, with a strange, immobile smile on his face. Then, shivering, although it was very warm in the library, he stood up and looked at the clock. It was twenty minutes to twelve. He returned the Chinese box to the writing desk, closed the door, and went to his bedroom.

en: As midnight was striking bronze blows upon the dusky air, Dorian Gray, dressed commonly, and with a muffler wrapped round his throat, crept quietly out of his house. In Bond Street he found a hansom with a good horse. He hailed it and in a low voice gave the driver an address.
vi: Lúc nửa đêm điểm những cú đánh chuông đồng lên không trung mờ tối, Dorian Gray mặc quần áo bình dân, khăn choàng quấn quanh họng, lặng lẽ lẻn ra khỏi nhà. Trên phố Bond, cậu thấy một cỗ xe ngựa hai bánh với một con ngựa tốt. Cậu gọi nó, nhỏ giọng đưa địa chỉ cho xà ích.
tr: Gece yarısı karanlık havaya bronz yumruklar indirirken Dorian Gray, sıradan biri gibi giyinmiş, boynuna bir atkı sarınmış olarak gizlice evden çıktı. Rond Sokağı’nda, atı sağlam görünen bir araba buldu. El etti ve arabacıya alçak sesle bir adres verdi.
es: Cuando la medianoche desgranaba doce golpes de bronce en la oscuridad, Dorian Gray, vestido con ropa nada llamativa y una bufanda enrollada al cuello, salió sigilosamente de su casa. En Bond Street encontró un coche de punto con un buen caballo. Lo llamó, pero al dar en voz baja una dirección, el cochero movió la cabeza.
vi_translation: At midnight, as the chimes echoed through the dim sky, Dorian Gray, dressed in common clothes with a scarf wrapped around his neck, quietly slipped out of the house. On Bond Street, he saw a two-wheeled carriage with a fine horse. He hailed it and softly gave the address to the coachman.
tr_translation: As the midnight darkness struck with bronze fists, Dorian Gray, dressed like an ordinary person with a scarf wrapped around his neck, secretly left the house. On Rond Street, he found a carriage with a sturdy-looking horse. He waved and quietly gave an address to the coachman.
es_translation: When midnight struck twelve bronze chimes in the darkness, Dorian Gray, dressed in inconspicuous clothes and a scarf wrapped around his neck, stealthily left his house. On Bond Street, he found a hansom cab with a good horse. He called it, but when he gave an address in a low voice, the cabman shook his head.

en: The man shook his head. “It is too far for me,” he muttered.
vi: Người này lắc đầu. “Quá xa với tôi,” hắn lẩm bẩm.
tr: Adam başını salladı. “Gidemem, çok uzak,” dedi.
es: Lo llamó, pero al dar en voz baja una dirección, el cochero movió la cabeza. —Es demasiado lejos para mí —murmuró.
vi_translation: The person shook their head. "Too far for me," he muttered.
tr_translation: The man nodded his head. "I can't go, it's too far," he said.
es_translation: He called it, but when he gave an address in a low voice, the cabman shook his head. —It's too far for me —he murmured.

en: “Here is a sovereign for you,” said Dorian. “You shall have another if you drive fast.”
vi: “Đây, một đồng xô-vơ-ren cho anh,” Dorian nói. “Anh có thể nhận được đồng nữa nếu chạy nhanh.
tr: “Al sana bir altın. Hızlı sürersen bir tane daha veririm.
es: —Aquí tiene un soberano —le dijo Dorian Gray—. Le daré otro si va deprisa.
vi_translation: “Here, a sovereign for you,” Dorian said. “You can get another one if you run fast.”
tr_translation: "Here's a gold coin for you. If you drive fast, I'll give you another one."
es_translation: —Here is a sovereign —Dorian Gray said to him—. I'll give you another if you hurry.

en: “All right, sir,” answered the man, “you will be there in an hour,” and after his fare had got in he turned his horse round and drove rapidly towards the river.
vi: “Vâng, thưa ngài,” người này trả lời, “ngài sẽ ở đó trong vòng một tiếng,” và sau khi tiền xe đã vào túi, hắn quay ngựa, phóng nhanh về phía sông.
tr: Adam, “Baş üstüne efendim, bir saatte varırız,” dedi. Yolcusu bindikten sonra atının başını çevirerek, hızla ırmağın yolunu tuttu. 9. Jöle içinde et, kümes hayvanları vb.
es: —De acuerdo, señor —respondió el cochero—; estaremos allí dentro de una hora —y después de que su pasajero subiera al vehículo, hizo dar la vuelta al caballo y se dirigió rápidamente hacia el río.
vi_translation: “Yes, sir,” the man replied, “you will be there within an hour,” and after the fare was in his pocket, he turned the horse and sped quickly towards the river.
tr_translation: Adam said, "Yes, sir, we will arrive in an hour." After the passenger mounted, he turned his horse's head and quickly headed towards the river. 9. Meat, poultry, etc. in jelly.
es_translation: —Alright, sir —replied the coachman—; we will be there within an hour —and after his passenger got into the vehicle, he turned the horse around and headed quickly towards the river.

en: CHAPTER XVI.
vi: Chương 16
tr: (Ç. N. On altıncı bölüm
es: Capítulo 16
vi_translation: Chapter 16
tr_translation: (C. N.) Chapter Sixteen
es_translation: Chapter 16

en: A cold rain began to fall, and the blurred street-lamps looked ghastly in the dripping mist. The public-houses were just closing, and dim men and women were clustering in broken groups round their doors. From some of the bars came the sound of horrible laughter. In others, drunkards brawled and screamed.
vi: Mưa lạnh bắt đầu rơi, những ngọn đèn đường nhòe nhoẹt nhìn thật ma quái trong màn sương ướt sũng. Các quán rượu vừa đóng, và các nam nhân nữ nhân lờ mờ đang tụm lại thành những nhóm vụn vỡ quanh cửa. Từ vài quầy rượu vọng đến tiếng cười kinh khủng. Ở các quầy khác, người say cãi lộn và la hét.
tr: Soğuk bir yağmur inmeye başlamıştı; şıpırtılı sisin içinde bulanık sokak fenerleri ölü gözlerini andırıyordu. Tam meyhanelerin kapanma saatiydi; kapı önlerinde silik erkek ve kadın karaltıları dağınık gruplar oluşturuyorlardı. Barların kimilerinden tüyler ürpertici kahkaha sesleri yansıyor, kimilerinde sarhoşlar bağırarak dövüşüyorlardı.
es: Empezó a caer una lluvia fría, y los faroles desdibujados no lanzaban ya, entre la niebla, más que un resplandor descolorido. Era el momento en que cerraban los establecimientos públicos, y hombres y mujeres todavía reunidos delante de sus puertas empezaban a desperdigarse. Del interior de algunas de las tabernas brotaban aún horribles carcajadas. En otras, los borrachos discutían y gritaban.
vi_translation: Cold rain began to fall, the streetlights blurred, looking truly eerie in the soaking mist. The pubs had just closed, and men and women were faintly gathering into fragmented groups around the doors. From a few bars came horrifying laughter. At other bars, the drunkards were arguing and shouting.
tr_translation: A cold rain had started to fall; the blurry street lamps in the splashing mist resembled dead eyes. It was exactly the closing time for the taverns; faint silhouettes of men and women were forming scattered groups in front of the doors. From some of the bars, hair-raising laughter echoed, while in others, drunks were shouting and fighting.
es_translation: A cold rain began to fall, and the blurred streetlights no longer cast anything more than a faded glow through the fog. It was the time when public establishments were closing, and men and women still gathered in front of their doors began to disperse. From the interior of some of the taverns, horrible laughter still erupted. In others, the drunks argued and shouted.

en: Lying back in the hansom, with his hat pulled over his forehead, Dorian Gray watched with listless eyes the sordid shame of the great city, and now and then he repeated to himself the words that Lord Henry had said to him on the first day they had met, “To cure the soul by means of the senses, and the senses by means of the soul.” Yes, that was the secret. He had often tried it, and would try it again now. There were opium dens where one could buy oblivion, dens of horror where the memory of old sins could be destroyed by the madness of sins that were new.
vi: Nằm ngửa trong xe, mũ kéo qua trán, Dorian Gray đưa mắt thờ ơ dõi theo nỗi nhục nhã nhớp nhúa của thành phố vĩ đại ấy, và thỉnh thoảng cậu lại nhắc đi nhắc lại với mình những lời mà huân tước Henry từng nói với cậu ngay hôm đầu họ gặp, “Chữa lành linh hồn bằng cách dùng các giác quan, và chữa lành các giác quan bằng cách dùng linh hồn.” Vâng, đấy là bí quyết. Cậu thường dùng thử nó, và sẽ dùng thử nó lại ngay bây giờ. Ở đó có các ổ thuốc phiện, nơi người ta có thể mua sự lãng quên, những hang ổ ghê rợn nơi mà ký ức về các tội lỗi cũ có thể bị hủy hoại bằng sự điên rồ của những tội lỗi mới.
tr: Arabada arkasına yaslanarak şapkasını gözlerine indirmiş oturan Dorian büyük şehrin pis, aşağılık rezilliğini donuk bakışlarla süzüyor ve arada, tanıştıkları o ilk gün Lord Henry’den duyduğu sözleri kendi kendine yineliyordu: “Ruhu duyular yoluyla, duyuları da ruh yoluyla şifaya kavuşturmak...” Evet, işin püf noktası buydu. Dorian çok kez denemişti bunu, şimdi de deneyecekti. “Unutuş”ların parayla satın alınabildiği afyon tekkeleri vardı ya, eski günahların anılarını yepyeni günahların çılgınlığıyla silebileceğiniz ürkü üreten izbeler.
es: Casi tumbado en el coche de punto, el sombrero calado sobre la frente, Dorian Gray contemplaba con indiferencia la sórdida abyección de la gran ciudad, y de cuando en cuando se repetía las palabras que lord Henry le había dicho el día que se conocieron: «Curar el alma por medio de los sentidos, y los sentidos por medio del alma». Sí, ése era el secreto. Dorian Gray lo había probado con frecuencia y se disponía a volver a hacerlo. Había fumaderos de opio donde se podía comprar el olvido, antros espantables donde se podía destruir el recuerdo de los antiguos pecados con el frenesí de los recién cometidos.
vi_translation: Lying on his back in the car, hat pulled over his forehead, Dorian Gray listlessly watched the sordid shame of that great city, and occasionally he repeated to himself the words that Lord Henry had said to him the very first day they met, "Cure the soul by means of the senses, and the senses by means of the soul." Yes, that was the secret. He often tried it, and would try it again right now. There were opium dens, where one could buy oblivion, hideous haunts where the memory of old sins could be destroyed by the madness of new ones.
tr_translation: Dorian, leaning back in the car with his hat pulled down over his eyes, was gazing with a blank stare at the filthy, vile depravity of the big city and occasionally repeating to himself the words he had heard from Lord Henry on the day they first met: "To cure the soul by means of the senses, and the senses by means of the soul..." Yes, that was the crux of the matter. Dorian had tried this many times, and now he would try it again. There were opium dens where "forgetfulness" could be bought with money, dens of horror where you could erase the memories of old sins with the madness of new ones.
es_translation: Almost lying down in the cab, his hat pulled down over his forehead, Dorian Gray gazed indifferently at the sordid abjection of the great city, and from time to time he repeated to himself the words that Lord Henry had said to him the day they met: "Cure the soul by means of the senses, and the senses by means of the soul." Yes, that was the secret. Dorian Gray had often tried it and was about to do so again. There were opium dens where one could buy forgetfulness, dreadful haunts where one could destroy the memory of old sins with the frenzy of newly committed ones.

en: The moon hung low in the sky like a yellow skull. From time to time a huge misshapen cloud stretched a long arm across and hid it. The gas-lamps grew fewer, and the streets more narrow and gloomy. Once the man lost his way and had to drive back half a mile. A steam rose from the horse as it splashed up the puddles. The sidewindows of the hansom were clogged with a grey-flannel mist.
vi: Trăng tà lơ lửng giữa trời như chiếc sọ vàng. Thảng hoặc, một đám mây dị dạng khổng lồ lại vươn cánh tay dài thượt ngang qua và che khuất nó. Đèn khí đốt hiếm dần đi, phố hẹp hơn và u ám hơn. Xà ích có lần bị lạc và phải đánh xe quay lại nửa dặm. Hơi nước bốc lên từ con ngựa lúc nó lội lõm bõm qua vũng nước mưa. Các ô cửa sổ bên sườn cỗ xe ấy bị bịt kín bằng một màn sương fla-nen xám.
tr: Ay ufkun üzerinde sarı bir kurukafa misali sallanıyordu. Arada kocaman, yamuk bir bulut upuzun kolunu uzatıp ayı gözden gizliyordu. Şimdi sokak fenerleri seyrelmiş, sokaklar daha dar, daha kapanıktı. Bir ara arabacı yolunu şaşırdı, neredeyse yarım kilometre geri dönmek zorunda kaldı. Su birikintilerini sıçratarak ilerleyen atın bedeninden buhar tütmekteydi. Gri kumaştan biçilmiş bir sis arabanın yan pencerelerini örtmüştü.
es: La luna, cerca del horizonte, parecía un cráneo amarillo. De cuando en cuando una enorme nube deforme extendía un largo brazo y la ocultaba por completo. Los faroles de gas se fueron distanciando, y las calles se hicieron más estrechas y sombrías. En una ocasión el cochero se equivocó de camino, y tuvo que volver sobre sus pasos casi un kilómetro. El caballo quedaba envuelto en nubes de vapor cuando pisoteaba los charcos. Las ventanas del coche de punto se fueron cubriendo de una película de cieno semejante a franela gris.
vi_translation: The waning moon hung in the sky like a golden skull. Occasionally, a gigantic misshapen cloud would stretch its long arm across and obscure it. Gas lamps became rarer, the streets narrower and gloomier. The coachman once got lost and had to turn back half a mile. Steam rose from the horse as it splashed through a puddle of rainwater. The windows on the side of the carriage were sealed with a gray flannel mist.
tr_translation: The moon was swaying on the horizon like a yellow skull. Occasionally, a huge, crooked cloud would stretch out its long arm and hide the moon from view. Now the street lamps had thinned out, the streets were narrower, more enclosed. At one point, the coachman lost his way and had to turn back almost half a kilometer. Steam was rising from the body of the horse as it splashed through puddles. A mist cut from gray cloth had covered the side windows of the carriage.
es_translation: The moon, near the horizon, looked like a yellow skull. From time to time, an enormous deformed cloud extended a long arm and completely obscured it. The gas lamps grew further apart, and the streets became narrower and gloomier. On one occasion, the coachman took the wrong path and had to retrace his steps for almost a kilometer. The horse was enveloped in clouds of vapor when it trampled the puddles. The windows of the cab became covered with a film of mud resembling gray flannel.

en: “To cure the soul by means of the senses, and the senses by means of the soul!” How the words rang in his ears! His soul, certainly, was sick to death. Was it true that the senses could cure it? Innocent blood had been spilled. What could atone for that? Ah! for that there was no atonement; but though forgiveness was impossible, forgetfulness was possible still, and he was determined to forget, to stamp the thing out, to crush it as one would crush the adder that had stung one. Indeed, what right had Basil to have spoken to him as he had done? Who had made him a judge over others? He had said things that were dreadful, horrible, not to be endured.
vi: “Chữa lành linh hồn bằng cách dùng các giác quan, và chữa lành các giác quan bằng cách dùng linh hồn!” Sao mà những lời này lại rung lên như vậy trong tai cậu! Linh hồn cậu chắc chắn đã chán ngấy. Có đúng là các giác quan có thể chữa lành nó? Máu người vô tội đã đổ. Cái gì có thể chuộc lại lỗi lầm ấy? Ôi! Không có sự cứu chuộc nào cho lỗi lầm ấy cả; nhưng dẫu không thể được tha thứ, thì vẫn còn có thể lãng quên, và cậu quyết định quên, để xóa bỏ thứ đó, để nghiền nát nó như người ta vẫn nghiền nát con rắn lục cắn người. Quả thật, Basil có quyền gì mà nói với cậu như y đã nói? Ai cho y làm quan tòa xét xử người khác? Y đã nói những điều khủng khiếp, kinh tởm, không sao chịu nổi.
tr: “Ruhu duyular yoluyla, duyuları da ruh yoluyla şifaya kavuşturmak!” Bu sözcükler nasıl da çınlıyordu kulaklarında! Sahiden de ruhu ölümcül hastaydı şu sırada. Duyuların ruhu şifaya kavuşturabilmesi olası mıydı gerçekten? Masum bir kan akıtılmıştı. Neyle ödenebilirdi bunun bedeli? Yok, hiçbir şeyle ödenemezdi bu. Gelgelelim bağışlanmak mümkün değilse bile unutmak hâlâ olasıydı. Dorian da unutmaya, bu anıyı silmeye kişinin kendini sokan zehirli bir yılanı ezmesi gibi, ezip yok etmeye kararlıydı. Hem zaten Basil ona hangi hakla söylemişti o lafları? Başkalarının tepesine kim dikmişti onu yargıç olarak? Öyle şeyler söylemişti ki feci, iğrenç, dayanılmaz.
es: «¡Curar el alma por medio de los sentidos y los sentidos por medio del alma!» ¡Cómo resonaban aquellas palabras en sus oídos! Su alma, desde luego, tenía una enfermedad mortal. ¿Sería verdad que los sentidos podían curarla? Se había derramado sangre inocente. ¿Cómo expiarlo? No; no había expiación posible; pero aunque el perdón fuera imposible, el olvido no lo era, y Dorian Gray estaba decidido a olvidar, a pisotear aquel recuerdo, a aplastarlo como aplastamos a la víbora que nos ha inyectado su ponzoña. Después de todo, ¿qué derecho tenía Basil a hablarle como lo había hecho? ¿Quién le había otorgado la potestad de juzgar a otros? Había dicho cosas espantosas, horribles, insoportables.
vi_translation: “Healing the soul by using the senses, and healing the senses by using the soul!” How these words resonated in his ears! His soul was surely fed up. Is it true that the senses can heal it? Innocent blood has been shed. What can atone for that sin? Oh! There is no redemption for that sin; but even if it cannot be forgiven, it can still be forgotten, and he decided to forget, to erase it, to crush it as one would crush a venomous snake. Indeed, what right did Basil have to speak to him as he did? Who made him judge over others? He had said terrible, disgusting, unbearable things.
tr_translation: “To heal the soul through the senses, and the senses through the soul!” How these words echoed in his ears! Indeed, his soul was mortally ill at this moment. Was it really possible for the senses to heal the soul? Innocent blood had been shed. What could pay the price for this? No, nothing could pay for this. However, even if forgiveness was not possible, forgetting was still an option. Dorian was determined to forget, to erase this memory, to crush and destroy it like one would crush a venomous snake that had bitten them. Besides, with what right had Basil said those words to him? Who had appointed him as a judge over others? He had said things that were terrible, disgusting, unbearable.
es_translation: “Cure the soul by means of the senses, and the senses by means of the soul!” How those words resonated in his ears! His soul, of course, had a mortal disease. Could it be true that the senses could cure it? Innocent blood had been shed. How to atone for it? No; there was no possible atonement; but although forgiveness was impossible, forgetting was not, and Dorian Gray was determined to forget, to trample that memory, to crush it as we crush the viper that has injected its venom into us. After all, what right did Basil have to speak to him as he had? Who had granted him the authority to judge others? He had said dreadful, horrible, unbearable things.

en: On and on plodded the hansom, going slower, it seemed to him, at each step. He thrust up the trap and called to the man to drive faster. The hideous hunger for opium began to gnaw at him. His throat burned and his delicate hands twitched nervously together. He struck at the horse madly with his stick. The driver laughed and whipped up. He laughed in answer, and the man was silent.
vi: Cậu cảm thấy dường như cỗ xe hai bánh ấy nặng nề lết tới, lết tới, chậm dần, theo từng bước. Cậu đẩy ô cửa sập lên, kêu xà ích cho xe chạy nhanh hơn. Cơn đói thuốc gớm guốc bắt đầu giày vò cậu. Họng cậu cháy bỏng, đôi tay mềm mại thì co quắp bồn chồn liên tục. Cậu đập gậy như điên lên con ngựa. Xà ích bật cười, giục ngựa chạy tới. Cậu cười đáp lại, và người ấy lặng thinh.
tr: Araba hâlâ yol alıyor, ama Dorian’a her adımda daha yavaşlıyormuş gibi geliyordu. Dorian öndeki kapağı kaldırarak daha hızlı sürsün diye arabacıya bağırdı. Afyona duyduğu iğrenç istek içini kemirmeye başlamıştı. Boğazı yanıyor, o ince elleri sinirden kilitlenip açılıyordu. Bastonuyla delicesine ata vurdu. Arabacı gülerek kamçısını şaklattı. Dorian da karşılık olarak gülünce adam sesini kesti.
es: El coche de punto avanzaba laboriosamente, disminuyendo la velocidad, le parecía a Dorian Gray, con cada paso. Abrió con violencia la trampilla del techo y ordenó al cochero que acelerase la marcha. La terrible ansia del opio empezaba a devorarlo. Le ardía la garganta y sus delicadas manos se habían contagiado de un temblor nervioso. Sacando un brazo por la ventanilla golpeó ferozmente al caballo con su bastón. El cochero se echó a reír y también él utilizó su látigo. Dorian Gray respondió riendo a su vez y el otro guardó silencio.
vi_translation: He felt as if the two-wheeled carriage was laboriously dragging itself along, dragging itself along, slowing down with each step. He pushed up the trapdoor and called out to the coachman to make the carriage go faster. The horrible craving for drugs began to torment him. His throat burned, and his soft hands twitched restlessly. He beat the horse madly with his stick. The coachman laughed and urged the horse forward. He laughed in response, and the coachman fell silent.
tr_translation: The carriage was still moving, but it seemed to Dorian that it was slowing down with every step. Dorian lifted the front flap and shouted at the driver to go faster. The disgusting craving for opium had started to gnaw at him. His throat was burning, and his slender hands were clenching and unclenching with nerves. He struck the horse wildly with his cane. The driver laughed and cracked his whip. When Dorian laughed in response, the man fell silent.
es_translation: The cab moved laboriously, slowing down, it seemed to Dorian Gray, with each step. He violently opened the roof hatch and ordered the driver to speed up. The terrible craving for opium began to consume him. His throat burned and his delicate hands had caught a nervous tremor. Sticking an arm out the window, he fiercely struck the horse with his cane. The driver laughed and he too used his whip. Dorian Gray responded by laughing in turn and the other fell silent.

en: The way seemed interminable, and the streets like the black web of some sprawling spider. The monotony became unbearable, and as the mist thickened, he felt afraid.
vi: Con đường dường như vô tận, còn phố xá như tấm mạng đen của con nhện nằm ườn nào đó. Sự đơn điệu trở nên không thể chịu nổi, và, lúc sương mù đặc lại, cậu thấy sợ.
tr: Yolun sonu hiç gelmeyecek gibiydi, yollar kocaman bir örümceğin simsiyah ağını andırıyordu. Gidişin tekdüzeliği çekilmez olmuştu. Sis yoğunlaştıkça Dorian korkmaya başladı.
es: El trayecto parecía interminable, y las calles se asemejaban a los negros hilos de una inmensa telaraña. La monotonía se hizo insoportable y, al espesarse la niebla, Dorian Gray sintió miedo.
vi_translation: The road seemed endless, and the streets like a black web of a spider sprawled somewhere. The monotony became unbearable, and, as the fog thickened, he felt afraid.
tr_translation: The end of the road seemed like it would never come, the roads resembled the pitch-black web of a giant spider. The monotony of the journey had become unbearable. As the fog thickened, Dorian began to feel afraid.
es_translation: The journey seemed endless, and the streets resembled the black threads of an immense spider web. The monotony became unbearable and, as the fog thickened, Dorian Gray felt fear.

en: Then they passed by lonely brickfields. The fog was lighter here, and he could see the strange, bottle-shaped kilns with their orange, fanlike tongues of fire. A dog barked as they went by, and far away in the darkness some wandering sea-gull screamed. The horse stumbled in a rut, then swerved aside and broke into a gallop.
vi: Sau đó họ chạy ngang qua các xưởng gạch hiu quạnh. Sương mù ở đây loãng hơn, cậu có thể thấy các lò nung hình-chai kỳ dị với những lưỡi lửa da cam trông như cái quạt. Một con chó sủa vang lúc họ chạy qua, và xa xa, trong bóng tối, con mòng biển vẩn vơ nào đó kêu ré lên. Ngựa vấp trên vết đường mòn, rồi ngoặt qua bên, và đột nhiên phi nước đại.
tr: Derken ıssız tuğla tarlalarının önünden geçmeye başladılar. Burada sis hafiflemişti; Dorian o garip, şişe biçimi ocakları, ocakların içlerindeki yelpaze biçimi turuncu yalazları seçebiliyordu. Bir köpek arabanın ardından havladı, karanlıkların içinde, uzakta bir yerde gezgin bir martı çığırdı. Yoldaki bir çukura giren at tökezleyerek yalpaladı; sonra şaha kalktı.
es: Luego pasaron junto a las solitarias fábricas de ladrillos. La niebla era allí menos densa, y pudo ver los extraños hornos con forma de botella y sus lenguas de fuego anaranjado que se extendían como abanicos. Un perro ladró cuando pasaban y a lo lejos, en la oscuridad, chilló una gaviota vagabunda. El caballo tropezó en un bache del camino, dio un bandazo y empezó a galopar.
vi_translation: Then they ran past the desolate brickworks. The fog here was thinner, and he could see the strange bottle-shaped kilns with orange tongues of flame that looked like fans. A dog barked loudly as they ran past, and far away, in the darkness, some wandering seagull screeched. The horse stumbled on the trail, then turned aside, and suddenly broke into a gallop.
tr_translation: Then they began to pass by desolate brick fields. Here the mist had lightened; Dorian could make out those strange, bottle-shaped kilns, and the fan-shaped orange flames inside them. A dog barked after the carriage, and somewhere far off in the darkness, a wandering seagull cried. The horse stumbled and lurched as it stepped into a pothole in the road; then it reared up.
es_translation: Then they passed by the solitary brick factories. The fog was less dense there, and he could see the strange bottle-shaped kilns and their tongues of orange fire that spread out like fans. A dog barked as they passed, and in the distance, in the darkness, a stray seagull screeched. The horse stumbled in a pothole in the road, swerved, and began to gallop.

en: After some time they left the clay road and rattled again over rough-paven streets. Most of the windows were dark, but now and then fantastic shadows were silhouetted against some lamplit blind. He watched them curiously. They moved like monstrous marionettes and made gestures like live things. He hated them. A dull rage was in his heart. As they turned a corner, a woman yelled something at them from an open door, and two men ran after the hansom for about a hundred yards. The driver beat at them with his whip.
vi: Một lát sau, họ rời khỏi đường đất, và lại chạy lóc cóc trên các con phố lát gồ ghề. Phần lớn cửa sổ tối om, nhưng thỉnh thoảng có những cái bóng kỳ dị in hình lên tấm rèm sáng đèn nào đó. Cậu tò mò quan sát chúng. Chúng chuyển động như các con rối khổng lồ, làm điệu bộ y như những vật sống. Cậu ghét chúng. Một cơn giận âm ỉ trong tim cậu. Lúc họ rẽ qua một góc phố, một người đàn bà la hét gì đó với họ từ một ô cửa mở, và hai người đàn ông chạy theo cỗ xe độ trăm thước mới thôi. Xà ích quất họ bằng roi da.
tr: Bir süre sonra balçık yoldan ayrılıp yamru yumru parke döşeli sokaklardan tangır tungur geçtiler. Buralardaki pencerelerin çoğu karanlıktı, gene de arada bir, lambayla aydınlanmış bir perdeye acayip gölgeler vuruyor ve Dorian bunlara merakla bakıyordu. Gölgeler dev kuklalar gibi oynaşıyor, canlı birer yaratıkmışçasına el kol sallıyorlardı. Dorian nefret ediyordu onlardan. Yüreğini donuk bir hınç bürüyordu. Bir köşeyi dönerlerken açık bir kapı aralığından bir kadın onlara bağırarak bir şeyler söyledi; iki adam yüz adım kadar arabanın ardından koştular. Arabacı onlara kırbacıyla vurdu.
es: Después de algún tiempo dejaron el camino de tierra y volvieron a traquetear por calles mal pavimentadas. La mayoría de las ventanas estaba a oscuras pero, a veces, sombras fantásticas se dibujaban sobre los estores iluminados por alguna lámpara. Dorian Gray las contemplaba con curiosidad. Se movían como marionetas monstruosas y hacían gestos de criaturas vivas. Sintió que las aborrecía. Tenía el corazón dominado por una rabia sorda. Al torcer una esquina, una mujer les gritó algo desde una puerta abierta, y dos hombres corrieron tras el coche de punto por espacio de unos cien metros. El cochero los golpeó con el látigo.
vi_translation: A moment later, they left the dirt road and started clattering along the rough cobbled streets again. Most of the windows were dark, but occasionally strange shadows were cast on the lit curtains. He curiously observed them. They moved like giant puppets, gesturing as if they were alive. He hated them. A smoldering anger burned in his heart. As they turned a corner, a woman shouted something at them from an open window, and two men chased the carriage for about a hundred yards before giving up. The coachman whipped them with a leather strap.
tr_translation: After a while, they left the muddy road and clattered through the bumpy cobblestone streets. Most of the windows around here were dark, yet occasionally, strange shadows were cast on a curtain lit by a lamp, and Dorian watched them with curiosity. The shadows moved like giant puppets, waving their arms as if they were living creatures. Dorian hated them. A dull resentment filled his heart. As they turned a corner, a woman shouted something at them from the gap of an open door; two men ran after the carriage for about a hundred steps. The coachman struck them with his whip.
es_translation: After some time, they left the dirt road and began to rattle along poorly paved streets again. Most of the windows were dark, but occasionally, fantastic shadows were cast on the blinds illuminated by some lamp. Dorian Gray watched them with curiosity. They moved like monstrous puppets and made gestures like living creatures. He felt that he loathed them. His heart was dominated by a dull rage. As they turned a corner, a woman shouted something at them from an open door, and two men ran after the cab for about a hundred meters. The coachman struck them with his whip.

en: It is said that passion makes one think in a circle. Certainly with hideous iteration the bitten lips of Dorian Gray shaped and reshaped those subtle words that dealt with soul and sense, till he had found in them the full expression, as it were, of his mood, and justified, by intellectual approval, passions that without such justification would still have dominated his temper. From cell to cell of his brain crept the one thought; and the wild desire to live, most terrible of all man’s appetites, quickened into force each trembling nerve and fibre. Ugliness that had once been hateful to him because it made things real, became dear to him now for that very reason. Ugliness was the one reality. The coarse brawl, the loathsome den, the crude violence of disordered life, the very vileness of thief and outcast, were more vivid, in their intense actuality of impression, than all the gracious shapes of art, the dreamy shadows of song. They were what he needed for forgetfulness. In three days he would be free.
vi: Nghe đồn là sự đam mê làm cho con người nghĩ ngợi loanh quanh. Đúng là với sự lặp đi lặp lại chán ngắt, đôi môi mím chặt của Dorian Gray cứ nhào đi nặn lại những lời quỷ quyệt bàn về linh hồn và cảm xúc ấy, cho đến khi cậu thấy trong nó toàn bộ biểu hiện, có thể nói là, của tâm trạng cậu, và biện hộ được, bằng sự chấp thuận của trí thông minh, cho những đam mê mà nếu không có sự biện hộ như vậy thì sẽ vẫn còn chi phối tâm trạng cậu. Từ tế bào não này qua tế bào não khác, một ý nghĩ lẻn qua; và nỗi khát khao dữ dội với sự sống, nỗi khát khao ghê gớm nhất trong số mọi ham muốn của con người, đã hồi sinh mạnh mẽ từng sợi thần kinh và mỗi thớ thịt run rẩy. Sự xấu xí mà có lần cậu thấy đáng ghét vì nó làm cho các thứ trở về thực tế thì lúc này lại trở nên thân thương với cậu cũng vì chính lý do đó. Sự xấu xí là thực tại độc nhất. Tiếng cãi cọ tục tĩu, cái ổ ghê tởm, bạo lực thô thiển của cuộc sống bừa bãi, và chính sự hèn hạ của bọn trộm cắp bụi đời, lại còn sinh động, nhờ ấn tượng hiện thực mãnh liệt của chúng, hơn mọi loại hình Nghệ thuật tử tế, những cái bóng mơ màng của Thơ ca. Chúng là những gì cậu cần để lãng quên. Cậu sẽ tự do trong ba ngày.
tr: Derler ki tutku kişinin düşüncelerini çember gibi çevirip gene başladığı noktaya getirirmiş. Gerçekten de Dorian kemirip durduğu dudaklarıyla, ruh ve duyu konusundaki o anlamlı sözleri iğrenç bir zikir gibi yineleyip duruyordu. Öyle ki en sonunda bu sözlerde ruhsal durumunun tam açıklamasını bulmaya başladı ve böylece tutkularını zihninin onayıyla haklı çıkardı. Ama bu onay olmasa da bu tutkular onun benliğinden ellerini çekmeyeceklerdi, nasılsa. Bu bir tek düşünce, onun beynindeki bir hücreden ötekine süzülüyor ve çılgın yaşama arzusu, insanoğlunun bu en ürkünç iştahı, titreyen sinir ve liflerinin her birine özsuyu gibi yürüyerek güç veriyordu. Bir zamanlar, her şeye gerçeklik kattığı için nefret ettiği çirkinliği şimdi aynı nedenle kendine yakın buluyordu. Tek gerçek çirkinlikti. Adi kavgalar, iğrenç izbeler, başıboş yaşantıların haşin şiddeti, hırsızların, itin, uğursuzun pespayeliği, çirkinliğin ürünleri, yarattıkları izlenimlerin elle tutulur yoğunluğu yüzünden sanatın girdiği bütün güzel biçimlerden, şarkının söylediği bütün düşsel gölgelerden daha canlı, daha belirgindi. Dorian’ın unutabilmek için gereksindiği şeyler işte bunlardı. Üç gün içinde özgürlüğüne kavuşacaktı.
es: Se dice que la pasión hace que se piense en círculos. Y, ciertamente, los labios que Dorian Gray no cesaba de morderse formaban y volvían a formar, en espantosa repetición, las sutiles palabras que se ocupaban del alma y de los sentidos, hasta encontrar en ellas la plena expresión, por así decirlo, de su estado de ánimo, y justificar así, aprobándolas intelectualmente, pasiones que sin esa justificación habrían dominado su voluntad. De célula en célula aquella idea única se apoderaba de su cerebro; y el arrebatado deseo de vivir, el más terrible de los apetitos humanos, redoblaba el vigor de cada nervio y músculo temblorosos. La fealdad que en otro tiempo le había parecido odiosa porque hacía las cosas reales, le resultaba ahora amable por esa misma razón. La fealdad era la única realidad. La trifulca vulgar, el antro repugnante, la violencia brutal de una vida desordenada, la vileza misma del ladrón y del fuera de la ley, tenían más vida, creaban una impresión de realidad más intensa que todas las elegantes formas del Arte, que las sombras soñadoras de la Canción. Eran lo que necesitaba para alcanzar el olvido. En el espacio de tres días quedaría libre.
vi_translation: It is rumored that passion makes people think in circles. Indeed, with the monotonous repetition, Dorian Gray's tightly pressed lips kept molding and reshaping those wicked words about the soul and emotions, until he saw in them the full expression, so to speak, of his mood, and justified, with the approval of intelligence, the passions that without such justification would still dominate his mood. From one brain cell to another, a thought sneaked through; and the intense craving for life, the most terrible of all human desires, revived powerfully every nerve and each trembling muscle fiber. The ugliness that he once found repulsive because it brought things back to reality now became dear to him for that very reason. Ugliness was the only reality. The obscene quarrels, the disgusting den, the crude violence of a disordered life, and even the baseness of the street thieves, were more vivid, thanks to their intense impression of reality, than any form of decent Art, the dreamy shadows of Poetry. They were what he needed to forget. He would be free in three days.
tr_translation: They say that passion circles a person's thoughts like a ring and brings them back to where they started. Indeed, Dorian, with his gnawed lips, kept repeating those meaningful words about soul and sense like a disgusting chant. So much so that in the end, he began to find a complete explanation of his spiritual state in these words and thus justified his passions with the approval of his mind. But even without this approval, these passions would not withdraw their hands from his being, anyway. This single thought was seeping from one cell in his brain to another, and the mad desire to live, this most dreadful appetite of mankind, was giving strength to every trembling nerve and fiber like sap. Once, he hated ugliness because it added reality to everything, but now he found it close to himself for the same reason. The only reality was ugliness. Vulgar brawls, disgusting slums, the harsh violence of vagrant lives, the baseness of thieves, dogs, and scoundrels, the products of ugliness, were more vivid and distinct than all the beautiful forms that art entered, and all the imaginary shadows that song sang, because of the tangible intensity of the impressions they created. These were the things Dorian needed to forget. In three days, he would be free.
es_translation: It is said that passion makes one think in circles. And, certainly, the lips that Dorian Gray kept biting formed and reformed, in a dreadful repetition, the subtle words that dealt with the soul and the senses, until he found in them the full expression, so to speak, of his state of mind, and thus justified, by intellectually approving them, passions that without that justification would have dominated his will. From cell to cell that single idea took hold of his brain; and the frantic desire to live, the most terrible of human appetites, redoubled the vigor of every trembling nerve and muscle. The ugliness that had once seemed odious to him because it made things real, now seemed kind to him for that very reason. Ugliness was the only reality. The vulgar brawl, the repugnant den, the brutal violence of a disordered life, the very vileness of the thief and the outlaw, had more life, created a more intense impression of reality than all the elegant forms of Art, than the dreamy shadows of Song. They were what he needed to achieve oblivion. In the span of three days, he would be free.

en: Suddenly the man drew up with a jerk at the top of a dark lane. Over the low roofs and jagged chimney-stacks of the houses rose the black masts of ships. Wreaths of white mist clung like ghostly sails to the yards.
vi: Đột nhiên người đó dừng xe lại với một cú giật mạnh thình lình trên đầu một ngõ tối. Trên các nóc thấp lè tè và các cụm ống khói lởm chởm của những ngôi nhà, mọc lên các cột buồm đen của những con tàu. Các đám sương trắng cuồn cuộn bám như những cánh buồm ma vào các trục căng buồm.
tr: Karanlık bir toprak yolun başında arabacı birden dizginleri çekerek durdu. Buradaki evlerin alçak damlarının, çentikli baca kümelerinin ardından kara gemi direkleri yükseliyordu. Beyaz sis halkaları avluların, serenlerin üzerinde hayalet yelkenler gibiydi.
es: De repente, el cochero se detuvo con un movimiento brusco al comienzo de una callejuela en sombras. Sobre los bajos tejados, erizados de chimeneas, se alzaban las negras arboladuras de los barcos. Espirales de niebla blanca se aferraban a las vergas como velas fantasmales.
vi_translation: Suddenly, the person stopped the vehicle with a sudden, strong jerk at the head of a dark alley. On the low, squat roofs and the jagged clusters of chimneys of the houses, the black masts of ships rose up. Billowing white fog clung to the taut masts like ghostly sails.
tr_translation: At the beginning of a dark dirt road, the coachman suddenly pulled the reins and stopped. Behind the low roofs of the houses here, and the jagged clusters of chimneys, black ship masts were rising. White rings of mist over the courtyards and spars were like ghostly sails.
es_translation: Suddenly, the coachman stopped abruptly at the beginning of a shadowy alley. Above the low rooftops, bristling with chimneys, the black masts of the ships rose. Spirals of white mist clung to the yards like ghostly sails.

en: “Somewhere about here, sir, ain’t it?” he asked huskily through the trap.
vi: “Đâu đó quanh đây phỏng ạ, thưa ngài?” hắn hỏi khản đặc qua ô cửa sập.
tr: Arabacı kapağın ardından boğuk sesle, “Buralarda bir yerde, değil mi, efendim?” diye sordu.
es: —Está en algún sitio por estos alrededores, ¿no es cierto, señor? —preguntó el cochero con voz ronca a través de la trampilla.
vi_translation: "Somewhere around here, perhaps, sir?" he asked hoarsely through the trapdoor.
tr_translation: The coachman asked in a muffled voice from behind the cover, "Somewhere around here, right, sir?"
es_translation: —It's somewhere around here, isn't it, sir? —asked the coachman in a hoarse voice through the hatch.

en: Dorian started and peered round. “This will do,” he answered, and having got out hastily and given the driver the extra fare he had promised him, he walked quickly in the direction of the quay. Here and there a lantern gleamed at the stern of some huge merchantman. The light shook and splintered in the puddles. A red glare came from an outward-bound steamer that was coaling. The slimy pavement looked like a wet mackintosh.
vi: Dorian giật mình, ngó quanh. “Thôi được rồi,” cậu trả lời, và, sau khi vội vã chui ra, đưa cho xà ích số tiền thưởng thêm mà cậu đã hứa với hắn, cậu rảo bước theo hướng bến cảng. Đó đây, đèn lồng lập lòe ở đuôi một tàu buôn khổng lồ nào đó. Ánh sáng rung rinh và vỡ vụn trong các vũng nước. Một ánh đỏ chói hắt đến từ một tàu hơi nước viễn dương đang ăn than. Vỉa hè nhầy nhụa trông như áo mưa ướt.
tr: Dorian irkilerek çevresine bakındı. “Burası iyi,” diyerek çarçabuk indi, arabacıya vaat ettiği ücreti ödedi, sonra hızlı adımlarla rıhtıma doğru yürüdü. Ötede beride, kocaman bir yük gemisinin kıçındaki bir fener parlıyordu. Parıltı sallandıkça su birikintileri de bin bir parçaya bölünüyordu. Denize açılmaya hazırlık olarak kömür ikmali yapan bir buharlı gemiden kıpkızıl bir aydınlık vurmuştu. Sıvışık kaldırım ıslak bir yağmurluğu andırıyordu.
es: Dorian, sobresaltado, miró a su alrededor. —Déjeme aquí —respondió y, después de apearse precipitadamente y de entregar el dinero prometido, se alejó a toda prisa en dirección al muelle. Aquí y allá una linterna brillaba en la proa de algún gigantesco barco mercante. La luz temblaba y se descomponía en los charcos. De un vapor a punto de partir que avivaba el fuego para aumentar la presión de la caldera salía un resplandor rojo. El suelo resbaladizo parecía un impermeable húmedo.
vi_translation: Dorian started, looking around. “Alright then,” he replied, and, after hastily getting out, handed the coachman the extra tip he had promised him, and walked briskly towards the harbor. Here and there, lanterns flickered at the stern of some gigantic merchant ship. The light shimmered and shattered in the puddles. A glaring red light was cast from an ocean-going steamship taking on coal. The slimy pavement looked like a wet raincoat.
tr_translation: Dorian shuddered and looked around. “This is good,” he said, quickly getting out, paid the promised fare to the driver, and then walked briskly towards the pier. Here and there, a lantern on the stern of a large cargo ship was shining. As the light flickered, the puddles were breaking into a thousand pieces. A crimson light was cast from a steamship taking on coal in preparation for setting sail. The slippery pavement resembled a wet raincoat.
es_translation: Dorian, startled, looked around. —Leave me here —he replied and, after dismounting hastily and handing over the promised money, he hurried away towards the dock. Here and there a lantern shone on the bow of some gigantic merchant ship. The light trembled and broke up in the puddles. From a steamer about to depart, which was stoking the fire to increase boiler pressure, a red glow emerged. The slippery ground looked like a wet raincoat.

en: He hurried on towards the left, glancing back now and then to see if he was being followed. In about seven or eight minutes he reached a small shabby house that was wedged in between two gaunt factories. In one of the top-windows stood a lamp. He stopped and gave a peculiar knock.
vi: Cậu hấp tấp đi tiếp về phía trái, thỉnh thoảng ngoái lại nhìn xem mình có bị bám theo không. Sau độ bảy hay tám phút, cậu đến một căn nhà nhỏ tồi tàn, nằm chêm vào giữa hai nhà máy hoang vắng. Trong một ô cửa sổ trên cao có để cây đèn. Cậu dừng lại, gõ một tiếng gõ riêng.
tr: Dorian hızlı adımlarla sola saptı. Arada, peşine takılan olup olmadığını görmek için arkasına bakıyordu. Yedi sekiz dakikada, iki ulu fabrikanın arasına sıkışmış duran, küçük, yoksul görünümlü bir eve ulaştı. Evin üst kat pencerelerinin birinde bir lamba vardı. Dorian durdu, özel bir parolayla kapıya vurdu.
es: Dorian Gray apresuró el paso hacia la izquierda, volviendo la cabeza de cuando en cuando para comprobar si alguien lo seguía. Siete u ocho minutos después llegó a una casita destartalada, encajonada entre dos lúgubres fábricas. En una de las ventanas del piso superior brillaba una luz. Se detuvo ante la puerta y llamó de una manera peculiar.
vi_translation: You hurriedly continued to the left, occasionally glancing back to see if you were being followed. After about seven or eight minutes, you arrived at a small, dilapidated house, wedged between two abandoned factories. In a high window, there was a lamp. You stopped and knocked a distinctive knock.
tr_translation: Dorian turned left with quick steps. Occasionally, he looked back to see if anyone was following him. In seven or eight minutes, he reached a small, poor-looking house squeezed between two large factories. There was a lamp in one of the upper floor windows of the house. Dorian stopped and knocked on the door with a special password.
es_translation: Dorian Gray hurried to the left, turning his head from time to time to check if someone was following him. Seven or eight minutes later, he arrived at a dilapidated little house, wedged between two gloomy factories. A light was shining in one of the upstairs windows. He stopped at the door and knocked in a peculiar manner.
