en: After a little time he heard steps in the passage and the chain being unhooked. The door opened quietly, and he went in without saying a word to the squat misshapen figure that flattened itself into the shadow as he passed. At the end of the hall hung a tattered green curtain that swayed and shook in the gusty wind which had followed him in from the street. He dragged it aside and entered a long low room which looked as if it had once been a third-rate dancing-saloon. Shrill flaring gas-jets, dulled and distorted in the fly-blown mirrors that faced them, were ranged round the walls. Greasy reflectors of ribbed tin backed them, making quivering disks of light. The floor was covered with ochre-coloured sawdust, trampled here and there into mud, and stained with dark rings of spilled liquor. Some Malays were crouching by a little charcoal stove, playing with bone counters and showing their white teeth as they chattered. In one corner, with his head buried in his arms, a sailor sprawled over a table, and by the tawdrily painted bar that ran across one complete side stood two haggard women, mocking an old man who was brushing the sleeves of his coat with an expression of disgust. “He thinks he’s got red ants on him,” laughed one of them, as Dorian passed by. The man looked at her in terror and began to whimper.
vi: Một lát sau cậu nghe tiếng bước chân trong hành lang, và sợi xích được tháo móc. Cửa mở êm ru, cậu bước vào mà không cần nói lời nào với cái hình dáng dị dạng mập lùn đã tự dát mỏng mình thành chiếc bóng khi cậu đi qua. Ở cuối sảnh có treo tấm rèm xanh lục tả tơi đang lắc lư run rẩy theo làn gió lốc bám theo cậu vào từ ngoài phố. Cậu kéo nó qua bên, bước vào căn phòng dài, thấp, nhìn như thể từng là tiệm nhảy hạng ba. Những cây đèn khí ga sáng chói, rú rít điếc tai, bị mờ đi và vặn vẹo đi trong những tấm gương đầy-trứng-ruồi đối diện chúng, được sắp thành hàng quanh tường. Các tấm phản quang dính mỡ bằng thiếc nổi gân đằng sau chúng, hắt ra các đĩa sáng run rẩy. Sàn phủ đầy mùn cưa màu đất son, bị giẫm lên đây đó thành bùn, vấy bẩn các vòng tròn sẫm màu từ rượu mạnh bị làm đổ. Vài người Mã Lai khom mình bên một cái lò than nhỏ để chơi với những thẻ xương, để lộ những bộ răng trắng khi nói huyên thuyên. Trong một góc, vùi đầu trong cánh tay, một thủy thủ nằm ườn qua bàn, và bên cái quầy rượu sơn phết lòe loẹt chạy hết một bên tường, hai phụ nữ hốc hác đứng trêu ghẹo một ông già đang phủi tay áo khoác với vẻ mặt kinh tởm. “Ông ấy nghĩ là ông ấy bị kiến đỏ bu,” một cô cười, lúc Dorian đi ngang qua. Người đàn ông sợ hãi nhìn cô ta và bắt đầu thút thít.
tr: Biraz sonra koridorda ayak seslerinin yürüdüğünü, zincirin çengelden çıkartıldığını işitti. Kapı usulca açıldı. Dorian, o geçerken gölgelerin arasına gerileyip büzüşen bodur, yamuk karaltıya tek söz söylemeden içeri girdi. Koridorun ucundaki ipil ipil yeşil perde, Dorian’ın peşinden içeri girmiş olan rüzgârın sert esintisiyle dalgalanıp sarsılıyordu. Dorian perdeyi bir yana iterek, eskiden üçüncü sınıf bir dans salonu olarak kullanılırmışa benzeyen basık tavanlı, uzun bir odaya girdi. Duvarlarda sesli sesli yalazlanan gaz lambalarının aydınlığı önlerindeki sinek pislikli aynalara körelip çarpılarak vuruyordu. Lambaların arkalarındaki yağlı, oluklu teneke yansıtıcılar titrek ışıktan birer daire oluşturuyorlardı. Yerler, yer yer çiğnenip çamurlaşmış, dökülen içkilerle halka halka simsiyah lekelenmiş sarı talaş tozuyla kaplıydı. Küçük bir kömür sobasının başında çömelmiş oturan birkaç Malayalı kemik fişlerle oynuyor, çene çaldıkça bembeyaz dişleri görünüyordu. Bir köşede, başı kollarının arasında olarak bir masaya abanıp kalmış bir gemici vardı. Bütün bir duvarı baştan başa kaplayan çiy boyalı barın önünde iki kılıksız, sıska kadın, ihtiyar bir adamı alaya almışlardı. Adam yüzünde bir tiksinti ifadesiyle ceketinin manşetlerini silkeleyip duruyordu. Dorian yanlarından geçerken kadınlardan biri, “Üstünde kırmızı karıncalar var sanıyor,” diyerek güldü. Adamcağız dehşet içinde ona bakarak içini çekip hıçkırdı.
es: Al cabo de algún tiempo oyó pasos en el corredor y luego el deslizarse de un cerrojo. La puerta se abrió sin ruido y Dorian Gray entró sin decir una sola palabra a la deforme criatura rechoncha que se aplastó contra la pared en sombra para darle paso. Al final del vestíbulo colgaba una andrajosa cortina verde, agitada y estremecida por el golpe de viento que siguió a Dorian Gray desde la calle. Apartándola, penetró en una habitación alargada y de techo bajo que daba la impresión de haber sido en otro tiempo una sala de baile de tercera categoría. Sobre las paredes ardían, sibilantes, mecheros de gas, cuya imagen, apagada y deforme, reproducían otros tantos espejos, negros de manchas de moscas. Los reflectores grasientos de estaño ondulado, colocados detrás, los convertían en temblorosos discos de luz. El suelo estaba cubierto de serrín ocre, que, a fuerza de pisarlo, se había transformado en barro, manchado, además, por oscuros redondeles de bebidas derramadas. Algunos malayos, acurrucados junto a una pequeña estufa de carbón de leña, jugaban con fichas de hueso y enseñaban unos dientes muy blancos al hablar. En un rincón, la cabeza escondida entre los brazos, un marinero se había derrumbado sobre una mesa, y junto al bar chillonamente pintado, que ocupaba uno de los laterales de la habitación, dos mujeres ojerosas se burlaban de un anciano que se sacudía las mangas de la chaqueta con expresión de repugnancia. —Cree que le atacan hormigas rojas —rió una de ellas cuando Dorian Gray pasó a su lado. El anciano la miró aterrorizado y empezó a gemir.
vi_translation: A moment later, he heard footsteps in the hallway, and the chain being unhooked. The door opened silently, and he stepped in without saying a word to the short, fat, deformed figure that had flattened itself into a shadow as he passed by. At the end of the hall hung a tattered green curtain, trembling and swaying in the gust of wind that had followed him in from the street. He pulled it aside and stepped into a long, low room that looked as if it had once been a third-rate dance hall. The gas lamps blazed brightly, hissing deafeningly, blurred and distorted in the fly-specked mirrors facing them, arranged in rows around the walls. The tin reflectors behind them, greasy and embossed, cast out trembling discs of light. The floor was covered in ochre-colored sawdust, trampled here and there into mud, stained with dark rings from spilled spirits. A few Malays crouched by a small charcoal stove, playing with bone tiles, revealing white teeth as they chattered. In one corner, with his head buried in his arms, a sailor sprawled across a table, and by the garishly painted bar running along one wall, two haggard women stood teasing an old man who was brushing off his coat with a look of disgust. “He thinks he's got red ants on him,” one of the women laughed, as Dorian walked past. The man looked at her in terror and began to whimper.
tr_translation: After a while, he heard footsteps walking in the corridor and the chain being unhooked. The door opened quietly. Dorian entered without saying a word to the short, crooked shadow that shrank back into the shadows as he passed. The green curtain at the end of the corridor was fluttering and shaking with the strong gust of wind that had followed Dorian inside. Dorian pushed the curtain aside and entered a low-ceilinged, long room that seemed to have once been used as a third-class dance hall. The light from the gas lamps flickering loudly on the walls was hitting the fly-specked mirrors in front of them, dimming and distorting. The oily, corrugated tin reflectors behind the lamps were forming circles of flickering light. The floors were covered with yellow sawdust, trampled and muddied in places, stained black in rings by spilled drinks. A few Malays squatting by a small coal stove were playing with bone chips, their white teeth showing as they chatted. In one corner, a sailor had collapsed onto a table, his head resting on his arms. In front of the dew-painted bar that covered an entire wall, two shabby, skinny women were mocking an old man. The man was shaking the cuffs of his jacket with an expression of disgust on his face. As Dorian passed by, one of the women laughed and said, "He thinks there are red ants on him." The poor man looked at her in horror, sighed, and sobbed.
es_translation: After some time, he heard footsteps in the corridor and then the sliding of a bolt. The door opened silently and Dorian Gray entered without saying a single word to the deformed, chubby creature that pressed itself against the shadowy wall to let him pass. At the end of the hallway hung a tattered green curtain, swaying and trembling from the gust of wind that followed Dorian Gray from the street. Pulling it aside, he entered a long, low-ceilinged room that gave the impression of having once been a third-rate ballroom. On the walls, gas burners hissed and burned, their dim and deformed images reflected in numerous mirrors, blackened with fly specks. The greasy, wavy tin reflectors placed behind them turned them into trembling discs of light. The floor was covered with ochre sawdust, which, from being trodden on, had turned into mud, further stained by dark rings of spilled drinks. Some Malays, crouched by a small charcoal stove, played with bone chips and showed very white teeth as they spoke. In a corner, with his head hidden in his arms, a sailor had collapsed over a table, and next to the garishly painted bar that occupied one side of the room, two haggard women mocked an old man who was shaking the sleeves of his jacket with an expression of disgust. —He thinks he's being attacked by red ants —laughed one of them as Dorian Gray walked past. The old man looked at her terrified and began to moan.

en: At the end of the room there was a little staircase, leading to a darkened chamber. As Dorian hurried up its three rickety steps, the heavy odour of opium met him. He heaved a deep breath, and his nostrils quivered with pleasure. When he entered, a young man with smooth yellow hair, who was bending over a lamp lighting a long thin pipe, looked up at him and nodded in a hesitating manner.
vi: Ở cuối phòng có một cầu thang nhỏ, dẫn lên một căn buồng tối sầm. Lúc Dorian vội vã leo lên ba bậc thang ọp ẹp, mùi thuốc phiện nồng nặc đón cậu. Cậu hít một hơi thật sâu, mũi cậu run rẩy vì sướng. Khi cậu vào rồi, một thanh niên tóc vàng mượt, đang khom lưng trên một cái đèn và châm cái tẩu dài nhỏ, nhìn cậu, gật đầu chào với thái độ do dự.
tr: Odanın dibindeki alçak bir merdiven karanlık bir bölmeye çıkıyordu. Dorian merdivenin sallantılı üç basamağını koşarak çıkarken afyonun ağır kokusu onu karşıladı. Dorian derin derin soludu, burun delikleri hazla titreşiyordu. O içeri girdiği zaman, bir lambanın üzerine eğilmiş elindeki ince uzun çubuğu yakmakta olan düz, sarı saçlı bir genç adam başını kaldırıp ona baktı, sonra, biraz kararsızlıkla selam verdi.
es: Al fondo de la habitación, una escalerita conducía a una habitación oscura. Mientras Dorian se apresuraba a ascender los tres desvencijados escalones, el denso olor del opio le asaltó. Respiró hondo y las aletas de la nariz se le estremecieron de placer. Al entrar, un joven de lisos cabellos rubios que, inclinado sobre una lámpara, encendía una larga pipa muy fina, miró en su dirección y le saludó, titubeante, con una inclinación de cabeza.
vi_translation: At the end of the room, there was a small staircase leading up to a darkened chamber. As Dorian hurriedly climbed the three creaky steps, the strong smell of opium greeted him. He took a deep breath, his nose trembling with pleasure. When he entered, a young man with sleek blonde hair, bent over a lamp and lighting a small long pipe, looked at him and nodded in greeting with a hesitant attitude.
tr_translation: A low staircase at the back of the room led to a dark compartment. As Dorian ran up the shaky three steps of the staircase, the heavy scent of opium greeted him. Dorian took a deep breath, his nostrils quivering with pleasure. When he entered, a young man with straight, blond hair, who was leaning over a lamp lighting a long, thin pipe in his hand, looked up at him and then greeted him with a bit of hesitation.
es_translation: At the back of the room, a small staircase led to a dark room. As Dorian hurried to ascend the three rickety steps, the dense smell of opium assaulted him. He took a deep breath, and his nostrils quivered with pleasure. Upon entering, a young man with smooth blond hair, who was leaning over a lamp lighting a long, very thin pipe, looked in his direction and greeted him hesitantly with a nod.

en: “You here, Adrian?” muttered Dorian.
vi: “Cậu đấy hả, Adrian?” Dorian lẩm bẩm.
tr: Dorian, “Buradasın ha, Adrian?” diye söylendi.
es: —¿Tú aquí, Adrian? —murmuró Dorian.
vi_translation: "Is that you, Adrian?" Dorian muttered.
tr_translation: Dorian muttered, "So, you're here, Adrian?"
es_translation: —You here, Adrian? —murmured Dorian.

en: “Where else should I be?” he answered, listlessly. “None of the chaps will speak to me now.”
vi: “Tôi còn ở đâu khác được?” y trả lời, lờ phờ. “Giờ đây chẳng còn thằng cha nào chịu nói chuyện với tôi nữa.”
tr: Öteki durgun bir sesle, “Ya başka nerede olayım?” diye yanıtladı. “Bizim çocukların hiçbiri benimle konuşmuyor ki artık.
es: —¿Dónde quieres que esté? —respondió el otro apáticamente—. Todos mis amigos me han retirado el saludo.
vi_translation: "Where else could I be?" he replied, listlessly. "Now no one is willing to talk to me anymore."
tr_translation: The other replied in a calm voice, "Where else would I be?" "None of our children talk to me anymore."
es_translation: —Where do you want me to be? —the other responded apathetically—. All my friends have stopped greeting me.

en: “I thought you had left England.”
vi: “Tôi tưởng cậu đã rời Anh.”
tr: “Ben senin İngiltere’den ayrıldığını sanıyordum.
es: —Creía que habías dejado Inglaterra.
vi_translation: “I thought you had left England.”
tr_translation: “I thought you had left England.”
es_translation: —I thought you had left England.

en: “Darlington is not going to do anything. My brother paid the bill at last. George doesn’t speak to me either.... I don’t care,” he added with a sigh. “As long as one has this stuff, one doesn’t want friends. I think I have had too many friends.”
vi: “Darlington chẳng chịu làm gì cả. Cuối cùng anh tôi trả hóa đơn. George cũng chẳng nói chuyện với tôi… Tôi không quan tâm,” y nói thêm, với tiếng thở dài. “Miễn còn cái món này thì cũng chẳng cần bạn. Tôi nghĩ tôi đã có quá nhiều bạn.”
tr: “Darlington’un hiçbir şey yapacağı yok. Ağabeyim sonunda hesabı ödedi. George da konuşmuyor benimle...” Sonra genç adam bir göğüs geçirerek, “Umurumda değil,” diye ekledi. “Bu insanın elinin altında bulunduktan sonra arkadaşa ne gerek var! Zaten fazla arkadaşım vardı, galiba.
es: —Darlington no hará nada contra mí. Mi hermano acabó por pagar la deuda. George tampoco me dirige la palabra... Me tiene sin cuidado —añadió con un suspiro—. Mientras esto no falte no se necesitan amigos. Creo que tenía demasiados.
vi_translation: “Darlington doesn't do anything. In the end, my brother paid the bill. George doesn't talk to me either… I don't care,” he added, with a sigh. “As long as I have this thing, I don't need friends. I think I have too many friends.”
tr_translation: “Darlington is not going to do anything. My brother finally paid the bill. George is not talking to me either...” Then the young man sighed and added, “I don't care,” “Who needs a friend when you have this at your disposal! I had too many friends anyway, I guess.”
es_translation: —Darlington will do nothing against me. My brother ended up paying the debt. George doesn't speak to me either... I don't care —he added with a sigh—. As long as this is not lacking, friends are not needed. I think I had too many.

en: Dorian winced and looked round at the grotesque things that lay in such fantastic postures on the ragged mattresses. The twisted limbs, the gaping mouths, the staring lustreless eyes, fascinated him. He knew in what strange heavens they were suffering, and what dull hells were teaching them the secret of some new joy. They were better off than he was. He was prisoned in thought. Memory, like a horrible malady, was eating his soul away. From time to time he seemed to see the eyes of Basil Hallward looking at him. Yet he felt he could not stay. The presence of Adrian Singleton troubled him. He wanted to be where no one would know who he was. He wanted to escape from himself.
vi: Dorian nhăn mặt, nhìn quanh những thứ kỳ cục đang nằm theo những tư thế rất quái dị trên các tấm nệm rách. Những tay chân xoắn vặn, những miệng há to, những mắt mờ xỉn lồ lộ dương lên, thôi miên cậu. Cậu biết họ đang chịu đựng khổ đau ở những thiên đường lạ nào, và những địa ngục xám xịt nào đang dạy họ bí quyết vui vẻ mới mẻ nào đó. Họ đang hơn cậu. Cậu đang bị cầm tù trong tư tưởng. Ký ức, như căn bệnh khủng khiếp, đang ăn dần linh hồn cậu. Đôi lúc dường như cậu thấy đôi mắt Basil Hallward nhìn cậu. Tuy nhiên cậu cảm thấy cậu không thể ở lại. Sự hiện diện của Adrian Singleton làm phiền cậu. Cậu muốn ở đâu mà không ai biết cậu là ai. Cậu cần trốn khỏi chính mình.
tr: Dorian irkilerek yüzünü buruşturdu; çevresine, eski püskü şiltelerin üzerinde, olmayacak biçimlerde serilip yatmış duran biçimsiz şeylere baktı. Çarpılmış bacaklar, açılmış ağızlar, boş bakan fersiz gözler onu büyülüyordu sanki. Onların hangi garip cennetlerde azap çektiklerini, hangi nursuz cehennemlerin yepyeni zevklerinin gizini öğrendiklerini biliyordu. Onların durumu kendisininkinden iyiydi. Kendisi düşüncelerinin zindanı içindeydi çünkü. Anılar, korkunç bir hastalık gibi ruhunu kemirip bitirmekteydi. Durup durup Basil Hallward’ın ona bakan gözlerini görür gibi oluyordu. Gene de burada kalabileceğini sanmıyordu. Adrian Singleton’un varlığı tedirgin ediyordu onu. Kimsenin kendisini tanımayacağı bir yerde olmak istiyordu. Kendi kendisinden kaçmayı istiyordu.
es: El rostro de Dorian Gray se crispó un instante; luego contempló las grotescas figuras que yacían sobre los mugrientos colchones en extrañas posturas. Los miembros contorsionados, las bocas abiertas, las miradas perdidas y los ojos vidriosos le fascinaban. Sabía en qué extraños paraísos se dedicaban al sufrimiento y qué tristes infiernos les enseñaban el secreto de alguna nueva alegría. Eran más afortunados que él, prisionero de sus pensamientos. La memoria, como una horrible enfermedad, le devoraba el alma. De cuando en cuando le parecía ver los ojos de Basil Hallward que lo miraban. Comprendió, sin embargo, que no podía quedarse allí. La presencia de Adrian Singleton le perturbaba. Quería estar en un lugar donde nadie supiera quién era. Quería huir de sí mismo.
vi_translation: Dorian grimaced, looking around at the bizarre things lying in very strange positions on the torn mattresses. Twisted limbs, wide-open mouths, dull eyes glaring, hypnotizing him. He knew they were enduring suffering in some strange paradises, and some gray hells were teaching them some new secret of joy. They were better off than him. He was imprisoned in thought. Memory, like a terrible disease, was slowly consuming his soul. Sometimes it seemed he saw Basil Hallward's eyes looking at him. However, he felt he could not stay. The presence of Adrian Singleton disturbed him. He wanted to be somewhere where no one knew who he was. He needed to escape from himself.
tr_translation: Dorian winced and grimaced; he looked around at the misshapen things sprawled in impossible positions on the tattered mattresses. Twisted legs, gaping mouths, lifeless eyes staring blankly seemed to mesmerize him. He knew in which strange heavens they suffered, and the secrets of the brand-new pleasures they learned in which lightless hells. Their situation was better than his own. Because he was in the prison of his thoughts. Memories were gnawing at his soul like a terrible disease. He kept seeing the eyes of Basil Hallward looking at him. Yet he didn't think he could stay here. The presence of Adrian Singleton disturbed him. He wanted to be somewhere no one would recognize him. He wanted to escape from himself.
es_translation: Dorian Gray's face twitched for an instant; then he gazed at the grotesque figures lying on the filthy mattresses in strange postures. The contorted limbs, the open mouths, the lost gazes, and the glassy eyes fascinated him. He knew in what strange paradises they indulged in suffering and what sad hells taught them the secret of some new joy. They were more fortunate than he, a prisoner of his thoughts. Memory, like a horrible disease, devoured his soul. From time to time, it seemed to him that he saw Basil Hallward's eyes looking at him. He understood, however, that he could not stay there. The presence of Adrian Singleton disturbed him. He wanted to be in a place where no one knew who he was. He wanted to flee from himself.

en: “I am going on to the other place,” he said after a pause.
vi: “Tôi sẽ đi chỗ khác,” cậu nói, sau một lúc ngập ngừng.
tr: Bir duralamadan sonra, “Ben öbür yere gidiyorum,” dedi.
es: —Me voy al otro sitio —dijo, después de una pausa.
vi_translation: "I will go somewhere else," he said, after a moment of hesitation.
tr_translation: After a pause, he said, "I am going to the other place."
es_translation: —I'm going to the other place —he said, after a pause.

en: “On the wharf?”
vi: “Qua bến tàu à?”
tr: “Rıhtımdakine mi?
es: —¿En el muelle?
vi_translation: “Crossing the dock?”
tr_translation: "The one on the dock?"
es_translation: —At the dock?

en: “Yes.”
tr: “Evet.
es: —Sí.
vi_translation: "Yes."
tr_translation: “Yes.”
es_translation: —Yes.

en: “That mad-cat is sure to be there. They won’t have her in this place now.”
vi: “Con mèo điên ấy chắc chắn sẽ ở đó. Bây giờ họ không cho nó vào chỗ này nữa.”
tr: “O kuduz kedi kesin oradadır. Buraya sokmuyorlar artık.
es: —Esa gata loca estará allí con toda seguridad. Aquí ya no la admiten.
vi_translation: “That crazy cat will definitely be there. Now they don't let it in this place anymore.”
tr_translation: “That rabid cat is definitely there. They don't let it in here anymore.”
es_translation: —That crazy cat will definitely be there. They don't let her in here anymore.

en: Dorian shrugged his shoulders. “I am sick of women who love one. Women who hate one are much more interesting. Besides, the stuff is better.”
vi: Dorian nhún vai. “Tôi phát ốm với những cô đang yêu ai đó rồi. Các cô đang ghét ai đó chính ra lại thú vị hơn nhiều. Vả lại, món ấy cũng hay hơn.”
tr: Dorian omuz silkti. “Bana âşık olan kadınlardan bıktım. İnsana diş bileyen kadınlar daha ilginç oluyor. Hem zaten oranın malı daha iyi.
es: Dorian se encogió de hombros. —Estoy harto de mujeres que me quieren. Las mujeres que odian son mucho más interesantes. Además, la mercancía es allí mejor.
vi_translation: Dorian shrugged. “I’m sick of those girls who are in love with someone. Girls who hate someone are actually much more interesting. Besides, that’s also more fun.”
tr_translation: Dorian shrugged his shoulders. “I'm tired of women who fall in love with me. Women who bear a grudge are more interesting. Besides, the goods there are better.”
es_translation: Dorian shrugged. —I am fed up with women who love me. Women who hate are much more interesting. Besides, the merchandise is better there.

en: “Much the same.”
vi: “Như nhau cả.
tr: “Al birini vur ötekine.
es: —Más o menos la misma cosa.
vi_translation: “The same.”
tr_translation: "Hit one with the other."
es_translation: —More or less the same thing.

en: “I like it better. Come and have something to drink. I must have something.”
vi: “Tôi thích nó hơn. Đi uống gì đi. Tôi phải uống gì đó.”
tr: “Oradaki benim daha çok hoşuma gidiyor. Gel de bir şeyler iç. Ben içmek ihtiyacındayım.
es: —Yo la prefiero. Ven a beber algo. Necesito una copa.
vi_translation: “I like it more.” “Let's go get a drink.” “I need to drink something.”
tr_translation: "I like the one over there more." "Come and have a drink." "I need to drink.""
es_translation: —I prefer her. Come have a drink. I need a drink.

en: “I don’t want anything,” murmured the young man.
vi: “Tôi chẳng muốn gì,” thanh niên lẩm bẩm. “Kệ đi.”
tr: Genç adam, “Ben bir şey istemiyorum,” diye söylendi.
es: —No quiero nada —murmuró el joven.
vi_translation: “I don't want anything,” the young man muttered.
tr_translation: The young man muttered, "I don't want anything."
es_translation: —I don't want anything —murmured the young man.

en: Adrian Singleton rose up wearily and followed Dorian to the bar. A half-caste, in a ragged turban and a shabby ulster, grinned a hideous greeting as he thrust a bottle of brandy and two tumblers in front of them. The women sidled up and began to chatter. Dorian turned his back on them and said something in a low voice to Adrian Singleton.
vi: Adrian Singleton uể oải đứng dậy, bám theo Dorian ra quầy rượu. Một người lai Ấn, vấn khăn xếp rách và bận áo un-xtơ sờn, nhe răng chào phát gớm lúc y đẩy một chai bran-đi và hai cái ly ra trước mặt họ. Những người đàn bà rụt rè lại gần, và bắt đầu nói luôn mồm. Dorian quay lưng lại với họ, nhỏ giọng nói gì đó với Adrian Singleton.
tr: Adrian Singleton bitkin bir tavırla yerinden kalkarak Dorian’ın peşi sıra bara yürüdü. Partal türbanlı, yıpranmış paltolu bir melez pis bir sırıtışla onları selamlayarak önlerine bir şişe brendiyle iki bardak sürdü. Kadınlar yanaşarak çene çalmaya giriştiler. Dorian onlara sırtını döndü, Adrian Singleton’a alçak sesle bir şeyler söyledi.
es: Adrian Singleton se levantó con aire cansado y siguió a Dorian Gray hasta el bar. Un mulato, con un turbante hecho jirones y un largo abrigo mugriento, les obsequió con una mueca espantosa a manera de saludo mientras colocaba ante ellos una botella de brandy y dos vasos. Las mujeres se acercaron y empezaron a parlotear. Dorian les volvió la espalda y dijo algo en voz baja a su acompañante.
vi_translation: Adrian Singleton lazily stood up, following Dorian to the bar. A half-Indian man, wearing a torn turban and a worn ulster coat, grinned grotesquely as he pushed a bottle of brandy and two glasses in front of them. The women timidly approached and began to chatter incessantly. Dorian turned his back to them, whispering something to Adrian Singleton.
tr_translation: Adrian Singleton, with a weary demeanor, got up and followed Dorian to the bar. A half-breed with a shabby turban and a worn-out coat greeted them with a dirty grin and placed a bottle of brandy and two glasses in front of them. The women approached and started to chatter. Dorian turned his back to them and said something in a low voice to Adrian Singleton.
es_translation: Adrian Singleton got up with a tired air and followed Dorian Gray to the bar. A mulatto, with a tattered turban and a long filthy coat, greeted them with a hideous grin as he placed a bottle of brandy and two glasses before them. The women approached and began to chatter. Dorian turned his back on them and said something in a low voice to his companion.

en: A crooked smile, like a Malay crease, writhed across the face of one of the women. “We are very proud to-night,” she sneered.
vi: Một nụ cười quanh co, như một nếp nhăn Mã Lai, quằn quại ngang mặt một người đàn bà. “Đêm nay chúng tôi rất tự hào,” mụ ta chế nhạo.
tr: Kadınlardan biri yüzünde Malaya hançerleri gibi eğri bir gülüş belirerek alaylı alaylı, “Bu gece kibrimizden başka bir şey gözükmüyor,” diye dudak büktü.
es: Una sonrisa tan retorcida como un cris malayo se paseó por el rostro de una de las mujeres. —¡Qué orgullosos estamos esta noche! —fueron sus burlonas palabras.
vi_translation: A crooked smile, like a Malay wrinkle, twisted across the face of a woman. “Tonight we are very proud,” she mocked.
tr_translation: One of the women, with a mocking smile curving on her face like Malayan daggers, sneered, "Tonight, nothing but our arrogance is visible."
es_translation: A smile as twisted as a Malay kris crossed the face of one of the women. —How proud we are tonight! —were his mocking words.

en: “For God’s sake don’t talk to me,” cried Dorian, stamping his foot on the ground. “What do you want? Money? Here it is. Don’t ever talk to me again.”
vi: “Vì Chúa, đừng nói chuyện với tôi,” Dorian la lớn, giậm chân xuống nền. “Cô muốn gì? Tiền? Đây. Đừng bao giờ nói chuyện với tôi lần nữa.”
tr: Dorian ayağını yere vurarak, “Tanrı aşkına konuşma benimle!” diye bağırdı. “Ne istiyorsun? Para mı? Al. Bir daha konuşayım deme benimle.
es: —Por el amor de Dios, no me dirijas la palabra —exclamó Dorian, golpeando el suelo con el pie—. ¿Qué es lo que quieres? ¿Dinero? Aquí lo tienes. Pero no vuelvas a dirigirme la palabra.
vi_translation: "For God's sake, don't talk to me," Dorian shouted, stamping his foot on the ground. "What do you want? Money? Here. Never talk to me again."
tr_translation: Dorian stomped his foot and shouted, "For God's sake, don't talk to me!" "What do you want? Money? Take it. Don't ever speak to me again."
es_translation: —For the love of God, do not speak to me —exclaimed Dorian, stamping his foot—. What do you want? Money? Here you have it. But do not speak to me again.

en: Two red sparks flashed for a moment in the woman’s sodden eyes, then flickered out and left them dull and glazed. She tossed her head and raked the coins off the counter with greedy fingers. Her companion watched her enviously.
vi: Hai tia lửa đỏ lóe lên chớp nhoáng trong đôi mắt u mê của người đàn bà, rồi tắt dần, để lại chúng mờ đục và đờ đẫn. Mụ ta hất đầu lên, cào sạch các đồng xu khỏi quầy bằng những ngón tay tham lam. Bạn mụ nhìn mụ thèm thuồng.
tr: Kadının içki bulanığı gözlerinde bir an iki kızıl kıvılcım çaktı, sonra söndü ve gözler gene donuklaşıp camlaştı. Kadın başını şöyle bir arkaya atarak, bar tezgâhının üstündeki çil paraları açgözlü parmaklarla tarayıp avuçladı. Arkadaşı onu hasetle süzüyordu.
es: En los ojos de la mujer, embrutecidos por el alcohol, aparecieron por un momento dos destellos rojos, pero volvieron a apagarse enseguida, dejándolos otra vez muertos y vidriosos. Luego sacudió la cabeza y con dedos avarientos recogió las monedas del mostrador. Su compañera la contempló con envidia.
vi_translation: Two red sparks flashed briefly in the dull eyes of the woman, then gradually faded, leaving them cloudy and vacant. She jerked her head up, greedily scraping the coins off the counter with her fingers. Her companion watched her with envy.
tr_translation: For a moment, two red sparks flashed in the woman's alcohol-clouded eyes, then they faded and her eyes became dull and glassy again. The woman threw her head back slightly, greedily raking and grabbing the coins on the bar counter with her fingers. Her friend was eyeing her with envy.
es_translation: In the woman's eyes, dulled by alcohol, two red flashes appeared for a moment, but they quickly faded, leaving them dead and glassy once again. Then she shook her head and with greedy fingers gathered the coins from the counter. Her companion watched her with envy.

en: “It’s no use,” sighed Adrian Singleton. “I don’t care to go back. What does it matter? I am quite happy here.”
vi: “Chẳng ích gì đâu,” Adrian Singleton thở dài. “Tôi không thích quay lại. Quan trọng gì? Ở đây tôi thấy rất vui.
tr: Adrian, “Boşuna,” diye içini çekti. “Dönmek istemiyorum. Ne fark eder? Burada bal gibi mutluyum ben.
es: —Es inútil —suspiró Adrian Singleton—. No tengo ganas de volver. ¿Qué más da? Estoy muy bien aquí.
vi_translation: "It's no use," Adrian Singleton sighed. "I don't want to go back. What's the point? I'm very happy here."
tr_translation: Adrian sighed, "It's pointless." "I don't want to go back. What difference does it make? I'm perfectly happy here."
es_translation: —It's useless —sighed Adrian Singleton—. I don't feel like going back. What difference does it make? I'm very well here.

en: “You will write to me if you want anything, won’t you?” said Dorian, after a pause.
vi: “Anh sẽ biên cho tôi nếu anh cần bất cứ thứ gì nhé, hứa đi?” Dorian nói, sau một lúc ngừng.
tr: Bir duralamadan sonra Dorian, “Bir şeye ihtiyacın olursa bana yazarsın, değil mi?” diye sordu.
es: —Me escribirás si necesitas algo, ¿de acuerdo? —dijo Dorian después de una pausa.
vi_translation: “You will write to me if you need anything, promise?” Dorian said, after a moment's pause.
tr_translation: After a pause, Dorian asked, "If you need anything, you'll write to me, won't you?"
es_translation: —You will write to me if you need anything, alright? —said Dorian after a pause.

en: “Perhaps.”
vi: “Có lẽ.”
tr: “Belki.
es: —Quizá.
vi_translation: “Maybe.”
tr_translation: “Maybe.”
es_translation: —Maybe.

en: “Good night, then.”
vi: “Vậy thì tạm biệt.”
tr: “İyi geceler, öyleyse.
es: —Buenas noches, entonces.
vi_translation: "Well then, goodbye."
tr_translation: “Good night, then.”
es_translation: —Good night, then.

en: “Good night,” answered the young man, passing up the steps and wiping his parched mouth with a handkerchief.
vi: “Tạm biệt,” thanh niên trả lời, đi lên các bậc thềm, lau cái miệng khô nẻ bằng khăn tay.
tr: Genç adam, “İyi geceler,” diye yanıtladı, kavrulmuş dudaklarını mendiliyle silerek merdivenden yukarı çıktı.
es: —Buenas noches —respondió el joven, volviendo a subir los escalones mientras se limpiaba la boca reseca con un pañuelo.
vi_translation: "Goodbye," the young man replied, walking up the steps, wiping his dry, chapped mouth with a handkerchief.
tr_translation: The young man replied, "Good night," wiping his parched lips with a handkerchief as he climbed the stairs.
es_translation: —Good evening —replied the young man, going back up the steps while wiping his dry mouth with a handkerchief.

en: Dorian walked to the door with a look of pain in his face. As he drew the curtain aside, a hideous laugh broke from the painted lips of the woman who had taken his money. “There goes the devil’s bargain!” she hiccoughed, in a hoarse voice.
vi: Dorian bước đến cửa với vẻ đau đớn trên mặt. Lúc cậu kéo rèm qua bên thì một tiếng cười khả ố bật ra khỏi đôi môi tô son của người đàn bà vừa lấy tiền của cậu. “Mới diễn ra một giao kèo của quỷ!” mụ vừa nói vừa nấc, bằng giọng khàn đặc.
tr: Dorian yüzünde acı çektiğini belli eden bir ifadeyle kapıya doğru yürüdü. Perdeyi araladığı sırada biraz önce parasını almış olan kadının o boyalı dudaklarından çirkin bir kahkaha koptu. Kadın taraz taraz bir sesle, hıçkırık tutmuş gibi, “İşte, şeytanın satın aldığı adam!” diye konuştu.
es: Dorian se dirigió hacia la puerta con una expresión dolorida en el rostro. Cuando apartaba la cortina verde, una risa espantosa salió de los labios pintados de la mujer que había recogido las monedas. —¡Ahí va el protegido del diablo! —exclamó con voz ronca entre dos ataques de hipo.
vi_translation: Dorian walked to the door with a look of pain on his face. As he pulled the curtain aside, a hideous laugh burst from the painted lips of the woman who had just taken his money. "A devil's bargain has just been struck!" she said with a thick, hoarse voice, hiccuping.
tr_translation: Dorian walked towards the door with an expression on his face that showed he was in pain. As he drew the curtain aside, an ugly laugh burst from the painted lips of the woman who had just taken his money. In a raspy voice, as if caught by a sob, the woman said, "There goes the man bought by the devil!"
es_translation: Dorian walked towards the door with a pained expression on his face. As he drew aside the green curtain, a ghastly laugh escaped the painted lips of the woman who had collected the coins. —There goes the devil's protégé! —he exclaimed in a hoarse voice between two hiccups.

en: “Curse you!” he answered, “don’t call me that.”
vi: “Con khốn!” cậu đáp lại, “đừng gọi ta thế.”
tr: Dorian, “Allah belanı versin,” dedi. “Söylemesene bu lafı.
es: —¡Maldita seas! —respondió Dorian—, ¡no me llames eso!
vi_translation: “You bitch!” he replied, “don’t call me that.”
tr_translation: Dorian said, "Damn you." "Don't say that.""
es_translation: —Damn you! —responded Dorian—, don't call me that!

en: She snapped her fingers. “Prince Charming is what you like to be called, ain’t it?” she yelled after him.
vi: Mụ bật ngón tay. “Hoàng tử Quyến rũ là cái tên mà mày muốn được gọi, phỏng?” mụ hét lên sau lưng cậu.
tr: Kadın parmaklarını şaklattı. “Tatlı Prens adını seversin sen, öyle değil mi?” diye onun arkasından bağırdı.
es: La mujer chasqueó los dedos. —Príncipe azul es lo que te gusta que te llamen, ¿no es eso? —le gritó mientras salía.
vi_translation: She snapped her fingers. "Prince Charming is the name you want to be called, right?" she yelled behind him.
tr_translation: The woman snapped her fingers. “You like the name Sweet Prince, don't you?” she shouted after him.
es_translation: The woman snapped her fingers. —Prince Charming is what you like to be called, isn't it? —he shouted at her as he left.

en: The drowsy sailor leaped to his feet as she spoke, and looked wildly round. The sound of the shutting of the hall door fell on his ear. He rushed out as if in pursuit.
vi: Gã thủy thủ ngủ gật nhảy dựng lên khi nghe mụ nói, điên cuồng nhìn quanh. Tiếng đóng cửa sảnh vang đến tai y. Y lao ra ngoài như thể để truy lùng.
tr: Onun bu sözleri üzerine masa başında uyuklayan gemici ayağa fırladı ve çılgın gözlerle çevresini taradı. Kulağına kapanan kapının sesi geldi. Adam kovaladığı biri varmış gibi dışarı koştu.
es: El marinero adormilado se levantó de un salto al oír a la mujer, y miró con ojos enloquecidos a su alrededor. El sonido de la puerta al cerrarse llegó hasta sus oídos, y salió precipitadamente, como en persecución de alguien.
vi_translation: The dozing sailor jumped up when he heard the woman speak, frantically looking around. The sound of the hall door closing reached his ears. He rushed outside as if to pursue.
tr_translation: Upon hearing these words, the sailor who was dozing at the table jumped up and scanned his surroundings with wild eyes. He heard the sound of a door closing. The man ran outside as if he were chasing someone.
es_translation: The drowsy sailor jumped up upon hearing the woman, and looked around with crazed eyes. The sound of the door closing reached his ears, and he rushed out, as if in pursuit of someone.

en: Dorian Gray hurried along the quay through the drizzling rain. His meeting with Adrian Singleton had strangely moved him, and he wondered if the ruin of that young life was really to be laid at his door, as Basil Hallward had said to him with such infamy of insult. He bit his lip, and for a few seconds his eyes grew sad. Yet, after all, what did it matter to him? One’s days were too brief to take the burden of another’s errors on one’s shoulders. Each man lived his own life and paid his own price for living it. The only pity was one had to pay so often for a single fault. One had to pay over and over again, indeed. In her dealings with man, destiny never closed her accounts.
vi: Dorian Gray vội vã đi dọc theo bến cảng, xuyên qua cơn mưa bụi. Cuộc gặp với Adrian Singleton đã làm cậu xao lòng kỳ lạ, và cậu tự hỏi không biết sự suy đồi của cuộc đời trẻ trung ấy có thật sự có lỗi của cậu như Basil Hallward từng nói cho cậu biết với lời lăng mạ ô nhục như vậy hay không. Cậu cắn môi, và trong vài giây, mắt cậu buồn hẳn đi. Tuy nhiên, rốt cuộc thì, chuyện đó có ý nghĩa gì với cậu? Đời người quá ngắn để mà mang gánh nặng lỗi lầm kẻ khác trên vai mình. Ai ai cũng phải sống cuộc đời của mình, và trả cái giá của mình cho việc sống nó. Chỉ đáng tiếc là người ta phải trả giá thường xuyên đến thế cho chỉ một sai sót duy nhất. Người ta cứ phải trả giá mãi trả giá mãi, thật sự là thế. Trong giao dịch với con người, Số phận chẳng bao giờ chịu kết sổ.
tr: Dorian Gray yağmur çisentisinin altında hızlı adımlarla rıhtım boyunca ilerliyordu. Adrian Singleton’ la karşılaşmak onu tuhaf biçimde duygulandırmıştı: Bu taze hayatın mahvolmasındaki suç gerçekten de, Basil Hallward’ın öylesine alçakça bir hakaretle ileri sürdüğü üzere, onun omzuna mı yüklenecekti? Dorian dudağını kemirdi, gözleri bir an üzüntüyle doldu. Öte yandan bu işin onunla ne ilgisi vardı ki? İnsan hayatı, başkalarının yaptığı hataların ağırlığını yüklenemeyecek kadar kısaydı. Herkes kendi hayatını yaşıyor ve yaşamak karşılığında kendine çıkan faturayı ödüyordu. İşin acıklı yanı şuydu ki insan tek bir hata için bir sürü ödeme yapmak zorunda kalıyordu. Durmadan ödeme yapmak zorunda kalıyordu, işin en doğrusu. İnsanla olan alışverişlerinde Kader, alacak defterini hiç kapamıyordu.
es: Dorian Gray avanzaba a buen paso por el muelle sin importarle la lluvia. Su encuentro con Adrian Singleton le había emocionado extrañamente, y se preguntaba si aquel desastre era responsabilidad suya, tal como Basil Hallward le había dicho de manera tan insultante. Se mordió los labios y por unos instantes sus ojos se llenaron de tristeza. Aunque, después de todo, ¿a él qué más le daba? La vida es demasiado corta para cargar con el peso de los errores ajenos. Cada persona gastaba su propia vida y pagaba su precio por vivirla. Lo único lamentable era que por una sola falta hubiera que pagar tantas veces. Que hubiera, efectivamente, que pagar y volver a pagar y seguir pagando. En sus tratos con los seres humanos, el Destino nunca cerraba las cuentas.
vi_translation: Dorian Gray hurried along the quay, through the drizzle. The meeting with Adrian Singleton had unsettled him strangely, and he wondered whether the degeneration of that young life was really his fault, as Basil Hallward had once told him with such shameful reproach. He bit his lip, and for a few seconds, his eyes grew sad. However, in the end, what did it matter to him? Life was too short to bear the burden of another's sins on one's shoulders. Everyone had to live their own life, and pay their own price for living it. The only pity was that one often had to pay so frequently for just a single mistake. One had to keep paying and paying, it was truly so. In dealings with humans, Fate never agreed to close the account.
tr_translation: Dorian Gray was walking briskly along the quay under the drizzle. Meeting Adrian Singleton had affected him in a strangely emotional way: Was the blame for the ruin of this fresh life really to be placed on his shoulders, as Basil Hallward had so basely suggested? Dorian bit his lip, his eyes filled with sorrow for a moment. On the other hand, what did this matter have to do with him? Human life was too short to bear the weight of others' mistakes. Everyone lived their own life and paid the price for living it. The tragic part was that a person had to pay for a single mistake many times over. They had to keep paying, that was the truth of it. In its dealings with humans, Fate never closed its ledger.
es_translation: Dorian Gray walked briskly along the dock, indifferent to the rain. His encounter with Adrian Singleton had strangely moved him, and he wondered if that disaster was his responsibility, as Basil Hallward had so insultingly told him. He bit his lips, and for a moment his eyes filled with sadness. Although, after all, what did it matter to him? Life is too short to bear the weight of others' mistakes. Each person spent their own life and paid their own price for living it. The only regrettable thing was that for a single fault one had to pay so many times. That indeed, one had to pay and pay again and keep paying. In its dealings with human beings, Fate never closed the accounts.

en: There are moments, psychologists tell us, when the passion for sin, or for what the world calls sin, so dominates a nature that every fibre of the body, as every cell of the brain, seems to be instinct with fearful impulses. Men and women at such moments lose the freedom of their will. They move to their terrible end as automatons move. Choice is taken from them, and conscience is either killed, or, if it lives at all, lives but to give rebellion its fascination and disobedience its charm. For all sins, as theologians weary not of reminding us, are sins of disobedience. When that high spirit, that morning star of evil, fell from heaven, it was as a rebel that he fell.
vi: Các nhà tâm lý học bảo chúng ta rằng có những lúc mà sự đam mê với tội lỗi, hoặc với cái mà thế gian gọi là tội lỗi, đã chi phối bản tính con người đến nỗi mọi thớ thịt, cũng như mọi tế bào não, dường như thấm đẫm những thôi thúc kinh hãi. Đàn ông và đàn bà trong những lúc như vậy thường đánh mất tự do ý chí. Họ tiến về sự kết thúc khủng khiếp của mình như những cỗ máy tự động, Quyền lựa chọn bị tước mất khỏi họ, còn lương tâm thì hoặc là bị giết, hoặc là nếu nó còn sống chăng nữa thì cũng sẽ sống chỉ để chống lại sự mê hoặc, và bất tuân theo sự quyến rũ của nó. Bởi vì mọi tội lỗi, như các nhà thần học vẫn nhắc chúng ta một cách không mệt mỏi, đều là tội bất tuân. Khi vị thần tối cao ấy, ngôi sao ban mai ấy của cái ác, rớt xuống từ thiên đường, là do một cuộc nổi loạn mà ngài mới rớt.
tr: Ruhbilimcilerin dediğine bakılırsa hayatta öyle anlar vardır ki, günaha –ya da toplumun günah saydığı şeylere– duyulan tutku kişinin huyuna öylesine el koyar ki, bedenin her lifi, beynin her hücresi sanki ürkünç itkilerle ayaklanır. Böyle zamanlarda kadınlar ve erkekler iradelerinin bağımsızlığını yitirirler. Kurgulu birer makine gibi kendilerini bekleyen sona ilerlerler. Seçme yeteneği ellerinden alınmıştır. Vicdan öldürülmüştür, varsa da salt başkaldırıya çekicilik katmak dikbaşlılığı sevimli göstermek için yaşamaktadır. Çünkü bütün günahların kaynağı, dinbilimcilerin bıkıp usanmadan söyledikleri gibi, büyük sözünden çıkmaktır. Günahın sabah yıldızı olan o yüce ruh cennetten kovulduysa isyankâr olduğu için kovulmuştu.
es: Hay momentos, nos dicen los psicólogos, en los que la pasión por el pecado, o por lo que el mundo llama pecado, domina hasta tal punto nuestro ser, que todas las fibras del cuerpo, al igual que las células del cerebro, no son más que instinto con espantosos impulsos. En tales momentos hombres y mujeres dejan de ser libres. Se dirigen hacia su terrible objetivo como autómatas. Pierden la capacidad de elección, y la conciencia queda aplastada o, si vive, lo hace para llenar de fascinación la rebeldía y dar encanto a la desobediencia. Cuando aquel espíritu poderoso, aquella perversa estrella de la mañana cayó del cielo, lo hizo como rebelde.
vi_translation: Psychologists tell us that there are times when the passion for sin, or what the world calls sin, dominates human nature to such an extent that every muscle fiber, as well as every brain cell, seems to be imbued with terrifying impulses. Men and women in such moments often lose their freedom of will. They move towards their terrible end like automatons, the power of choice taken from them, and their conscience either killed or, if it still lives, it lives only to struggle against the temptation, and to defy its allure. For every sin, as theologians tirelessly remind us, is a sin of disobedience. When that supreme deity, that morning star of evil, fell from heaven, it was due to a rebellion that he fell.
tr_translation: According to psychologists, there are moments in life when the passion for sin—or for what society deems sinful—takes such hold of a person's nature that every fiber of the body, every cell of the brain, seems to revolt with dreadful impulses. At such times, men and women lose the independence of their will. They move towards their impending fate like programmed machines. The ability to choose has been taken from them. Conscience has been killed, and if it exists at all, it lives only to add allure to rebellion and to make stubbornness seem charming. For the source of all sin, as theologians tirelessly say, is great disobedience. If that exalted spirit, the morning star of sin, was cast out of heaven, it was because he was rebellious.
es_translation: There are moments, psychologists tell us, when the passion for sin, or for what the world calls sin, dominates our being to such an extent that all the fibers of the body, as well as the cells of the brain, are nothing but instinct with horrifying impulses. In such moments, men and women cease to be free. They move towards their terrible objective like automatons. They lose the ability to choose, and the conscience is crushed or, if it lives, it does so to fill rebellion with fascination and to give charm to disobedience. When that powerful spirit, that perverse morning star fell from heaven, it did so as a rebel.

en: Callous, concentrated on evil, with stained mind, and soul hungry for rebellion, Dorian Gray hastened on, quickening his step as he went, but as he darted aside into a dim archway, that had served him often as a short cut to the ill-famed place where he was going, he felt himself suddenly seized from behind, and before he had time to defend himself, he was thrust back against the wall, with a brutal hand round his throat.
vi: Chai sạn, tập trung vào cái ác, với tâm hồn vẩn đục và linh hồn khát khao nổi loạn, Dorian Gray đi gấp, rảo bước nhanh hơn, nhưng khi cậu lao qua bên, vào con đường tối mò dưới cái mái vòm vẫn hay phụng sự cậu như lối tắt tới cái nơi khét tiếng mà cậu đang đến, cậu chợt cảm thấy mình bị tóm lấy từ phía sau, và trước khi cậu có thời gian để tự vệ thì cậu đã bị xô vào tường, với một bàn tay hung ác vòng quanh cổ cậu.
tr: Günah düşüncelerine saplanmaktan yüreği taşlaşmış, zihni kararmış, ruhu isyana acıkmış durumdaki Dorian Gray adımlarını gitgide sıklaştırarak son hızla yürümeyi sürdürüyordu. Derken, gittiği kötü yere kestirmeden ulaşmak için çoğunlukla yaptığı gibi loş bir kemer altına saptığı sırada birinin onu apansız arkadan kavradığını hissetti. Daha kendini savunmaya fırsat bulamadan duvara doğru itildi, acımasız bir el boğazına yapıştı.
es: Insensible, sin otra meta que el mal, contaminado el espíritu y el alma hambrienta de rebeldía, Dorian Gray se apresuró, acelerando el paso a medida que avanzaba. Pero en el momento en que se desviaba con el fin de penetrar por un pasaje oscuro que con frecuencia le había servido de atajo para llegar al lugar adonde se dirigía, sintió que lo sujetaban por detrás y, antes de que tuviera tiempo para defenderse, se vio arrojado contra el muro, con una mano brutal apretándole la garganta.
vi_translation: Hardened, focused on evil, with a tainted soul and a spirit yearning for rebellion, Dorian Gray hurried, quickening his pace, but as he dashed aside, into the pitch-dark road under the archway that often served him as a shortcut to the infamous place he was heading to, he suddenly felt himself grabbed from behind, and before he had time to defend himself, he was shoved against the wall, with a vicious hand wrapped around his neck.
tr_translation: With his heart hardened from being mired in sinful thoughts, his mind darkened, and his soul hungry for rebellion, Dorian Gray continued to walk at full speed, quickening his steps more and more. Then, as he turned into a dim archway, as he often did to take a shortcut to the bad place he was heading, he felt someone suddenly grab him from behind. Before he had a chance to defend himself, he was pushed against the wall, a ruthless hand gripping his throat.
es_translation: Insensible, with no other goal than evil, his spirit contaminated and his soul hungry for rebellion, Dorian Gray hurried, quickening his pace as he went. But at the moment he turned to enter a dark passage that had often served as a shortcut to his destination, he felt himself grabbed from behind, and before he had time to defend himself, he was thrown against the wall, with a brutal hand squeezing his throat.

en: He struggled madly for life, and by a terrible effort wrenched the tightening fingers away. In a second he heard the click of a revolver, and saw the gleam of a polished barrel, pointing straight at his head, and the dusky form of a short, thick-set man facing him.
vi: Cậu vùng vẫy điên cuồng để sống, và, với một cố gắng khủng khiếp, vặn được các ngón tay siết chặt ấy ra. Trong một giây, cậu nghe tiếng cách của khẩu súng lục ổ quay, thấy ánh lập lòe của cái nòng súng bóng loáng đang chĩa thẳng vào đầu mình, và hình dáng mờ tối của một người đàn ông thấp lùn chắc mập đối diện cậu.
tr: Dorian, canını kurtarmak için delicesine çırpınmaya başladı, boğazını sıkan parmakları müthiş bir çabayla çekip attı. Ânında bir tabanca tıkırtısı duydu, tam kafasına çevrilmiş cilalı bir namlunun ışıltısıyla önünde duran kısa boylu, tıknaz yapılı adamın karaltısını seçti.
es: Luchó desesperadamente y, con un terrible esfuerzo, logró librarse de la creciente presión de los dedos. Pero un segundo después oyó el chasquido de un revólver y vio el brillo de un cañón que le apuntaba directamente a la cabeza, así como la silueta imprecisa del individuo bajo y robusto que le hacía frente.
vi_translation: He struggled frantically to live, and, with a tremendous effort, managed to pry those tightly gripping fingers apart. In a second, he heard the click of the revolver, saw the glimmer of the shiny barrel pointing straight at his head, and the dim figure of a short, stout man facing him.
tr_translation: Dorian began to struggle frantically to save his life, pulling away the fingers that were squeezing his throat with tremendous effort. In an instant, he heard the click of a gun, saw the glint of a polished barrel aimed at his head, and made out the silhouette of a short, stocky man standing before him.
es_translation: He fought desperately and, with a tremendous effort, managed to free himself from the increasing pressure of the fingers. But a second later he heard the click of a revolver and saw the gleam of a barrel pointing directly at his head, as well as the indistinct silhouette of the short and sturdy individual facing him.

en: “What do you want?” he gasped.
vi: “Anh muốn gì?” cậu thở hổn hển.
tr: “Ne istiyorsun?” diye kesik kesik sordu.
es: —¿Qué quiere? —jadeó.
vi_translation: “What do you want?” he panted.
tr_translation: "What do you want?" he asked haltingly.
es_translation: —What do you want? —he gasped.

en: “Keep quiet,” said the man. “If you stir, I shoot you.”
vi: “Im ngay,” người đó nói. “Nếu mày cựa quậy, tao sẽ bắn mày.”
tr: “Kes sesini,” dedi adam. “Kıpırdarsan vururum.
es: —Estese quieto —dijo el otro—. Si se mueve, disparo.
vi_translation: “Stay still,” the person said. “If you move, I will shoot you.”
tr_translation: "Shut up," said the man. "If you move, I'll shoot."
es_translation: —Stay still —said the other—. If you move, I'll shoot.

en: “You are mad. What have I done to you?”
vi: “Anh điên rồi. Tôi đã làm gì anh?”
tr: “Deli misin sen?
es: —Ha perdido el juicio. ¿Qué tiene contra mí?
vi_translation: “You're crazy. What have I done to you?”
tr_translation: “Are you crazy? What did I ever do to you?”
es_translation: —You've lost your mind. What do you have against me?

en: “You wrecked the life of Sibyl Vane,” was the answer, “and Sibyl Vane was my sister. She killed herself. I know it. Her death is at your door. I swore I would kill you in return. For years I have sought you. I had no clue, no trace. The two people who could have described you were dead. I knew nothing of you but the pet name she used to call you. I heard it to-night by chance. Make your peace with God, for to-night you are going to die.”
vi: “Mày phá đời Sibyl Vane,” là câu trả lời, “và Sibyl Vane là chị tao. Chị ấy đã tự sát. Tao biết chuyện ấy. Chị ấy chết do lỗi của mày. Tao đã thề là tao sẽ giết mày để trả thù. Suốt nhiều năm, tao đi tìm mày. Tao không có manh mối, không dấu vết nào. Hai người có thể mô tả về mày thì đều đã chết. Tao không biết gì về mày ngoài cái biệt danh âu yếm mà chị ấy từng hay gọi mày. Đêm nay tao tình cờ nghe thấy nó. Hãy cầu Chúa đi, vì đêm nay mày sẽ chết.”
tr: Ben ne yaptım sana?” Adam, “Sibyl Vane’in hayatını söndürdün,” diye yanıtladı. “Sibyl Vane de benim ablamdı. Kendi canına kıydı. Bundan eminim. Ölümüne sebep sensin. Karşılığında seni öldürmeye yemin etmiştim. Yıllardır seni arıyorum. Hiçbir iz, bir ipucu yoktu elimde. Seni tanımlayabilecek olan iki kişi ölmüşlerdi. Seninle ilgili olarak onun sana taktığı o addan başka hiçbir şey bilmiyordum. Bu gece bir rastlantıyla bu adı duydum. Tanrına dua et, çünkü bu gece ölüyorsun.
es: —Usted destrozó la vida de Sibyl Vane —fue la respuesta—. Y Sibyl Vane era mi hermana. Se suicidó. Lo sé. Usted es el responsable. Juré matarlo. Llevo años buscándolo. No tenía ninguna pista ni el menor rastro. Las dos personas que podían darme una descripción suya han muerto. Sólo sabía el nombre cariñoso que Sibyl utilizaba. Hace un momento lo he oído por casualidad. Póngase a bien con Dios, porque va a morir esta noche.
vi_translation: “You ruined Sibyl Vane's life,” was the reply, “and Sibyl Vane was my sister. She committed suicide. I know about it. She died because of you. I swore I would kill you to avenge her. For many years, I searched for you. I had no clues, no traces. The two people who could describe you were both dead. I knew nothing about you except the affectionate nickname she used to call you. Tonight I happened to hear it. Pray to God, for tonight you will die.”
tr_translation: The man replied, “You extinguished Sibyl Vane’s life.” “Sibyl Vane was my sister. She took her own life. I am sure of it. You are the cause of her death. I swore to kill you in return. I have been searching for you for years. I had no trace, no clue. The two people who could identify you were dead. I knew nothing about you except the name she gave you. Tonight, by chance, I heard that name. Pray to your god, because tonight you die.”
es_translation: —You destroyed Sibyl Vane's life —was the response—. And Sibyl Vane was my sister. She committed suicide. I know. You are responsible. I swore to kill you. I've been looking for you for years. I had no clue or the slightest trace. The two people who could give me a description of you are dead. I only knew the affectionate name that Sibyl used. A moment ago, I heard it by chance. Make peace with God, because you are going to die tonight.

en: Dorian Gray grew sick with fear. “I never knew her,” he stammered. “I never heard of her. You are mad.”
vi: Dorian sợ phát ốm. “Tôi chưa hề quen cô ấy,” cậu lắp bắp. “Tôi chưa hề nghe về cô ấy. Anh điên rồi.”
tr: Dorian Gray korkudan bayılacak gibi oldu. “Onu tanımıyorum,” diye kekeledi. “Adını bile duymuş değilim. Sen delisin.
es: Dorian Gray se sintió enfermar de miedo. —No sé de qué me habla —tartamudeó—. Nunca he oído ese nombre. Está usted loco.
vi_translation: Dorian was scared to death. “I have never met her,” he stammered. “I have never heard of her. You are crazy.”
tr_translation: Dorian Gray felt like he was going to faint from fear. “I don't know him,” he stammered. “I haven't even heard his name. You are mad.”
es_translation: Dorian Gray felt sick with fear. —I don't know what you're talking about —he stammered—. I've never heard that name. You're crazy.

en: “You had better confess your sin, for as sure as I am James Vane, you are going to die.” There was a horrible moment. Dorian did not know what to say or do. “Down on your knees!” growled the man. “I give you one minute to make your peace—no more. I go on board to-night for India, and I must do my job first. One minute. That’s all.”
vi: “Mày nên thú tội thì hơn, vì cũng chắc chắn như tao là James Vane, mày sắp chết.” Một khoảnh khắc khủng khiếp. Dorian không biết phải nói hay làm gì. “Quỳ xuống!” người đó gầm gừ. “Tao cho mày một phút để cầu nguyện — không hơn. Đêm nay tao sẽ lên tàu đi Ấn Độ, và tao phải làm việc của mình trước đã. Một phút. Chỉ thế thôi.”
tr: “İyisi mi sen günahını itiraf et, çünkü benim adımın James Vane olduğu nasıl kesinse senin öleceğin de öylesine kesin.” Korkunç bir an geçti. Dorian ne diyeceğini, ne yapacağını bilemiyordu. Adam, “Diz çök!” diye hırladı. “Son duan için bir dakika veriyorum sana; başka vaktin yok. Bu gece Hindistan’a gidiyoruz. Gemiye binmeden önce bu işi bitirmem gerek. Bir tek dakika. Hepsi bu.
es: —Más le vale confesar su pecado, porque va a morir, tan cierto como que me llamo James Vane. Durante un terrible momento, Dorian no supo qué hacer ni qué decir. —¡De rodillas! —gruñó su agresor—. Le doy un minuto para que se arrepienta, nada más. Me embarco para la India, pero antes he de cumplir mi promesa. Un minuto. Eso es todo.
vi_translation: "You'd better confess, for as sure as I am James Vane, you're about to die." A dreadful moment. Dorian didn't know what to say or do. "Kneel down!" the man growled. "I'll give you one minute to pray — no more. Tonight, I'm boarding a ship to India, and I must do my duty first. One minute. That's all."
tr_translation: "You better confess your sin, because just as sure as my name is James Vane, you will die." A terrible moment passed. Dorian didn't know what to say or what to do. The man snarled, "Kneel down!" "I'm giving you one minute for your last prayer; you have no other time. We are going to India tonight. I need to finish this before boarding the ship. One single minute. That's all."
es_translation: —He'd better confess his sin, because he's going to die, as surely as my name is James Vane. During a terrible moment, Dorian did not know what to do or say. —On your knees! —growled his assailant—. I'll give you one minute to repent, nothing more. I'm embarking for India, but first I must fulfill my promise. One minute. That's all.

en: Dorian’s arms fell to his side. Paralysed with terror, he did not know what to do. Suddenly a wild hope flashed across his brain. “Stop,” he cried. “How long ago is it since your sister died? Quick, tell me!”
vi: Hai cánh tay Dorian buông xuôi xuống sườn. Đờ ra vì sợ, cậu không biết phải làm gì. Đột nhiên, một hy vọng điên cuồng lóe lên trong óc cậu. “Dừng lại,” cậu kêu to. “Từ khi chị của anh chết đến nay đã được bao lâu rồi? Nói cho tôi biết, mau lên!”
tr: Dorian’ın kolları yanlarına düştü. Dehşetten felce uğramış gibi, ne yapacağını bilemiyordu. Birden kafasının içinden çılgın bir umut uçup geçti. “Dur!” diye bağırdı. “Ablan öleli ne kadar oluyor? Çabuk söyle bana!
es: Dorian dejó caer los brazos. Paralizado por el terror, no sabía qué hacer. De repente sé le pasó por la cabeza una loca esperanza. —Espere —exclamó—. ¿Cuánto hace que murió su hermana? ¡Deprisa, dígamelo!
vi_translation: Dorian's arms fell to his sides. Paralyzed by fear, he didn't know what to do. Suddenly, a wild hope flashed through his mind. "Stop," he shouted. "How long has it been since your sister died? Tell me, quickly!"
tr_translation: Dorian's arms fell to his sides. He was paralyzed with horror, not knowing what to do. Suddenly, a wild hope flashed through his mind. "Stop!" he shouted. "How long has it been since your sister died? Quick, tell me!"
es_translation: Dorian let his arms fall. Paralyzed by terror, he didn't know what to do. Suddenly, a wild hope crossed his mind. —Wait —he exclaimed—. How long has it been since your sister died? Quickly, tell me!

en: “Eighteen years,” said the man. “Why do you ask me? What do years matter?”
vi: “Mười tám năm,” người đó nói. “Sao mày hỏi tao? Bao nhiêu năm thì sao?”
tr: Adam, “On sekiz yıl,” diye yanıtladı. “Ne soruyorsun? Yılının ne önemi var?
es: —Dieciocho años —respondió el marinero—. ¿Por qué me lo pregunta? ¿Qué importancia tiene?
vi_translation: "Eighteen years," the person said. "Why are you asking me? What does it matter how many years?"
tr_translation: Adam replied, "Eighteen years." "Why are you asking? What difference does the year make?"
es_translation: —Eighteen years —replied the sailor—. Why do you ask me that? What difference does it make?

en: “Eighteen years,” laughed Dorian Gray, with a touch of triumph in his voice. “Eighteen years! Set me under the lamp and look at my face!”
vi: “Mười tám năm,” Dorian Gray cười lớn, với một chút vui mừng trong giọng. “Mười tám năm! Hãy đưa tôi ra dưới ánh đèn và nhìn mặt tôi!”
tr: Dorian Gray, “On sekiz yıl ha!” diye güldü. Sesinde bir zafer tınısı vardı. “On sekiz yıl! Beni şu fenerin dibine götür de yüzüme bak!
es: —Dieciocho años —rió Dorian Gray, con acento triunfal en la voz—. ¡Dieciocho años! ¡Lléveme bajo la luz y míreme la cara!
vi_translation: "Eighteen years," Dorian Gray laughed loudly, with a hint of joy in his voice. "Eighteen years! Bring me under the light and look at my face!"
tr_translation: Dorian Gray laughed, "Eighteen years, huh!" There was a tone of triumph in his voice. "Eighteen years! Take me to the base of that lantern and look at my face!"
es_translation: —Eighteen years —laughed Dorian Gray, with a triumphant tone in his voice—. Eighteen years! Take me under the light and look at my face!

en: James Vane hesitated for a moment, not understanding what was meant. Then he seized Dorian Gray and dragged him from the archway.
vi: James Vane lưỡng lự một lát, không hiểu điều đó có nghĩa gì. Rồi y túm lấy Dorian Gray và lôi cậu ra khỏi vòm cuốn.
tr: James Vane bir an, denilenden hiçbir anlam çıkartamayarak duraksadı. Sonra Dorian Gray’i kavrayarak kemerin altından dışarı çekti.
es: James Vane vaciló un momento, sin entender de qué se trataba. Luego sujetó a Dorian Gray para sacarlo de los soportales.
vi_translation: James Vane hesitated for a moment, not understanding what it meant. Then he grabbed Dorian Gray and dragged him out of the archway.
tr_translation: James Vane paused for a moment, unable to make any sense of what was being said. Then he grabbed Dorian Gray and pulled him out from under the archway.
es_translation: James Vane hesitated for a moment, not understanding what it was about. Then he grabbed Dorian Gray to take him out of the arcades.

en: Dim and wavering as was the wind-blown light, yet it served to show him the hideous error, as it seemed, into which he had fallen, for the face of the man he had sought to kill had all the bloom of boyhood, all the unstained purity of youth. He seemed little more than a lad of twenty summers, hardly older, if older indeed at all, than his sister had been when they had parted so many years ago. It was obvious that this was not the man who had destroyed her life.
vi: Lờ mờ và chập chờn trong gió, nhưng ánh đèn vẫn đủ cho y thấy sự nhầm lẫn ghê gớm mà y dường như đã mắc phải, vì gương mặt của người mà y tìm giết ấy có mọi vẻ tươi tắn xuân thì, mọi sự thuần khiết không vương chút bụi trần của tuổi xuân. Người ấy dường như chỉ là một chàng trai vừa mới trải qua hai mươi mùa hạ, hầu như không già hơn, nếu quả thực có già hơn đi nữa, so với chị y khi họ chia tay bao nhiêu năm trước. Hiển nhiên đây không phải người đã phá hoại đời chị ấy.
tr: Rüzgârda sallanan fenerin ışığı sönük ve dalgalı olmakla birlikte gemiciye düştüğü feci yanılgıyı göstermeye yetti, çünkü öldürmeye kalkıştığı adamın yüzünde delikanlılığın olanca tazeliği, gençliğin kirlenmemiş saflığı okunuyordu. Yirmi yaşında bir delikanlıdan pek de büyük durmuyordu bu adam; yıllar önce ayrıldığı ablasının öylece kalıp kalan yaşından pek büyük durmuyordu. Sibyl’in hayatını söndüren kişinin bu olmadığı ortadaydı.
es: Si bien la luz, por la violencia del viento, era débil y temblorosa, le permitió de todos modos comprobar el espantoso error que, al parecer, había cometido, porque el rostro de su víctima poseía todo el frescor de la adolescencia, la pureza sin mancha de la juventud. Apenas parecía superar las veinte primaveras; la edad que tenía su hermana, si es que llegaba, cuando él se embarcó por vez primera, hacía ya tantos años. Sin duda no era aquél el hombre que había destrozado la vida de Sibyl.
vi_translation: Dim and flickering in the wind, but the light was still enough for him to see the terrible mistake he seemed to have made, because the face of the person he sought to kill had all the freshness of youth, all the purity untouched by the dust of life. That person seemed to be just a young man who had just gone through twenty summers, hardly older, if indeed older at all, compared to his sister when they parted many years ago. Clearly, this was not the person who had ruined his sister's life.
tr_translation: Although the light of the lantern swaying in the wind was dim and flickering, it was enough to show the sailor the dreadful mistake he had made, because the face of the man he attempted to kill bore all the freshness of youth and the untainted purity of adolescence. This man did not look much older than a twenty-year-old boy; he did not look much older than the age his sister had remained when they parted years ago. It was clear that this was not the person who had extinguished Sibyl's life.
es_translation: Although the light, due to the violence of the wind, was weak and flickering, it nevertheless allowed him to confirm the horrifying mistake he had apparently made, because the face of his victim possessed all the freshness of adolescence, the spotless purity of youth. She barely seemed to be over twenty springs; the age his sister had been, if she even reached it, when he first embarked, so many years ago. Without a doubt, this was not the man who had ruined Sibyl's life.

en: He loosened his hold and reeled back. “My God! my God!” he cried, “and I would have murdered you!”
vi: Y lỏng tay ra và loạng choạng lùi lại. “Chúa ơi! Chúa ơi!” y kêu lớn, “chút nữa thì tôi đã giết anh!”
tr: James Vane, Dorian’ı bırakarak geriye doğru sendeledi. “Ulu Tanrım!” diye inledi. “Aman Tanrım! Ben de seni öldürecektim.
es: James Vane aflojó la presión de la mano y dio un paso atrás. —¡Dios mío! —exclamó—. ¡Y me disponía a matarlo!
vi_translation: He loosened his grip and staggered back. "Oh my God! Oh my God!" he shouted, "I almost killed you!"
tr_translation: James Vane staggered backward, leaving Dorian. “Great God!” he moaned. “Oh my God! I was going to kill you.”
es_translation: James Vane loosened the pressure of his hand and took a step back. —My God! —he exclaimed—. And I was about to kill him!

en: Dorian Gray drew a long breath. “You have been on the brink of committing a terrible crime, my man,” he said, looking at him sternly. “Let this be a warning to you not to take vengeance into your own hands.”
vi: Dorian Gray hít một hơi thở dài. “Anh xém chút nữa là phạm phải một tội ác khủng khiếp, người ơi,” cậu nói, nhìn y nghiêm khắc. “Hãy để việc này là một lời răn cho anh rằng đừng có tự tay trả thù.”
tr: Dorian Gray derin bir soluk aldı. Karşısındaki adama sert sert bakarak, “Neredeyse korkunç bir suç işlemek üzereydin, ahbap,” dedi. “Bu sana ders olsun da öç almayı Tanrı’ya bırak.
es: Dorian Gray respiró hondamente. —Ha estado usted a punto de cometer una terrible equivocación —dijo, mirándolo con severidad—. Que le sirva de escarmiento para no tomarse la justicia por su mano.
vi_translation: Dorian Gray took a deep breath. "You almost committed a terrible crime, my friend," he said, looking at him sternly. "Let this be a lesson to you not to take revenge into your own hands."
tr_translation: Dorian Gray took a deep breath. Looking sternly at the man in front of him, he said, "You were about to commit an almost terrible crime, my friend." "Let this be a lesson to you and leave revenge to God."
es_translation: Dorian Gray breathed deeply. —You were about to make a terrible mistake —he said, looking at him sternly—. Let this be a lesson to you not to take justice into your own hands.

en: “Forgive me, sir,” muttered James Vane. “I was deceived. A chance word I heard in that damned den set me on the wrong track.”
vi: “Tha lỗi cho tôi, thưa ngài,” James Vane thì thào. “Tôi bị lừa. Một lời tình cờ mà tôi nghe thấy trong cái ổ khốn kiếp ấy đã khiến tôi lạc lối.”
tr: James Vane, “Bağışlayın beni, beyefendi,” diye mırıldandı. “Aldanmışım. O Tanrı’nın belası izbede kulağıma çalınan bir söz beni yanılttı.
es: —Perdóneme —murmuró el otro—. Estaba equivocado. Una palabra oída en ese maldito antro ha hecho que me confundiera.
vi_translation: “Forgive me, sir,” James Vane whispered. “I was deceived. A chance word I overheard in that wretched den led me astray.”
tr_translation: James Vane, "Forgive me, sir," he murmured. "I was mistaken. A word I overheard in that godforsaken dive misled me."
es_translation: —Forgive me —murmured the other—. I was mistaken. A word heard in that damned den made me confused.

en: “You had better go home and put that pistol away, or you may get into trouble,” said Dorian, turning on his heel and going slowly down the street.
vi: “Anh nên về nhà thì hơn, và cất khẩu súng ấy đi, hoặc không thì anh có thể bị rắc rối đấy,” Dorian nói, quay gót, và đi chầm chậm xuống phố.
tr: Dorian, “Artık evine gitsen de şu tabancayı kaldırsan iyi olur, yoksa başın belaya girebilir,” diyerek döndü, ağır ağır yürüyerek uzaklaştı.
es: —Será mejor que vuelva a casa y abandone esa arma. De lo contrario, tendrá problemas —dijo Dorian Gray, dándose la vuelta y alejándose lentamente calle abajo.
vi_translation: "You should go home, and put that gun away, or else you might get into trouble," Dorian said, turning on his heel, and slowly walked down the street.
tr_translation: Dorian said, "It would be good if you went home now and put away that gun, otherwise you might get into trouble," and then turned and walked away slowly.
es_translation: —It would be better if you go back home and abandon that weapon. Otherwise, you will have problems —said Dorian Gray, turning around and slowly walking down the street.

en: James Vane stood on the pavement in horror. He was trembling from head to foot. After a little while, a black shadow that had been creeping along the dripping wall moved out into the light and came close to him with stealthy footsteps. He felt a hand laid on his arm and looked round with a start. It was one of the women who had been drinking at the bar.
vi: James Vane đứng trên vỉa hè, khiếp sợ. Y run từ đầu đến chân. Lát sau, một bóng đen bò dọc theo bức tường ướt đẫm, dịch ra ngoài sáng và lại gần y với những bước chân lén lút. Y cảm thấy một bàn tay đặt lên cánh tay y và giật mình nhìn quanh. Đó là một trong những người đàn bà đã uống ở quầy rượu.
tr: James Vane kaldırımda, dehşet içinde kalakalmıştı. Tepeden tırnağa zangırdıyordu. Biraz sonra, deminden beri ıslak duvar dibinden usul usul yaklaşmakta olan ufak, siyah bir karaltı ışığa çıktı, sessiz, sinsi adımlarla ona yaklaştı. James Vane koluna bir elin dokunduğunu duyup irkilerek döndü. Barda kafayı çekmekte olan kadınlardan biriydi bu.
es: James Vane, horrorizado, inmóvil en mitad de la calzada, empezó a temblar de pies a cabeza. Poco después, una sombra oscura que se había ido acercando sigilosamente pegada a la pared, salió a la luz y se le acercó con pasos furtivos. El marinero sintió una mano en el brazo y se volvió a mirar sobresaltado. Era una de las mujeres que bebían en el bar.
vi_translation: James Vane stood on the sidewalk, terrified. He was trembling from head to toe. A moment later, a shadow crept along the drenched wall, moving into the light and approaching him with stealthy steps. He felt a hand placed on his arm and started, looking around. It was one of the women who had been drinking at the bar.
tr_translation: James Vane stood frozen on the sidewalk, in horror. He was trembling from head to toe. A little later, a small, black figure that had been slowly approaching from the wet wall came into the light, and with silent, stealthy steps, it approached him. James Vane turned around with a start as he felt a hand touch his arm. It was one of the women who had been drinking in the bar.
es_translation: James Vane, horrified, motionless in the middle of the street, began to tremble from head to toe. Shortly after, a dark shadow that had been stealthily approaching along the wall came into the light and approached him with furtive steps. The sailor felt a hand on his arm and turned around startled. It was one of the women who drank in the bar.

en: “Why didn’t you kill him?” she hissed out, putting haggard face quite close to his. “I knew you were following him when you rushed out from Daly’s. You fool! You should have killed him. He has lots of money, and he’s as bad as bad.”
vi: “Sao anh lại không giết nó?” Mụ rít lên, đưa bộ mặt hốc hác lại sát mặt y. “Tôi biết anh bám theo nó khi anh lao ra khỏi Daly. Anh ngốc quá! Lẽ ra anh phải giết nó. Nó có rất nhiều tiền, và nó ác thật là ác.”
tr: Kadın o çökmüş yüzünü adamınkine yaklaştırarak tiz bir fısıltıyla, “Neden gebertmedin onu?” diye sordu. “Daly’nin oradan fırlayıp çıktığında ben anladım onun peşine düştüğünü. Sersem! Gebertecektin onu. Dünya kadar parası var. Kendi de kötünün kötüsü.
es: —¿Por qué no lo has matado? —le susurró, acercando mucho el rostro ojeroso al de James—. Me di cuenta de que lo seguías cuando saliste corriendo de casa de Daly. ¡Pobre imbécil! Tendrías que haberlo matado. Tiene mucho dinero y es lo peor de lo peor.
vi_translation: “Why didn't you kill it?” She hissed, bringing her gaunt face close to his. “I know you followed it when you rushed out of Daly. You are so stupid! You should have killed it. It has a lot of money, and it is truly evil.”
tr_translation: Bringing her sunken face close to the man's, the woman asked in a shrill whisper, "Why didn't you kill him?" "When Daly rushed out from there, I knew he was after him. Idiot! You should have killed him. He has a ton of money. He's the worst of the worst himself."
es_translation: —Why haven't you killed him? —he whispered, bringing his haggard face very close to James's—. I realized you were following him when you ran out of Daly's house. Poor fool! You should have killed him. He has a lot of money and is the worst of the worst.

en: “He is not the man I am looking for,” he answered, “and I want no man’s money. I want a man’s life. The man whose life I want must be nearly forty now. This one is little more than a boy. Thank God, I have not got his blood upon my hands.”
vi: “Anh ta không phải người tôi tìm kiếm,” y trả lời, “và tôi không cần tiền của người nào cả. Tôi cần sinh mạng một người. Cái người mà tôi muốn lấy mạng thì bây giờ cũng phải gần bốn mươi rồi. Còn kẻ này chỉ lớn hơn một chút so với một cậu bé. Ơn Chúa, tôi đã không để tay mình dính máu anh ta.”
tr: James Vane, “Aradığım adam o değil,” diye yanıtladı. “Kimsenin parasında gözüm yok benim. Bir adamın canını istiyorum. Canını istediğim adam şimdi kırk yaşlarında olmalı. Bu desen daha küçük çocuk. Tanrı’ ya bin şükür ki ellerim onun kanına bulanmadı.
es: —No es el hombre que busco —respondió James Vane—, y no me interesa el dinero de nadie. Quiero una vida. Quien yo busco anda cerca de los cuarenta. Ese que he dejado ir es poco más que un niño. Gracias a Dios no me he manchado las manos con su sangre.
vi_translation: “He is not the person I am looking for,” he replied, “and I do not need anyone's money. I need a person's life. The person whose life I want to take must be nearly forty by now. But this one is just a little older than a boy. Thank God, I did not let my hands be stained with his blood.”
tr_translation: James Vane replied, "The man I'm looking for is not him." "I have no interest in anyone's money. I want a man's life. The man whose life I want should be around forty years old now. This one here is just a young boy. Thank God my hands are not stained with his blood."
es_translation: —He is not the man I am looking for —replied James Vane—, and I am not interested in anyone's money. I want a life. The one I am looking for is around forty. The one I let go is little more than a child. Thank God I have not stained my hands with his blood.

en: The woman gave a bitter laugh. “Little more than a boy!” she sneered. “Why, man, it’s nigh on eighteen years since Prince Charming made me what I am.”
vi: Người đàn bà cười cay đắng. “Chỉ lớn hơn một chút so với một cậu bé!” mụ cười khinh bỉ. “Tại sao vậy, cậu ơi, đã gần mười tám năm từ khi Hoàng tử Quyến rũ làm tôi thành ra thế này.”
