tr: Kadın acı acı güldü. “Dünkü çocuk mu dedin?” diye alayla dudak büktü. “Anam, Tatlı Prens beni bu hallere düşüreli neredeyse on sekiz yıl oluyor be!
es: La mujer dejó escapar una risa amarga. —¡Poco más que un niño! —repitió con voz burlona—. Pobrecito mío, hace casi dieciocho años que el Príncipe Azul hizo de mí lo que soy.
vi_translation: The woman laughed bitterly. “Only a little older than a boy!” she sneered. “Why, my dear, it has been nearly eighteen years since Prince Charming made me this way.”
tr_translation: The woman laughed bitterly. "Did you say yesterday's child?" she scoffed, curling her lip. "My dear, it's been almost eighteen years since the Sweet Prince put me in this state!"
es_translation: The woman let out a bitter laugh. —Little more than a child! —he repeated in a mocking voice—. My poor dear, it's been almost eighteen years since Prince Charming made me what I am.

en: “You lie!” cried James Vane.
vi: “Bà nói dối!” James Vane kêu lên.
tr: James Vane, “Yalan söylüyorsun!” diye bağırdı.
es: —¡Mientes! —exclamó el marinero.
vi_translation: “You are lying!” James Vane shouted.
tr_translation: James Vane shouted, "You are lying!"
es_translation: —You're lying! —exclaimed the sailor.

en: She raised her hand up to heaven. “Before God I am telling the truth,” she cried.
vi: Mụ giơ tay lên trời. “Thề trước Chúa, tôi đã nói sự thật,” mụ kêu lên.
tr: Kadın elini göğe doğru kaldırdı. “Tanrı’nın huzurunda doğruyu söylüyorum.
es: La mujer levantó los brazos al cielo. —¡Juro ante Dios que te digo la verdad! —exclamó.
vi_translation: She raised her hand to the sky. "I swear before God, I have told the truth," she exclaimed.
tr_translation: The woman raised her hand towards the sky. “I am telling the truth in the presence of God.”
es_translation: The woman raised her arms to the sky. —I swear to God I'm telling you the truth! —he exclaimed.

en: “Before God?”
vi: “Thề trước Chúa?”
tr: “Tanrı’nın huzurunda mı dedin?
es: —¿Ante Dios?
vi_translation: “Swear before God?”
tr_translation: “Did you say in the presence of God?”
es_translation: —Before God?

en: “Strike me dumb if it ain’t so. He is the worst one that comes here. They say he has sold himself to the devil for a pretty face. It’s nigh on eighteen years since I met him. He hasn’t changed much since then. I have, though,” she added, with a sickly leer.
vi: “Hãy bắt tôi câm luôn nếu chả phải vậy. Nó là kẻ tệ nhất từng đến đây. Họ bảo nó đã bán mình cho quỷ để có một bộ mặt đẹp. Đã gần mười tám năm từ khi tôi gặp nó. Nó chẳng thay đổi gì mấy từ hồi đó. Mặc dù tôi thì,” mụ nói thêm, với một cái liếc mắt khổ sở.
tr: “Yalan söylüyorsam iki gözüm önüme aksın. Buraya dadananların en kötüsü odur. Diyorlar ki yüzü güzel kalsın diye ruhunu şeytana satmış. Ben onu tanıyalı on sekiz yıl kadar oluyor. Bu arada hemen hiç değişmedi. Ama ben değiştim,” diye kadın acı bir sırıtışla ekledi.
es: —Que me quede muda si no es cierto. Es el peor de toda la canalla que viene por aquí. Dicen que vendió el alma al diablo por una cara bonita. Hace casi dieciocho años que lo conozco. No ha cambiado mucho desde entonces. Yo, en cambio, sí —añadió con una horrible mueca.
vi_translation: “Strike me dumb if it isn't so. He is the worst one ever to come here. They say he sold his soul to the devil for a handsome face. It's been nearly eighteen years since I met him. He hasn't changed much since then. Though I have,” she added, with a miserable glance.
tr_translation: “If I'm lying, may my eyes fall out. He is the worst of those who haunt this place. They say he sold his soul to the devil to keep his face beautiful. It's been about eighteen years since I got to know him. In the meantime, he has hardly changed. But I have changed,” the woman added with a bitter grin.
es_translation: —May I be struck dumb if it isn't true. He is the worst of all the scoundrels that come around here. They say he sold his soul to the devil for a pretty face. I've known him for almost eighteen years. He hasn't changed much since then. I, on the other hand, have —she added with a horrible grimace.

en: “You swear this?”
vi: “Bà thề thật hả?”
tr: “Yemin eder misin buna?
es: —¿Me juras que es cierto?
vi_translation: “Do you swear?”
tr_translation: “Do you swear to this?”
es_translation: —Do you swear to me that it's true?

en: “I swear it,” came in hoarse echo from her flat mouth. “But don’t give me away to him,” she whined; “I am afraid of him. Let me have some money for my night’s lodging.”
vi: “Tôi xin thề,” lời lặp lại khàn khàn vang đến từ cái miệng mỏng quẹt của mụ. “Nhưng đừng tố cáo tôi với nó,” mụ rên rỉ; “tôi sợ nó lắm. Cho tôi ít tiền để trả chỗ trọ đêm nay.”
tr: Kadının o dümdüz ağzından, “Yemin ediyorum,” diye boğuk bir yankı yükseldi. Sonra, “Sakın ona söyleme,” diye mızıldanarak yalvardı. “Korkarım ben ondan. Hadi, bana biraz para ver de bu gecelik yatacak bir yer bulayım.
es: —Lo juro —las dos palabras salieron como un eco ronco de su boca hundida—. Pero no le digas que lo he denunciado —gimió—. Le tengo miedo. Dame algo para pagarme una cama esta noche.
vi_translation: “I swear,” the hoarse repetition came from her thin, pinched mouth. “But don't tell on me to it,” she moaned; “I'm very afraid of it. Give me some money to pay for tonight's lodging.”
tr_translation: From the woman's flat mouth, a muffled echo rose, "I swear." Then she pleaded, whining, "Don't tell him, please." "I'm afraid of him. Come on, give me some money so I can find a place to sleep for the night."
es_translation: —I swear —the two words came out like a hoarse echo from his sunken mouth—. But don't tell him that I reported him —he whimpered—. I'm afraid of him. Give me something to pay for a bed tonight.

en: He broke from her with an oath and rushed to the corner of the street, but Dorian Gray had disappeared. When he looked back, the woman had vanished also.
vi: Y chửi thề và bỏ mặc mụ, lao đến góc phố, nhưng Dorian Gray đã biến mất. Khi y ngoái nhìn lại, người đàn bà cũng không còn đó nữa.
tr: James Vane bir sövgü savurarak kolunu kadının elinden kurtardı, köşe başına koştu, gelgelelim Dorian Gray görünürlerde yoktu. James Vane arkasına baktığında kadının da ortadan kaybolmuş olduğunu gördü.
es: James Vane se apartó de ella con una imprecación y corrió hasta la esquina de la calle, pero Dorian Gray había desaparecido. Cuando volvió la vista, tampoco encontró a la mujer.
vi_translation: He cursed and left her, rushing to the corner of the street, but Dorian Gray had disappeared. When he looked back, the woman was also no longer there.
tr_translation: James Vane, cursing, wrenched his arm free from the woman's grasp and ran to the corner, but Dorian Gray was nowhere to be seen. When James Vane looked back, he saw that the woman had also disappeared.
es_translation: James Vane moved away from her with a curse and ran to the corner of the street, but Dorian Gray had disappeared. When he looked back, he couldn't find the woman either.

en: CHAPTER XVII.
vi: Chương 17
tr: On yedinci bölüm
es: Capítulo 17
vi_translation: Chapter 17
tr_translation: The seventeenth chapter
es_translation: Chapter 17

Multiple_ents: ['duquesa de monmouth', 'monmout', 'selby royal', 'dorian', 'dorian gray', 'lady narborough', 'duchess of monmouth', 'leydi narborough', 'narborough', 'lord henry', 'henry']
en: A week later Dorian Gray was sitting in the conservatory at Selby Royal, talking to the pretty Duchess of Monmouth, who with her husband, a jaded-looking man of sixty, was amongst his guests. It was tea-time, and the mellow light of the huge, lace-covered lamp that stood on the table lit up the delicate china and hammered silver of the service at which the duchess was presiding. Her white hands were moving daintily among the cups, and her full red lips were smiling at something that Dorian had whispered to her. Lord Henry was lying back in a silk-draped wicker chair, looking at them. On a peach-coloured divan sat Lady Narborough, pretending to listen to the duke’s description of the last Brazilian beetle that he had added to his collection. Three young men in elaborate smoking-suits were handing tea-cakes to some of the women. The house-party consisted of twelve people, and there were more expected to arrive on the next day.
vi: Một tuần sau, Dorian Gray ngồi trong nhà kính ở điền trang Selby Royal và chuyện trò với nữ công tước xinh đẹp Monmouth, cô ấy với chồng, một người đàn ông nhìn mỏi mệt tuổi sáu mươi, làm khách của cậu. Đang là giờ uống trà, và ánh sáng dịu dàng của cây đèn đồ sộ bọc đăng ten đứng trên bàn soi sáng đồ sứ tinh xảo và đồ bạc dập búa của bộ đồ trà trong bữa tiệc mà nữ công tước chủ trì. Đôi tay trắng ngần của cô rập rờn yểu điệu giữa chén tách, và đôi môi mọng đỏ của cô thì cười với điều gì đó mà Dorian thì thào vào tai cô. Huân tước Henry nằm ngửa trên chiếc ghế đan liễu gai bọc lụa và ngắm họ. Trên đi-văng màu đào, bà Narborough ngồi làm bộ nghe công tước mô tả về con bọ cánh cứng Bra-xin mới nhất mà ngài vừa bổ sung cho bộ sưu tập của mình. Ba người đàn ông trẻ tuổi bận trang phục hút thuốc cầu kỳ đang trao bánh ngọt uống trà cho vài phụ nữ. Nhóm khách ở lại chơi nhà gồm có mười hai vị, và mong là mai còn đến thêm nữa.
tr: Aradan bir hafta geçmişti. Dorian Gray, Royal Selby’ nin limonluğunda oturmuş, güzel Monmouth Düşesi’yle konuşmaktaydı. Düşesin, altmış yaşlarında, bezgin görünümlü bir adam olan kocası da konuklar arasındaydı. Çay saatiydi. Masanın üzerindeki dantel abajurlu kocaman lambanın yumuşak ışığı, çay takımının ince porselenleriyle dövme gümüşlerini aydınlatıyordu. Servisi düşes yapmaktaydı. O beyaz elleri bardakların arasında usul usul kıpırdarken dolgun kırmızı dudakları da Dorian’ın fısıldamış olduğu bir şeye gülümsüyordu. İpek örtülü bir hasır koltuğa yaslanmış oturan Lord Henry onları süzmekteydi. Şeftali rengindeki bir divanın üstüne oturmuş olan Leydi Narborough, koleksiyonuna kattığı en son Brezilya böceğinin tanımlamasını yapan düke kulak veriyormuş gibi yapıyordu. Şık, özentili smokinler giymiş üç genç adam hanımlara pasta dağıtmaktaydılar. Konakta o gün on iki kişi toplanmıştı. Ertesi gün başkalarının da gelmesi bekleniyordu.
es: Una semana después, Dorian Gray, en el invernadero de Selby Royal, hablaba con la duquesa de Monmouth, una mujer muy hermosa que, junto con su marido, sexagenario de aspecto fatigado, figuraba entre sus invitados. Era la hora del té y, sobre la mesa, la suave luz de la gran lámpara cubierta de encaje iluminaba la delicada porcelana y la plata repujada del servicio. La duquesa hacía los honores: sus manos blancas se movían armoniosamente entre las tazas, y sus encendidos labios sensuales sonreían escuchando las palabras que Dorian le susurraba al oído. Lord Henry, recostado en un sillón de mimbre cubierto con un paño de seda, los contemplaba. Sentada en un diván color melocotón, lady Narborough fingía escuchar la descripción que le hacía el duque del último escarabajo brasileño que acababa de añadir a su colección. Tres jóvenes elegantemente vestidos de esmoquin ofrecían pastas para el té a algunas de las señoras. Los invitados formaban un grupo de doce personas, y se esperaba que llegaran algunos más al día siguiente.
vi_translation: One week later, Dorian Gray was sitting in the conservatory at Selby Royal estate and conversing with the beautiful Duchess of Monmouth, she and her husband, a weary-looking man in his sixties, were his guests. It was tea time, and the gentle light from the large lace-covered lamp on the table illuminated the exquisite porcelain and the hammered silver of the tea set at the party hosted by the duchess. Her delicate white hands fluttered gracefully among the cups, and her full red lips smiled at something Dorian whispered in her ear. Lord Henry lay back on a silk-covered wicker chair and watched them. On the peach-colored sofa, Mrs. Narborough sat pretending to listen to the duke describe the latest Brazilian beetle he had added to his collection. Three young men in elaborate smoking attire were serving pastries and tea to several women. The group of guests staying at the house comprised twelve people, and hopefully more would arrive tomorrow.
tr_translation: A week had passed. Dorian Gray was sitting in the conservatory of Royal Selby, talking with the beautiful Duchess of Monmouth. The duchess's husband, a weary-looking man in his sixties, was also among the guests. It was tea time. The soft light of the large lamp with a lace shade on the table illuminated the fine porcelain and wrought silver of the tea set. The duchess was serving. As her white hands gently moved among the cups, her full red lips were smiling at something Dorian had whispered. Lord Henry, who was reclining in a wicker chair covered with silk, was observing them. Lady Narborough, who was sitting on a peach-colored sofa, was pretending to listen to the duke describing the latest Brazilian insect he had added to his collection. Three young men, dressed in stylish, pretentious tuxedos, were distributing cakes to the ladies. Twelve people had gathered at the mansion that day. More guests were expected to arrive the next day.
es_translation: A week later, Dorian Gray, in the conservatory of Selby Royal, was speaking with the Duchess of Monmouth, a very beautiful woman who, along with her husband, a weary-looking sexagenarian, was among his guests. It was tea time, and on the table, the soft light of the large lace-covered lamp illuminated the delicate porcelain and the embossed silver of the service. The Duchess was playing hostess: her white hands moved harmoniously among the cups, and her sensuous red lips smiled as she listened to the words Dorian whispered in her ear. Lord Henry, reclining in a wicker chair covered with a silk cloth, watched them. Seated on a peach-colored divan, Lady Narborough pretended to listen to the Duke's description of the latest Brazilian beetle he had just added to his collection. Three young men elegantly dressed in tuxedos offered tea pastries to some of the ladies. The guests formed a group of twelve people, and a few more were expected to arrive the next day.

en: “What are you two talking about?” said Lord Henry, strolling over to the table and putting his cup down. “I hope Dorian has told you about my plan for rechristening everything, Gladys. It is a delightful idea.”
vi: “Hai người đang chuyện trò về cái gì thế?” huân tước Henry nói, lững thững lại gần bàn, đặt tách xuống. “Tôi hy vọng là Dorian đã kể cô nghe về kế hoạch của tôi với việc đặt lại tên cho mọi thứ, Gladys. Đó là một ý tưởng thú vị.”
tr: Lord Henry aheste adımlarla masaya yaklaştı, çay bardağını elinden bırakarak, “Siz ikiniz neler konuşuyorsunuz böyle?” diye sordu. “Benim her şeye yeniden ad takma tasarımı umarım Dorian sana anlatmıştır, Gladys. Nefis bir fikir.
es: —¿De qué estáis hablando? —preguntó lord Henry, acercándose a la mesa y dejando la taza—. Confío en que Dorian te haya hablado de mi plan para rebautizarlo todo, Gladys. Es una idea deliciosa.
vi_translation: "What are you two talking about?" Lord Henry said, strolling leisurely towards the table and setting down his cup. "I hope Dorian has told you about my plan to rename everything, Gladys. It's an interesting idea."
tr_translation: Lord Henry approached the table slowly, putting down his tea cup, and asked, "What are you two talking about?" "I hope Dorian has told you about my plan to rename everything, Gladys. A splendid idea."
es_translation: —What are you talking about? —asked Lord Henry, approaching the table and setting down the cup—. I trust that Dorian has told you about my plan to rename everything, Gladys. It's a delightful idea.

en: “But I don’t want to be rechristened, Harry,” rejoined the duchess, looking up at him with her wonderful eyes. “I am quite satisfied with my own name, and I am sure Mr. Gray should be satisfied with his.”
vi: “Nhưng tôi không muốn bị đặt lại tên đâu, Harry,” nữ công tước cãi lại, ngước nhìn y bằng đôi mắt tuyệt đẹp của mình. “Tôi cảm thấy rất hài lòng với tên mình, và tôi chắc chắn là mít-tơ Gray cũng cảm thấy hài lòng với tên anh ấy.”
tr: Düşes o şahane gözlerini Lord Henry’nin yüzüne doğru kaldırarak, “Ama ben adımın değişmesini istemiyorum ki, Harry,” dedi. “Kendi adımdan hoşnudum ben. Sanırım mr Gray de kendi adından yakınmıyor.
es: —Pero yo no quiero cambiar de nombre, Harry —replicó la duquesa, obsequiándole con una maravillosa mirada de reproche—. Me gusta mucho el que tengo, y estoy seguro de que al señor Gray también le satisface el suyo.
vi_translation: “But I don't want to be renamed, Harry,” the duchess retorted, looking up at him with her beautiful eyes. “I am very satisfied with my name, and I am sure that Mr. Gray is also satisfied with his.”
tr_translation: The Duchess raised her magnificent eyes to Lord Henry's face and said, "But I don't want my name to be changed, Harry." "I am pleased with my own name. I think Mr. Gray is not complaining about his own name either."
es_translation: —But I don't want to change my name, Harry —replied the duchess, bestowing him with a wonderful look of reproach—. I like the one I have very much, and I am sure that Mr. Gray is also satisfied with his.

en: “My dear Gladys, I would not alter either name for the world. They are both perfect. I was thinking chiefly of flowers. Yesterday I cut an orchid, for my button-hole. It was a marvellous spotted thing, as effective as the seven deadly sins. In a thoughtless moment I asked one of the gardeners what it was called. He told me it was a fine specimen of Robinsoniana, or something dreadful of that kind. It is a sad truth, but we have lost the faculty of giving lovely names to things. Names are everything. I never quarrel with actions. My one quarrel is with words. That is the reason I hate vulgar realism in literature. The man who could call a spade a spade should be compelled to use one. It is the only thing he is fit for.”
vi: “Gladys yêu quý ơi, không đời nào tôi lại đổi tên hai người đâu. Cả hai cái tên ấy đều hoàn hảo rồi. Tôi đang nghĩ chủ yếu về hoa. Hôm qua tôi cắt một bông phong lan để cài khuyết áo. Nó là một thứ lổ đổ tuyệt diệu, hữu hiệu như bảy mối tội đầu. Trong một khoảnh khắc vô tư lự, tôi hỏi một người làm vườn xem nó được gọi là gì. Y bảo tôi rằng nó là một mẫu tuyệt đẹp của loài Robinsoniana, hoặc thứ gì đó kinh khiếp đại loại như vậy. Đúng là một sự thật đáng buồn, nhưng chúng ta đã mất khả năng đặt những cái tên đáng yêu cho các vật thể. Tên là tất cả. Tôi chẳng bao giờ phàn nàn về các hành vi. Sự phàn nàn duy nhất của tôi là với từ ngữ. Đó là lý do mà tôi ghét chủ nghĩa hiện thực thô tục trong văn chương. Ai có thể gọi cái xẻng là cái xẻng thì nên bị bắt phải dùng nó. Nó cũng là thứ duy nhất phù hợp với hắn.”
tr: “Sevgili Gladys, ne senin adını ne de onunkini, dünyaları verseler değiştirmem. İkisi de kusursuz. Ben en çok çiçekleri düşünüyordum. Dün bir orkide kesmiştim, yakama takmak için. Yedi günah kadar çarpıcı, benekli, harika bir şeydi. Akılsızlığım tuttu, bahçıvanlardan birine çiçeğin adını sordum. Çok cins bir Robinsoniana mı, işte öyle feci bir şey dedi. Hazin bir gerçek, ne var ki nesnelere güzel adlar takma yeteneğini yitirmişiz. Oysa ad her şey demektir. Ben eylemlerle hiç didişmem. Tek didiştiğim adlardır. Edebiyatta kaba saba gerçekçilikten de işte bu nedenle tiksiniyorum ya.
es: —Mi querida Gladys, no os cambiaría el nombre por nada del mundo a ninguno de los dos. Ambos son perfectos. Pensaba sobre todo en las flores. Ayer corté una orquídea para ponérmela en el ojal. Era una pequeña maravilla jaspeada, tan eficaz como los siete pecados capitales. En un momento de inconsciencia le pregunté a uno de los jardineros cómo se llamaba. Me dijo que era un hermoso ejemplar de Robinsoniana o algún otro espanto parecido. Es una triste verdad, pero hemos perdido la capacidad de poner nombres agradables a las cosas. Los nombres lo son todo. Nunca me quejo de las acciones, sólo de las palabras. Ése es el motivo de que aborrezca el realismo vulgar en literatura. A la persona capaz de llamar pala a una pala se la debería forzar a usarla. Es la única cosa para la que sirve.
vi_translation: “Dear Gladys, I would never change your names. Both names are already perfect. I am mainly thinking about flowers. Yesterday I cut an orchid to wear in my buttonhole. It was a marvelous, mottled thing, as effective as the seven deadly sins. In a moment of carelessness, I asked a gardener what it was called. He told me it was a beautiful specimen of Robinsoniana, or some other dreadful name like that. It is a sad truth, but we have lost the ability to give lovely names to things. Names are everything. I never complain about actions. My only complaint is about words. That is why I hate the vulgar realism in literature. Anyone who can call a spade a spade should be made to use it. It is the only thing suitable for him.”
tr_translation: "Dear Gladys, I wouldn't change either your name or his, even if they gave me the world. Both are perfect. I was mostly thinking about the flowers. Yesterday, I cut an orchid to wear on my lapel. It was as striking as the seven deadly sins, speckled, a wonderful thing. In my foolishness, I asked one of the gardeners for the name of the flower. He said something awful like a very rare Robinsoniana. A sad truth, but we have lost the ability to give beautiful names to things. Yet, a name means everything. I never quarrel with actions. The only thing I quarrel with are names. That's why I despise crude realism in literature."
es_translation: —My dear Gladys, I wouldn't change the name of either of you for anything in the world. Both are perfect. I was mostly thinking about the flowers. Yesterday I cut an orchid to put in my buttonhole. It was a small speckled marvel, as effective as the seven deadly sins. In a moment of unconsciousness, I asked one of the gardeners what it was called. He told me it was a beautiful specimen of Robinsoniana or some other similar horror. It's a sad truth, but we have lost the ability to give pleasant names to things. Names are everything. I never complain about actions, only about words. That is why I abhor vulgar realism in literature. The person capable of calling a spade a spade should be forced to use it. It's the only thing it's good for.

en: “Then what should we call you, Harry?” she asked.
vi: “Vậy rồi chúng tôi phải gọi anh là gì, Harry?” cô hỏi.
tr: Düşes, “Öyleyse sana ne ad takalım, Harry?” diye sordu.
es: —Y a ti, Harry, ¿cómo deberíamos llamarte? —preguntó la duquesa.
vi_translation: "So what should we call you, Harry?" she asked.
tr_translation: The Duchess asked, "So what shall we call you, Harry?"
es_translation: —And you, Harry, what should we call you? —asked the duchess.

en: “His name is Prince Paradox,” said Dorian.
vi: “Tên anh ấy là Hoàng tử Ngược ngạo,” Dorian nói.
tr: Dorian, “Onun adı Prens İkilem’dir,” dedi.
es: —Se llama Príncipe Paradoja —dijo Dorian.
vi_translation: “His name is the Contrary Prince,” Dorian said.
tr_translation: Dorian said, "His name is Prince Dilemma."
es_translation: —His name is Prince Paradox —said Dorian. —There is no doubt that it is him!

en: “I recognize him in a flash,” exclaimed the duchess.
vi: “Tôi nhận ra anh ấy ngay tức thì,” nữ công tước la lên.
tr: Düşes, “Anında tanıdım!” diye el çırptı.
es: —¡No cabe duda de que es él! —exclamó la duquesa.
vi_translation: “I recognized him immediately,” the duchess exclaimed.
tr_translation: The Duchess clapped her hands and exclaimed, "I recognized it instantly!"
es_translation: —exclaimed the duchess.

en: “I won’t hear of it,” laughed Lord Henry, sinking into a chair. “From a label there is no escape! I refuse the title.”
vi: “Tôi sẽ không đồng ý đâu” huân tước Henry cười, hạ mình xuống ghế. “Cái nhãn đã dán là không trốn được! Tôi từ chối danh hiệu này.”
tr: Lord Henry, “Sakın ha!” diye gülerek bir koltuğa çöktü. “Kişiye damga vuruldu mu kurtuluş yoktur! Bu sanı geri çeviriyorum.
es: —De ninguna de las maneras —rió lord Henry, dejándose caer en una silla—. ¡No hay forma de escapar a una etiqueta! Rechazo ese título.
vi_translation: “I will not agree,” Lord Henry laughed, lowering himself into the chair. “Once the label is attached, it cannot be escaped! I refuse this title.”
tr_translation: Lord Henry, "Don't you dare!" he said, laughing as he sank into a chair. "Once a person is branded, there is no escape! I reject this notion."
es_translation: —By no means —laughed Lord Henry, dropping into a chair—. There is no way to escape a label! I reject that title.

en: “Royalties may not abdicate,” fell as a warning from pretty lips.
vi: “Các hoàng thân không thể thoái vị được đâu,” buột ra như lời cảnh cáo từ đôi môi xinh.
tr: Düşesin güzel dudaklarından, “Saraylıların sanlarından vazgeçmelerine izin yoktur,” diye bir uyarı döküldü.
es: —La realeza no debe abdicar —fue la advertencia que lanzaron unos hermosos labios.
vi_translation: “Princes cannot abdicate,” slipped out as a warning from her lovely lips.
tr_translation: A warning fell from the Duchess's beautiful lips, "The nobles are not allowed to renounce their titles."
es_translation: —Royalty must not abdicate —was the warning issued by some beautiful lips.

en: “You wish me to defend my throne, then?”
vi: “Vậy là cô muốn tôi giữ ngôi, phải không?”
tr: “Tahtımı savunayım mı istiyorsun öyleyse?
es: —¿Deseas, entonces, que defienda mi trono?
vi_translation: “So you want me to keep the throne, don't you?”
tr_translation: "So, you want me to defend my throne?""
es_translation: —Do you wish, then, that I defend my throne?

en: “Yes.”
vi: “Vâng.
tr: “Evet.
es: —Sí.
vi_translation: “Yes.”
tr_translation: “Yes.”
es_translation: —Yes.

en: “I give the truths of to-morrow.”
vi: “Tôi sẽ công bố các sự thật của ngày mai.
tr: “Ben yarının doğrularını bildiririm.
es: —Ofrezco las verdades de mañana.
vi_translation: “I will reveal the truths of tomorrow.”
tr_translation: “I will inform the truths of tomorrow.”
es_translation: —I offer the truths of tomorrow.

en: “I prefer the mistakes of to-day,” she answered.
vi: “Tôi thích lỗi lầm hôm nay hơn,” cô đáp lại.
tr: Genç kadın, “Ben bugünün yanılgılarını yeğlerim,” diye yanıtladı.
es: —Prefiero las equivocaciones de hoy —respondió ella.
vi_translation: “I prefer today's mistakes,” she replied.
tr_translation: The young woman replied, "I prefer today's mistakes."
es_translation: —I prefer today's mistakes —she replied.

en: “You disarm me, Gladys,” he cried, catching the wilfulness of her mood.
vi: “Cô lột hết vũ khí của tôi rồi, Gladys,” y kêu lên, bắt theo tâm tính ương ngạnh của cô.
tr: Lord Henry de onun kaprisli havasına ayak uydurarak, “Silahımı elimden alıyorsun, Gladys!” dedi.
es: —Me desarmas, Gladys —exclamó lord Henry, advirtiendo lo obstinado de su actitud.
vi_translation: “You've stripped me of all my weapons, Gladys,” he exclaimed, catching on to her stubborn temperament.
tr_translation: Lord Henry, matching her capricious mood, said, "You are disarming me, Gladys!"
es_translation: —You disarm me, Gladys —exclaimed Lord Henry, noticing the stubbornness of her attitude.

en: “Of your shield, Harry, not of your spear.”
vi: “Lột khiên thôi, Harry: không phải giáo.
tr: “Kalkanını aldım, Harry, mızrağını değil.
es: —De tu escudo, pero no de tu lanza.
vi_translation: "Take off the shield, Harry: not the spear.""
tr_translation: “I took his shield, Harry, not his spear.”
es_translation: —Of your shield, but not of your spear.

en: “I never tilt against beauty,” he said, with a wave of his hand.
vi: “Tôi chẳng bao giờ chọc giáo vào Sắc đẹp,” y nói, với cái vẫy tay.
tr: Lord Henry elini şöyle bir sallayarak, “Ben güzellikle asla dövüşe tutuşmam,” dedi.
es: —Nunca arremeto contra la belleza —dijo él, haciendo un gesto de sumisión con la mano.
vi_translation: “I never poke a spear at Beauty,” he said, with a wave of his hand.
tr_translation: Lord Henry, waving his hand slightly, said, "I never argue with beauty."
es_translation: —I never attack beauty —he said, making a gesture of submission with his hand.

en: “That is your error, Harry, believe me. You value beauty far too much.”
vi: “Đó là lỗi của anh, Harry, tin tôi đi. Anh đánh giá sắc đẹp quá cao đó.”
tr: “Senin yanlışın da bu, inan bana, Harry. Güzelliğe aşırı değer biçiyorsun.
es: —Ése es tu error, Harry, créeme. Valoras demasiado la belleza.
vi_translation: “It is your fault, Harry, believe me. You overestimate beauty too much.”
tr_translation: “That's your mistake too, believe me, Harry. You place too much value on beauty.”
es_translation: —That is your mistake, Harry, believe me. You value beauty too much.

en: “How can you say that? I admit that I think that it is better to be beautiful than to be good. But on the other hand, no one is more ready than I am to acknowledge that it is better to be good than to be ugly.”
vi: “Sao cô có thể nói thế được? Tôi thừa nhận rằng tôi nghĩ là đẹp thì hơn ngoan. Nhưng mặt khác thì không ai sẵn sàng công nhận hơn tôi là ngoan thì hơn xấu.”
tr: “Nasıl böyle söylersin? Gerçi itiraf ederim, güzel olmanın erdemli olmaktan iyi olduğu görüşündeyimdir. Öte yandan erdemli olmanın çirkin olmaktan yeğ olduğunu da herkesten önce ben kabul ederim.
es: —¿Cómo puedes decir eso? Reconozco que, en mi opinión, es mejor ser hermoso que bueno. Pero, por otra parte, nadie está más dispuesto que yo a admitir que es mejor ser bueno que feo.
vi_translation: “How can you say that? I admit that I think being beautiful is better than being obedient. But on the other hand, no one is more willing to acknowledge than I am that being obedient is better than being ugly.”
tr_translation: "How can you say such a thing? Although I admit, I am of the opinion that being beautiful is better than being virtuous. On the other hand, I am the first to accept that being virtuous is preferable to being ugly."
es_translation: —How can you say that? I recognize that, in my opinion, it is better to be beautiful than good. But, on the other hand, no one is more willing than I am to admit that it is better to be good than ugly.

en: “Ugliness is one of the seven deadly sins, then?” cried the duchess. “What becomes of your simile about the orchid?”
vi: “Vậy thì sự xấu xí là một trong bảy mối tội đầu hay sao?” nữ công tước kêu lên. “Thế chuyện gì đã xảy ra với nụ cười của anh về hoa lan?”
tr: Düşes, “Çirkinlik yedi ölümcül günahtan biri sence, öyle mi?” diye sordu. “O zaman orkide konusundaki benzetmen, ne oluyor, peki?
es: —En ese caso, ¿la fealdad es uno de los siete pecados capitales? —exclamó la duquesa—. ¿Y qué sucede con tu metáfora sobre la orquídea?
vi_translation: “So, is ugliness one of the seven deadly sins?” the duchess exclaimed. “What happened to your smile about the orchids?”
tr_translation: The Duchess asked, "Do you think ugliness is one of the seven deadly sins?" "Then what about your metaphor regarding the orchid?"
es_translation: —In that case, is ugliness one of the seven deadly sins? —exclaimed the duchess—. And what about your metaphor about the orchid?

en: “Ugliness is one of the seven deadly virtues, Gladys. You, as a good Tory, must not underrate them. Beer, the Bible, and the seven deadly virtues have made our England what she is.”
vi: “Sự xấu xí là một trong bảy mối đức đầu, Gladys. Cô, với tư cách một thành viên trung thành của đảng Bảo thủ, không nên đánh giá thấp chúng. Bia, Kinh Thánh, và bảy mối đức đầu đã làm cho nước Anh của chúng ta thành ra thế này”
tr: “Çirkinlik yedi ölümcül erdemden biridir, Gladys. Sen Muhafazakâr Parti’nin sadık bir üyesi olarak bu erdemleri hafife almamak durumundasın. İngiltere’mizi bugünkü durumuna getiren, bira, İncil ve yedi ölümcül erdem olmuştur.
es: —La fealdad es una de las siete virtudes capitales, Gladys. Tú, como buena tory, no debes subestimarlas. La cerveza, la Biblia y las siete virtudes capitales han hecho de nuestra Inglaterra lo que es.
vi_translation: “Ugliness is one of the seven deadly virtues, Gladys. You, as a loyal member of the Conservative party, should not underestimate them. Beer, the Bible, and the seven deadly virtues have made our England what it is.”
tr_translation: “Ugliness is one of the seven deadly virtues, Gladys. As a loyal member of the Conservative Party, you must not underestimate these virtues. It is beer, the Bible, and the seven deadly virtues that have brought our England to its current state.”
es_translation: —Ugliness is one of the seven capital virtues, Gladys. You, as a good Tory, should not underestimate them. Beer, the Bible, and the seven capital virtues have made our England what it is.

en: “You don’t like your country, then?” she asked.
vi: “Vậy là anh không thích nước mình hay sao?” cô hỏi.
tr: Düşes, “Vatanını pek sevmiyorsun demek?” diye sordu.
es: —¿Quiere eso decir que no te gusta tu país? —preguntó la duquesa.
vi_translation: “So, you don't like our country?” she asked.
tr_translation: The Duchess asked, "So, you don't love your country very much?"
es_translation: —Does that mean you don't like your country? —asked the duchess.

en: “I live in it.”
vi: “Tôi sống trong nó.”
tr: “Vatanımda yaşıyorum ya.
es: —Vivo en él.
vi_translation: “I live in it.”
tr_translation: “I live in my homeland.”
es_translation: —I live in it.

en: “That you may censure it the better.”
vi: “Để anh có thể chỉ trích nó tốt hơn.”
tr: “Eleştirsen daha iyi.
es: —Para poder censurarlo mejor.
vi_translation: "So that he can criticize it better."
tr_translation: “It would be better if you criticized.”
es_translation: —To be able to censor it better.

en: “Would you have me take the verdict of Europe on it?” he inquired.
vi: “Chẳng lẽ cô muốn tôi chấp nhận dư luận của châu Âu về nó?” y hỏi lại.
tr: Lord Henry, “Vatanım konusunda Avrupa’nın görüşünü mü alayım isterdiniz?” diye sordu.
es: —¿Prefieres que acepte el veredicto de Europa? —quiso saber lord Henry.
vi_translation: "Do you really want me to accept Europe's opinion about it?" he asked back.
tr_translation: Lord Henry, "Would you like me to take Europe's view on my homeland?" he asked.
es_translation: "Do you prefer that I accept Europe's verdict?" Lord Henry wanted to know.

en: “What do they say of us?”
vi: “Họ nói gì về ta vậy?”
tr: “Ne diyor onlar bizim için?
es: —¿Qué dicen de nosotros?
vi_translation: “What are they saying about me?”
tr_translation: “What are they saying about us?”
es_translation: —What do they say about us?

en: “That Tartuffe has emigrated to England and opened a shop.”
vi: “Là Đạo đức giả đã di cư đến Anh và mở một cửa hàng.”
tr: “Tartuffe İngiltere’ye yerleşti, dükkân işletiyor, diyorlar.
es: —Que Tartufo ha emigrado a Inglaterra y ha abierto una tienda.
vi_translation: “It was Hypocrisy who emigrated to England and opened a shop.”
tr_translation: "They say Tartuffe has settled in England and is running a shop."
es_translation: —That Tartuffe has emigrated to England and opened a shop.

en: “Is that yours, Harry?”
vi: “Chuyện của anh hả, Harry?”
tr: “Senin mi bu buluş, Harry?
es: —¿Es eso de tu cosecha, Harry?
vi_translation: “Your story, Harry?”
tr_translation: "Is this your invention, Harry?"
es_translation: —Is that your own doing, Harry?

en: “I give it to you.”
vi: “Tôi tặng nó cho cô.”
tr: “Sana sunuyorum.
es: —Te lo regalo.
vi_translation: “I give it to you.”
tr_translation: “I present it to you.”
es_translation: —I give it to you as a gift.

en: “I could not use it. It is too true.”
vi: “Tôi không thể dùng nó. Nó quá đúng.”
tr: “Kullanamam ki! Gereğinden fazla doğru.
es: —No podría utilizarlo. Es demasiado cierto.
vi_translation: “I can't use it. It's too accurate.”
tr_translation: “I can't use it! It's too accurate.”
es_translation: —I couldn't use it. It's too true.

en: “You need not be afraid. Our countrymen never recognize a description.”
vi: “Cô không phải lo. Các đồng hương của ta chẳng bao giờ nhận ra sự mô tả nào.”
tr: “Korkman için hiç neden yok. Yurttaşlarımız tanımlardan hiçbir şey çıkartamazlar.
es: —No tienes por qué asustarte. Nuestros compatriotas nunca reconocen una descripción.
vi_translation: "You don't have to worry." "My compatriots will never recognize any description."
tr_translation: “There is no reason for worry. Our citizens cannot infer anything from the definitions.”
es_translation: —You have no reason to be scared. Our compatriots never recognize a description.

en: “They are practical.”
vi: “Họ thực dụng.
tr: “Pratiktirler de ondan.
es: —Son gente práctica.
vi_translation: “They are practical.”
tr_translation: “They are also imitators of him.”
es_translation: —They are practical people.

en: “They are more cunning than practical. When they make up their ledger, they balance stupidity by wealth, and vice by hypocrisy.”
vi: “Họ khôn vặt hơn là thực dụng. Khi họ lập sổ cái, họ cân đối sự ngu đần bằng sự giàu có, và sự đồi bại bằng sự đạo đức giả.”
tr: “Pratikten çok kurnazdırlar. Hesap defterlerini tutarken budalalığı servetle dengelerler, kötü huylarını da ikiyüzlülükle.
es: —Son más astutos que prácticos. A la hora de la contabilidad, compensan estupidez con riqueza y vicio con hipocresía.
vi_translation: “They are more cunning than practical. When they create a ledger, they balance stupidity with wealth, and depravity with hypocrisy.”
tr_translation: “They are more cunning than practical. While keeping their account books, they balance foolishness with wealth, and their bad habits with hypocrisy.”
es_translation: —They are more cunning than practical. When it comes to accounting, they compensate stupidity with wealth and vice with hypocrisy.

en: “Still, we have done great things.”
vi: “Tuy nhiên, ta đã làm nhiều việc vĩ đại.
tr: “Gene de büyük işler başarmışız.
es: —Hemos hecho grandes cosas, de todos modos.
vi_translation: “However, I have done many great things.”
tr_translation: “We have accomplished great things together.”
es_translation: —We have done great things, anyway.

en: “Great things have been thrust on us, Gladys.”
vi: “Những việc vĩ đại đã bị ấn lên ta, Gladys.”
tr: “Büyük şeyler bize zorla yamandı, Gladys.
es: —Grandes cosas se nos han venido encima, Gladys.
vi_translation: "Great things have been impressed upon us, Gladys."
tr_translation: “Big things were forced upon us, Gladys.”
es_translation: —Great things have come upon us, Gladys.

en: “We have carried their burden.”
vi: “Ta đã mang gánh nặng của chúng.”
tr: “Yüklerini taşıdık ama.
es: —Hemos cargado con su peso.
vi_translation: “We have borne their burdens.”
tr_translation: “But we carried their loads.”
es_translation: —We have carried their weight.

en: “Only as far as the Stock Exchange.”
vi: “Chỉ xa đến tận sàn giao dịch chứng khoán.”
tr: “Yalnızca borsada.
es: —Sólo hasta el edificio de la Bolsa.
vi_translation: “Only as far as the stock exchange.”
tr_translation: “Only in the stock market.”
es_translation: —Just to the Stock Exchange building.

en: She shook her head. “I believe in the race,” she cried.
vi: Cô lắc đầu. “Tôi tin vào chủng tộc,” cô la lên.
tr: Düşes başını sallayarak, “Benim ırkımıza inancım var,” dedi.
es: La duquesa movió la cabeza. —Creo en la raza —exclamó.
vi_translation: She shook her head. “I believe in the race,” she shouted.
tr_translation: The Duchess nodded, "I have faith in my race," she said.
es_translation: The duchess moved her head. —I believe in the race —he exclaimed.

en: “It represents the survival of the pushing.”
vi: “Nó tượng trưng cho tàn tích của sự tự khẳng định.
tr: “Ancak yırtıkların ayakta kalabildiğinin resmidir, bizim ırk.
es: —La raza representa el triunfo de los arribistas.
vi_translation: “It symbolizes the remnants of self-assertion.”
tr_translation: “However, it is the picture of the torn ones that can stand, our race.”
es_translation: —The race represents the triumph of the social climbers.

en: “It has development.”
vi: “Nó có sự phát triển.
tr: “Gelişme göstermiştir.
es: —Eso significa progreso.
vi_translation: “It has development.”
tr_translation: “It has shown improvement.”
es_translation: —That means progress.

en: “Decay fascinates me more.”
vi: “Sự suy tàn quyến rũ tôi hơn.”
tr: “Yozlaşma daha çok ilgilendirir beni.
es: —La decadencia me fascina más.
vi_translation: “The decline fascinates me more.”
tr_translation: “Corruption concerns me more.”
es_translation: —Decadence fascinates me more.

en: “What of art?” she asked.
vi: “Còn về Nghệ thuật thì sao?” cô hỏi.
tr: Düşes, “Ya sanata ne diyorsun?” diye sordu.
es: —¿Y dónde dejas el arte? —preguntó ella.
vi_translation: “What about Art?” she asked.
tr_translation: The Duchess asked, "And what do you say about art?"
es_translation: —And where do you leave art? —she asked.

en: “It is a malady.”
vi: “Nó là căn bệnh.
tr: “Bir illettir.
es: —Es una enfermedad.
vi_translation: “It is a disease.”
tr_translation: “It is a disease.”
es_translation: —It's an illness.

en: “Love?”
vi: “Ái tình?”
tr: “Aşk?
es: —¿El amor?
vi_translation: “Love?”
tr_translation: “Love?”
es_translation: —Love?

en: “An illusion.”
vi: “Một ảo tưởng.
tr: “Yanılsama.
es: —Una ilusión.
vi_translation: “An illusion.”
tr_translation: “Illusion.”
es_translation: —An illusion.

en: “Religion?”
vi: “Tôn giáo?”
tr: “Din?
es: —¿La religión?
vi_translation: “Religion?”
tr_translation: “Day?”
es_translation: —Religion?

en: “The fashionable substitute for belief.”
vi: “Thế phẩm hợp mốt cho Đức tin.”
tr: “İnancın yerini tutan günün modası.
es: —El sucedáneo elegante de la fe.
vi_translation: "The fashionable substitute for Faith."
tr_translation: “The fashion of the day that replaces faith.”
es_translation: —The elegant substitute for faith.

en: “You are a sceptic.”
vi: “Anh là kẻ hoài nghi.
tr: “Sen kuşkucusun.
es: —Eres un escéptico.
vi_translation: “You are a skeptic.”
tr_translation: “You are skeptical.”
es_translation: —You are a skeptic.

en: “Never! Scepticism is the beginning of faith.”
vi: “Không hề! Chủ nghĩa hoài nghi là căn nguyên của niềm tin.
tr: “Hiç de değil. Kuşkuculuk imanın başlangıcıdır.
es: —¡Jamás! El escepticismo es el comienzo de la fe.
vi_translation: "Not at all! Skepticism is the root of faith."
tr_translation: “Not at all. Skepticism is the beginning of faith.”
es_translation: —Never! Skepticism is the beginning of faith.

en: “What are you?”
vi: “Anh là ai?”
tr: “Ya nesin sen öyleyse?
es: —¿Qué eres entonces?
vi_translation: "Who are you?"
tr_translation: “What are you then?”
es_translation: —What are you then?

en: “To define is to limit.”
vi: “Định nghĩa là định hạn.
tr: “Tanımlamak kısıtlamaktır.
es: —Definir es limitar.
vi_translation: "To define is to limit.""
tr_translation: “To define is to limit.”
es_translation: —To define is to limit.

en: “Give me a clue.”
vi: “Cho tôi một đầu mối.”
tr: “Bir ipucu ver bana.
es: —Dame una pista.
vi_translation: "Give me a lead."
tr_translation: “Give me a clue.”
es_translation: —Give me a hint.

en: “Threads snap. You would lose your way in the labyrinth.”
vi: “Chỉ đứt. Cô sẽ lạc lối trong mê cung.
tr: “İp dediğin kopar. Labirentte kaybolabilirsin.
es: —Los hilos se rompen. Te perderías en el laberinto.
vi_translation: “Just broken. You will get lost in the maze.”
tr_translation: “A string can break. You can get lost in the labyrinth.”
es_translation: —The threads break. You would get lost in the labyrinth.

en: “You bewilder me. Let us talk of some one else.”
vi: “Anh làm tôi bối rối. Ta hãy nói về ai đó khác.
tr: “Aklımı şaşırtıyorsun. Başka birinden konuşalım.
es: —Me desconciertas. Hablemos de otras personas.
vi_translation: "You make me confused. Let's talk about someone else."
tr_translation: "You astonish me. Let's talk about someone else."
es_translation: —You baffle me. Let's talk about other people.

en: “Our host is a delightful topic. Years ago he was christened Prince Charming.”
vi: “Chủ nhà của ta là một chủ đề thú vị. Nhiều năm trước, cậu ấy được đặt tên là Hoàng tử Quyến rũ.”
tr: “Ev sahibimiz enfes bir konu. Yıllar önce Tatlı Prens adını vermişlerdi.
es: —Nuestro anfitrión es un tema inmejorable. Hace años le pusieron el nombre de Príncipe Azul.
vi_translation: “Our host is an interesting subject. Many years ago, he was named Prince Charming.”
tr_translation: “Our host is a delightful subject. Years ago, they named him Sweet Prince.”
es_translation: —Our host is an unbeatable topic. Years ago, they gave him the name Prince Charming.

en: “Ah! don’t remind me of that,” cried Dorian Gray.
vi: “Ôi! Đừng nhắc tôi về điều ấy,” Dorian Gray kêu lên.
tr: Dorian, “Ay, onu anımsatma bana!” diye bağırdı.
es: —¡Ah! No me lo recuerdes —exclamó Dorian Gray.
vi_translation: “Oh! Don't remind me of that,” Dorian Gray exclaimed.
tr_translation: Dorian shouted, "Oh, don't remind me of that!"
es_translation: —Ah! Don't remind me —exclaimed Dorian Gray.

en: “Our host is rather horrid this evening,” answered the duchess, colouring. “I believe he thinks that Monmouth married me on purely scientific principles as the best specimen he could find of a modern butterfly.”
vi: “Chủ nhà của ta chiều nay khá là khó chịu,” nữ công tước trả lời, đỏ mặt lên. “Tôi tin là anh ấy nghĩ rằng Monmouth lấy tôi làm vợ dựa theo những nguyên lý khoa học thuần túy như mẫu vật tốt nhất mà ông ấy có thể tìm thấy về một con bướm tân thời.”
tr: Düşes pembeleşerek, “Ev sahibimiz bu gece biraz tatsız,” dedi. “Monmouth’un benimle salt bilimsel nedenlerle evlendiğini düşünüyor sanırım; beni çağdaş kelebeklerin en iyi örneği saydığı için.
es: —Nuestro anfitrión no está hoy demasiado amable -respondió la duquesa, ruborizándose—. En mi opinión, cree que Monmouth se casó conmigo por razones puramente científicas, por ser el mejor ejemplar disponible de la mariposa moderna.
vi_translation: “Our host this afternoon was quite unpleasant,” the duchess replied, blushing. “I believe he thinks that Monmouth married me based on purely scientific principles, like the best specimen he could find of a modern butterfly.”
tr_translation: The Duchess blushingly said, "Our host is a bit unpleasant tonight." "I think he believes Monmouth married me for purely scientific reasons; because he considers me the best example of contemporary butterflies."
es_translation: —Our host is not very kind today -replied the duchess, blushing—. In my opinion, he believes that Monmouth married me for purely scientific reasons, for being the best available specimen of the modern butterfly.

en: “Well, I hope he won’t stick pins into you, Duchess,” laughed Dorian.
vi: “Vậy sao, tôi mong là ông ấy không chọc đinh ghim vào cô, thưa nữ công tước,” Dorian cười.
tr: Dorian, “Öyleyse umarım size iğne batırmaz, düşes,” diye güldü.
es: —Espero que no la retenga clavándole alfileres, duquesa —rió Dorian.
vi_translation: "Is that so? I hope he doesn't stick a pin in you, Duchess," Dorian laughed.
tr_translation: Dorian laughed, "Well, then I hope she doesn't prick you with a needle, Duchess."
es_translation: "I hope you are not keeping her by sticking pins into her, Duchess," laughed Dorian.

en: “Oh! my maid does that already, Mr. Gray, when she is annoyed with me.”
vi: “Ôi! Người hầu của tôi đã làm thế rồi, mít-tơ Gray, khi nó tức tôi.”
tr: Dorian, “Öyleyse umarım size iğne batırmaz, düşes,” diye güldü. “A canım, oda hizmetçim sık sık yapıyor onu, bana içerlediği zaman.
es: —Espero que no la retenga clavándole alfileres, duquesa —rió Dorian. —Eso ya lo hace mi doncella, señor Gray, cuando está enfadada conmigo.
vi_translation: "Oh! My servant did that, Mr. Gray, when he was angry with me."
tr_translation: Dorian laughed, "Well, then I hope she doesn't prick you with a needle, Duchess." "Oh dear, my room maid often does that when she is upset with me."
es_translation: "I hope you are not keeping her by sticking pins into her, Duchess," laughed Dorian. —My maid already does that, Mr. Gray, when she's angry with me.

en: “And what does she get annoyed with you about, Duchess?”
vi: “Thế nó tức cô vì chuyện gì vậy, nữ công tước?”
tr: “Peki, size ne yüzden içerliyor, düşes?
es: —Y, ¿qué motivos tiene para enfadarse con usted, duquesa?
vi_translation: "So why is he angry with you, Duchess?"
tr_translation: “Well, why is she upset with you, Duchess?”
es_translation: —And, what reasons does she have to be angry with you, Duchess?

en: “For the most trivial things, Mr. Gray, I assure you. Usually because I come in at ten minutes to nine and tell her that I must be dressed by half-past eight.”
vi: “Vì những chuyện hết sức vớ vẩn, mít-tơ Gray, tôi cam đoan với anh. Thường thì vì tôi đến vào lúc chín giờ kém mười và bảo nó là tôi phải được mặc đồ xong trước tám rưỡi.”
tr: “İnanın bana, en entipüften şeyler yüzünden, mr Gray. Saat dokuza on kala onu çağırıp da, saat sekiz buçukta giyinmiş, hazırlanmış olmam gerektiğini söylediğim zaman kırılıyor, çoğunlukla.
es: —Las cosas más triviales, señor Gray, se lo aseguro. De ordinario me presento a las nueve menos diez y le digo que debo estar vestida para las ocho y media.
vi_translation: "For the most trivial matters, Mr. Gray, I assure you. Usually because I arrive at ten to nine and tell him that I must be dressed by half past eight."
tr_translation: “Believe me, Mr. Gray, it's often over the most trivial things. When I call him at ten to nine and tell him that I should have been dressed and ready by half-past eight, he gets upset, most of the time.”
es_translation: —The most trivial things, Mr. Gray, I assure you. Usually, I show up at ten to nine and tell him that I must be dressed by half-past eight.

en: “How unreasonable of her! You should give her warning.”
vi: “Sao mà nó vô lý thế! Cô phải cảnh cáo nó.”
tr: “Ne tutarsız kızmış! Yol vermelisiniz ona.
es: —¡Qué poco razonable por su parte! Debería usted despedirla.
vi_translation: “How unreasonable it is! You have to warn her.”
tr_translation: “What an inconsistent girl! You should let her pass.”
es_translation: —How unreasonable of her! You should fire her.

en: “I daren’t, Mr. Gray. Why, she invents hats for me. You remember the one I wore at Lady Hilstone’s garden-party? You don’t, but it is nice of you to pretend that you do. Well, she made it out of nothing. All good hats are made out of nothing.”
vi: “Tôi không dám đâu, mít-tơ Gray. Vì sao, nó chế ra những chiếc mũ cho tôi. Anh có nhớ cái tôi đội ở bữa tiệc trong vườn nhà bà Hilstone không? Anh không nhớ, nhưng anh thật tử tế khi giả bộ là có nhớ. Đấy, nó làm ra cái mũ ấy chẳng từ cái gì cả. Mọi cái mũ đẹp đều được làm ra chẳng từ cái gì cả.”
tr: “Bunu göze alamam, mr Gray. Bu kız şapkalar icat ediyor benim için. Leydi Hilstone’un bahçe partisinde taktığım şapka aklınızda mı? Değil ama çok şeker olduğunuz için anımsamış numarası yapıyorsunuz. Neyse, işte hizmetçim bu şapkayı yoktan var etti. Bütün güzel şapkalar yoktan var edilenlerdir.
es: —No me atrevo, señor Gray. Inventa sombreros para mí, sin ir más lejos. ¿Recuerda el que me puse para la fiesta al aire libre de lady Hilstone? Claro que no, pero es usted muy amable fingiendo lo contrario. Bien: me lo hizo ella de nada. Todos los buenos sombreros están hechos de nada.
vi_translation: “I don't dare, Mr. Gray. Because, she makes hats for me. Do you remember the one I wore at Mrs. Hilstone's garden party? You don't remember, but you are so kind to pretend that you do. Well, she made that hat out of nothing. All beautiful hats are made out of nothing.”
tr_translation: “I can't risk it, Mr. Gray. This girl invents hats for me. Do you remember the hat I wore at Lady Hilstone's garden party? You don't, but you're pretending to remember because you're so sweet. Anyway, my maid conjured that hat out of nothing. All beautiful hats are conjured out of nothing.”
es_translation: —I don't dare, Mr. Gray. She invents hats for me, to say the least. Do you remember the one I wore to Lady Hilstone's outdoor party? Of course you don't, but you're very kind to pretend otherwise. Well, she made it for me out of nothing. All good hats are made out of nothing.

en: “Like all good reputations, Gladys,” interrupted Lord Henry. “Every effect that one produces gives one an enemy. To be popular one must be a mediocrity.”
vi: “Như mọi thanh danh thôi, Gladys,” huân tước Henry ngắt lời. “Mỗi ấn tượng mà ta tạo ra đều đem lại cho ta một kẻ thù. Để được lòng thiên hạ thì ta phải là một kẻ tầm thường.
tr: “Güzel kişilerin ünleri gibi, Gladys!” diye Lord Henry lafa karıştı. “Kişinin yarattığı her etki kişiye bir düşman kazandırır. Toplumda gözde olmak için orta karar olmak gerekir.
es: —Como todas las buenas reputaciones, Gladys —le interrumpió lord Henry—. Cada efecto que uno produce le crea un enemigo. Para conseguir la popularidad hay que ser mediocre.
vi_translation: “Like all reputations, Gladys,” Lord Henry interrupted. “Every impression we create brings us an enemy. To be liked by everyone, we must be a mediocre person.”
tr_translation: “Like the fame of beautiful people, Gladys!” Lord Henry interjected. “Every effect a person creates earns them an enemy. To be popular in society, one must be mediocre.”
es_translation: —Like all good reputations, Gladys —interrupted Lord Henry—. Every effect one produces creates an enemy. To achieve popularity, one must be mediocre.

en: “Not with women,” said the duchess, shaking her head; “and women rule the world. I assure you we can’t bear mediocrities. We women, as some one says, love with our ears, just as you men love with your eyes, if you ever love at all.”
vi: “Không phải với đàn bà,” nữ công tước vừa nói vừa lắc đầu; “và đàn bà thống trị thế gian. Tôi đoan chắc với anh rằng chúng tôi không thể chịu được bọn người tầm thường. Đàn bà chúng tôi, như ai đó nói, yêu bằng tai, y như đàn ông các anh yêu bằng mắt, ấy là giả dụ như các anh nói chung có khi nào đó biết yêu.”
tr: Düşes, “Kadınlar için hiç de öyle değil,” diye başını salladı. “Dünyayı yönetenler de kadınlardır. İnanın bana, orta karar şeylerden nefret ederiz biz. Birilerinin dediği gibi, biz kadınlar kulağımızla severiz, nasıl ki siz erkekler de gözünüzle seversiniz, yani severseniz eğer.
es: —No en el caso de las mujeres —dijo la duquesa agitando la cabeza—; y las mujeres gobiernan el mundo. Te aseguro que no soportan a los mediocres. Nosotras las mujeres, como dice alguien, amamos con los oídos, igual que vosotros, los hombres, amáis con los ojos, si es que amáis alguna vez.
vi_translation: “Not with women,” the duchess said, shaking her head; “and women rule the world. I assure you that we cannot stand ordinary people. We women, as someone said, love with our ears, just as you men love with your eyes, that is, assuming you ever know how to love at all.”
tr_translation: The Duchess shook her head, "Not at all for women," she said. "It is women who rule the world. Believe me, we hate mediocre things. As someone once said, we women love with our ears, just as you men love with your eyes, that is, if you love at all."
es_translation: —Not in the case of women —said the duchess, shaking her head—; and women rule the world. I assure you they do not tolerate mediocrity. We women, as someone says, love with our ears, just as you men love with your eyes, if you ever love at all.

en: “It seems to me that we never do anything else,” murmured Dorian.
vi: “Tôi thấy dường như chúng tôi chẳng bao giờ làm gì khác chứ nhỉ,” Dorian thì thầm.
tr: “Sevmekten başka bir şey yapmayız, gibi geliyor bana,” diye Dorian mırıldandı.
es: —Yo diría que apenas hacemos otra cosa —murmuró Dorian.
vi_translation: “It seems like we never do anything else, do we?” Dorian whispered.
tr_translation: “It seems to me that we do nothing but love,” Dorian murmured.
es_translation: —I would say we hardly do anything else —murmured Dorian.

en: “Ah! then, you never really love, Mr. Gray,” answered the duchess with mock sadness.
vi: “Ôi! Vậy thì anh chưa bao giờ thật sự yêu rồi, mít-tơ Gray,” nữ công tước trả lời, ra vẻ buồn bã.
tr: Düşes yapmacık bir üzüntüyle, “Ya! Demek aslında hiç sevmiyorsunuz, mr Gray!” dedi.
es: —Yo diría que apenas hacemos otra cosa —murmuró Dorian. —En ese caso, señor Gray, usted nunca ama de verdad —dijo la duquesa con fingida tristeza.
vi_translation: "Oh! Then you have never truly loved, Mr. Gray," the duchess replied, appearing sorrowful.
tr_translation: The Duchess said with a feigned sadness, "Oh! So you don't actually love it at all, Mr. Gray!"
es_translation: —I would say we hardly do anything else —murmured Dorian. —In that case, Mr. Gray, you never truly love —said the duchess with feigned sadness.

en: “My dear Gladys!” cried Lord Henry. “How can you say that? Romance lives by repetition, and repetition converts an appetite into an art. Besides, each time that one loves is the only time one has ever loved. Difference of object does not alter singleness of passion. It merely intensifies it. We can have in life but one great experience at best, and the secret of life is to reproduce that experience as often as possible.”
vi: “Gladys yêu quý của tôi!” huân tước Henry kêu lên. “Sao cô lại có thể nói thế? Ái tình sống nhờ sự lặp lại, còn sự lặp lại thì biến đổi ham muốn thành nghệ thuật. Ngoài ra, mỗi lần ta yêu là một lần duy nhất ta đã từng yêu. Sự khác biệt về đối tượng không thay đổi được tính độc nhất của niềm đam mê. Nó chỉ làm sâu đậm thêm cho cái đó mà thôi. Chúng ta chỉ có thể có trong đời một trải nghiệm vĩ đại là đã may mắn lắm rồi, và bí mật của cuộc đời là tái sinh cái trải nghiệm ấy thường xuyên nhất có thể.”
tr: Lord Henry, “Sevgili Gladys, bunu nasıl söyleyebilirsin?” diye bağırdı. “Romantizm denen şeyi canlı tutan yinelemektir; yinelemek de bir iştahı sanata dönüştürür. Hem zaten insanın her aşkı tek aşkıdır. Hedeflerin değişmesi tutkunun tekliğini zedelemez ki! Yalnızca yoğunlaştırmaya yarar. Hayatta taş çatlasa bir tek yüce deneyim geçebilir başımızdan; yaşamın gizi de bu deneyimi elden geldiğince çoğaltabilmektir.
es: —¡Mi querida Gladys! —exclamó lord Henry—. ¿Cómo puedes decir eso? El sentimiento romántico se alimenta de la repetición, y la repetición convierte un apetito en arte. Además, cada vez que se ama es la única vez que se ha amado nunca. La diversidad del objeto no altera la unicidad de la pasión. Tan sólo la intensifica. En el mejor de los casos, sólo podemos tener una experiencia en la vida, y el secreto es reproducirla con la mayor frecuencia posible.
vi_translation: “My dear Gladys!” Lord Henry exclaimed. “How can you say that? Love lives on repetition, and repetition transforms desire into art. Moreover, each time we love is the only time we have ever loved. The difference in the object does not change the uniqueness of the passion. It only deepens it. We are fortunate if we can have one great experience in life, and the secret of life is to recreate that experience as often as possible.”
tr_translation: Lord Henry, "Dear Gladys, how can you say that?" he exclaimed. "What keeps romance alive is repetition; repetition turns an appetite into art. Besides, every love is a unique love. Changing goals does not undermine the singularity of passion! It only serves to intensify it. In life, at most, we can experience one sublime moment; the secret of life is to multiply this experience as much as possible."
es_translation: —My dear Gladys! —exclaimed Lord Henry—. How can you say that? Romantic feeling is nourished by repetition, and repetition turns an appetite into art. Moreover, every time one loves is the only time one has ever loved. The diversity of the object does not alter the uniqueness of the passion. It only intensifies it. At best, we can only have one experience in life, and the secret is to reproduce it as frequently as possible.

en: “Even when one has been wounded by it, Harry?” asked the duchess after a pause.
vi: “Ngay cả khi ta bị nó làm tổn thương sao, Harry?” nữ công tước hỏi, sau một lúc ngập ngừng.
tr: Bir duralamadan sonra düşes, “İnsanı yaralamış da olsa, öyle mi, Harry?” diye sordu.
es: —¿Incluso cuando se ha quedado herido por ella, Harry? —preguntó la duquesa después de una pausa.
vi_translation: "Even if it hurts me, Harry?" the duchess asked, after a moment of hesitation.
tr_translation: After a pause, the duchess asked, "Even if it has hurt a person, is that so, Harry?"
es_translation: —Even when one has been hurt by it, Harry? —asked the Duchess after a pause.

en: “Especially when one has been wounded by it,” answered Lord Henry.
vi: “Nhất là khi ta bị nó làm tổn thương,” huân tước Henry trả lời.
tr: Lord Henry, “Özellikle o zaman,” diye karşılık verdi.
es: —Sobre todo cuando uno ha quedado herido —respondió lord Henry.
vi_translation: “Especially when it has hurt us,” Lord Henry replied.
tr_translation: Lord Henry, "Especially then," he replied.
es_translation: —Especially when one has been hurt —responded Lord Henry.

en: The duchess turned and looked at Dorian Gray with a curious expression in her eyes. “What do you say to that, Mr. Gray?” she inquired.
vi: Nữ công tước quay qua nhìn Dorian Gray với ánh mắt tò mò. “Anh nói gì về điều ấy, mít-tơ Gray?” cô hỏi.
tr: Düşes dönüp Dorian Gray’e baktı. Gözlerinde tuhaf bir ifade vardı. “Siz ne diyorsunuz buna, mr Gray?” diye sordu.
es: La duquesa se volvió a mirar a Dorian Gray con una curiosa expresión en los ojos. —¿Qué dice usted a eso, señor Gray? —quiso saber.
vi_translation: The Duchess turned to look at Dorian Gray with a curious gaze. “What do you say about that, Mr. Gray?” she asked.
tr_translation: The Duchess turned and looked at Dorian Gray. There was a strange expression in her eyes. “What do you say to this, Mr. Gray?” she asked.
es_translation: The duchess turned to look at Dorian Gray with a curious expression in her eyes. —What do you say to that, Mr. Gray? —he wanted to know.

en: Dorian hesitated for a moment. Then he threw his head back and laughed. “I always agree with Harry, Duchess.”
vi: Dorian lưỡng lự một lúc. Sau đó cậu hất đầu ra sau và cười. “Tôi luôn đồng ý với Harry, thưa nữ công tước.
tr: Dorian bir an duraksadı. Sonra başını geriye atarak güldü. “Ben her zaman Harry’nin görüşüne katılırım, düşes.
es: Dorian vaciló un momento. Luego echó la cabeza hacia atrás y rió. —Siempre estoy de acuerdo con Harry, duquesa.
vi_translation: Dorian hesitated for a moment. Then he threw his head back and laughed. “I always agree with Harry, Duchess.”
tr_translation: Dorian paused for a moment. Then he threw his head back and laughed. “I always agree with Harry's view, Duchess.”
es_translation: Dorian hesitated for a moment. Then he threw his head back and laughed. —I always agree with Harry, Duchess.

en: “Even when he is wrong?”
vi: “Ngay cả khi anh ấy sai?”
tr: “Yanıldığı zaman bile mi?
es: —¿Incluso cuando se equivoca?
vi_translation: "Even if he is wrong?"
tr_translation: “Even when he is wrong?”
es_translation: —Even when he's wrong?

en: “Harry is never wrong, Duchess.”
vi: “Harry chẳng bao giờ sai, thưa nữ công tước.
tr: “Harry hiç yanılmaz, düşes.
es: —Harry nunca se equivoca, duquesa.
vi_translation: “Harry is never wrong, madam duchess.”
tr_translation: “Harry is never wrong, Duchess.”
es_translation: —Harry is never wrong, Duchess.

en: “And does his philosophy make you happy?”
vi: “Thế triết lý của anh ấy có làm anh hạnh phúc không?”
tr: “Peki, onun bu yaşam felsefesi size mutluluk veriyor mu?
es: —Y, ¿le hace feliz su filosofía?
vi_translation: “Does his philosophy make you happy?”
tr_translation: “Well, does this philosophy of life give you happiness?”
es_translation: —And, does your philosophy make you happy?

en: “I have never searched for happiness. Who wants happiness? I have searched for pleasure.”
vi: “Tôi chưa bao giờ đi tìm hạnh phúc. Ai mà lại cần hạnh phúc? Tôi tìm kiếm niềm vui.”
tr: “Ben hiçbir zaman mutluluk peşinde koşmadım ki! Mutluluğu isteyen kim? Ben hep zevk aradım.
es: —La felicidad no ha sido nunca mi objetivo. ¿Quién quiere felicidad? Siempre he buscado el placer.
vi_translation: “I have never sought happiness. Who needs happiness? I seek joy.”
tr_translation: "I never chased after happiness!" "Who wants happiness?" "I always sought pleasure.""
es_translation: —Happiness has never been my goal. Who wants happiness? I have always sought pleasure.

en: “And found it, Mr. Gray?”
vi: “Và anh tìm được nó chưa, mít-tơ Gray?”
tr: “Ve de buldunuz, öyle mi mr Gray? “Çoğunlukla.
es: —¿Y lo ha encontrado, señor Gray?
vi_translation: "And have you found it yet, Mr. Gray?"
tr_translation: "And you found it, did you Mr. Gray?" “Mostly.
es_translation: —And have you found it, Mr. Gray?

en: “Often. Too often.”
vi: “Thường xuyên. Quá thường xuyên.”
tr: Gerektiğinden çok.
es: —Con frecuencia. Con demasiada frecuencia.
vi_translation: “Too often. Far too often.”
tr_translation: More than necessary.”
es_translation: —Often. Too often.

en: The duchess sighed. “I am searching for peace,” she said, “and if I don’t go and dress, I shall have none this evening.”
vi: Nữ công tước thở dài. “Tôi tìm kiếm sự bình yên,” cô nói, “và nếu tôi không đi thay đồ thì tôi sẽ chẳng có chút nào chiều nay.”
tr: Düşes içini çekti. “Ben huzur arıyorum,” dedi. “Şimdi de hemen gidip hazırlanmazsam bu gece hiç huzur bulamam.
es: La duquesa suspiró. —Mi objetivo es la paz —dijo—. Y si no me marcho y me visto no tendré ninguna esta noche.
vi_translation: The Duchess sighed. “I seek peace,” she said, “and if I don't go change my clothes, I won't have any this afternoon.”
tr_translation: The Duchess sighed. “I am looking for peace,” she said. “If I don't go and get ready right now, I won't find any peace tonight.”
es_translation: The duchess sighed. —My goal is peace —he said—. And if I don't leave and get dressed, I won't have any tonight.

en: “Let me get you some orchids, Duchess,” cried Dorian, starting to his feet and walking down the conservatory.
vi: “Hãy để tôi lấy cho cô vài bông lan, thưa nữ công tước,” Dorian la lên, nhỏm phắt dậy, và bước xuống nhà kính.
tr: Dorian, “Size birkaç orkide koparayım, düşes,” diyerek kalkıp uzaklaştı.
es: —Permítame traerle unas orquídeas, duquesa —exclamó Dorian, poniéndose en pie y alejándose hacia el fondo del invernadero.
vi_translation: "Let me get you some orchids, Duchess," Dorian exclaimed, jumping up, and heading down to the greenhouse.
tr_translation: Dorian said, "Let me pick a few orchids for you, Duchess," and got up and walked away.
es_translation: —Allow me to bring you some orchids, Duchess —exclaimed Dorian, standing up and moving towards the back of the greenhouse.

en: “You are flirting disgracefully with him,” said Lord Henry to his cousin. “You had better take care. He is very fascinating.”
vi: “Cô ve vãn cậu ấy một cách thật trơ trẽn,” huân tước Henry nói với em họ mình. “Cô nên cẩn thận thì hơn. Cậu ấy rất quyến rũ đấy.”
tr: Lord Henry kuzenine, “Hiç utanmadan fingirdiyorsun onunla,” dedi. “Ayağını denk alsan iyi olur. Büyüleyici bir adamdır.
es: —Coqueteas desaforadamente con él —le dijo lord Henry a su prima—. Te aconsejo prudencia. Es una criatura fascinante.
vi_translation: "She flirts with him so shamelessly," Lord Henry said to his cousin. "You should be more careful. He is very charming."
tr_translation: Lord Henry said to his cousin, "You are flirting with him shamelessly." "You better watch your step. He is a charming man."
es_translation: —You flirt outrageously with him —Lord Henry said to his cousin—. I advise you to be cautious. He is a fascinating creature.

en: “If he were not, there would be no battle.”
vi: “Nếu anh ấy không thế thì đã chẳng phải chiến đấu.”
tr: “Öyle olmasaydı mücadele de olmazdı ki.
es: —Si no lo fuera, no habría lucha.
vi_translation: "If he wasn't like that, he wouldn't have had to fight."
tr_translation: "If it weren't like that, there wouldn't be any struggle either."
es_translation: —If it weren't so, there wouldn't be a struggle.

en: “Greek meets Greek, then?”
vi: “Vậy là người Hy Lạp đấu với người Hy Lạp, hả?”
tr: “Yunanlı Yunanlıya karşı, öyle mi?
es: —¿Se trata entonces de un griego contra otro?
vi_translation: “So, it's Greeks fighting Greeks, huh?”
tr_translation: “Greek against Greek, is that so?”
es_translation: —Is it then a Greek against another?

en: “I am on the side of the Trojans. They fought for a woman.”
vi: “Tôi bên Tơ-roa. Họ chiến đấu vì một người đàn bà.”
tr: “Ben Troyalılardan yanayım. Bir kadın uğruna savaştı onlar.
es: —Yo estoy de parte de los troyanos. Lucharon por una mujer.
vi_translation: “I am with Troy. They fight for a woman.”
tr_translation: “I am on the side of the Trojans. They fought for the sake of a woman.”
es_translation: —I am on the side of the Trojans. They fought for a woman.

en: “They were defeated.”
vi: “Họ đã bị đánh bại.”
tr: “Yenildiler ama.
es: —Fueron derrotados.
vi_translation: "They were defeated."
tr_translation: “But they lost.”
es_translation: —They were defeated.

en: “There are worse things than capture,” she answered.
vi: “Có những chuyện còn tệ hơn là bị bắt,” cô trả lời.
tr: Genç kadın, “Tutsak edilmekten kötü şeyler de vardır,” diye karşılık verdi.
es: —Hay cosas peores que ser capturado —respondió ella.
vi_translation: “There are things worse than being caught,” she replied.
tr_translation: The young woman replied, "There are things worse than being imprisoned."
es_translation: —There are worse things than being captured —she replied.

en: “You gallop with a loose rein.”
vi: “Cô phi ngựa với cái dây cương lỏng.
tr: “Boş dizginle doludizgin gidiyorsun.
es: —Te lanzas al galope y sueltas las riendas.
vi_translation: “She gallops with the loose reins.”
tr_translation: "You are going full speed with loose reins.""
es_translation: —You gallop off and let go of the reins.

en: “Pace gives life,” was the riposte.
vi: “Nước kiệu mang đến cuộc đời,” là lời đối đáp.
tr: Düşes, “Hız hayat yaratır,” diye bir yanıt yapıştırdı.
es: —La velocidad es vida —fue su respuesta.
vi_translation: "The trot brings life," was the reply.
tr_translation: The Duchess retorted, "Speed creates life."
es_translation: —Speed is life —was his response.

en: “I shall write it in my diary to-night.”
vi: “Tôi sẽ viết nó vào nhật ký đêm nay.”
tr: “Bu gece günceme yazacağım.
es: —Lo anotaré esta noche en mi diario.
vi_translation: “I will write it in my diary tonight.”
tr_translation: “Tonight I will write in my journal.”
es_translation: —I will write it in my diary tonight.

en: “What?”
vi: “Gì cơ?”
tr: “Neyi?
es: —¿Qué anotarás?
vi_translation: "What?"
tr_translation: "What?"
es_translation: —What will you write down?

en: “That a burnt child loves the fire.”
vi: “Là một đứa trẻ đã bị thiêu lại còn yêu lửa.”
tr: “Ateşten eli yanan çocuğun ateşi sevdiğini.
es: —Que a un niño con quemaduras le gusta el fuego.
vi_translation: “As a child who was burned but still loves fire.”
tr_translation: “The child whose hand is burned by fire loves the fire.”
es_translation: —That a child with burns likes fire.

en: “I am not even singed. My wings are untouched.”
vi: “Tôi thậm chí không bị sém. Cánh tôi còn nguyên.
tr: “Ateş bana dokunmadı ki! Kanatlarım sapasağlam duruyor.
es: —Ni siquiera me he chamuscado. Tengo las alas intactas.
vi_translation: “I wasn't even singed. My wings are intact.”
tr_translation: "The fire didn't touch me! My wings are perfectly intact."
es_translation: —I haven't even singed myself. My wings are intact.

en: “You use them for everything, except flight.”
vi: “Cô dùng nó cho mọi việc, ngoài bay.”
tr: “Uçmak dışında her amaçla kullanıyorsun onları.
es: —Las usas para todo menos para volar.
vi_translation: “She uses it for everything, except flying.”
tr_translation: “You use them for every purpose except flying.”
es_translation: —You use them for everything except flying.

en: “Courage has passed from men to women. It is a new experience for us.”
vi: “Sự cam đảm đã chuyển từ nam qua nữ. Đó là một kinh nghiệm mới cho ta.
tr: “Cesaret erkeklerden kadınlara geçmiş. Bizim için yepyeni bir şey bu.
es: —El valor ha pasado de los hombres a las mujeres. Es una nueva experiencia para nosotras.
vi_translation: "Courage has shifted from men to women. This is a new experience for us."
tr_translation: "Courage has passed from men to women. This is something entirely new for us."
es_translation: —Courage has passed from men to women. It is a new experience for us.

en: “You have a rival.”
vi: “Cô có một đối thủ.”
tr: “Bir rakibin var.
es: —Tienes una rival.
vi_translation: "You have a rival."
tr_translation: "You have a rival."
es_translation: —You have a rival.

en: “Who?”
vi: “Ai?”
tr: “Kim?
es: -¿Quién?
vi_translation: "Huh?"
tr_translation: “Kim?”
es_translation: —Who?

en: He laughed. “Lady Narborough,” he whispered. “She perfectly adores him.”
vi: Y cười. “Bà Narborough,” y thì thào. “Bà ấy cực mê cậu ta.”
tr: Lord Henry güldü. “Leydi Narborough,” diye fısıldadı. “Resmen tapıyor Dorian’a.
es: Su primo se echó a reír. —Lady Narborough-susurró—. Lo adora.
vi_translation: He smiled. “Mrs. Narborough,” he whispered. “She is extremely fond of him.”
tr_translation: Lord Henry laughed. “Lady Narborough,” he whispered. “She practically worships Dorian.”
es_translation: His cousin burst out laughing. —Lady Narborough—he whispered—. She adores him.

en: “You fill me with apprehension. The appeal to antiquity is fatal to us who are romanticists.”
vi: “Anh làm tôi sợ. Sức hấp dẫn với đồ cổ rất tai hại cho những kẻ theo chủ nghĩa lãng mạn như chúng ta.”
tr: “İçime korku salıyorsun! Bizim gibi romantikler için antika sevgisi ölümcüldür.
es: —Me llenas de aprensión. Las románticas no podemos competir con el atractivo de la Antigüedad.
vi_translation: "You scare me. The attraction to antiques is very harmful to romantics like us."
tr_translation: "You instill fear in me! For romantics like us, the love for antiques is deadly."
es_translation: —You fill me with apprehension. We romantics cannot compete with the allure of Antiquity.

en: “Romanticists! You have all the methods of science.”
vi: “Những kẻ theo chủ nghĩa lãng mạn! Cô có mọi phương pháp khoa học.
tr: “Romantik mi dedin? Yavrum, sen fen bilimlerinin her türlü yöntemiyle donanmışsın.
es: —¡Románticas! Empleáis todos los métodos de la ciencia.
vi_translation: “Romantics! You have all the scientific methods.”
tr_translation: “Did you say romantic? My dear, you are equipped with every method of the natural sciences.”
es_translation: —Romantics! You employ all the methods of science.

en: “Men have educated us.”
vi: “Đàn ông đã dạy chúng tôi.”
tr: “Erkekler bizi yetiştirdiler.
es: —Los hombres nos han educado.
vi_translation: “Men have taught us.”
tr_translation: “Men raised us.”
es_translation: —Men have educated us.

en: “But not explained you.”
vi: “Nhưng không giải thích cho các cô.”
tr: “Gene de sizin gizinizi açıklayamadılar.
es: —Pero no os han explicado.
vi_translation: “But not explaining to you ladies.”
tr_translation: “They also couldn't explain your secret.”
es_translation: —But they haven't explained it to you.

en: “Describe us as a sex,” was her challenge.
vi: “Mô tả chúng tôi như một giới tính xem nào,” là thách thức của cô.
tr: Genç kadın meydan okurcasına, “Bizi bir bütün olarak tanımla bakalım!” dedi.
es: —Describe alas mujeres —fue su desafío.
vi_translation: “Describe us as a gender, then,” was her challenge.
tr_translation: The young woman defiantly said, "Go ahead, define us as a whole!"
es_translation: —Describe women —was his challenge.

en: “Sphinxes without secrets.”
vi: “Những con Sphynx không bí mật.”
tr: “Gizi olmayan Sfenkslersiniz.
es: —Esfinges sin secretos.
vi_translation: “The Sphynx cats have no secrets.”
tr_translation: “You are Sphinxes without riddles.”
es_translation: Sphinxes without secrets.

en: She looked at him, smiling. “How long Mr. Gray is!” she said. “Let us go and help him. I have not yet told him the colour of my frock.”
vi: Cô nhìn y, mỉm cười. “Mít-tơ Gray lâu quá!” cô nói. “Ta hãy đi giúp anh ấy nào. Tôi vẫn chưa nói cho anh ấy biết màu váy tôi.”
tr: Düşes ona gülümseyerek baktı. “mr Gray de amma uzattı! Hadi gidip yardım edelim. Daha elbisemin rengini söylemedim ona.
es: Lo miró, sonriendo. —¡Cuánto tarda el señor Gray! —dijo—. Vayamos a ayudarle. No le he dicho el color de mi vestido.
vi_translation: She looked at him, smiling. "Mr. Gray, it's been so long!" she said. "Let's go help him." "I still haven't told him the color of my dress."
tr_translation: The Duchess looked at him with a smile. "Mr. Gray is taking forever! Let's go and help him. I haven't even told him the color of my dress yet."
es_translation: She looked at him, smiling. —How long Mr. Gray is taking! —he said—. Let's go help him. I haven't told him the color of my dress.

en: “Ah! you must suit your frock to his flowers, Gladys.”
vi: “À! Cô phải chọn váy hợp với hoa cậu ấy, Gladys.”
tr: “Sen elbisenin rengini onun verdiği çiçeklere uydurmalısın, Gladys.
es: —¡Ah! tendrás que elegir el vestido de acuerdo con sus flores, Gladys.
vi_translation: "Ah! You have to choose a dress that matches his flowers, Gladys."
tr_translation: "You should match the color of your dress to the flowers he gave you, Gladys."
es_translation: —Ah! You will have to choose the dress according to its flowers, Gladys.

en: “That would be a premature surrender.”
vi: “Thế sẽ là một sự đầu hàng quá sớm.”
tr: “Teslim bayrağını vakitsiz çekmek olur bu.
es: —Eso sería una rendición prematura.
vi_translation: “That would be too early of a surrender.”
tr_translation: “It would be premature to raise the white flag now.”
es_translation: —That would be a premature surrender.

en: “Romantic art begins with its climax.”
vi: “Nghệ thuật lãng mạn bắt đầu bằng điểm cao trào.”
tr: “Romantik sanat doruk noktasından başlar.
es: —El arte romántico empieza en el momento culminante.
vi_translation: “Romantic art begins with the climax.”
tr_translation: "Romantic art begins at its peak."
es_translation: —Romantic art begins at the climactic moment.

en: “I must keep an opportunity for retreat.”
vi: “Tôi phải giữ một cơ hội để rút lui chứ.”
tr: “Gerekirse geri çekilebilmek için fırsat bırakmalıyım kendime.
es: —He de reservarme una posibilidad de retirada.
vi_translation: “I must keep an opportunity to retreat.”
tr_translation: “I must leave myself an opportunity to retreat if necessary.”
es_translation: —I must reserve myself a possibility of withdrawal.

en: “In the Parthian manner?”
vi: “Theo kiểu Parthia?”
tr: “Partlar gibi mi?
es: —¿A la manera de los partos?
vi_translation: "In the Parthian style?"
tr_translation: “Like the Parthians?”
es_translation: —In the manner of the Parthians?

en: “They found safety in the desert. I could not do that.”
vi: “Họ thấy an toàn trong sa mạc. Tôi không thể làm thế.”
tr: “Onlar güvenliği çölde bulmuşlar. Ben bunu yapamam.
es: —Encontraron la salvación en el desierto. Eso no está a mi alcance.
vi_translation: “They feel safe in the desert. I cannot do that.”
tr_translation: “They found safety in the desert. I can't do this.”
es_translation: —They found salvation in the desert. That is beyond my reach.

en: “Women are not always allowed a choice,” he answered, but hardly had he finished the sentence before from the far end of the conservatory came a stifled groan, followed by the dull sound of a heavy fall. Everybody started up. The duchess stood motionless in horror. And with fear in his eyes, Lord Henry rushed through the flapping palms to find Dorian Gray lying face downwards on the tiled floor in a deathlike swoon.
vi: “Đàn bà không phải lúc nào cũng được phép lựa chọn,” y trả lời, nhưng chỉ vừa mới dứt câu thì từ cuối nhà kính vọng đến một tiếng rên cố nén, theo sau là tiếng động trầm đục của một cú ngã nặng. Mọi người nhỏm hết dậy. Nữ công tước đứng bất động trong sợ hãi. Và với nỗi lo ngại trong mắt, huân tước Henry lao qua những lá cọ lắc lư để tìm thấy Dorian Gray nằm úp mặt trên sàn lát đá trong cơn bất tỉnh như chết.
tr: Lord Henry, “Kadınlara her zaman seçenek tanınmaz,” diye karşılık verdi, ama cümlesi daha tam bitmeden limonluğun öbür ucundan boğuk bir inilti ve hemen ardından ağır bir cismin yere düştüğünü belirten kof bir patırtı duyuldu. Herkes ayağa fırlamıştı. Düşes dehşetten donup kalmıştı. Lord Henry, gözleri korkuyla dolarak palmiyelerin hışırtılı geniş yapraklarını yara yara koştu.
