Dorian Gray’i yerin tuğla döşemesi üzerinde yüzükoyun, ölü gibi baygın yatar buldu.
es: —A las mujeres no siempre se les permite escoger —respondió lord Henry. Pero apenas terminada la frase, del extremo más alejado del invernadero llegó un gemido ahogado, seguido del ruido sordo de una caída. Todo el mundo se sobresaltó. La duquesa permaneció inmóvil, horrorizada. Y lord Henry, el miedo en los ojos, corrió entre palmeras agitadas hasta encontrar a Dorian Gray tumbado boca abajo sobre el suelo enlosado, víctima de un desvanecimiento semejante a la muerte.
vi_translation: “Women are not always allowed to choose,” he replied, but just as he finished his sentence, a stifled groan echoed from the end of the greenhouse, followed by the dull thud of a heavy fall. Everyone sprang up. The duchess stood motionless in fear. And with worry in his eyes, Lord Henry rushed through the swaying palm leaves to find Dorian Gray lying face down on the tiled floor in a deathlike faint.
tr_translation: Lord Henry replied, "Women are not always given a choice," but before he could finish his sentence, a muffled groan was heard from the other end of the conservatory, followed immediately by a hollow thud indicating that a heavy object had fallen to the ground. Everyone had jumped to their feet. The Duchess was frozen in horror. Lord Henry, his eyes filled with fear, ran through the rustling broad leaves of the palm trees. He found Dorian Gray lying face down on the brick floor, unconscious as if dead.
es_translation: —Women are not always allowed to choose —replied Lord Henry. But just as the sentence was finished, from the farthest end of the greenhouse came a muffled groan, followed by the dull sound of a fall. Everyone was startled. The duchess remained motionless, horrified. And Lord Henry, fear in his eyes, ran through the swaying palm trees until he found Dorian Gray lying face down on the tiled floor, a victim of a fainting spell that resembled death.

en: He was carried at once into the blue drawing-room and laid upon one of the sofas. After a short time, he came to himself and looked round with a dazed expression.
vi: Cậu lập tức được khênh vào phòng khách xanh lam, và đặt lên một chiếc xô-pha. Sau một thời gian ngắn, cậu tỉnh lại, và nhìn quanh với vẻ mặt sững sờ.
tr: Dorian’ı hemen mavi salona taşıyıp kanepelerden birine yatırdılar. Az sonra genç adam kendine geldi, sersem sersem çevresine bakındı.
es: Se le transportó al instante al salón azul, colocándolo sobre uno de los sofás. Poco después recobró el conocimiento y miró a su alrededor con aire desconcertado.
vi_translation: You were immediately carried into the blue living room and placed on a sofa. After a short while, you regained consciousness and looked around with a bewildered expression.
tr_translation: They immediately carried Dorian to the blue salon and laid him on one of the couches. A little later, the young man came to his senses and looked around dazedly.
es_translation: He was instantly transported to the blue room, placing him on one of the sofas. Shortly after, he regained consciousness and looked around with a bewildered air.

en: “What has happened?” he asked. “Oh! I remember. Am I safe here, Harry?” He began to tremble.
vi: “Có chuyện gì xảy ra thế?” cậu hỏi. “Ôi! Tôi nhớ rồi. Ở đây tôi có an toàn không, Harry?” Cậu bắt đầu run.
tr: “Ne oldu?” diye sordu. “Ha biliyorum. Harry, güvenlikte miyim burada?” Titremeye başlamıştı.
es: —¿Qué ha sucedido? —preguntó—. ¡Ah! Ya recuerdo. ¿Estoy a salvo aquí, Harry? —y empezó a temblar.
vi_translation: “What happened?” he asked. “Oh! I remember now. Am I safe here, Harry?” He began to tremble.
tr_translation: “What happened?” he asked. “Oh, I know. Harry, am I safe here?” She had started trembling.
es_translation: —What has happened? —he asked—. Ah! Now I remember. Am I safe here, Harry? —and he began to tremble.

en: “My dear Dorian,” answered Lord Henry, “you merely fainted. That was all. You must have overtired yourself. You had better not come down to dinner. I will take your place.”
vi: “Dorian thân mến của tôi,” huân tước Henry trả lời, “cậu chỉ bị ngất. Có vậy thôi. Cậu hẳn là đã bắt mình làm việc quá sức. Tốt hơn là cậu đừng xuống ăn tối nữa. Tôi sẽ thế chỗ cậu.”
tr: Lord Henry, “Sevgili Dorian, bir baygınlık geçirdin, hepsi bu,” diye yanıtladı. “Kendini aşırı yormuş olmalısın. Yemeğe gelmesen iyi olur. Ben senin yerini alırım.
es: —Mi querido Dorian —respondió lord Henry—, no has hecho más que desmayarte. Eso ha sido todo. Debes de haberte fatigado más de la cuenta. Será mejor que no bajes a cenar. Yo haré tus veces.
vi_translation: “My dear Dorian,” Lord Henry replied, “you just fainted. That's all. You must have overworked yourself. It would be better if you didn't come down for dinner. I'll take your place.”
tr_translation: Lord Henry replied, "Dear Dorian, you just fainted, that's all." "You must have overexerted yourself. It would be better if you didn't come to dinner. I'll take your place."
es_translation: —My dear Dorian —responded Lord Henry—, you have merely fainted. That is all. You must have overexerted yourself. It would be better if you didn't come down for dinner. I will take your place.

en: “No, I will come down,” he said, struggling to his feet. “I would rather come down. I must not be alone.”
vi: “Không, tôi sẽ xuống dưới,” cậu nói, chật vật đứng dậy. “Tôi thích xuống dưới hơn. Tôi không nên ở một mình.
tr: Dorian, “Yok geleceğim,” diyerek güçlükle ayağa kalktı. “Gelmem daha iyi olur. Yalnız kalmamalıyım.
es: —No; bajaré —dijo, poniéndose en pie con algún esfuerzo—. Prefiero hacerlo. No debo quedarme solo.
vi_translation: "No, I will go downstairs," he said, struggling to stand up. "I prefer going downstairs. I shouldn't be alone."
tr_translation: Dorian, "No, I will come," he said, struggling to his feet. "It would be better if I came. I shouldn't be alone."
es_translation: —No; I will go down —he said, standing up with some effort—. I prefer to do it. I must not stay alone.

en: He went to his room and dressed. There was a wild recklessness of gaiety in his manner as he sat at table, but now and then a thrill of terror ran through him when he remembered that, pressed against the window of the conservatory, like a white handkerchief, he had seen the face of James Vane watching him.
vi: Cậu vào phòng mình và thay đồ. Có một sự khinh suất phóng túng trong thái độ vui vẻ của cậu khi cậu ngồi bên bàn, nhưng thỉnh thoảng một cơn rùng mình kinh sợ lại chạy xuyên qua cậu khi cậu nhớ là, ép vào cửa sổ nhà kính, như một chiếc khăn tay trắng, cậu đã thấy cái mặt James Vane nhìn cậu.
tr: Odasına çıkıp giysilerini değiştirdi. Sofraya oturduğunda dizginsiz, alabildiğine bir neşe içindeydi. Gelgelelim arada bir, limonluk penceresine bir beyaz mendil gibi yapışmış, James Vane’in kendini gözleyen yüzünü görmüş olduğu aklına geldikçe, tepeden tırnağa dehşetle ürperiyordu.
es: Fue a su habitación para vestirse. Cuando se sentó a la mesa, había en su actitud una extraña alegría temeraria, aunque, de cuando en cuando, le recorría un estremecimiento al recordar que, aplastado, como un pañuelo blanco, contra el cristal del invernadero, había visto el rostro de James Vane que lo vigilaba.
vi_translation: You went into your room and changed clothes. There was a careless abandon in your cheerful demeanor as you sat by the table, but occasionally a shudder of fear ran through you when you remembered that, pressed against the greenhouse window like a white handkerchief, you had seen James Vane's face looking at you.
tr_translation: He went up to his room and changed his clothes. When he sat down at the table, he was in an unrestrained, boundless joy. However, every now and then, the thought of having seen James Vane’s face, pressed against the greenhouse window like a white handkerchief, made him shudder with terror from head to toe.
es_translation: He went to his room to get dressed. When he sat down at the table, there was a strange reckless joy in his demeanor, although, from time to time, a shudder ran through him as he remembered that, crushed like a white handkerchief against the glass of the greenhouse, he had seen the face of James Vane watching him.

en: CHAPTER XVIII.
vi: Chương 18
tr: On sekizinci bölüm
es: Capítulo 18
vi_translation: Chapter 18
tr_translation: Eighteenth chapter
es_translation: Chapter 18

en: The next day he did not leave the house, and, indeed, spent most of the time in his own room, sick with a wild terror of dying, and yet indifferent to life itself. The consciousness of being hunted, snared, tracked down, had begun to dominate him. If the tapestry did but tremble in the wind, he shook. The dead leaves that were blown against the leaded panes seemed to him like his own wasted resolutions and wild regrets. When he closed his eyes, he saw again the sailor’s face peering through the mist-stained glass, and horror seemed once more to lay its hand upon his heart.
vi: Hôm sau, cậu không ra khỏi nhà, và, quả thật, đã tiêu phần lớn thời gian trong phòng riêng, đổ bệnh vì sợ chết phát điên, tuy nhiên lại dửng dưng với chính cuộc sống. Ý thức về việc bị săn, bị bẫy, bị theo dõi và bị tóm được, bắt đầu thống trị cậu. Hễ tấm thảm thêu chỉ rung lên trong gió thôi là cậu đã run. Cậu thấy dường như những chiếc lá chết bị thổi lên các ô kính bọc chì giống những quyết định phí hoài và những hối tiếc rồ dại của mình. Khi cậu nhắm mắt, cậu lại thấy bộ mặt người thủy thủ ấy đang nhòm qua tấm kính nhuộm sương, và sự ghê rợn dường như lại một lần nữa đặt tay nó lên tim cậu.
tr: Ertesi gün Dorian evden çıkmadı; daha doğrusu zamanının çoğunu kendi odasında geçirdi. Çılgınca bir ölüm korkusuyla hasta düşmüş durumda, gene de hayata karşı ilgisizdi. Av niyetine izlenmenin, kapana kısılmak, yakalanmak üzere olmanın bilinci benliğine el koymaya başlamıştı. Rüzgâr bir perdeyi titretse o zangırdıyordu. Kurşunlu camlara vuran kuru yapraklar onun kendi boşa giden yeminleri, çılgın pişmanlıklarıydı sanki. Ne zaman gözlerini yumsa gemicinin o sisle buğulanmış camdan kendisine baktığını görüyor ve dehşet yüreğini tutup sıkıyordu.
es: Al día siguiente Dorian Gray no salió de la casa y, de hecho, pasó la mayor parte del tiempo en su habitación, presa de un loco miedo a morir y, sin embargo, indiferente a la vida. El convencimiento de ser perseguido, de que se le tendían trampas, de estar acorralado, empezaba a dominarlo. Si el viento agitaba ligeramente los tapices, se echaba a temblar. Las hojas secas arrojadas contra las vidrieras le parecían la imagen de sus resoluciones abandonadas y de sus vanos remordimientos. Cuando cerraba los ojos, veía de nuevo el rostro del marinero mirando a través del cristal empañado por la niebla, y creía sentir una vez más cómo el horror le oprimía el corazón.
vi_translation: The next day, he did not leave the house, and, indeed, spent most of the time in his own room, falling ill from the fear of going mad, yet indifferent to life itself. The awareness of being hunted, trapped, watched, and caught began to dominate him. Whenever the embroidered carpet fluttered in the wind, he would tremble. He felt as if the dead leaves blown against the leaded glass panes were like his wasted decisions and his wild regrets. When he closed his eyes, he saw the face of that sailor peering through the misted glass, and the horror seemed to lay its hand on his heart once more.
tr_translation: The next day, Dorian did not leave the house; or rather, he spent most of his time in his own room. Fallen ill with a frantic fear of death, he was still indifferent to life. The awareness of being hunted, trapped, and about to be caught had begun to take hold of his consciousness. He would shudder if the wind made a curtain flutter. The dry leaves hitting the leaded windows were like his own wasted oaths, his mad regrets. Whenever he closed his eyes, he saw the sailor looking at him through that misted glass, and terror gripped his heart.
es_translation: The next day, Dorian Gray did not leave the house and, in fact, spent most of the time in his room, gripped by a mad fear of dying and, yet, indifferent to life. The conviction of being pursued, of traps being set for him, of being cornered, began to dominate him. If the wind slightly stirred the tapestries, he would start to tremble. The dry leaves thrown against the glass panes seemed to him the image of his abandoned resolutions and his vain regrets. When he closed his eyes, he saw again the face of the sailor looking through the fogged glass, and he believed he felt once more how horror gripped his heart.

en: But perhaps it had been only his fancy that had called vengeance out of the night and set the hideous shapes of punishment before him. Actual life was chaos, but there was something terribly logical in the imagination. It was the imagination that set remorse to dog the feet of sin. It was the imagination that made each crime bear its misshapen brood. In the common world of fact the wicked were not punished, nor the good rewarded. Success was given to the strong, failure thrust upon the weak. That was all. Besides, had any stranger been prowling round the house, he would have been seen by the servants or the keepers. Had any foot-marks been found on the flower-beds, the gardeners would have reported it. Yes, it had been merely fancy. Sibyl Vane’s brother had not come back to kill him. He had sailed away in his ship to founder in some winter sea. From him, at any rate, he was safe. Why, the man did not know who he was, could not know who he was. The mask of youth had saved him.
vi: Nhưng, không chừng chỉ sự tưởng tượng của cậu gọi sự báo thù ra khỏi màn đêm, và đặt hình thù gớm guốc của sự trừng phạt ra trước mặt cậu. Đời thực quả là những hỗn loạn, nhưng cũng có gì đó lô-gích đáng sợ trong trí tưởng tượng. Chính trí tưởng tượng đã bắt sự ăn năn bám sát gót chân tội lỗi. Chính trí tưởng tượng đã khiến cho mỗi tội ác đều phải mang theo lũ con dị dạng của nó. Trong thế giới thực tế bình thường thì cái ác không bị phạt, mà cái tốt cũng không được thưởng. Sự thành công được dâng cho kẻ mạnh, sự thất bại bị ấn lên kẻ yếu. Chỉ vậy thôi. Hơn nữa, nếu có bất kỳ kẻ lạ nào lảng vảng quanh nhà thì có lẽ hắn cũng bị các gia nhân hoặc bảo vệ bắt gặp. Nếu có bất cứ dấu chân nào được tìm thấy trong các luống hoa, hẳn là những người làm vườn đã báo lại. Đúng: đó chỉ là sự tưởng tượng mà thôi. Em trai Sibyl Vane không quay lại để giết cậu. Hắn đã lên tàu đi xa để chìm xuống vùng biển mùa đông nào đó. Dù sao đi nữa, cậu cũng chắc chắn không bị hắn tấn công. Sao, kẻ không biết cậu là ai thì cũng không thể biết cậu là ai. Chiếc mặt nạ tuổi xuân đã cứu cậu.
tr: Ama bu öç imgesini gece karanlığından çekip çıkartan, karşısına korkunç ceza sahneleri dizen belki de kendi imgelemiydi yalnızca. Hayatın kendisi kaostan ibaretti ya, imgelem denen şeyin müthiş bir mantığı vardı. Pişmanlığı günahın izini sürmeye yollayan imgelemdi. Her suça çarpık döller doğurtan imgelemdi. Gündelik olgular dünyasında ne kötüler ceza görüyor ne de iyiler ödüllendiriliyordu. Başarı güçlülere veriliyor, yenilgi zayıfların eline tutuşturuluyordu. Hepsi bu. Hem zaten evin çevresinde bir yabancı dolaşmış olsa hizmetçiler, bekçiler görürdü. Çiçek yataklarında ayak izine rastlansa bahçıvanlar bildirirdi. Evet, evet, hayalden ibaretti. Yoksa Sibly Vane’in kardeşi dönüp onu öldürmeye gelmiş olamazdı. Gemisine binip açılmış, şimdi kim bilir hangi kış denizlerinde yalpalanmaktaydı. Dorian’ın hiç değilse ondan yana bir korkusu yoktu. Zaten adam onun kim olduğunu bilmiyordu ki! Bilemezdi de. Gençliğin maskesi onu kurtarmıştı.
es: Aunque quizás sólo su imaginación hubiera hecho surgir la venganza de la noche, colocando ante sus ojos las formas horribles del castigo. La vida real era caótica, pero la imaginación seguía una lógica terrible. La imaginación enviaba al remordimiento tras las huellas del pecado. La imaginación hacía que cada delito concibiera su monstruosa progenie. En el universo ordinario de los hechos no se castigaba a los malvados ni se recompensaba a los buenos. El éxito correspondía a los fuertes y el fracaso recaía sobre los débiles. Eso era todo. Además, si algún desconocido hubiera merodeado por los alrededores de la casa, los criados o los guardas lo hubieran visto. Si se hubieran encontrado huellas en los arriates, los jardineros habrían informado de ello. Sin duda se trataba sólo de su imaginación. El hermano de Sibyl Vane no había venido hasta Selby Royal para matarlo. Se había hecho a la mar en su barco para irse finalmente a pique en algún mar invernal. De él, al menos, nada tenía que temer. Aquel pobre desgraciado ni siquiera sabía quién era, no podía saber quién era. La máscara de la juventud lo había salvado.
vi_translation: But, perhaps it is only your imagination that calls forth vengeance from the night, and places the grotesque form of punishment before you. Real life is indeed chaotic, but there is also a terrifying logic in imagination. It is imagination that makes remorse cling to the heels of guilt. It is imagination that makes every crime carry its own deformed offspring. In the ordinary real world, evil is not punished, nor is good rewarded. Success is offered to the strong, failure is stamped on the weak. That's all. Moreover, if any stranger were lurking around the house, he would likely be caught by the servants or guards. If any footprints were found in the flower beds, the gardeners would have reported it. Yes: it is only imagination. Sibyl Vane's brother did not come back to kill you. He boarded a ship to some distant winter sea. In any case, you are certainly not under attack by him. Why, someone who doesn't know who you are cannot know who you are. The mask of youth has saved you.
tr_translation: But perhaps it was only his own imagination that pulled this image of revenge out of the darkness of the night and set before him scenes of terrible punishment. Life itself was nothing but chaos, yet the thing called imagination had a tremendous logic. It was the imagination that sent remorse to trace the mark of sin. It was the imagination that gave birth to twisted offspring for every crime. In the world of everyday phenomena, neither the wicked were punished nor the good rewarded. Success was given to the strong, and defeat was handed to the weak. That was all. Besides, if a stranger had been wandering around the house, the servants and guards would have seen him. If footprints were found in the flower beds, the gardeners would have reported it. Yes, yes, it was all just imagination. Otherwise, Sibly Vane's brother could not have come back to kill him. He had boarded his ship and sailed away, now who knows in which winter seas he was rocking. At least Dorian had no fear from him. After all, the man did not know who he was! He could not have known. The mask of youth had saved him.
es_translation: Although perhaps only his imagination had conjured the vengeance of the night, placing before his eyes the horrible forms of punishment. Real life was chaotic, but imagination followed a terrible logic. Imagination sent remorse in the footsteps of sin. Imagination made each crime conceive its monstrous progeny. In the ordinary universe of facts, the wicked were not punished, nor were the good rewarded. Success belonged to the strong and failure befell the weak. That was all. Moreover, if some stranger had been lurking around the house, the servants or the guards would have seen him. If footprints had been found in the flowerbeds, the gardeners would have reported it. Undoubtedly, it was only his imagination. Sibyl Vane's brother had not come to Selby Royal to kill him. He had set sail on his ship only to finally sink in some winter sea. From him, at least, he had nothing to fear. That poor wretch didn't even know who he was, couldn't know who he was. The mask of youth had saved him.

en: And yet if it had been merely an illusion, how terrible it was to think that conscience could raise such fearful phantoms, and give them visible form, and make them move before one! What sort of life would his be if, day and night, shadows of his crime were to peer at him from silent corners, to mock him from secret places, to whisper in his ear as he sat at the feast, to wake him with icy fingers as he lay asleep! As the thought crept through his brain, he grew pale with terror, and the air seemed to him to have become suddenly colder. Oh! in what a wild hour of madness he had killed his friend! How ghastly the mere memory of the scene! He saw it all again. Each hideous detail came back to him with added horror. Out of the black cave of time, terrible and swathed in scarlet, rose the image of his sin. When Lord Henry came in at six o’clock, he found him crying as one whose heart will break.
vi: Tuy nhiên, nếu đó chỉ là ảo giác, thì thật khủng khiếp khi nghĩ là lương tâm lại có thể dựng lên những bóng ma ghê sợ như vậy, cho chúng một hình thể rõ ràng, và khiến chúng chuyển động được trước mắt người! Đời cậu sẽ thành ra cái kiểu gì, nếu ngày và đêm, những cái bóng tội lỗi của cậu cứ nhòm cậu từ các góc lặng câm, nhạo báng cậu từ các nơi bí mật, thì thào vào tai cậu những lúc cậu ngồi trong các bữa tiệc, đánh thức cậu bằng những ngón tay băng giá khi cậu nằm ngủ! Lúc ý nghĩ ấy trườn qua não cậu, cậu tái người đi vì sợ, và cậu thấy dường như không khí đột nhiên trở nên lạnh hơn. Ôi! Cậu đã giết bạn mình trong một cái giờ điên loạn thế nào! Chỉ ký ức về cảnh ấy thôi cũng đã ghê sợ làm sao! Cậu lại thấy toàn bộ nó. Mỗi chi tiết gớm guốc lại quay về với cậu với sự ghê rợn bổ sung. Ra khỏi cái hang đen của Thời gian, khủng khiếp và quấn băng đỏ tươi, hình ảnh tội lỗi của cậu vươn dậy. Khi huân tước Henry đến vào lúc sáu giờ, y thấy cậu đang khóc như một kẻ có trái tim sắp vỡ.
tr: Öte yandan bu gördüğü salt bir yanılsamaysa ne korkunç bir şeydi: vicdanın böyle ürpertici heyulalar yaratarak onlara gözle görülür biçimler verebildiğini, onları insanın gözleri önünde hareket ettirebildiğini düşünmek! Ne biçim bir hayat olurdu onunkisi, eğer işlediği suçların gölgeleri gece gündüz sessiz köşelerden onu gözetleyecekler, gizli yerlerden ona dil çıkartacaklarsa, şölen sofralarında kulağına fısıldayacak, buzdan parmaklarıyla onu uykusundan uyandıracaklarsa! Bu düşünceler kafasından geçtikçe Dorian korkudan sararıyor, hava birden soğumuş gibi geliyordu. Tanrım! Nasıl yabanıl bir delilik anında öldürmüştü arkadaşını! Bu sahnenin salt anısı bile nasıl da feciydi! Dorian her şeyi yeniden görür gibiydi. Her bir ayrıntı tüm çirkinliğiyle, eskisinden daha korkunç olarak gözünün önünde canlanıyordu. Zamanın karanlık mağarasından, kızıllara bürünmüş olarak tüyler ürpertici günahının imgesi yükseliyordu. Lord Henry saat altıda odasına geldiği zaman Dorian’ı bir daha hiç avunmayacakmış gibi ağlar buldu.
es: Pero si sólo había sido una ilusión, ¡qué terrible pensar que la conciencia pudiera engendrar fantasmas tan temerosos, dándoles forma visible, haciendo que se movieran como seres reales! ¿Qué clase de vida sería la suya si, de día y de noche, sombras de su crimen le observaban desde rincones silenciosos, se burlaban de él desde lugares secretos, le susurraban al oído en medio de un banquete, lo despertaban con dedos helados mientras dormía? Al presentársele aquella idea en el cerebro, palideció de terror y tuvo la impresión de que el aire se había enfriado de repente. ¡En qué espantosa hora de locura había asesinado a su amigo! ¡Qué atroz el simple recuerdo de la escena! Volvía a verlo todo. Cada odioso detalle se le aparecía con renovado horror. De la negra caverna del tiempo, terrible y envuelva en escarlata, se alzaba la imagen de su pecado. Cuando lord Henry se presentó a las seis en punto, lo encontró llorando como alguien a quien está a punto de rompérsele el corazón.
vi_translation: However, if it is just an illusion, it is truly terrifying to think that the conscience could conjure up such dreadful phantoms, give them a clear form, and make them move before one's eyes! What kind of life would you have if day and night, your guilty shadows kept peering at you from silent corners, mocking you from secret places, whispering in your ear while you sit at feasts, waking you with icy fingers as you sleep! As that thought slithered through your mind, you turned pale with fear, and it seemed as if the air suddenly grew colder. Oh! How you killed your friend in a moment of madness! Even the memory of that scene is horrifying! You see it all again. Every gruesome detail returns to you with added horror. Out of the dark cave of Time, terrible and wrapped in bright red bandages, your sinful image rises. When Lord Henry arrived at six o'clock, he found you crying like someone with a heart about to break.
tr_translation: On the other hand, if what he saw was merely an illusion, how terrifying it was: to think that the conscience could create such chilling phantoms, give them visible forms, and make them move before one's eyes! What kind of life would his be, if the shadows of the crimes he committed were to watch him from silent corners day and night, stick their tongues out at him from hidden places, whisper in his ear at banquet tables, and wake him from his sleep with icy fingers! As these thoughts passed through his mind, Dorian turned pale with fear, feeling as if the air had suddenly grown cold. My God! How he had killed his friend in a moment of wild madness! Even the mere memory of this scene was so dreadful! Dorian felt as if he were seeing everything anew. Every detail, in all its ugliness, appeared before his eyes more terrifying than ever before. From the dark cave of time, the image of his horrifying sin, cloaked in crimson, rose up. When Lord Henry came to his room at six o'clock, he found Dorian crying as if he would never be consoled again.
es_translation: But if it had only been an illusion, how terrible to think that the mind could spawn such fearful phantoms, giving them visible form, making them move like real beings! What kind of life would his be if, day and night, shadows of his crime watched him from silent corners, mocked him from secret places, whispered in his ear in the midst of a banquet, woke him with icy fingers while he slept? As this idea presented itself in his brain, he turned pale with terror and had the impression that the air had suddenly cooled. In what dreadful hour of madness had he murdered his friend! How atrocious the mere memory of the scene! He saw it all again. Every hateful detail appeared to him with renewed horror. From the black cavern of time, terrible and wrapped in scarlet, rose the image of his sin. When Lord Henry arrived at six o'clock sharp, he found him crying like someone whose heart was about to break.

en: It was not till the third day that he ventured to go out. There was something in the clear, pine-scented air of that winter morning that seemed to bring him back his joyousness and his ardour for life. But it was not merely the physical conditions of environment that had caused the change. His own nature had revolted against the excess of anguish that had sought to maim and mar the perfection of its calm. With subtle and finely wrought temperaments it is always so. Their strong passions must either bruise or bend. They either slay the man, or themselves die. Shallow sorrows and shallow loves live on. The loves and sorrows that are great are destroyed by their own plenitude. Besides, he had convinced himself that he had been the victim of a terror-stricken imagination, and looked back now on his fears with something of pity and not a little of contempt.
vi: Đến tận hôm thứ ba cậu mới đánh bạo bước ra ngoài. Có gì đó trong không khí trong lành, thơm mùi thông của buổi sáng mùa đông ấy dường như đã mang về lại cho cậu niềm vui và nhiệt huyết sống. Nhưng không chỉ các điều kiện tự nhiên của môi trường chung quanh gây ra sự thay đổi. Bản chất cậu cũng đã nổi dậy chống lại sự quá mức của nỗi thống khổ cứ cố tìm cách hủy hoại tính hoàn hảo của sự điềm tĩnh vốn thuộc về nó. Luôn là vậy với những khí chất tinh tế và được trui rèn tinh vi. Những niềm đam mê mạnh mẽ của chúng phải bị bóp méo hoặc bẻ cong. Chúng giết người, hoặc chính chúng chết. Những nỗi buồn hời hợt và những tình yêu hời hợt vẫn sống tiếp. Những tình yêu và nỗi buồn vĩ đại thì bị phá hủy bởi chính sự đủ đầy của chúng. Hơn nữa, cậu tự thuyết phục mình rằng cậu là nạn nhân của một trí tưởng tượng bị ảnh hưởng bởi sự khiếp sợ, và giờ đây nhìn lại những lo ngại của mình với gì đó xót thương và rất khinh thường.
tr: Dorian ancak üçüncü gün odasından dışarı adım atmayı göze alabildi. O kış sabahının çam kokulu, duru havasındaki bir şey onun yaşama isteğini ve sevincini yeniden canlandırmış gibiydi. Gene de bu değişimi yaratan yalnızca çevrenin nesnel koşulları olmamıştı. Kendi yaradılışı da, dirliğinin kusursuzluğunu aşındırıp gölgelemeye kalkışan aşırı üzüntüye başkaldırmıştı. Karmaşık ve gergin huylu kişiler hep böyledir. Çok güçlü olan duyguları ya incitir ya da eğilir. Ya öldürür ya da ölür. Sığ hüzünler, sığ aşklar uzun ömürlüdür. Büyük aşklar, büyük üzüntülerse kendi büyüklüklerinin kurbanı olurlar. Zaten Dorian dehşete kapılan hayal gücünün kurbanı olduğuna kendi kendini inandırmıştı ve çektiği korkuları şimdi biraz acıma, bir hayli de küçümsemeyle anıyordu.
es: Tan sólo al tercer día se aventuró a salir. Había algo en el aire límpido de aquella mañana de invierno, en la que flotaba el aroma de los pinos, que pareció devolverle la alegría y el ansia de vivir. Pero no sólo las condiciones exteriores habían provocado el cambio. Su propia naturaleza se rebelaba contra el exceso de angustia que había tratado de alterar, de mutilar, su serenidad perfecta. Siempre es así con temperamentos sutiles y delicados. Sus pasiones ardientes hieren o ceden. Matan o mueren. Los sufrimientos y los amores superficiales viven largamente. A los grandes amores y sufrimientos los destruye su propia plenitud. Dorian Gray estaba convencido además de haber sido víctima de una imaginación aterrorizada, y veía ya los temores de ayer con un poco de compasión y una buena dosis de desprecio.
vi_translation: It wasn't until Tuesday that he finally dared to step outside. There was something in the fresh, pine-scented air of that winter morning that seemed to bring back to him the joy and zest for life. But it wasn't just the natural conditions of the surrounding environment that caused the change. His own nature had also risen up against the excess of the anguish that kept trying to destroy the perfection of the calmness that belonged to it. It is always so with those who have a delicate and finely tuned temperament. Their strong passions must be distorted or bent. They either kill or die themselves. Shallow sorrows and shallow loves continue to live on. Great loves and great sorrows are destroyed by their own fullness. Moreover, he convinced himself that he was the victim of an imagination influenced by terror, and now looked back at his fears with something like pity and great disdain.
tr_translation: Dorian could only muster the courage to step out of his room on the third day. Something in the pine-scented, clear air of that winter morning seemed to have rekindled his desire and joy for life. Yet, it wasn't just the objective conditions of the environment that caused this change. His own nature had also rebelled against the excessive sorrow that tried to erode and overshadow the perfection of his existence. People with complex and tense temperaments are always like this. Very strong emotions either hurt or yield. They either kill or die. Shallow sorrows, shallow loves are long-lived. Great loves, great sorrows become victims of their own greatness. After all, Dorian had convinced himself that he was a victim of his terrified imagination, and now he recalled his fears with a bit of pity and quite a bit of disdain.
es_translation: Only on the third day did he venture out. There was something in the clear air of that winter morning, in which the scent of pines floated, that seemed to restore his joy and zest for life. But it was not only the external conditions that had caused the change. His own nature was rebelling against the excess of anguish that had tried to alter, to mutilate, his perfect serenity. It is always so with subtle and delicate temperaments. Their burning passions either wound or yield. They kill or die. Superficial sufferings and loves live long. Great loves and sufferings are destroyed by their own fullness. Dorian Gray was also convinced that he had been the victim of a terrified imagination, and he now viewed the fears of yesterday with a bit of compassion and a good dose of contempt.

en: After breakfast, he walked with the duchess for an hour in the garden and then drove across the park to join the shooting-party. The crisp frost lay like salt upon the grass. The sky was an inverted cup of blue metal. A thin film of ice bordered the flat, reed-grown lake.
vi: Sau bữa sáng, cậu dạo bước cùng nữ công tước độ một giờ trong vườn, sau đó chạy xe ngang qua công viên để tham gia vào nhóm săn. Sương giá giòn tan nằm như muối trên cỏ. Bầu trời là cái cốc lộn ngược bằng kim loại xanh lam. Một màng băng mỏng viền quanh con hồ bằng phẳng mọc đầy sậy.
tr: Kahvaltıdan sonra düşesle bahçede bir saat dolaştı, sonra arabaya binerek parkın öbür ucundaki av partisine katılmaya gitti. Çıtırtılı kırağı otların üzerine tuz gibi yayılmıştı. Gökyüzü mavi metalden, ters dönmüş bir kupaydı. Kamışlı durgun gölün kıyılarını ince bir tuz tabakası çevirmişti.
es: Después del desayuno paseó con la duquesa por el jardín durante una hora, y luego atravesó el parque en coche para reunirse con la partida de caza. La escarcha matinal recubría la hierba como un manto de sal. El cielo era una copa invertida de metal azul. Una delgada capa de hielo bordeaba el lago inmóvil donde crecían los juncos.
vi_translation: After breakfast, he strolled with the duchess for about an hour in the garden, then drove through the park to join the hunting party. The crisp frost lay like salt on the grass. The sky was an inverted cup of blue metal. A thin layer of ice bordered the flat lake filled with reeds.
tr_translation: After breakfast, he walked in the garden with the duchess for an hour, then got into the carriage and went to join the hunting party at the other end of the park. The crackling frost was spread over the grass like salt. The sky was an inverted cup of blue metal. A thin layer of salt surrounded the shores of the still, reedy lake.
es_translation: After breakfast, he walked with the duchess in the garden for an hour, and then crossed the park by carriage to join the hunting party. The morning frost covered the grass like a mantle of salt. The sky was an inverted cup of blue metal. A thin layer of ice bordered the still lake where the reeds grew.

en: At the corner of the pine-wood he caught sight of Sir Geoffrey Clouston, the duchess’s brother, jerking two spent cartridges out of his gun. He jumped from the cart, and having told the groom to take the mare home, made his way towards his guest through the withered bracken and rough undergrowth.
vi: Tại góc rừng thông, cậu thoáng thấy ngài Geoffrey Clouston, anh trai của nữ công tước, đang giật mạnh hai vỏ đạn đã dùng ra khỏi súng. Cậu nhảy khỏi xe, và sau khi bảo người giữ ngựa đưa con ngựa cái về nhà, liền đi về phía vị khách của mình qua bãi dương xỉ diều hâu khô héo và tầng cây thấp bờm xờm.
tr: Çamlığın köşesinde Dorian, düşesin kardeşi Sir Geoffrey Clouston’u gördü. Sir Geoffrey tüfeğinden patlamış iki fişeği çıkartmaktaydı. Dorian arabadan aşağı atladı, arabacıya kısrağı geri götürmesini söyledikten sonra kurumuş çalıların, dikenli fundaların arasından geçerek konuğunun yanına gitti.
es: En el límite del pinar reconoció a sir Geoffrey Clouston, el hermano de la duquesa, que expulsaba dos cartuchos vacíos de su escopeta de caza. Apeándose del vehículo, después de decirle al palafrenero que regresara con la yegua, se abrió camino hacia su invitado entre los helechos secos y la espesa maleza.
vi_translation: At the corner of the pine forest, he glimpsed Mr. Geoffrey Clouston, the duke's brother, forcefully pulling two spent shells out of his gun. He jumped out of the car, and after instructing the stable hand to take the mare back home, he headed towards his guest through the withered bracken ferns and the tangled underbrush.
tr_translation: At the corner of the pine grove, Dorian saw the Duchess's brother, Sir Geoffrey Clouston. Sir Geoffrey was removing two spent cartridges from his rifle. Dorian jumped down from the carriage, told the coachman to take the mare back, and then went to his guest, passing through the dried bushes and thorny heathers.
es_translation: At the edge of the pine forest, he recognized Sir Geoffrey Clouston, the Duchess's brother, who was ejecting two spent cartridges from his hunting rifle. Dismounting from the vehicle, after telling the groom to return with the mare, he made his way to his guest through the dry ferns and thick underbrush.

en: “Have you had good sport, Geoffrey?” he asked.
vi: “Chơi vui không, Geoffrey?” cậu hỏi.
tr: “İyi avlandın mı, Geoffrey?” diye sordu.
es: —¿Buena caza, Geoffrey? —preguntó.
vi_translation: "Did you have fun, Geoffrey?" he asked.
tr_translation: “Did you hunt well, Geoffrey?” he asked.
es_translation: —Good hunting, Geoffrey? —he asked.

en: “Not very good, Dorian. I think most of the birds have gone to the open. I dare say it will be better after lunch, when we get to new ground.”
vi: “Không vui lắm, Dorian. Tôi nghĩ hầu hết bọn chim đã bay ra nơi đồng không mông quạnh rồi. Tôi dám nói là sau bữa trưa sẽ vui hơn, khi ta đến khu đất mới.
tr: “Pek de iyi değildi, Dorian. Kuşların çoğu açığa çıkmışlar sanıyorum. Yemekten sonra, yeni bir alana gidince daha iyi olacak, herhalde.
es: —No demasiado buena, Dorian. Me parece que la mayoría de las aves han salido ya a cielo abierto. Espero que tengamos más suerte después del almuerzo, cuando iniciemos otra batida.
vi_translation: "Not very happy, Dorian. I think most of the birds have flown to the desolate fields. I dare say it will be more enjoyable after lunch, when we reach the new land."
tr_translation: “It wasn't very good, Dorian. I think most of the birds have been exposed. After dinner, it will probably be better when we go to a new area.”
es_translation: —Not too good, Dorian. It seems to me that most of the birds have already flown out into the open sky. I hope we have better luck after lunch, when we start another drive.

en: Dorian strolled along by his side. The keen aromatic air, the brown and red lights that glimmered in the wood, the hoarse cries of the beaters ringing out from time to time, and the sharp snaps of the guns that followed, fascinated him and filled him with a sense of delightful freedom. He was dominated by the carelessness of happiness, by the high indifference of joy.
vi: Dorian dạo bước bên y. Không khí thơm ngát, ánh sáng đỏ và nâu le lói trong rừng, tiếng kêu khàn khàn của những người xua dã thú thỉnh thoảng lại vang lên, tiếng súng lách cách sắc nét theo sau, quyến rũ cậu, và khiến cậu ngập tràn cảm xúc tự do thích thú. Cậu bị chi phối hoàn toàn bởi niềm hạnh phúc bất cẩn, bởi niềm hân hoan bàng quang tột đỉnh.
tr: Dorian onun yanı sıra ağır ağır yürümeye başladı. Mis kokulu temiz, ayaz hava, korunun içinde parlayan kahverengi kırmızı ışıklar, kuşları kışkışlayan adamların durup durup çınlayan boğuk bağırışlarıyla bunları izleyen keskin tüfek sesleri onu adeta büyülüyor, içini tatlı bir özgürlük duyusuyla dolduruyordu. Mutluluğun verdiği kaygısızlık, sevincin uyandırdığı umursamazlık şimdi bütün öbür duygularından baskın çıkmıştı.
es: Dorian caminó a su lado. El aire intensamente aromático, los resplandores marrones y rojos que aparecían momentáneamente en el pinar, los gritos roncos de los ojeadores que resonaban de cuando en cuando y el ruido seco de las detonaciones que los seguían eran para él motivo de fascinación, y lo llenaban de un delicioso sentimiento de libertad. Le dominaba la despreocupación de la felicidad, la suprema indiferencia de la alegría.
vi_translation: Dorian walked beside him. The air was fragrant, red and brown light flickered in the forest, the hoarse cries of the beaters occasionally rang out, followed by the sharp clatter of guns, enchanting him, and filling him with a sense of joyful freedom. He was completely dominated by a careless happiness, by an overwhelming sense of euphoric detachment.
tr_translation: Dorian began to walk slowly beside him. The fragrant, clean, crisp air, the brown and red lights shining within the grove, the muffled shouts of the men chasing away the birds, and the sharp sounds of rifles following these shouts almost enchanted him, filling him with a sweet sense of freedom. The carefreeness brought by happiness, the indifference awakened by joy, now dominated all his other feelings.
es_translation: Dorian walked by his side. The intensely aromatic air, the brown and red glows that momentarily appeared in the pine forest, the hoarse cries of the beaters that occasionally echoed, and the dry noise of the gunshots that followed were a source of fascination for him, filling him with a delightful sense of freedom. He was dominated by the carefree nature of happiness, the supreme indifference of joy.

en: Suddenly from a lumpy tussock of old grass some twenty yards in front of them, with black-tipped ears erect and long hinder limbs throwing it forward, started a hare. It bolted for a thicket of alders. Sir Geoffrey put his gun to his shoulder, but there was something in the animal’s grace of movement that strangely charmed Dorian Gray, and he cried out at once, “Don’t shoot it, Geoffrey. Let it live.”
vi: Đột nhiên, từ bụi cỏ già lổn nhổn, độ hai chục thước trước mặt họ, với đôi tai chóp đen dựng đứng và các chân sau dài thượt đẩy thân mình tới trước, đột ngột xuất hiện một con thỏ rừng. Nó chạy trốn vào một bụi trăn. Ngài Geoffrey kê súng lên vai, nhưng có gì đó ở sự yêu kiều của con thú trong lúc chuyển động đã quyến rũ Dorian Gray một cách kỳ lạ, và cậu hét lên ngay lập tức, “Đừng bắn nó, Geoffrey. Để nó sống.”
tr: Birden, yirmi metre kadar ilerideki sık bir kuru ot kümesinin içinden, kara uçlu kulaklarını dikmiş, uzun arka bacakları üstünde hoplayarak bir tavşan fırladı. Hemen karşıki akçaağaçlara doğru koşmaya başladı. Sir Geoffrey tüfeğini omzuna koymuştu bile. Gelgelelim Dorian hayvanın devinimlerindeki uyumdan çok hoşlanarak hemen o an, “Geoffrey, vurma!” diye bağırdı. “Bırak yaşasın!
es: De repente, de una espesa mata de hierbas amarillentas, a unos veinte metros de donde ellos se encontraban, erguidas las orejas de puntas negras, avanzando a saltos sobre sus largas patas traseras, salió una liebre, que se dirigió de inmediato hacia un grupo de alisos. Sir Geoffrey se llevó la escopeta al hombro, pero algo en los ágiles movimientos del animal cautivó extrañamente a Dorian Gray, quien gritó de inmediato: —¡No dispares, Geoffrey! Déjala vivir.
vi_translation: Suddenly, from the old, scraggly bushes, about twenty yards in front of them, with black-tipped ears standing upright and long hind legs pushing its body forward, a hare abruptly appeared. It fled into a thicket of brambles. Sir Geoffrey raised his gun to his shoulder, but something about the grace of the animal in motion strangely captivated Dorian Gray, and he immediately shouted, “Don’t shoot it, Geoffrey. Let it live.”
tr_translation: Suddenly, from within a dense cluster of dry grass about twenty meters ahead, a rabbit with black-tipped ears sprang up, hopping on its long hind legs. It immediately started running towards the maple trees opposite. Sir Geoffrey had already shouldered his rifle. However, Dorian, greatly pleased by the harmony in the animal's movements, shouted at that very moment, "Geoffrey, don't shoot!" "Let it live!"
es_translation: Suddenly, from a thick clump of yellowish grass, about twenty meters from where they were standing, with its black-tipped ears erect, hopping on its long hind legs, a hare emerged, which immediately headed towards a group of alders. Sir Geoffrey raised his shotgun to his shoulder, but something in the agile movements of the animal strangely captivated Dorian Gray, who immediately shouted: —Don't shoot, Geoffrey! Let her live.

en: “What nonsense, Dorian!” laughed his companion, and as the hare bounded into the thicket, he fired. There were two cries heard, the cry of a hare in pain, which is dreadful, the cry of a man in agony, which is worse.
vi: “Tào lao quá, Dorian!” bạn cậu bật cười, và lúc con thỏ nhảy vọt vào bụi thì y nổ súng. Nghe thấy hai tiếng kêu, tiếng kêu của con thỏ trong cơn đau, rất dễ sợ, và tiếng kêu của người trong cơn hấp hối, còn kinh khủng hơn.
tr: Adam, “Saçmalama, Dorian!” diye güldü ve tam tavşan fundalığa daldığı anda tüfeğini ateşledi. İki bağırış duyuldu: can acısı çeken bir tavşanın bağırışı –ki fecidir– ve can acısı çeken bir insanın bundan da beter olan bağırışı.
es: —¡Qué absurdo, Dorian! —rió Clouston, disparando cuando la liebre entraba de un salto en la espesura. Se, oyeron dos gritos: el de la liebre herida de muerte, que es terrible, y el de un ser humano agonizante, que es todavía peor.
vi_translation: “That's nonsense, Dorian!” his friend laughed, and as the rabbit leaped into the bush, he fired. There were two cries: the cry of the rabbit in pain, very frightening, and the cry of a person in their death throes, even more terrifying.
tr_translation: Adam laughed, "Don't be ridiculous, Dorian!" and fired his rifle just as the rabbit darted into the thicket. Two cries were heard: the cry of a rabbit in pain – which is dreadful – and the even worse cry of a human in pain.
es_translation: —How absurd, Dorian! —laughed Clouston, shooting as the hare leaped into the thicket. Two cries were heard: the terrible one of the mortally wounded hare, and the even worse one of a dying human being.

en: “Good heavens! I have hit a beater!” exclaimed Sir Geoffrey. “What an ass the man was to get in front of the guns! Stop shooting there!” he called out at the top of his voice. “A man is hurt.”
vi: “Trời ơi! Tôi bắn trúng một người xua thú rồi!” ngài Geoffrey la lên. “Gã đần nào mà lại chui vào trước họng súng thế này! Đằng kia ngưng bắn đi!” ông ta hét to hết sức mình. “Có người bị thương.
tr: Sir Geoffrey, “Aman Tanrım, kışkışçılardan birini vurdum!” diye bağırdı. “Ne salaklık! Tüfeklerin karşısında durulur mu?” Sonra sesinin var gücüyle, “Hey, oradakiler, ateşi kesin, adam vuruldu!” diye haykırmaya başladı.
es: —¡Cielo santo! ¡He alcanzado a un ojeador! —exclamó sir Geoffrey—. ¡Qué estupidez ponerse delante de las escopetas! ¡Dejen de disparar! —gritó con todas sus fuerzas—. Hay un herido.
vi_translation: “Oh my God! I shot a beater!” Sir Geoffrey shouted. “What kind of fool would walk right into the line of fire! Stop shooting over there!” he yelled at the top of his lungs. “Someone is injured.”
tr_translation: Sir Geoffrey shouted, "My God, I shot one of the beaters!" "What stupidity! Who stands in front of the guns?" Then, with all his might, he started yelling, "Hey, you over there, cease fire, a man has been shot!"
es_translation: —Good heavens! I've hit a beater! —exclaimed Sir Geoffrey—. What stupidity to get in front of the guns! Stop shooting! —he shouted with all his might—. There is an injured person.

en: The head-keeper came running up with a stick in his hand.
vi: Trưởng nhóm gác rừng chạy lại với cây gậy trong tay.
tr: Başkorucu elinde bir sopayla koşarak geldi.
es: El guarda mayor llegó corriendo con un bastón en la mano.
vi_translation: The forest guard leader ran over with a stick in his hand.
tr_translation: The head guard came running with a stick in his hand.
es_translation: The chief guard arrived running with a baton in his hand.

en: “Where, sir? Where is he?” he shouted. At the same time, the firing ceased along the line.
vi: “Đâu, thưa ngài? Nó đâu?” y gào lên. Cùng lúc ấy, cuộc bắn dừng lại suốt dọc tuyến.
tr: “Nerede, efendim? Nerede adam?” diye bağırıyordu. Bu arada ateş çizgisindeki tüfek sesleri de kesilmişti.
es: —¿Dónde, señor? ¿Dónde está? —gritó. Al mismo tiempo cesó el fuego en toda la línea.
vi_translation: "Where, sir?" "Where is it?" he shouted. At the same time, the shooting stopped all along the line.
tr_translation: "Where, sir? Where is the man?" he was shouting. Meanwhile, the rifle shots in the line of fire had also ceased.
es_translation: —Where, sir? Where is it? —he shouted. At the same time, the fire ceased along the entire line.

en: “Here,” answered Sir Geoffrey angrily, hurrying towards the thicket. “Why on earth don’t you keep your men back? Spoiled my shooting for the day.”
vi: “Đây,” ngài Geoffrey trả lời, giận dữ, vội vã bước về phía bụi cây. “Trời đất ơi, sao anh không giữ người của mình đằng sau? Làm hỏng cả ngày săn của tôi.”
tr: Sir Geoffrey öfkeyle, “Burada,” diye yanıtlayarak fundalığa doğru koştu. “Adamlarını neden geride tutmazsın? Bugünlük av berbat oldu!
es: —Ahí —respondió muy irritado sir Geoffrey, acercándose al bosquecillo—. ¿Por qué demonios no controla a sus hombres? Me han echado a perder toda una jornada de caza.
vi_translation: “Here,” Sir Geoffrey replied angrily, hurrying towards the bushes. “Good heavens, why didn't you keep your men behind? You've ruined my entire hunting day.”
tr_translation: Sir Geoffrey angrily replied, "Here," and ran towards the heath. "Why don't you hold your men back? Today's hunt is ruined!"
es_translation: —There —replied Sir Geoffrey very irritated, approaching the grove—. Why the devil don't you control your men? They have ruined an entire day of hunting for me.

en: Dorian watched them as they plunged into the alder-clump, brushing the lithe swinging branches aside. In a few moments they emerged, dragging a body after them into the sunlight. He turned away in horror. It seemed to him that misfortune followed wherever he went. He heard Sir Geoffrey ask if the man was really dead, and the affirmative answer of the keeper. The wood seemed to him to have become suddenly alive with faces. There was the trampling of myriad feet and the low buzz of voices. A great copper-breasted pheasant came beating through the boughs overhead.
vi: Dorian theo dõi họ lúc họ lao vào bụi trăn, gạt các nhánh cây mềm mại, đu đưa qua một bên. Một lúc sau, họ hiện ra, kéo một thi thể theo sau ra ngoài nắng. Cậu sợ hãi quay đi. Cậu thấy dường như sự rủi ro cứ bám theo cậu bất cứ nơi đâu cậu đi. Cậu nghe thấy ngài Geoffrey hỏi không biết người này đã chết thật chưa, và câu trả lời khẳng định của người gác rừng. Cậu thấy dường như khu rừng bỗng trở nên nhan nhản mặt người. Có tiếng giẫm đạp của hàng vạn cái chân, và tiếng ồn ào khe khẽ của các giọng nói. Một con chim trĩ ngực-đồng khổng lồ đến vỗ cánh qua những cành cây trên đầu.
tr: Dorian onların akçaağaçların o diri, kıvrak, sallantılı dallarını aralayarak fundalığa dalışlarını seyretti. Birkaç dakika sonra geri geldiler ve arkalarından sürüdükleri bir gövdeyi gün ışığına çıkardılar. Dorian dehşet ve tiksintiyle başını çevirdi. Nereye gitse şanssızlık onu izliyordu sanki. Sir Geoffrey adamın ölmüş olup olmadığını sordu. Korucu, evet, diye yanıtladı. Dorian bunları duydu. Koru birden sayısız insan yüzleriyle kıpır kıpır olmuş gibi geldi. Sayısız ayakların patırtısı, alçak konuşma sesleri duyuluyordu. Yukarıki dalları hışırdata hışırdata, kocaman, göğsü bakır renginde bir sülün çıkageldi.
es: Dorian los contempló mientras penetraban en el alisal, apartando las delgadas ramas flexibles. Al verlos reaparecer a los pocos momentos, arrastrando un cuerpo sin vida que llevaron hasta el sol, se dio la vuelta horrorizado. Le pareció que las desgracias lo seguían dondequiera que iba. Oyó preguntar a sir Geoffrey si aquel hombre estaba realmente muerto, y la respuesta afirmativa del guarda mayor. Tuvo de pronto la impresión de que el bosque se había llenado de rostros. Oía los pasos de miles de pies y un murmullo confuso de voces. Un gran faisán de pecho cobrizo pasó aleteando entre las ramas más altas.
vi_translation: Dorian watched them as they rushed into the thicket, brushing aside the soft, swaying branches. A moment later, they emerged, dragging a corpse out into the sunlight. He turned away in fear. He felt as if misfortune followed him wherever he went. He heard Sir Geoffrey question whether the person was truly dead, and the ranger's affirmative response. He felt as if the forest suddenly became teeming with faces. There was the trampling sound of thousands of feet, and the soft murmur of voices. A giant copper-breasted pheasant flew through the branches overhead.
tr_translation: Dorian watched them as they parted the lively, supple, swaying branches of the maple trees and plunged into the thicket. A few minutes later, they returned and dragged a body into the daylight behind them. Dorian turned his head away in horror and disgust. It seemed as if misfortune followed him wherever he went. Sir Geoffrey asked if the man was dead. The ranger replied, yes. Dorian heard this. Suddenly, the grove seemed to be teeming with countless human faces. The sound of countless footsteps and low voices could be heard. A large pheasant with a copper-colored chest appeared, rustling the upper branches.
es_translation: Dorian watched them as they entered the alder grove, pushing aside the thin, flexible branches. Seeing them reappear a few moments later, dragging a lifeless body which they brought into the sunlight, he turned away in horror. It seemed to him that misfortunes followed him wherever he went. He heard Sir Geoffrey ask if the man was really dead, and the chief gamekeeper's affirmative response. Suddenly, he had the impression that the forest was filled with faces. He heard the footsteps of thousands of feet and a confused murmur of voices. A large pheasant with a coppery breast flew flapping through the highest branches.

en: After a few moments—that were to him, in his perturbed state, like endless hours of pain—he felt a hand laid on his shoulder. He started and looked round.
vi: Sau vài phút mà với cậu, trong tình trạng rối bời, tựa như những giờ đớn đau vô tận, cậu cảm thấy một bàn tay đặt lên vai. Cậu giật mình, nhìn quanh.
tr: Dorian sarsılmıştı, ona acı dolu saatler gibi gelen birkaç dakikanın ardından omzuna bir elin dokunduğunu hissetti. İrkilerek dönüp arkasına baktı.
es: Después de unos momentos que fueron para él, dada la agitación de su espíritu, como interminables horas de dolor, sintió que una mano se posaba en su hombro. Sobresaltado, volvió la vista.
vi_translation: After a few minutes that, in his agitated state, felt like endless hours of pain, he felt a hand placed on his shoulder. He started and looked around.
tr_translation: Dorian was shaken; after a few minutes that felt like hours of agony, he felt a hand touch his shoulder. He turned around with a start.
es_translation: After a few moments that felt to him, given the agitation of his spirit, like endless hours of pain, he felt a hand rest on his shoulder. Startled, he turned his gaze.

en: “Dorian,” said Lord Henry, “I had better tell them that the shooting is stopped for to-day. It would not look well to go on.”
vi: “Dorian,” huân tước Henry nói, “tôi nên bảo họ rằng cuộc săn dừng lại hôm nay thì hơn. Có vẻ không hay lắm nếu cứ tiếp tục.”
tr: “Dorian,” dedi Lord Henry. “Bugünlük avın sona erdiğini herkese söyleyeyim bari. Devam etmek yakışık almaz.
es: —Dorian —dijo lord Henry—. Será mejor decirles que por hoy se ha terminado la caza. No parecería bien seguir adelante.
vi_translation: "Dorian," Lord Henry said, "I should tell them that the hunt should stop today." "It doesn't seem very appropriate to continue."
tr_translation: “Dorian,” said Lord Henry. “I should tell everyone that the hunt is over for today. It would not be appropriate to continue.”
es_translation: —Dorian —said Lord Henry—. It would be better to tell them that the hunt is over for today. It wouldn't seem right to continue.

en: “I wish it were stopped for ever, Harry,” he answered bitterly. “The whole thing is hideous and cruel. Is the man ...?”
vi: “Tôi mong là nó sẽ dừng lại mãi mãi, Harry,” cậu trả lời, chua xót. “Toàn bộ chuyện này thật ghê tởm và độc ác. Người đó đã…”
tr: Dorian acı acı, “Keşke temelli sona erse, Harry!” dedi. “Pis, vahşi bir iş! Adam...
es: —Me gustaría detenerla para siempre, Harry —respondió amargamente—. Todo es horrible y cruel. ¿Está...?
vi_translation: "I hope it stops forever, Harry," he replied, bitterly. "This whole thing is disgusting and cruel. That person has..."
tr_translation: Dorian bitterly said, "I wish it would end forever, Harry!" "A filthy, savage business! The man..."
es_translation: —I would like to stop it forever, Harry —he responded bitterly—. Everything is horrible and cruel. Is it...?

en: He could not finish the sentence.
vi: Cậu không thể nói hết câu.
tr: Cümlesinin sonunu getiremedi.
es: No pudo terminar la frase.
vi_translation: You couldn't finish the sentence.
tr_translation: He couldn't finish his sentence.
es_translation: He couldn't finish the sentence.

en: “I am afraid so,” rejoined Lord Henry. “He got the whole charge of shot in his chest. He must have died almost instantaneously. Come; let us go home.”
vi: “Tôi e là vậy,” huân tước Henry đáp lại. “Hắn lãnh cả số đạn vào ngực. Chắc hắn đã chết gần như ngay lập tức. Nào; ta hãy về nhà thôi.”
tr: Lord Henry, “Korkarım evet,” diye yanıtladı. “Olanca saçmayı göğsüne yemiş. Anında ölmüş olsa gerek. Yürü, eve dönelim.
es: —Mucho me temo —replicó lord Henry—. La descarga le alcanzó de lleno en el pecho. Debe de haber muerto de manera casi instantánea. Ven; volvamos a casa.
vi_translation: “I’m afraid so,” Lord Henry replied. “He took all the bullets to the chest. He must have died almost instantly. Come; let’s go home.”
tr_translation: Lord Henry replied, "I'm afraid so." "He took all the nonsense to heart. He must have died instantly. Come on, let's go home."
es_translation: —I greatly fear so —replied Lord Henry—. The shot hit him squarely in the chest. He must have died almost instantly. Come; let's go back home.

en: They walked side by side in the direction of the avenue for nearly fifty yards without speaking. Then Dorian looked at Lord Henry and said, with a heavy sigh, “It is a bad omen, Harry, a very bad omen.”
vi: Họ bước bên nhau theo hướng con đường dưới hàng cây độ năm chục thước mà chẳng nói năng gì. Sau đó Dorian nhìn huân tước Henry, và nói, với một tiếng thở dài trĩu nặng, “đó là điềm xấu, Harry, một điềm rất xấu.”
tr: Anayola doğru hemen hemen elli metre, hiç konuşmadan, yan yana yürüdüler. Sonra Dorian, Lord Henry’ye bakıp derinden içini çekerek, “Uğursuzluk belirtisi bu, Harry,” dedi. “Çok büyük bir uğursuzluk.
es: Echaron a andar, uno al lado del otro, en dirección al paseo, y recorrieron casi cincuenta metros sin hablar. Luego Dorian miró a lord Henry y dijo, con un hondo suspiro: —Es un mal presagio, Harry; un pésimo presagio.
vi_translation: They walked side by side along the path under the trees for about fifty meters without saying a word. Then Dorian looked at Lord Henry and said, with a heavy sigh, "It is a bad omen, Harry, a very bad omen."
tr_translation: They walked almost fifty meters towards the main road, side by side, without speaking. Then Dorian looked at Lord Henry and, sighing deeply, said, "This is a bad omen, Harry," "A very bad omen."
es_translation: They started walking, side by side, towards the promenade, and covered almost fifty meters without speaking. Then Dorian looked at Lord Henry and said, with a deep sigh: —It's a bad omen, Harry; a terrible omen.

en: “What is?” asked Lord Henry. “Oh! this accident, I suppose. My dear fellow, it can’t be helped. It was the man’s own fault. Why did he get in front of the guns? Besides, it is nothing to us. It is rather awkward for Geoffrey, of course. It does not do to pepper beaters. It makes people think that one is a wild shot. And Geoffrey is not; he shoots very straight. But there is no use talking about the matter.”
vi: “Là sao?” huân tước Henry hỏi. “Ôi! Tai nạn này hả. Bạn ơi, vô phương cứu chữa thôi. Đó là lỗi của chính gã đó. Sao gã lại chui vào ngay trước họng súng? Ngoài ra, nó cũng chẳng can hệ gì đến ta. Cũng khá là rầy rà cho Geoffrey, dĩ nhiên. Vãi đạn vào người xua thú thì đúng là không ra làm sao cả. Nó khiến cho thiên hạ nghĩ y là một tay súng lung tung. Mà Geoffrey không thế; y bắn rất chuẩn. Nhưng nói về chuyện này cũng chẳng ích gì.”
tr: Lord Henry, “Ne?” diye sordu. “Ha, şu kazayı demek istiyorsun, herhalde. Sevgili dostum, olan olmuş. Adamın kendi suçu. Silahın önüne geçilir mi? Hem zaten bize ne, kuzum? Geoffrey için biraz biçimsiz bir durum, doğallıkla. Kışkışçıları vurmak hoş bir şey değil. Sonra adamın adı kötü nişancıya çıkar. Oysa Geoffrey kötü nişancı değildir. Tetiği çekti mi tam isabet alır. Her neyse, bu konuyu konuşmanın bir yararı yok.
es: —¿A qué te refieres? —preguntó lord Henry—. Ah, hablas del accidente, imagino. Pero, ¿quién podía preverlo? La culpa ha sido suya. ¿Qué hacía por delante de la línea de fuego? En cualquier caso no es asunto nuestro. Molesto para Geoffrey, sin duda. No está bien visto agujerear ojeadores. Hace pensar a la gente que uno no sabe dónde tira. Y Geoffrey lo sabe perfectamente; donde pone el ojo pone la bala. Pero no sirve de nada hablar de este asunto.
vi_translation: “What do you mean?” Lord Henry asked. “Oh! This accident, huh. My friend, it's hopeless. It was his own fault. Why did he get right in front of the gun? Besides, it has nothing to do with us. It's quite a hassle for Geoffrey, of course. Shooting at the person driving the game is really not okay at all. It makes people think he's a reckless shooter. But Geoffrey isn't like that; he's a very accurate shooter. But talking about this is pointless.”
tr_translation: Lord Henry asked, "What?" "Oh, you mean that accident, I suppose. My dear friend, what's done is done. It was the man's own fault. Can you step in front of a gun? And anyway, what does it matter to us, dear? It's a bit awkward for Geoffrey, naturally. Shooting beaters is not a pleasant thing. Then the man gets a reputation for being a bad shot. But Geoffrey is not a bad shot. When he pulls the trigger, he hits the mark. Anyway, there's no point in talking about this."
es_translation: —What do you mean? —asked Lord Henry—. Ah, you're talking about the accident, I imagine. But, who could have foreseen it? It was his fault. What was he doing in front of the firing line? In any case, it's not our concern. Annoying for Geoffrey, no doubt. It's not well-regarded to shoot beaters. It makes people think one doesn't know where they're aiming. And Geoffrey knows perfectly well; where he sets his eye, he sets his bullet. But it's no use talking about this matter.

en: Dorian shook his head. “It is a bad omen, Harry. I feel as if something horrible were going to happen to some of us. To myself, perhaps,” he added, passing his hand over his eyes, with a gesture of pain.
vi: Dorian lắc đầu. “Đó là điểm xấu, Harry. Tôi cảm thấy như thể có gì đó khủng khiếp sắp xảy ra với ai đó trong chúng ta. Với chính tôi, không chừng,” cậu nói thêm, gạt tay qua mắt, với điệu bộ đau đớn.
tr: Dorian başını salladı. “Harry, uğursuzluk bu. İçimde öyle bir his var, sanki aramızdan birilerinin başına feci bir şey gelecek. Belki de benim başıma,” diye ekleyerek elini, ağrı çekiyormuş gibi gözlerine bastırdı.
es: Dorian hizo un gesto negativo con la cabeza. —Es un mal presagio, Harry. Siento como si algo horrible nos fuese a suceder a alguno de nosotros. A mí, tal vez —añadió, pasándose las manos por los ojos, con un gesto de dolor.
vi_translation: Dorian shook his head. "That is a bad point, Harry. I feel as if something terrible is about to happen to one of us. To myself, perhaps," he added, brushing his hand across his eyes with a pained expression.
tr_translation: Dorian nodded his head. "Harry, this is ominous. I have a feeling that something terrible is going to happen to one of us. Maybe to me," he added, pressing his hand to his eyes as if in pain.
es_translation: Dorian shook his head. —It's a bad omen, Harry. I feel like something horrible is going to happen to one of us. To me, perhaps —he added, passing his hands over his eyes, with a gesture of pain.

en: The elder man laughed. “The only horrible thing in the world is ennui, Dorian. That is the one sin for which there is no forgiveness. But we are not likely to suffer from it unless these fellows keep chattering about this thing at dinner. I must tell them that the subject is to be tabooed. As for omens, there is no such thing as an omen. Destiny does not send us heralds. She is too wise or too cruel for that. Besides, what on earth could happen to you, Dorian? You have everything in the world that a man can want. There is no one who would not be delighted to change places with you.”
vi: Người lớn hơn bật cười. “Thứ duy nhất khủng khiếp trên đời này là buồn chán, Dorian à. Đó là một tội lỗi không được tha thứ. Nhưng chắc ta cũng không phải chịu đựng nó đâu, trừ phi những ông bạn ấy cứ bép xép về chuyện này ở bữa tối. Tôi phải dặn họ là chủ đề này bị cấm. Còn về điềm báo, không có cái thứ nào như một điềm báo cả. Số phận không gửi sứ giả đến cho ta. Về phần này, bà ấy quá khôn hoặc quá ác. Ngoài ra, liệu trên trần gian còn chuyện gì có thể xảy ra với cậu được, Dorian? Cậu có mọi thứ mà con người có thể cần đến. Không một ai lại không vui lòng đổi chỗ với cậu.”
tr: Arkadaşı güldü. “Dünyada tek feci şey can sıkıntısıdır Dorian. Hiç bağışlanmayan tek günah odur. Neyse, bizim bu felakete uğramamız olası değil, bu heriflerin sofrada da bu olayı ağızlarında çiğneyip durmaları dışında. Konunun tabu olduğunu onlara söyleyeyim bari. Uğursuzluk belirtisine gelince, yok böyle şey. Kaderin bizlere önceden haberci göndermek gibi bir huyu yoktur. Bunu yapmayacak kadar bilgedir o ya da acımasız: Hem zaten kuzum Dorian, ne gelebilir ki senin başına? İnsanın isteyebileceği her şeye sahipsin. Kim desen seve seve yer değiştirir seninle.
es: Su amigo de más edad se echó a reír. —Lo único horrible en el mundo es el ennui, Dorian. Ése es el único pecado que no tiene perdón. Pero no es probable que lo padezcamos, a no ser que nuestros amigos sigan hablando durante la cena de lo sucedido. He de decirles que es un tema tabú. En cuanto a presagios, no existe nada semejante. El destino no nos envía heraldos. Es demasiado prudente o demasiado cruel para eso. Además, ¿qué demonios podría sucederte? Tienes todo lo que un hombre puede desear. Cualquiera se cambiaría por ti.
vi_translation: The older person laughed. “The only terrible thing in this world is boredom, Dorian. It is an unforgivable sin. But surely we don't have to endure it, unless those friends of ours keep babbling about it at dinner. I must tell them that this topic is forbidden. As for omens, there is no such thing as an omen. Fate does not send messengers to us. In this regard, she is either too wise or too cruel. Besides, what on earth could possibly happen to you, Dorian? You have everything a person could need. No one would be unwilling to trade places with you.”
tr_translation: His friend laughed. “The only dreadful thing in the world is boredom, Dorian. It is the only sin for which there is no forgiveness. Anyway, it is unlikely that we will suffer from this calamity, except for these guys chewing over the same topic at the table. I might as well tell them that the subject is taboo. As for the sign of bad luck, there is no such thing. Fate does not have the habit of sending us a warning in advance. It is too wise or too ruthless to do so: Besides, my dear Dorian, what could possibly happen to you? You have everything a person could desire. Anyone would gladly trade places with you.”
es_translation: His older friend burst out laughing. —The only horrible thing in the world is ennui, Dorian. That is the only sin that is unforgivable. But it is unlikely that we will suffer from it, unless our friends continue talking during dinner about what happened. I must tell them that it is a taboo subject. As for omens, there is no such thing. Fate does not send us heralds. It is too prudent or too cruel for that. Besides, what the hell could happen to you? You have everything a man could desire. Anyone would trade places with you.

en: “There is no one with whom I would not change places, Harry. Don’t laugh like that. I am telling you the truth. The wretched peasant who has just died is better off than I am. I have no terror of death. It is the coming of death that terrifies me. Its monstrous wings seem to wheel in the leaden air around me. Good heavens! don’t you see a man moving behind the trees there, watching me, waiting for me?”
vi: “Không có một ai mà tôi lại không muốn đổi chỗ với họ, Harry. Đừng cười như thế. Tôi đang nói sự thật với anh. Người nông dân cùng khổ vừa mới chết ấy cũng sung sướng hơn tôi. Tôi không sợ Cái chết. Chính sự tiếp cận của Cái chết mới làm tôi khiếp sợ. Đôi cánh khổng lồ của nó dường như đương lượn vòng trên không khí xám chì quanh tôi. Trời ơi! Anh có thấy một người đang di chuyển sau những cái cây đằng kia, theo dõi tôi, chờ đợi tôi không?”
tr: “Ben de kim isterse onunla yer değiştiririm Harry. Gülmesene öyle. Biraz önce ölen o sefil köylünün bile durumu benden daha iyi. Ölümden korkum yok benim. Beni dehşete düşüren ölümün gelişidir. Ölümün o dev kanatları çevremizdeki şu kurşun gibi ağır havanın içinde kulaç atıyor sanki. Aman Tanrım! Şu ağaçların ardında bir adam var, görmüyor musun? Beni gözetliyor, yolumu bekliyor.
es: —No hay nadie con quien yo no estaría dispuesto a cambiarme, Harry. No te rías así. Te estoy diciendo la verdad. Ese pobre campesino que acaba de morir es más afortunado que yo. No le tengo miedo a la muerte. Es su forma de llegar lo que me aterroriza. Sus alas monstruosas parecen girar en el aire plomizo a mi alrededor. ¡Dios del cielo! ¿No has visto a un hombre moviéndose detrás de aquellos árboles, un individuo que me vigila, que me está esperando?
vi_translation: “There is no one I wouldn't want to trade places with, Harry. Don't laugh like that. I'm telling you the truth. Even that poor farmer who just died is happier than I am. I'm not afraid of Death. It's the approach of Death that terrifies me. Its enormous wings seem to be circling in the leaden gray air around me. Oh my God! Do you see someone moving behind those trees over there, watching me, waiting for me?”
tr_translation: “I would switch places with anyone who wants, Harry. Don't laugh like that. Even the wretched peasant who just died is in a better situation than me. I'm not afraid of death. What horrifies me is the approach of death. It's as if death's giant wings are swimming through this leaden air around us. My God! There's a man behind those trees, don't you see? He's watching me, waiting for my path.”
es_translation: —There is no one with whom I wouldn't be willing to trade places, Harry. Don't laugh like that. I'm telling you the truth. That poor peasant who just died is luckier than I am. I'm not afraid of death. It's the way it comes that terrifies me. Its monstrous wings seem to whirl in the leaden air around me. Good heavens! Didn't you see a man moving behind those trees, an individual who is watching me, who is waiting for me?

en: Lord Henry looked in the direction in which the trembling gloved hand was pointing. “Yes,” he said, smiling, “I see the gardener waiting for you. I suppose he wants to ask you what flowers you wish to have on the table to-night. How absurdly nervous you are, my dear fellow! You must come and see my doctor, when we get back to town.”
vi: Huân tước Henry nhìn theo hướng mà bàn tay đeo găng run rẩy ấy đang chỉ. “Vâng,” y vừa cười vừa nói, “tôi thấy người làm vườn đang chờ cậu. Tôi cho là hắn cần hỏi cậu xem cậu muốn có những bông hoa nào trên bàn đêm nay. Sao mà cậu lại bất an một cách vô lý đến vậy, bạn ơi! Cậu phải đến gặp bác sỹ của tôi, khi ta quay về thành phố.”
tr: Lord Henry o titreyen, eldivenli elin imlediği yöne baktı. Gülümseyerek, “Evet,” diye karşılık verdi. “Bahçıvanın seni beklediğini görüyorum. Bu gece sofrada hangi çiçekleri istediğini sormak istiyor olsa gerek. Sinirlerin gülünç derecede gergin, yavrucuğum. Kente döndüğümüzde mutlaka git, benim doktoruma görün.
es: Lord Henry miró en la dirección que señalaba la temblorosa mano enguantada. —Sí —dijo sonriendo—; veo un jardinero que te espera. Imagino que desea preguntarte qué flores quieres esta noche en la mesa. ¡Qué increíblemente nervioso estás, mi querido amigo! Has de ir a ver a mi médico cuando vuelvas a Londres.
vi_translation: Lord Henry looked in the direction the trembling gloved hand was pointing. "Yes," he said with a smile, "I see the gardener waiting for you. I suppose he needs to ask you which flowers you want on the table tonight. Why are you so unreasonably anxious, my friend! You must see my doctor when we return to the city."
tr_translation: Lord Henry shivered and looked in the direction indicated by the gloved hand. Smiling, he replied, "Yes." "I see the gardener is waiting for you. He probably wants to ask which flowers you want on the table tonight. Your nerves are ridiculously tense, my dear. When we return to the city, you must go see my doctor."
es_translation: Lord Henry looked in the direction indicated by the trembling gloved hand. —Yes —he said, smiling—; I see a gardener waiting for you. I imagine he wants to ask you which flowers you want on the table tonight. How incredibly nervous you are, my dear friend! You must go see my doctor when you return to London.

en: Dorian heaved a sigh of relief as he saw the gardener approaching. The man touched his hat, glanced for a moment at Lord Henry in a hesitating manner, and then produced a letter, which he handed to his master. “Her Grace told me to wait for an answer,” he murmured.
vi: Dorian thở phào nhẹ nhõm khi cậu thấy người làm vườn lại gần. Người ấy chạm tay vào mũ mình, liếc nhìn một lát vào huân tước Henry với thái độ lưỡng lự, rồi lấy ra một lá thư, trao nó cho chủ mình. “Quý bà bảo tôi chờ trả lời,” y thì thào.
tr: Bahçıvanın yaklaştığını gören Dorian rahat bir soluk aldı. Adam elini şapkasına götürdü, bir an Lord Henry’ den yana duraksayarak baktı, sonra bir mektup çıkararak efendisine verdi. “Düşes hazretleri bekleyip yanıt getirmemi buyurdular,” diye mırıldandı.
es: Dorian dejó escapar un suspiro de alivio al ver acercarse al jardinero, quien, llevándose la mano al sombrero, miró un momento a lord Henry, como dubitativo, y luego sacó una carta, que entregó a su amo. —Su gracia me ha dicho que esperase la respuesta —murmuró.
vi_translation: Dorian breathed a sigh of relief when he saw the gardener approaching. The gardener touched his hat, glanced hesitantly at Lord Henry, then took out a letter and handed it to his master. “The lady told me to wait for a reply,” he whispered.
tr_translation: Dorian breathed a sigh of relief when he saw the gardener approaching. The man touched his hat, hesitated for a moment while looking towards Lord Henry, then took out a letter and handed it to his master. “Her Grace, the Duchess, commanded me to wait and bring back a response,” he murmured.
es_translation: Dorian let out a sigh of relief upon seeing the gardener approach, who, touching his hat, looked at Lord Henry for a moment, as if hesitant, and then took out a letter, which he handed to his master. —His grace told me to wait for the response —he murmured.

en: Dorian put the letter into his pocket. “Tell her Grace that I am coming in,” he said, coldly. The man turned round and went rapidly in the direction of the house.
vi: Dorian đút thư vào túi. “Bảo bà là tôi đến ngay đây,” cậu nói, lạnh lùng. Người hầu quay đi, và bước nhanh về hướng ngôi nhà.
tr: Dorian mektubu cebine attı. Soğuk soğuk, “Düşes hazretlerine söyle, şimdi geliyorum,” dedi. Adam dönerek eve doğru hızla uzaklaştı.
es: Dorian se guardó la carta en el bolsillo. —Dígale a su gracia que llegaré enseguida —respondió con frialdad. El mensajero se dio la vuelta, regresando rápidamente hacia la casa.
vi_translation: Dorian put the letter in his pocket. "Tell her I am coming immediately," he said coldly. The servant turned away and walked quickly towards the house.
tr_translation: Dorian put the letter in his pocket. Coldly, he said, "Tell Her Grace the Duchess that I am coming now." Adam turned and quickly walked away towards the house.
es_translation: Dorian put the letter in his pocket. —Tell his grace that I will arrive shortly —he responded coldly. The messenger turned around, quickly returning to the house.

en: “How fond women are of doing dangerous things!” laughed Lord Henry. “It is one of the qualities in them that I admire most. A woman will flirt with anybody in the world as long as other people are looking on.”
vi: “Sao mà đàn bà ưa làm những việc nguy hiểm thế cơ chứ!” huân tước Henry cười. “Đó là một trong các phẩm chất ở họ mà tôi ngưỡng mộ nhất. Đàn bà sẽ đong đưa với bất cứ ai trên đời này chừng nào mà những người khác còn để ý đến.”
tr: Lord Henry gülerek, “Şu kadın milleti tehlikeli şeyleri nasıl da severler!” dedi. “Benim en hayran olduğum niteliklerinden biridir. Yeter ki herkesin gözü önünde olsun.
es: —¡Cuánto les gusta a las mujeres hacer cosas peligrosas! —rió lord Henry—. Es una de las cualidades que más admiro en ellas. Una mujer puede coquetear con cualquiera con tal de que haya otras personas mirando.
vi_translation: “Why do women like to do such dangerous things!” Lord Henry laughed. “That is one of the qualities in them that I admire the most. Women will flirt with anyone in the world as long as others are paying attention.”
tr_translation: Lord Henry laughed, "How women love dangerous things!" he said. "It is one of the qualities I admire most about them. As long as it is in front of everyone."
es_translation: —How much women love to do dangerous things! —laughed Lord Henry—. It is one of the qualities I admire most in them. A woman can flirt with anyone as long as there are other people watching.

en: “How fond you are of saying dangerous things, Harry! In the present instance, you are quite astray. I like the duchess very much, but I don’t love her.”
vi: “Sao mà anh ưa nói những điều nguy hiểm thế, Harry! Trong trường hợp này thì anh lầm to rồi. Tôi thích nữ công tước rất nhiều, nhưng tôi không yêu cô ấy.”
tr: “Sen de tehlikeli laflar etmeyi nasıl da seviyorsun, Harry! Ama şu sırada çok yanılıyorsun. Düşesten çok hoşlanıyorum, ama ona âşık değilim.
es: —¡Cuánto te gusta decir cosas peligrosas, Harry! En este caso te equivocas por completo. Me gusta mucho la duquesa, pero no estoy enamorado de ella.
vi_translation: “Why do you like to say such dangerous things, Harry! In this case, you are greatly mistaken. I like the duchess very much, but I do not love her.”
tr_translation: “How you love to say dangerous things, Harry! But right now, you are very wrong. I like Duchess very much, but I am not in love with her.”
es_translation: —How much you like to say dangerous things, Harry! In this case, you are completely wrong. I like the duchess a lot, but I am not in love with her.

en: “And the duchess loves you very much, but she likes you less, so you are excellently matched.”
vi: “Còn nữ công tước yêu cậu rất nhiều, nhưng cô ấy thích cậu không nhiều bằng, vậy nên cô cậu cực kỳ xứng đôi vừa lứa.
tr: “Düşesse sana çok âşık, ama senden pek hoşlanmıyor. Yani birbirinize denksiniz.
es: —Y la duquesa te quiere más de lo que le gustas, de manera que estáis perfectamente emparejados.
vi_translation: “As for the duchess, she loves you very much, but she doesn't like you as much, so you two are extremely well-matched.”
