tr_translation: “The Duchess is very much in love with you, but she doesn't quite like you. So, you are equal to each other.”
es_translation: —And the duchess loves you more than she likes you, so you are perfectly matched.

en: “You are talking scandal, Harry, and there is never any basis for scandal.”
vi: “Anh đơm đặt rồi đấy, Harry, mà chẳng hề có cơ sở nào để đơm đặt chuyện gì.
tr: “Sen skandaldan konuşuyorsun, Harry. Oysa skandal için ortada hiçbir dayanak yok.
es: —¡Eso es difamación, Harry, y nunca hay motivo alguno para la difamación!
vi_translation: "You're making things up, Harry, without any basis for it.""
tr_translation: "You are talking about a scandal, Harry. However, there is no basis for a scandal."
es_translation: —That is defamation, Harry, and there is never any reason for defamation!

en: “The basis of every scandal is an immoral certainty,” said Lord Henry, lighting a cigarette.
vi: “Cơ sở của mọi chuyện đơm đặt là niềm tin chắc chắn vào một sự phi luân vô đạo,” huân tước Henry nói, châm một điếu thuốc.
tr: “Her skandalın dayanağı ahlakdışı bir güvendir.
es: —El fundamento de toda difamación es una certeza inmoral —dijo lord Henry encendiendo un cigarrillo.
vi_translation: “The basis of all scandal is an unwavering belief in some form of immorality,” Lord Henry said, lighting a cigarette.
tr_translation: “The basis of every scandal is an immoral confidence.”
es_translation: —The basis of all slander is an immoral certainty —said Lord Henry, lighting a cigarette.

en: “You would sacrifice anybody, Harry, for the sake of an epigram.”
vi: “Anh có lẽ sẽ hy sinh bất cứ ai, Harry, vì một lời trào phúng.
tr: “Harry, nükteli bir özdeyişin keyfine kurban etmeyeceğin kimse yok!
es: -Sacrificarías a cualquiera por un epigrama.
vi_translation: “You would probably sacrifice anyone, Harry, for a witty remark.”
tr_translation: "Harry, there is no one you wouldn't sacrifice for the pleasure of a witty aphorism!""
es_translation: —You would sacrifice anyone for an epigram.

en: “The world goes to the altar of its own accord,” was the answer.
vi: “Thiên hạ tự nguyện đi đến bàn thờ mà,” là câu trả lời.
tr: Arkadaşı, “Dünya bir kurbanlık koyundur; tıpış tıpış gelip bıçağın altına yatar,” diye karşılık verdi.
es: —El mundo camina hacia el ara por decisión propia —fue la respuesta.
vi_translation: “People willingly go to the altar,” was the answer.
tr_translation: His friend replied, "The world is a sacrificial lamb; it comes meekly and lies down under the knife."
es_translation: —The world is heading towards the altar by its own decision —was the response.

en: “I wish I could love,” cried Dorian Gray with a deep note of pathos in his voice. “But I seem to have lost the passion and forgotten the desire. I am too much concentrated on myself. My own personality has become a burden to me. I want to escape, to go away, to forget. It was silly of me to come down here at all. I think I shall send a wire to Harvey to have the yacht got ready. On a yacht one is safe.”
vi: “Tôi ước gì tôi có thể yêu.” Dorian Gray kêu lên, với một nốt xúc động trầm sâu trong giọng. “Nhưng tôi dường như đã mất đam mê, đã quên dục vọng. Tôi quá tập trung vào mình. Cá tính của tôi đã trở thành gánh nặng với tôi. Tôi muốn thoát ra, muốn đi xa, muốn quên cả. Tôi cũng thật ngây thơ khi xuống đây. Tôi nghĩ tôi sẽ gửi một bức điện báo cho Harvey chuẩn bị thuyền buồm sẵn sàng. Trên thuyền buồm ta sẽ an toàn.
tr: Dorian Gray derin bir duygusallıkla, “Keşke sevebilsem!” diye bağırdı. “Ne var ki sevebilmek tutkusunu yitirmişim sanki, sevmenin ne olduğunu da unutmuşum. Kendi kişiliğim omzumda yük olup çıktı. Çok kendime yönelik oldum. Kaçmak, uzaklaşmak istiyorum, unutmak. Kalkıp buraya gelmem başlı başına sersemlikti. İyisi mi Harvey’e tel çekeyim de yatı hazır etsin. Yatta insan tehlikelerden uzaktır.
es: —Me gustaría ser capaz de amar —exclamó Dorian Gray con una nota de profundo patetismo en la voz—. Pero se diría que he perdido la pasión y olvidado el deseo. Estoy demasiado centrado en mí mismo. Mi personalidad se ha convertido en una carga. Quiero escapar, alejarme, olvidar. Ha sido una tontería volver aquí. Creo que voy a telegrafiar a Harvey para que prepare el yate. En el yate estaré a salvo.
vi_translation: “I wish I could love.” Dorian Gray exclaimed, with a deep note of emotion in his voice. “But I seem to have lost passion, forgotten desire. I am too focused on myself. My personality has become a burden to me. I want to escape, to go far away, to forget everything. I was so naive to come down here. I think I will send a telegram to Harvey to prepare the sailboat. On the sailboat, we will be safe.”
tr_translation: Dorian Gray shouted with deep emotion, "I wish I could love!" "But it seems I have lost the passion to love, I have forgotten what it means to love. My own personality has become a burden on my shoulders. I have become too self-centered. I want to escape, to get away, to forget. Coming here was sheer folly. I'd better wire Harvey to prepare the yacht. On the yacht, one is safe from dangers."
es_translation: —I would like to be able to love —exclaimed Dorian Gray with a note of deep pathos in his voice—. But it seems that I have lost passion and forgotten desire. I am too focused on myself. My personality has become a burden. I want to escape, get away, forget. It was foolish to come back here. I think I will telegraph Harvey to prepare the yacht. On the yacht, I will be safe.

en: “Safe from what, Dorian? You are in some trouble. Why not tell me what it is? You know I would help you.”
vi: “An toàn với cái gì, Dorian? Cậu đang có chuyện gì đó không vui. Sao không kể tôi nghe xem nó thế nào? Cậu biết tôi sẽ giúp cậu mà.”
tr: “Hangi tehlike, Dorian? Başında bir dert var senin. Bana anlatsana, nedir. Sana yardım ederim, biliyorsun.
es: —¿A salvo de qué, Dorian? Tienes algún problema. ¿Por qué no me dices de qué se trata? Sabes que te ayudaría.
vi_translation: "Safe with what, Dorian? You seem to be unhappy about something. Why don't you tell me what it is? You know I will help you."
tr_translation: “What danger, Dorian? You are in trouble. Tell me, what is it. You know I will help you.”
es_translation: —Safe from what, Dorian? Do you have a problem. Why don't you tell me what it's about? You know I would help you.

en: “I can’t tell you, Harry,” he answered sadly. “And I dare say it is only a fancy of mine. This unfortunate accident has upset me. I have a horrible presentiment that something of the kind may happen to me.”
vi: “Tôi không thể kể cho anh, Harry,” cậu trả lời, buồn bã. “Và tôi dám nói nó chỉ là tưởng tượng của tôi. Tai nạn không may này làm tôi lo ngại. Tôi có một linh cảm khủng khiếp rằng một điều gì đó đại loại như vậy có thể xảy đến với tôi.”
tr: Dorian üzüntüyle, “Söyleyemem, Harry,” dedi. “Zaten belki de kuruntudan ibarettir. Bu baş belası kaza sarstı beni. Benim başıma da böyle bir şey gelecek diye kötü bir his var içimde.
es: —No te lo puedo decir, Harry—respondió con tristeza—. Y supongo que sólo se trata de mi imaginación. Ese desgraciado accidente me ha trastornado. Tengo un horrible presentimiento de que algo parecido puede sucederme a mí.
vi_translation: "I can't tell you, Harry," he replied, sadly. "And I dare say it is just my imagination. This unfortunate accident worries me. I have a terrible feeling that something like this might happen to me."
tr_translation: Dorian said sadly, "I can't tell you, Harry." "Besides, it might just be a figment of my imagination. This troublesome accident has shaken me. I have a bad feeling that something like this will happen to me too."
es_translation: —I can't tell you, Harry—he responded sadly—. And I suppose it's just my imagination. That unfortunate accident has unsettled me. I have a horrible premonition that something similar could happen to me.

en: “What nonsense!”
vi: “Vớ vẩn quá!”
tr: “Amma saçmalıyorsun!
es: —¡Qué absurdo!
vi_translation: "Nonsense!"
tr_translation: “But you're talking nonsense!”
es_translation: —How absurd!

en: “I hope it is, but I can’t help feeling it. Ah! here is the duchess, looking like Artemis in a tailor-made gown. You see we have come back, Duchess.”
vi: “Tôi mong là vậy, nhưng tôi không thể không cảm thấy nó. A! Nữ công tước đây rồi, trông như Artemis mặc áo dài may đo. Cô thấy đấy, chúng tôi đã quay lại, thưa nữ công tước.”
tr: “Umarım öyledir ama bu duyguyu bastıramıyorum. Oo, işte düşes, ısmarlama giyinmiş Artemis’e benziyor! Sayın düşes, görüyorsunuz ya dönüp geldik.
es: —Espero que tengas razón, pero así es como lo siento. ¡Ah! Ahí está la duquesa, que parece Artemisa en traje sastre. Ya ve que estamos de regreso, duquesa.
vi_translation: "I hope so, but I can't help feeling it." "Ah! Here comes the Duchess, looking like Artemis in a tailored gown." "You see, we have returned, Duchess."
tr_translation: “I hope so, but I can't suppress this feeling. Oh, there's the duchess, she looks like a tailor-made Artemis! Madam duchess, as you can see, we've come back.”
es_translation: —I hope you're right, but that's how I feel. Ah! There is the duchess, who looks like Artemis in a tailored suit. You see that we are back, duchess.

en: “I have heard all about it, Mr. Gray,” she answered. “Poor Geoffrey is terribly upset. And it seems that you asked him not to shoot the hare. How curious!”
vi: “Tôi đã nghe thấy hết rồi, mít-tơ Gray,” cô trả lời. “Geoffrey tội nghiệp đang lo lắm. Và dường như là anh có xin anh ấy không bắn con thỏ rừng ấy. Lạ thật!”
tr: Genç kadın, “Her şeyi duydum, mr Gray,” dedi. “Zavallı Geoffrey öyle üzgün ki! Siz de galiba ona, tavşana ateş etme, demişsiniz. Ne tuhaf!
es: —Me han informado de todo, señor Gray —respondió ella—. El pobre Geoffrey está terriblemente afectado. Y al parecer usted le había pedido que no disparase contra la liebre. ¡Qué curioso!
vi_translation: “I heard everything, Mr. Gray,” she replied. “Poor Geoffrey is very worried. And it seems that you asked him not to shoot that hare. How strange!”
tr_translation: The young woman said, "I heard everything, Mr. Gray." "Poor Geoffrey is so upset! I think you also told him not to shoot the rabbit. How strange!"
es_translation: —I have been informed of everything, Mr. Gray —she replied—. Poor Geoffrey is terribly affected. And it seems you had asked him not to shoot at the hare. How curious!

en: “Yes, it was very curious. I don’t know what made me say it. Some whim, I suppose. It looked the loveliest of little live things. But I am sorry they told you about the man. It is a hideous subject.”
vi: “Đúng rồi, rất lạ. Tôi không biết điều gì khiến tôi nói vậy. Một ý nghĩ bất chợt nào đó, tôi nghĩ thế. Nó giống như sinh vật nhỏ dễ thương nhất. Nhưng tôi lấy làm tiếc là họ đã kể cho cô nghe về người ấy. Đó là một chủ đề ghê tởm.”
tr: “Evet, gerçekten de tuhaf oldu. Bunu neden söyledim, bilemiyorum. Aklıma esti herhalde. Tavşan öyle hoş göründü ki gözüme: minicik, şipşirin bir canlı. Neyse, ölen adamdan size söz etmelerine üzüldüm. Feci bir durum bu.
es: —Sí; muy curioso. No sé qué fue lo que me empujó a decirlo. Un impulso repentino, supongo. Me pareció una bestiecilla encantadora. Siento que le hayan hablado del ojeador. Es una cosa lamentable.
vi_translation: “That's right, very strange. I don't know what made me say that. Some sudden thought, I think. It's like the cutest little creature. But I'm sorry they told you about that person. It's a disgusting subject.”
tr_translation: “Yes, it really was strange. I don't know why I said that. It must have just come to my mind. The rabbit looked so cute to me: a tiny, adorable creature. Anyway, I was sorry to hear them talk about the dead man. It's a terrible situation.”
es_translation: —Yes; very curious. I don't know what pushed me to say it. A sudden impulse, I suppose. It seemed like a charming little creature to me. I'm sorry they told you about the scout. It's a regrettable thing.

en: “It is an annoying subject,” broke in Lord Henry. “It has no psychological value at all. Now if Geoffrey had done the thing on purpose, how interesting he would be! I should like to know some one who had committed a real murder.”
vi: “Đó là một chủ đề khó chịu,” huân tước Henry cắt ngang. “Nó chẳng có giá trị tâm lý nào cả. Bây giờ, giả dụ Geoffrey đã chủ tâm làm việc ấy thì anh ta sẽ thú vị làm sao! Tôi những muốn biết ai đó từng phạm phải một tội giết người thật sự.
tr: Lord Henry, “Can sıkıcı bir konu,” diye araya girdi. “Psikolojik yönden hiç değer taşımıyor. Bak, Geoffrey bu işi kasıtlı yapmış olsaydı, onu pek ilginç bulmaya başlardım doğrusu! Gerçekten cinayet işlemiş biriyle tanışmayı pek isterim.
es: —Es un tema molesto —intervino lord Henry—. Carece de valor psicológico. En cambio, si Geoffrey lo hubiera hecho aposta, ¡qué interesante sería! Me gustaría conocer a un verdadero asesino.
vi_translation: “That is an unpleasant topic,” Lord Henry interrupted. “It has no psychological value at all. Now, suppose Geoffrey had deliberately done it, how interesting he would be! I would love to know someone who has actually committed a real murder.”
tr_translation: Lord Henry interrupted, "A boring subject," he said. "It has no value from a psychological standpoint. Look, if Geoffrey had done this intentionally, I would indeed start to find it very interesting! I would really like to meet someone who has actually committed a murder."
es_translation: —It's an annoying topic —interjected Lord Henry—. It lacks psychological value. On the other hand, if Geoffrey had done it on purpose, how interesting it would be! I would like to meet a real murderer.

en: “How horrid of you, Harry!” cried the duchess. “Isn’t it, Mr. Gray? Harry, Mr. Gray is ill again. He is going to faint.”
vi: “Sao anh quá đáng vậy, Harry!” nữ công tước kêu lên. “Phải không, mít-tơ Gray? Harry, mít-tơ Gray lại ốm rồi. Anh ấy sắp ngất.”
tr: Düşes, “Ne canavarsın, Harry!” diye bağırdı. “Öyle değil mi mr Gray? Harry, mr Gray’e gene fenalık geldi. Bayılacak galiba.
es: —¡Qué desagradable eres, Harry! —exclamó la duquesa—. ¿No le parece, señor Gray? Harry, el señor Gray vuelve a no encontrarse bien. Me parece que se va a desmayar.
vi_translation: “Why are you being so unreasonable, Harry!” the duchess exclaimed. “Isn't that right, Mr. Gray? Harry, Mr. Gray is sick again. He's about to faint.”
tr_translation: The Duchess shouted, "What a monster you are, Harry!" "Isn't that right, Mr. Gray? Harry, Mr. Gray is feeling unwell again. He might faint."
es_translation: —How unpleasant you are, Harry! —exclaimed the duchess—. Don't you think so, Mr. Gray? Harry, Mr. Gray is feeling unwell again. I think he is going to faint.

en: Dorian drew himself up with an effort and smiled. “It is nothing, Duchess,” he murmured; “my nerves are dreadfully out of order. That is all. I am afraid I walked too far this morning. I didn’t hear what Harry said. Was it very bad? You must tell me some other time. I think I must go and lie down. You will excuse me, won’t you?”
vi: Dorian cố gắng đứng thẳng, và cười. “Không có gì đâu, thưa nữ công tước,” cậu lẩm bẩm; “thần kinh tôi quá đỗi rối loạn. Chỉ vậy thôi. Tôi e là mình đã đi bộ quá xa sáng nay. Tôi không nghe thấy điều Harry nói. Nó có tệ lắm không? Cô phải kể cho tôi lúc khác nhé. Tôi nghĩ tôi phải đi nằm. Cô sẽ thứ lỗi cho tôi, phải không cô?”
tr: Dorian kendini zorla toparlayarak gülümsedi. “Bir şey yok, düşes,” diye mırıldandı. “Sinirlerim fena halde bozuk. Başka bir şey yok. Bu sabah çok yürümüş olsam gerek. Harry ne dedi, duymadım. Çok mu hınzırdı? Başka bir zaman anlatın bana. Gidip yatsam iyi olacak. Kusuruma bakmazsınız, değil mi?
es: Dorian hizo un esfuerzo para reponerse y sonrió. —No es nada, duquesa —murmuró—; tan sólo que estoy muy nervioso. Nada más que eso. Me temo que he caminado demasiado esta mañana. No he oído lo que ha dicho Harry. ¿Algo muy inconveniente? Me lo tendrá que contar en otra ocasión. Creo que voy a ir a tumbarme un rato. Me disculpará usted, ¿no es cierto?
vi_translation: Dorian tried to stand up straight and laughed. “It's nothing, Duchess,” he muttered; “my nerves are terribly upset. That's all. I'm afraid I walked too far this morning. I didn't hear what Harry said. Was it very bad? You must tell me another time. I think I must lie down. You will forgive me, won't you?”
tr_translation: Dorian forced himself to smile. “It's nothing, Duchess,” he murmured. “My nerves are terribly frayed. Nothing else. I must have walked a lot this morning. What did Harry say? I didn't hear. Was it very mischievous? Tell me another time. I should go lie down. You won't mind, will you?”
es_translation: Dorian made an effort to recover and smiled. —It's nothing, Duchess —he murmured—; it's just that I'm very nervous. Nothing more than that. I'm afraid I've walked too much this morning. I didn't hear what Harry said. Something very inappropriate? You'll have to tell me another time. I think I'm going to lie down for a while. You will excuse me, won't you?

en: They had reached the great flight of steps that led from the conservatory on to the terrace. As the glass door closed behind Dorian, Lord Henry turned and looked at the duchess with his slumberous eyes. “Are you very much in love with him?” he asked.
vi: Họ đến đợt cầu thang rộng dẫn từ nhà kính lên sân hiên. Lúc cánh cửa kính khép lại sau lưng Dorian, huân tước Henry quay qua nhìn nữ công tước với đôi mắt mơ màng. “Cô yêu nó lắm hả?” y hỏi.
tr: Limonluktan terasa yükselen büyük merdivene varmışlardı. Camlı kapı Dorian’ın ardından kapandığı zaman Lord Henry döndü, o uykulu gözleriyle düşese baktı. “Çok mu âşıksın ona?” diye sordu.
es: Habían llegado ya a la gran escalera que llevaba desde el invernadero hasta la terraza. Mientras la puerta de cristal se cerraba detrás de Dorian, lord Henry se volvió y miró a su prima con ojos lánguidos. —¿Estás muy enamorada de él? —preguntó.
vi_translation: They reached the wide staircase leading from the conservatory to the terrace. As the glass door closed behind Dorian, Lord Henry turned to look at the duchess with dreamy eyes. “Do you love it very much?” he asked.
tr_translation: They had reached the large staircase rising from the lemon-scented terrace. When the glass door closed behind Dorian, Lord Henry turned and looked at the duchess with his sleepy eyes. “Are you very much in love with her?” he asked.
es_translation: They had already reached the grand staircase that led from the greenhouse to the terrace. As the glass door closed behind Dorian, Lord Henry turned and looked at his cousin with languid eyes. —Are you very much in love with him? —he asked.

en: She did not answer for some time, but stood gazing at the landscape. “I wish I knew,” she said at last.
vi: Cô không đáp lại một lúc, chỉ đứng nhìn phong cảnh. “Tôi ước gì tôi biết,” rốt cuộc cô nói.
tr: Genç kadın bir süre karşılık vermeyerek gözlerini manzarada dolaştırdı. Sonunda, “Bilebilsem!” dedi.
es: La duquesa tardó algún tiempo en contestar, contemplando, inmóvil, el paisaje. —Me gustaría saberlo —dijo, finalmente.
vi_translation: She didn't respond for a moment, just stood looking at the scenery. "I wish I knew," she finally said.
tr_translation: The young woman, without responding for a while, let her eyes wander over the scenery. Finally, she said, "If only I knew!"
es_translation: The duchess took some time to respond, contemplating the landscape motionlessly. —I would like to know —he said, finally.

en: He shook his head. “Knowledge would be fatal. It is the uncertainty that charms one. A mist makes things wonderful.”
vi: Y lắc đầu. “Biết rõ chỉ hại. Lơ mơ mới hấp dẫn. Sương mù làm các thứ thành ra kỳ diệu.”
tr: Lord Henry başını salladı. “Bilmek her şeyin sonu olur. Çekici olan bilememektir. Sis her şeye harika bir güzellik katar.
es: Lord Henry movió la cabeza. —Saberlo sería fatal. Es la incertidumbre lo que nos atrae. Un poco de niebla mejora mucho las cosas.
vi_translation: Y shook his head. "Knowing clearly only harms. Being vague is more attractive. The fog makes things magical."
tr_translation: Lord Henry nodded his head. "To know would be the end of everything. What is attractive is not knowing. Mist adds a wonderful beauty to everything."
es_translation: Lord Henry shook his head. —Knowing it would be fatal. It is the uncertainty that attracts us. A little fog improves things a lot.

en: “One may lose one’s way.”
vi: “Có thể lạc đường.
tr: “Ya da insana yolunu şaşırtır.
es: —Se puede perder el camino.
vi_translation: “Could be lost.”
tr_translation: “Or it confuses a person’s way.”
es_translation: —You can lose the way.

en: “All ways end at the same point, my dear Gladys.”
vi: “Đường nào cũng kết thúc tại cùng một điểm, Gladys ơi.”
tr: “Bütün yolların sonu aynı noktaya çıkar, biricik Gladys.
es: —Todos los caminos llevan al mismo sitio, mi querida Gladys.
vi_translation: "All roads end at the same point, Gladys."
tr_translation: “All roads lead to the same point, my dear Gladys.”
es_translation: —All roads lead to the same place, my dear Gladys.

en: “What is that?”
vi: “Là gì?”
tr: “Ya o nedir?
es: —¿Que es...?
vi_translation: "What is it?"
tr_translation: “What is that?”
es_translation: —What is...?

en: “Disillusion.”
vi: “Vỡ mộng.
tr: “Hayal kırıklığı.
es: —La desilusión.
vi_translation: “Disillusioned.”
tr_translation: “Disappointment.”
es_translation: —The disappointment.

en: “It was my début in life,” she sighed.
vi: “Đó cũng là début vào đời của tôi,” cô thở dài.
tr: Genç kadın, “Hayata attığım ilk adımdı o,” diye iç geçirdi.
es: —Fue mi debut en la vida —suspiró la duquesa.
vi_translation: “That was also my debut into life,” she sighed.
tr_translation: The young woman sighed, "That was the first step I took in life."
es_translation: —It was my debut in life —sighed the duchess.

en: “It came to you crowned.”
vi: “Nó đội mũ miện đến với cô.
tr: “Başında taçla geldi sana.
es: —Pero llegó con la corona ducal.
vi_translation: “It came to you wearing a crown.”
tr_translation: “He came to you with a crown on his head.”
es_translation: —But he arrived with the ducal crown.

en: “I am tired of strawberry leaves.”
vi: “Tôi đã chán lá dâu1.” 1 Hàng công tước (trên mũ có trang trí hình lá dâu tây.)
tr: “Çiçek yapraklarından usandım.
es: —Estoy harta de hojas de fresa.
vi_translation: "I am tired of mulberry leaves." 1 Duke's row (on the hat decorated with a strawberry leaf.)
tr_translation: “I am tired of flower petals.”
es_translation: —I'm fed up with strawberry leaves.

en: “They become you.”
vi: “Chúng hợp với cô.
tr: “Sana yaraşıyor.
es: —Te sientan bien.
vi_translation: “They suit you.”
tr_translation: “It suits you.”
es_translation: —They look good on you.

en: “Only in public.”
vi: “Chỉ lúc công khai.
tr: “Ancak el içindeyken.
es: —Sólo en público.
vi_translation: “Only when public.”
tr_translation: “Only when in the hand.”
es_translation: —Only in public.

en: “You would miss them,” said Lord Henry.
vi: “Cô sẽ nhớ chúng,” huân tước Henry nói.
tr: Lord Henry, “Yitirirsen ararsın,” dedi.
es: —Las echarías de menos —dijo lord Henry.
vi_translation: “She will miss them,” Lord Henry said.
tr_translation: Lord Henry, "You lose it, you search for it," he said.
es_translation: —You would miss them —said Lord Henry.

en: “I will not part with a petal.”
vi: “Tôi sẽ không bỏ cánh hoa nào.”
tr: “Tek yaprağından bile vazgeçecek değilim.
es: —No renunciaría ni a un pétalo.
vi_translation: “I will not pluck any petals.”
tr_translation: “I won't give up even a single leaf.”
es_translation: —I wouldn't give up even a single petal.

en: “Monmouth has ears.”
vi: “Monmouth có tai.”
tr: “Monmouth’un kulağı var.
es: —Monmouth tiene oídos.
vi_translation: "Monmouth has ears."
tr_translation: “Monmouth has an ear.”
es_translation: —Monmouth has ears.

en: “Old age is dull of hearing.”
vi: “Tuổi già nghễnh ngãng.
tr: “Yaşlılıkta kulaklar ağırlaşır.
es: —Los ancianos son duros de oído.
vi_translation: “Old age is hard of hearing.”
tr_translation: “In old age, ears become heavy.”
es_translation: —The elderly are hard of hearing.

en: “Has he never been jealous?”
vi: “Ông ta đã bao giờ ghen chưa?”
tr: “Hiç kıskanmadı mı seni?
es: —¿No ha tenido nunca celos?
vi_translation: “Has he ever been jealous?”
tr_translation: “Didn't he ever get jealous of you?”
es_translation: —Have you never been jealous?

en: “I wish he had been.”
vi: “Tôi ước gì ông ấy đã từng.
tr: “Keşke kıskanmış olsaydı!
es: —Ojalá los hubiera tenido.
vi_translation: “I wish he had.”
tr_translation: "I wish he had been jealous!""
es_translation: —I wish I had had them.

en: He glanced about as if in search of something. “What are you looking for?” she inquired.
vi: Y nhìn quanh như thể tìm gì đó. “Anh kiếm gì vậy?” cô hỏi.
tr: Lord Henry bir şey arıyormuş gibi gözlerini çevrede dolaştırdı. Düşes, “Ne arıyorsun?” diye sordu.
es: Lord Henry miró a su alrededor como si buscara algo. —¿Qué estás buscando? —preguntó ella.
vi_translation: He looked around as if searching for something. “What are you looking for?” she asked.
tr_translation: Lord Henry looked around as if searching for something. The Duchess asked, "What are you looking for?"
es_translation: Lord Henry looked around as if he were searching for something. —What are you looking for? —she asked.

en: “The button from your foil,” he answered. “You have dropped it.”
vi: “Cái nút bịt đầu gươm của cô,” y trả lời. “Cô đã làm rơi nó.”
tr: “Senin kılıcını. Elinden düşürmüşsün.
es: —El botón de tu florete —respondió él—. Se te acaba de caer.
vi_translation: “The pommel of your sword,” he replied. “You dropped it.”
tr_translation: “Your sword. You have dropped it from your hand.”
es_translation: —The button of your foil —he replied—. It just fell off.

en: She laughed. “I have still the mask.”
vi: Cô bật cười. “Tôi vẫn còn mặt nạ.”
tr: Düşes güldü. “Maskem hâlâ yerinde.
es: La duquesa se echó a reír. —Todavía me queda la máscara.
vi_translation: She burst out laughing. "I still have the mask."
tr_translation: The Duchess laughed. “My mask is still in place.”
es_translation: The duchess burst out laughing. —I still have the mask left.

en: “It makes your eyes lovelier,” was his reply.
vi: “Nó khiến mắt cô đẹp hơn,” là lời đáp trả của y.
tr: Lord Henry, “Masken gözlerini daha güzel gösteriyor,” diye karşılık verdi.
es: —Hace que tus ojos parezcan todavía más hermosos —fue su respuesta.
vi_translation: “It makes your eyes more beautiful,” was his response.
tr_translation: Lord Henry replied, "The mask makes your eyes look more beautiful."
es_translation: —It makes your eyes look even more beautiful —was his response.

en: She laughed again. Her teeth showed like white seeds in a scarlet fruit.
vi: Cô lại cười. Răng cô hiện ra như những hạt trắng trong quả hồng.
tr: Düşes gene güldü. Dişleri kırmızı meyve içinde beyaz birer tane gibi duruyordu.
es: Su prima volvió a reír. Sus dientes brillaron como simientes blancas en un fruto escarlata.
vi_translation: She laughed again. Her teeth appeared like white seeds in a persimmon.
tr_translation: The Duchess laughed again. Her teeth looked like white seeds in red fruit.
es_translation: Her cousin laughed again. Her teeth shone like white seeds in a scarlet fruit.

en: Upstairs, in his own room, Dorian Gray was lying on a sofa, with terror in every tingling fibre of his body. Life had suddenly become too hideous a burden for him to bear. The dreadful death of the unlucky beater, shot in the thicket like a wild animal, had seemed to him to pre-figure death for himself also. He had nearly swooned at what Lord Henry had said in a chance mood of cynical jesting.
vi: Trên gác, trong phòng riêng, Dorian Gray đang nằm trên xô-pha, với nỗi khiếp sợ trong từng thớ thịt ngứa ran. Cuộc đời đột nhiên trở thành gánh nặng quá ghê tởm với cậu để mang theo. Cái chết khủng khiếp ấy của kẻ xua thú đen đủi, bị bắn trong bụi cây như một con thú hoang, làm cậu thấy dường như cũng là cái chết được miêu tả trước của chính cậu. Cậu suýt ngất trước những gì mà huân tước Henry nói trong tâm trạng đùa giỡn cay độc tình cờ.
tr: Üst kattaki odasında Dorian Gray, gövdesinin her lifi korkudan zangırdayarak bir kanepede yatıyordu. Yaşam, apansız, taşıyamayacağı oranda çirkin, iğrenç bir yük olup çıkmıştı. Çalılar arasında bir yaban hayvanı gibi vurulan bahtsız adamın ölümü gözüne, onun kendi ölümünü haber veren bir simge gibi görünüyordu. Lord Henry’nin alaycı bir anında rastgele söylediği sözleri duyduğu zaman bayılacak gibi olmuştu.
es: En el piso alto, Dorian Gray estaba tumbado en un sofá de su cuarto, sintiendo vibrar de terror todas las fibras de su cuerpo. De repente la vida se había convertido en un peso insoportable. La horrible muerte del desdichado ojeador, derribado entre la maleza como un animal salvaje, le había parecido una prefiguración de su propia muerte. Casi se había desmayado al oír la broma cínica que lord Henry había lanzado al azar.
vi_translation: Upstairs, in his private room, Dorian Gray was lying on the sofa, with terror tingling in every fiber of his being. Life had suddenly become an unbearably loathsome burden for him to carry. The terrible death of the unlucky animal trainer, shot in the bushes like a wild beast, made him feel as if it was a foretelling of his own demise. He nearly fainted at what Lord Henry said in a mood of bitter jest.
tr_translation: In his room upstairs, Dorian Gray was lying on a couch, every fiber of his being trembling with fear. Life had suddenly become an unbearably ugly, disgusting burden. The death of the unfortunate man, struck down like a wild animal among the bushes, appeared to him as a symbol foretelling his own death. He had felt faint when he heard the words Lord Henry had casually uttered in a moment of mockery.
es_translation: On the upper floor, Dorian Gray was lying on a sofa in his room, feeling every fiber of his body vibrate with terror. Suddenly, life had become an unbearable burden. The horrible death of the unfortunate gamekeeper, struck down among the underbrush like a wild animal, had seemed to him a prefiguration of his own death. He had almost fainted upon hearing the cynical joke that Lord Henry had made at random.

en: At five o’clock he rang his bell for his servant and gave him orders to pack his things for the night-express to town, and to have the brougham at the door by eight-thirty. He was determined not to sleep another night at Selby Royal. It was an ill-omened place. Death walked there in the sunlight. The grass of the forest had been spotted with blood.
vi: Lúc năm giờ, cậu rung chuông gọi gia nhân và ra lệnh cho hắn đóng gói đồ đạc của cậu để đi chuyến tàu tốc hành đêm về thành phố, và thu xếp để có cỗ xe độc mã ở cửa lúc tám rưỡi. Cậu kiên quyết không ngủ thêm đêm nữa ở Selby Royal. Nó là một nơi báo điềm gở. Cái chết bước ở đó trong nắng. Cỏ trong rừng thì bị vấy máu.
tr: Saat beşte çıngırağı çalıp uşağını çağırdı: Gece ekspresiyle kente döneceği için çantasını hazırlamasını, faytonun da saat sekiz buçukta kapıya gelmesini söyledi. Selby Royal’de bir gece daha geçirmemeye kararlıydı. Uğursuzluk dolu bir yerdi burası. Ölüm güpegündüz kol geziyordu burada. Ormanın otlarına kan düşmüştü.
es: A las cinco llamó a su criado y le ordenó que le preparase una maleta para regresar a Londres en el expreso de la noche, y que la berlina estuviera delante de la puerta a las ocho y media. Había decidido no dormir una noche más en Selby Royal. Era un lugar de malos augurios. La muerte se paseaba por allí a la luz del día. La hierba del bosque se había manchado de sangre.
vi_translation: At five o'clock, he rang the bell to call the servant and ordered him to pack his belongings for the night express train to the city, and to arrange for a one-horse carriage at the door at half-past eight. He was determined not to spend another night at Selby Royal. It was a place of ominous signs. Death walked there in the sunlight. The grass in the forest was stained with blood.
tr_translation: At five o'clock, he rang the bell and called his servant: Since he would be returning to the city with the night express, he told him to prepare his bag and to have the carriage at the door by half-past eight. He was determined not to spend another night at Selby Royal. This place was filled with ominousness. Death roamed here in broad daylight. Blood had fallen on the forest grass.
es_translation: At five o'clock, he called his servant and ordered him to prepare a suitcase to return to London on the night express, and that the carriage should be in front of the door at half-past eight. He had decided not to spend another night at Selby Royal. It was a place of bad omens. Death roamed there in broad daylight. The forest grass had been stained with blood.

en: Then he wrote a note to Lord Henry, telling him that he was going up to town to consult his doctor and asking him to entertain his guests in his absence. As he was putting it into the envelope, a knock came to the door, and his valet informed him that the head-keeper wished to see him. He frowned and bit his lip. “Send him in,” he muttered, after some moments’ hesitation.
vi: Sau đó cậu viết một bức thư ngắn cho huân tước Henry, bảo y rằng cậu về lại thành phố để nhờ bác sỹ khám, và xin y tiếp khách giùm khi cậu vắng mặt. Khi cậu đang bỏ thư vào phong bì, một tiếng gõ cửa vang lên, và người hầu của cậu báo tin cho cậu rằng trưởng nhóm gác rừng mong được gặp cậu. Cậu cau mày, cắn môi. “Cho ông ta vào,” cậu lẩm bẩm, sau đôi chút lưỡng lự.
tr: Sonra Lord Henry’ye bir pusula yazarak doktoruna görünmek üzere kente gideceğini bildirdi, kendi yokluğunda konuklarının ağırlanmasını ondan rica etti. Bunu zarfa koyarken kapıya vuruldu; uşağı başkorucunun onu görmek istediğini bildirdi. Dorian yüzünü asarak dudağını dişledi. Bir anlık bir duraksamadan sonra, “Gelsin,” dedi.
es: Luego escribió una nota para lord Henry, diciéndole que regresaba a Londres para consultar a su médico, y pidiéndole que distrajera a sus huéspedes durante su ausencia. Cuando la estaba metiendo en el sobre, oyó llamar a la puerta, y su ayuda de cámara le informó de que el guarda mayor quería verlo. Dorian Gray frunció el ceño y se mordió los labios. —Dígale que pase —murmuró, después de una breve vacilación.
vi_translation: Then he wrote a short letter to Lord Henry, telling him that he was returning to the city to see a doctor, and asking him to entertain guests in his absence. As he was putting the letter into an envelope, there was a knock on the door, and his servant informed him that the head forester wished to see him. He frowned, biting his lip. "Let him in," he muttered, after a moment's hesitation.
tr_translation: Then he wrote a note to Lord Henry, informing him that he would go to the city to see his doctor, and asked him to entertain his guests in his absence. As he was putting it in the envelope, there was a knock at the door; his servant informed him that the head gamekeeper wanted to see him. Dorian frowned and bit his lip. After a moment's hesitation, he said, "Let him come in."
es_translation: Then he wrote a note to Lord Henry, telling him that he was returning to London to consult his doctor, and asking him to entertain his guests during his absence. As he was putting it into the envelope, he heard a knock at the door, and his valet informed him that the chief guard wanted to see him. Dorian Gray frowned and bit his lips. "Tell him to come in," he murmured, after a brief hesitation.

en: As soon as the man entered, Dorian pulled his chequebook out of a drawer and spread it out before him.
vi: Ngay khi người đó vào, Dorian lôi cuốn sổ séc ra khỏi ngăn kéo, bày nó ra trước mặt.
tr: Adam içeri girer girmez Dorian çek defterini çekmecesinden çıkartıp masanın üstüne koydu.
es: Tan pronto como entró su visitante, Dorian sacó de un cajón el talonario de cheques y lo abrió.
vi_translation: As soon as the person entered, Dorian pulled the checkbook out of the drawer and laid it out in front of him.
tr_translation: As soon as Adam entered, Dorian took the checkbook out of his drawer and placed it on the table.
es_translation: As soon as his visitor entered, Dorian took a checkbook out of a drawer and opened it.

en: “I suppose you have come about the unfortunate accident of this morning, Thornton?” he said, taking up a pen.
vi: “Tôi cho là anh đến về vụ tai nạn không may sáng nay, phải không Thornton?” cậu vừa nói, vừa cầm bút lên.
tr: Kalemini eline alarak, “Sabahki üzücü kaza için geldin sanırım, değil mi, Thornton?” dedi.
es: —Imagino, Thornton, que viene para hablarme del desafortunado accidente de esta mañana —dijo, empuñando la pluma.
vi_translation: "I suppose you are here about the unfortunate accident this morning, aren't you Thornton?" he said, picking up a pen.
tr_translation: Taking his pen in hand, he said, "I assume you came for the unfortunate accident this morning, didn't you, Thornton?"
es_translation: —I imagine, Thornton, that you have come to talk to me about the unfortunate accident this morning —he said, gripping the pen.

en: “Yes, sir,” answered the gamekeeper.
vi: “Vâng, thưa ngài,” người gác rừng đáp lời.
tr: Korucu, “Evet, efendim,” diye yanıtladı.
es: —Así es, señor —respondió el guardabosque.
vi_translation: “Yes, sir,” the ranger replied.
tr_translation: The ranger replied, "Yes, sir."
es_translation: —That's right, sir —replied the forest ranger.

en: “Was the poor fellow married? Had he any people dependent on him?” asked Dorian, looking bored. “If so, I should not like them to be left in want, and will send them any sum of money you may think necessary.”
vi: “Anh chàng đáng thương ấy có vợ chưa? Anh ta có ai sống phụ thuộc vào mình không?” Dorian hỏi, trông rất buồn. “Nếu thế, tôi sẽ không muốn họ bị bỏ mặc trong cảnh nghèo khó, và sẽ gửi cho họ bất cứ số tiền nào mà anh cho là cần thiết.
tr: “Zavallı adam evli miymiş? Eline bakan kimse var mıymış?” diye Dorian bezgin bezgin sordu. “Varsa açıkta kalmalarını istemem. Senin uygun gördüğün kadar bir para yollarım onlara.
es: —¿Estaba casado ese pobre infeliz? ¿Tenía personas a su cargo? —preguntó Dorian, con aire aburrido—. Si es así, no quisiera que pasaran necesidades, y estoy dispuesto a enviarles la cantidad que usted considere necesaria.
vi_translation: “Does that poor fellow have a wife?” “Does he have anyone dependent on him?” Dorian asked, looking very sad. “If so, I wouldn't want them to be left in poverty, and I will send them whatever amount of money you think is necessary.”
tr_translation: “Is the poor man married? Does he have anyone dependent on him?” asked Dorian wearily. “If there is, I don't want them to be left out in the cold. I'll send them some money, as much as you see fit.”
es_translation: —Was that poor wretch married? Did he have dependents? —asked Dorian, with a bored air—. If so, I wouldn't want them to be in need, and I am willing to send them the amount you deem necessary.

en: “We don’t know who he is, sir. That is what I took the liberty of coming to you about.”
vi: “Chúng tôi không biết anh ta là ai, thưa ngài. Đó là lý do mà tôi mạn phép đến gặp ngài.
tr: “Adamın kim olduğunu bilmiyoruz, efendim. Sizi bu yüzden rahatsız ediyorum ya.
es: —No sabemos quién es, señor. Eso es lo que me he tomado la libertad de venir a decirle.
vi_translation: "We don't know who he is, sir." That is the reason I took the liberty to come see you."
tr_translation: "We don't know who the man is, sir. That's why I'm bothering you."
es_translation: —We don't know who it is, sir. That is what I have taken the liberty to come and tell you.

en: “Don’t know who he is?” said Dorian, listlessly. “What do you mean? Wasn’t he one of your men?”
vi: “Không biết anh ta là ai?” Dorian hỏi, thờ ơ. “Ý anh muốn nói gì? Chẳng lẽ anh ta không phải là người của anh sao?”
tr: Dorian sıkıntılı bir sesle, “Kim olduğunu bilmiyor musunuz?” diye sordu. “Ne demek yani? Senin adamlarından biri değil mi?
es: —¿No saben quién es? —preguntó Dorian distraídamente—. ¿Qué quiere decir? ¿No era uno de sus hombres?
vi_translation: “Don't know who he is?” Dorian asked, indifferently. “What do you mean? Isn't he your man?”
tr_translation: Dorian asked in a troubled voice, "Don't you know who he is?" "What do you mean? Isn't he one of your men?"
es_translation: —Don't you know who he is? —asked Dorian distractedly—. What do you mean? Wasn't he one of your men?

en: “No, sir. Never saw him before. Seems like a sailor, sir.”
vi: “Không, thưa ngài. Tôi chưa hề thấy anh ta trước đây. Có vẻ như là một thủy thủ, thưa ngài.”
tr: “Yoo, efendim. Hiç görmediğim biri. Gemiciye benziyor, efendim.
es: —No, señor. No lo había visto nunca. Parece un marinero, señor.
vi_translation: “No, sir. I have never seen him before. He seems to be a sailor, sir.”
tr_translation: "Yes, sir. Someone I've never seen before. He looks like a sailor, sir."
es_translation: —No, sir. I had never seen him before. He looks like a sailor, sir.

en: The pen dropped from Dorian Gray’s hand, and he felt as if his heart had suddenly stopped beating. “A sailor?” he cried out. “Did you say a sailor?”
vi: Cây bút rớt khỏi tay Dorian Gray, cậu cảm thấy như thể tim bất ngờ ngừng đập. “Thủy thủ?” cậu la lên. “Có phải anh nói một thủy thủ không?”
tr: Kalem elinden düştü ve Dorian’ın yüreği birden duruvermiş gibi oldu. “Gemici mi?” diye bağırdı. “Gemici mi dedin?
es: A Dorian Gray se le cayó la pluma de la mano, y tuvo la sensación de que el corazón dejaba de latirle. —¿Un marinero? —exclamó—. ¿Ha dicho un marinero?
vi_translation: The pen dropped from Dorian Gray's hand, he felt as if his heart had suddenly stopped beating. "A sailor?" he exclaimed. "Did you say a sailor?"
tr_translation: The pen fell from his hand and it was as if Dorian's heart suddenly stopped. “A sailor?” he shouted. “Did you say a sailor?”
es_translation: Dorian Gray dropped the pen from his hand and felt as if his heart had stopped beating. —A sailor? —he exclaimed—. Did you say a sailor?

en: “Yes, sir. He looks as if he had been a sort of sailor; tattooed on both arms, and that kind of thing.”
vi: “Vâng, thưa ngài. Trông anh ta như thể anh ta từng là thủy thủ thì phải; hình xăm trên cả hai cánh tay, và đại loại thế.”
tr: “Evet, efendim. Denizciye benziyor: İki kolunda da dövmeler var.
es: —Sí, señor. Parece como si hubiera sido marinero o algo parecido; tatuajes en los dos brazos y otras cosas por el estilo.
vi_translation: "Yes, sir." "He looks like he might have been a sailor; tattoos on both arms, and that sort of thing."
tr_translation: "Yes, sir. He looks like a sailor: He has tattoos on both arms."
es_translation: —Yes, sir. It seems as if he had been a sailor or something similar; tattoos on both arms and other things like that.

en: “Was there anything found on him?” said Dorian, leaning forward and looking at the man with startled eyes. “Anything that would tell his name?”
vi: “Có tìm thấy gì trên người anh ta không?” Dorian nói, cúi về phía trước và nhìn người đó với đôi mắt thảng thốt. “Bất cứ thứ gì có thể cho biết tên anh ta?”
tr: Dorian öne doğru eğilerek şaşırmış gözlerle korucunun yüzünü taradı. “Üzerinden bir şey çıktı mı? Adını sanını gösteren bir şey?
es: —¿Llevaba algo encima? —preguntó Dorian, inclinándose hacia adelante y mirando al guardabosque con ojos llenos de sobresalto—. ¿Algo que nos permita saber su nombre?
vi_translation: “Did you find anything on him?” Dorian said, leaning forward and looking at the person with startled eyes. “Anything that could tell us his name?”
tr_translation: Dorian leaned forward and scanned the ranger's face with surprised eyes. "Did anything come out of him? Something that shows his name or identity?"
es_translation: —Did he have anything on him? —asked Dorian, leaning forward and looking at the gamekeeper with eyes full of shock—. Anything that would allow us to know his name?

en: “Some money, sir—not much, and a six-shooter. There was no name of any kind. A decent-looking man, sir, but rough-like. A sort of sailor we think.”
vi: “Một ít tiền, thưa ngài — không nhiều, và khẩu súng lục. Không có bất cứ tên tuổi gì cả. Một người trông cũng đứng đắn, thưa ngài, nhưng có vẻ thô lậu. Thủy thủ thì phải, chúng tôi nghĩ vậy.”
tr: “Biraz para, efendim; çok değil, bir tabanca. Ad falan yok. Efendiden bir adama benziyor, efendim, ama kılık kıyafeti kaba saba. Denizci falan olsa gerek, diyoruz biz.
es: —Algo de dinero, señor, no mucho, y un revólver de seis tiros. Nada que lo identifique. Aspecto de persona decente, sin ser un caballero. Algo así como un marinero, creemos nosotros.
vi_translation: “A little money, sir — not much, and a revolver. No identification at all. A person who seemed respectable, sir, but somewhat rough. A sailor, we think.”
tr_translation: “A little money, sir; not much, a pistol. No name or anything. He looks like a gentleman, sir, but his clothes are rough. We think he must be a sailor or something.”
es_translation: —Some money, sir, not much, and a six-shot revolver. Nothing that identifies him. He looks like a decent person, without being a gentleman. Something like a sailor, we believe.

en: Dorian started to his feet. A terrible hope fluttered past him. He clutched at it madly. “Where is the body?” he exclaimed. “Quick! I must see it at once.”
vi: Dorian đứng phắt dậy. Một hy vọng khủng khiếp dập dờn bay ngang qua cậu. Cậu điên cuồng chộp lấy nó. “Cái xác đâu rồi?” cậu la lên. “Nhanh! Tôi phải thấy nó ngay.”
tr: Dorian yerinden fırlamıştı. Müthiş bir umut kanat çırparak yanından sıyırıp geçti. Dorian deli gibi sarıldı bu umuda. “Ceset nerede?” diye haykırdı. “Çabuk! Hemen görmek istiyorum.
es: Dorian se puso en pie. Una imposible esperanza le rozó con su ala y se agarró a ella con frenesí. —¿Dónde está el cadáver? —exclamó—. ¡Deprisa! He de verlo cuanto antes.
vi_translation: Dorian stood up abruptly. A terrible hope fluttered across him. He desperately grasped at it. “Where is the body?” he shouted. “Quick! I must see it immediately.”
tr_translation: Dorian jumped up from his seat. A tremendous hope fluttered past him. Dorian clung to this hope like a madman. “Where is the body?” he shouted. “Quick! I want to see it immediately.”
es_translation: Dorian stood up. An impossible hope brushed him with its wing, and he clung to it frantically. —Where is the corpse? —he exclaimed—. Quickly! I must see it as soon as possible.

en: “It is in an empty stable in the Home Farm, sir. The folk don’t like to have that sort of thing in their houses. They say a corpse brings bad luck.”
vi: “Nó ở một chuồng ngựa bỏ không tại Trang trại Gia đình, thưa ngài. Mọi người không thích để cái thứ kiểu ấy trong nhà. Họ bảo xác chết đem vận đen đến.”
tr: “Çiftlik evinin orada, boş bir ahırda, efendim. Kimse eve almak istemedi. Ölünün varlığı uğursuzluk getirir, diyorlar.
es: —En un establo vacío de la granja, señor. Nadie quiere tener una cosa así en su casa. Dicen que un cadáver trae mala suerte.
vi_translation: “It is in an empty stable at the Family Farm, sir. People don't like to keep that kind of thing in the house. They say dead bodies bring bad luck.”
tr_translation: "By the farmhouse, in an empty barn, sir. No one wanted to take it into the house. They say the presence of the dead brings bad luck."
es_translation: —In an empty barn on the farm, sir. Nobody wants to have something like that in their house. They say a corpse brings bad luck.

en: “The Home Farm! Go there at once and meet me. Tell one of the grooms to bring my horse round. No. Never mind. I’ll go to the stables myself. It will save time.”
vi: “Trang trại Gia đình! Đến đó ngay và đón tôi. Bảo một người giữ ngựa mang ngựa của tôi lại đây. Không. Đừng bận tâm. Tôi sẽ tự đến chuồng ngựa. Thế sẽ tiết kiệm được thời gian.
tr: “Çiftlik evi ha! Sen şimdi hemen oraya git, beni bekle. Seyislerden birine söyle, atımı getirsin. Ama yok, boş ver. Ahıra ben kendim giderim. Zaman kazanmış olurum.
es: —¡La granja! Vaya inmediatamente allí y espéreme. Diga a uno de los mozos de cuadra que me traiga el caballo. No. No se preocupe. Iré yo al establo. Ahorraremos tiempo.
vi_translation: “Family Farm! Go there immediately and pick me up. Tell a stable hand to bring my horse here. No. Never mind. I will go to the stable myself. That will save time.”
tr_translation: “The farmhouse, huh! You go there immediately and wait for me. Tell one of the grooms to bring my horse. But no, never mind. I'll go to the stable myself. I'll save some time.”
es_translation: —The farm! Go there immediately and wait for me. Tell one of the stable boys to bring me the horse. No. Don't worry. I'll go to the stable myself. We'll save time.

en: In less than a quarter of an hour, Dorian Gray was galloping down the long avenue as hard as he could go. The trees seemed to sweep past him in spectral procession, and wild shadows to fling themselves across his path. Once the mare swerved at a white gate-post and nearly threw him. He lashed her across the neck with his crop. She cleft the dusky air like an arrow. The stones flew from her hoofs.
vi: Trong chưa đầy một phần tư giờ, Dorian Gray phi nước đại theo con đường dài dưới hàng cây, cố gắng chạy nhanh hết sức có thể. Những cái cây dừng như quét qua cậu trong một đám rước ma, và những chiếc bóng hoang dại quăng mình ngang đường cậu đi. Có lần con ngựa cái đi chệch tại một cột cổng trắng và suýt nữa ném cậu đi. Cậu quất roi ngang cổ nó. Nó rẽ không khí tối mờ như một mũi tên. Những viên đá bay khỏi móng guốc nó.
tr: Daha bir çeyrek saate varmadan Dorian atını uzun, ağaçlı yol boyunca doludizgin sürüyordu. Ağaçlar, bir hayaletler resmî geçidi gibi yanından uçup geçiyor, garip gölgeler kendilerini atının nalları altına atıyorlardı sanki. Bir ara, beyaz bir çit kapısında at yana fırlayınca Dorian’ı neredeyse sırtından atıyordu. Dorian kamçısını onun boynuna indirdi. Kısrak loş havayı ok gibi delip geçti, nalları havaya taşlar savurdu.
es: En menos de un cuarto de hora Dorian Gray galopaba por la gran avenida. Los árboles parecían desfilar a ambos lados como un cortejo de fantasmas, y sombras extrañas se arrojaban furiosamente en su camino. En una ocasión la yegua hizo un extraño ante un poste blanco y estuvo a punto de derribarlo. Dorian le golpeó el cuello con la fusta. El animal se adentró en la oscuridad como una flecha. Sus cascos hacían volar los guijarros.
vi_translation: In less than a quarter of an hour, Dorian Gray galloped down the long road under the trees, trying to run as fast as he could. The trees seemed to sweep past him in a ghostly procession, and wild shadows flung themselves across his path. Once the mare swerved at a white gatepost and nearly threw him off. He lashed its neck with the whip. It cut through the dim air like an arrow. Stones flew from its hooves.
tr_translation: Before another quarter of an hour had passed, Dorian was riding his horse at full gallop along the long, tree-lined road. The trees flew past him like a parade of ghosts, and strange shadows seemed to throw themselves under his horse's hooves. At one point, when the horse suddenly veered at a white gate, it almost threw Dorian off its back. Dorian brought his whip down on its neck. The mare pierced through the dim air like an arrow, her hooves flinging stones into the air.
es_translation: In less than a quarter of an hour, Dorian Gray was galloping down the grand avenue. The trees seemed to parade on either side like a procession of ghosts, and strange shadows furiously threw themselves in his path. On one occasion, the mare shied at a white post and nearly threw him off. Dorian struck her neck with the whip. The animal darted into the darkness like an arrow. Her hooves sent pebbles flying.

en: At last he reached the Home Farm. Two men were loitering in the yard. He leaped from the saddle and threw the reins to one of them. In the farthest stable a light was glimmering. Something seemed to tell him that the body was there, and he hurried to the door and put his hand upon the latch.
vi: Cuối cùng cậu cũng đến Trang trại Gia đình. Hai người đàn ông đang tha thẩn trong sân. Cậu nhảy khỏi yên và ném dây cương cho một trong số họ. Ở chuồng ngựa xa nhất, một ánh đèn le lói. Có gì đó dường như mách cậu là cái xác đang ở đó, và cậu hấp tấp chạy đến cửa, đặt tay lên then.
tr: Sonunda çiftlik evine vardılar. Avluda iki adam duruyordu. Dorian yere atladı, dizgini adamlardan birine attı. Önündeki ahırda bir ışık yanmaktaydı. Bir ses ölünün orada olduğunu söylemiş gibi Dorian çabucak kapıya yürüdü, elini mandala uzattı.
es: Finalmente llegó a la granja y encontró a dos hombres ociosos en el patio. Dorian saltó de la silla y le arrojó a uno de ellos las riendas. En el establo más distante parpadeaba una luz. Algo le dijo que allí se hallaba el cadáver. Corrió hacia la puerta y puso la mano en el picaporte.
vi_translation: Finally, you arrived at the Family Farm. Two men were wandering in the yard. You jumped off the saddle and threw the reins to one of them. In the farthest stable, a light flickered. Something seemed to tell you that the body was there, and you hurriedly ran to the door, placing your hand on the latch.
tr_translation: Finally, they arrived at the farmhouse. Two men were standing in the yard. Dorian jumped to the ground and threw the reins to one of the men. A light was shining in the stable in front of him. As if a voice had told him the dead body was there, Dorian quickly walked to the door and reached for the latch.
es_translation: Finally, he arrived at the farm and found two idle men in the yard. Dorian jumped off the saddle and threw the reins to one of them. A light flickered in the farthest stable. Something told him that the corpse was there. He ran to the door and put his hand on the doorknob.

en: There he paused for a moment, feeling that he was on the brink of a discovery that would either make or mar his life. Then he thrust the door open and entered.
vi: Ở đó, cậu dừng lại một lát, cảm thấy rằng cậu đang cận kề một sự khám phá có thể hoặc là tạo dựng hoặc tàn hại đời mình. Sau đó cậu đẩy cửa mở, bước vào.
tr: Burada bir an duraladı: Bir bulgunun eşiğinde olduğunu, bunun hayatını ya kurtaracağını ya da mahvedeceğini hissediyordu. Sonra kapıyı itip açarak içeri girdi.
es: Luego se detuvo un momento, sintiendo que estaba a punto de hacer un descubrimiento que haría renacer su vida o la destruiría. A continuación abrió la puerta de golpe y entró.
vi_translation: There, he paused for a moment, feeling that he was on the verge of a discovery that could either make or break his life. Then he pushed the door open and stepped inside.
tr_translation: He paused here for a moment: He felt that he was on the verge of a discovery, one that would either save or ruin his life. Then he pushed the door open and entered.
es_translation: Then he paused for a moment, feeling that he was about to make a discovery that would either revive his life or destroy it. Next, he flung the door open and entered.

en: On a heap of sacking in the far corner was lying the dead body of a man dressed in a coarse shirt and a pair of blue trousers. A spotted handkerchief had been placed over the face. A coarse candle, stuck in a bottle, sputtered beside it.
vi: Trên đống vải làm bao tải ở góc xa, một xác người đang nằm, bận sơ mi thô và quần xanh. Một chiếc khăn tay lốm đốm đặt ngang mặt. Một cây nến thô kệch, cắm trong chai, kêu xèo xèo bên nó.
tr: Karşı köşedeki bir çuval yığınının üzerine, kaba mavi bir mintanla mavi pantolon giymiş bir adamın cesedi uzatılmıştı. Yüzüne benekli bir mendil örtülmüştü. Yanı başında, bir şişe ağzına sokulmuş ucuz bir mum fıslayarak yanmaktaydı.
es: Sobre un montón de sacos vacíos, y en el rincón más alejado de la puerta, yacía el cadáver de un hombre vestido con una camisa de tela basta y unos pantalones azules. Sobre el rostro le habían colocado un pañuelo de lunares. Una vela de mala calidad, hundida en el cuello de una botella, chisporroteaba a su lado.
vi_translation: On a pile of fabric for making sacks in the far corner, a human corpse was lying, dressed in a coarse shirt and blue pants. A spotted handkerchief was placed across the face. A crude candle, stuck in a bottle, sizzled beside it.
tr_translation: The body of a man dressed in a coarse blue shirt and blue pants was laid on top of a pile of sacks in the opposite corner. A spotted handkerchief was draped over his face. Beside him, a cheap candle stuck into the mouth of a bottle was burning with a sputter.
es_translation: On a pile of empty sacks, and in the corner farthest from the door, lay the corpse of a man dressed in a coarse cloth shirt and blue trousers. A polka-dotted handkerchief had been placed over his face. A poor-quality candle, sunk into the neck of a bottle, sputtered beside him.

en: Dorian Gray shuddered. He felt that his could not be the hand to take the handkerchief away, and called out to one of the farm-servants to come to him.
vi: Dorian Gray rùng mình. Cậu cảm thấy mình không thể tự tay lấy cái khăn tay ra, và lớn tiếng gọi một tá điền đến chỗ cậu.
tr: Dorian Gray ürperdi. Kendisinin o mendili dünyada kaldıramayacağını anlayarak ırgatlardan birini yanına çağırdı.
es: Dorian Gray se estremeció. Sintió que no podía ser su mano la que retirase el pañuelo, y pidió a uno de los gañanes que se acercara.
vi_translation: Dorian Gray shuddered. He felt that he could not take out the handkerchief himself, and loudly called a tenant over to him.
tr_translation: Dorian Gray shuddered. Realizing that he could not lift that handkerchief himself, he called one of the laborers over.
es_translation: Dorian Gray shuddered. He felt that it could not be his hand that removed the handkerchief, and asked one of the laborers to come closer.

en: “Take that thing off the face. I wish to see it,” he said, clutching at the door-post for support.
vi: “Lấy thứ ấy ra khỏi cái mặt. Tôi muốn thấy nó,” cậu nói, chộp lấy trụ cửa để tìm chỗ dựa.
tr: Kapının direğine tutunarak, “Şu şeyi çek onun yüzünden. Görmek istiyorum!” dedi.
es: —Quítenle eso que tiene sobre la cara. Quiero verlo —dijo, agarrándose a la jamba de la puerta para no caer.
vi_translation: "Take that off your face. I want to see it," he said, grabbing the doorpost for support.
tr_translation: Holding onto the doorpost, he said, "Take that thing off his face. I want to see!"
es_translation: —Take off whatever is on his face. I want to see him —he said, holding onto the door jamb to avoid falling.

en: When the farm-servant had done so, he stepped forward. A cry of joy broke from his lips. The man who had been shot in the thicket was James Vane.
vi: Khi tá điền làm thế, cậu bước lên trước. Một tiếng kêu vui sướng bật khỏi môi cậu. Người bị bắn trong bụi cây chính là James Vane.
tr: Irgat denileni yapınca Dorian ilerledi. Dudaklarından bir sevinç ünlemi koptu. Fundalıkta vurulmuş olan adam James Vane’di.
es: Cuando el gañán hizo lo que le pedían, Dorian Gray se adelantó. De sus labios escapó un grito de alegría. El hombre muerto entre la maleza era James Vane.
vi_translation: When the tenant did so, he stepped forward. A cry of joy escaped his lips. The person shot in the bushes was James Vane.
tr_translation: When the laborer did as he was told, Dorian stepped forward. A cry of joy escaped from his lips. The man who had been shot in the thicket was James Vane.
es_translation: When the laborer did what they asked of him, Dorian Gray stepped forward. A cry of joy escaped from his lips. The dead man among the undergrowth was James Vane.

en: He stood there for some minutes looking at the dead body. As he rode home, his eyes were full of tears, for he knew he was safe.
vi: Cậu đứng đó vài phút, nhìn cái xác. Lúc cậu phi ngựa về nhà, mắt cậu đẫm lệ, vì cậu biết mình đã an toàn.
tr: Dorian orada dakikalarca durup ölüye baktı. Atını eve doğru sürerken gözleri yaş doluydu, çünkü tehlikeyi atlatmış olduğunu biliyordu.
es: Permaneció allí unos minutos contemplando el cadáver. Luego regresó a la casa principal con los ojos llenos de lágrimas, sabiendo que estaba, a salvo.
vi_translation: He stood there for a few minutes, looking at the corpse. When he rode the horse back home, his eyes were filled with tears, because he knew he was safe.
tr_translation: Dorian stood there for minutes, looking at the dead. As he rode his horse towards home, his eyes were filled with tears because he knew he had escaped the danger.
es_translation: He remained there for a few minutes, contemplating the corpse. Then he returned to the main house with his eyes full of tears, knowing that he was safe.

en: CHAPTER XIX.
vi: Chương 19
tr: On dokuzuncu bölüm
es: Capítulo 19
vi_translation: Chapter 19
tr_translation: Nineteenth chapter
es_translation: Chapter 19

en: “There is no use your telling me that you are going to be good,” cried Lord Henry, dipping his white fingers into a red copper bowl filled with rose-water. “You are quite perfect. Pray, don’t change.”
vi: "Cậu bảo tôi là cậu sẽ sống tử tế thì cũng chẳng ích gì,” huân tước Henry kêu lên, nhúng các ngón tay trắng vào một tô đồng đỏ đựng đầy nước hồng. “Cậu đã hoàn hảo lắm rồi. Xin đấy, đừng thay đổi.
tr: Lord Henry, “İyi insan olacağım, deyip durmanın bir yararı yok,” diyerek o beyaz parmaklarını gülsuyu dolu bakır bir tasa batırdı. “Kusursuzsun sen. Kuzum, değişme.
es: —No me digas que vas a ser bueno —exclamó lord Henry, sumergiendo los dedos en un cuenco de cobre rojo lleno de agua de rosas—. Eres absolutamente perfecto. Haz el favor de no cambiar.
vi_translation: "You told me that you would live decently, but it doesn't help at all," Lord Henry exclaimed, dipping his white fingers into a red copper bowl filled with rose water. "You are already perfect. Please, don't change."
tr_translation: Lord Henry, "There is no use in saying I will be a good person," he said, dipping his white fingers into a copper bowl filled with rose water. "You are perfect. My dear, do not change."
es_translation: —Don't tell me you're going to be good —exclaimed Lord Henry, dipping his fingers into a red copper bowl filled with rose water—. You are absolutely perfect. Do me a favor and don't change.

en: Dorian Gray shook his head. “No, Harry, I have done too many dreadful things in my life. I am not going to do any more. I began my good actions yesterday.”
vi: Dorian Gray lắc đầu. “Không, Harry, tôi đã làm quá nhiều việc kinh khủng trong đời mình. Tôi sẽ không làm thêm nữa. Tôi bắt đầu làm việc tốt từ hôm qua.”
tr: Dorian Gray başını salladı. “Yok, Harry, yaptığım çirkin şeyler yetti de arttı artık. Bundan sonra tövbe. İyi şeyler yapmaya dün başladım.
es: Dorian Gray movió la cabeza. —No, Harry, no. He hecho demasiadas cosas horribles en mi vida. No voy a hacer ninguna más. Ayer empecé con las buenas acciones.
vi_translation: Dorian Gray shook his head. "No, Harry, I have done too many terrible things in my life. I will not do any more. I started doing good deeds from yesterday."
tr_translation: Dorian Gray shook his head. "No, Harry, the ugly things I've done are more than enough. From now on, I repent. I started doing good things yesterday."
es_translation: Dorian Gray moved his head. —No, Harry, no. I have done too many horrible things in my life. I am not going to do any more. Yesterday, I started with good deeds.

en: “Where were you yesterday?”
vi: “Hôm qua cậu ở đâu?”
tr: “Neredeydin sen dün?
es: —¿Dónde estuviste ayer?
vi_translation: "Where were you yesterday?"
tr_translation: “Where were you yesterday?”
es_translation: —Where were you yesterday?

en: “In the country, Harry. I was staying at a little inn by myself.”
vi: “Ở quê, Harry. Tôi đã tự lưu lại trong một khách sạn nhỏ.”
tr: “Kent dışındaydım. Küçük bir handa kaldım, tek başıma.
es: —En el campo, Harry. Solo, en una humilde posada.
vi_translation: "In the countryside, Harry. I have checked myself into a small hotel."
tr_translation: “I was outside the city. I stayed in a small inn, alone.”
es_translation: —In the countryside, Harry. Alone, in a humble inn.

en: “My dear boy,” said Lord Henry, smiling, “anybody can be good in the country. There are no temptations there. That is the reason why people who live out of town are so absolutely uncivilized. Civilization is not by any means an easy thing to attain to. There are only two ways by which man can reach it. One is by being cultured, the other by being corrupt. Country people have no opportunity of being either, so they stagnate.”
vi: “Chàng trai của tôi,” huân tước Henry nói, mỉm cười, “ai cũng có thể tử tế ở quê. Nơi ấy không có cám dỗ. Đó là lý do tại sao mà những người sống ngoài thành phố lại hoàn toàn thiếu văn minh như vậy. Sự văn minh dẫu gì cũng không phải cái dễ đạt được. Chỉ có hai con đường để con người có thể tiếp cận nó. Một là được giáo hóa, hai là bị tha hóa. Người nhà quê không có cơ hội với cả hai, nên họ trì độn."
tr: Lord Henry, “Sevgili dostum,” dedi gülümseyerek. “Kent dışında herkes uslu oturur. Baştan çıkarıcı bir şey yok ki orada. Kent dışında yaşayan kimselerin uygarlıktan iyice uzak olmaları da bu yüzdendir ya. Uygarlık, ulaşılması hiç de kolay olan bir şey değildir. Kişi ancak iki yoldan ulaşabilir uygarlığa. Biri kültürlü olmak, öbürü de ahlaksız olmak. Kent dışında yaşayanlar bunların ikisine de fırsat bulamadıkları için durgun sular gibi yosun tutup giderler.
es: —Mi querido muchacho —dijo lord Henry sonriendo—, cualquiera puede ser bueno en el campo, donde no existen tentaciones. Ése es el motivo de que las personas que no habitan en ciudades vivan todavía en estado de barbarie. La civilización no es algo que se consiga fácilmente. Sólo hay dos maneras. O se es culto o se está corrompido. La gente del campo carece de ocasiones para ambas cosas, de manera que sólo conocen el estancamiento.
vi_translation: “My boy,” Lord Henry said, smiling, “anyone can be good in the countryside. There are no temptations there. That is why people who live outside the city are so completely uncivilized. Civilization is not something easily achieved. There are only two ways for a person to approach it. One is through education, the other is through corruption. Country folk have no opportunity for either, so they remain dull."
tr_translation: Lord Henry, "My dear friend," he said with a smile. "Everyone behaves well outside the city. There is nothing seductive there. That is why those who live outside the city are quite far from civilization. Civilization is not something that is easy to attain. One can only reach civilization in two ways. One is by being cultured, the other by being immoral. Since those who live outside the city have no opportunity for either, they become stagnant waters covered with algae."
es_translation: —My dear boy —said Lord Henry, smiling—, anyone can be good in the countryside, where there are no temptations. That is why people who do not live in cities still live in a state of barbarism. Civilization is not something that is easily achieved. There are only two ways. Either one is cultured or one is corrupt. Country people lack opportunities for both, so they only know stagnation.

en: “Culture and corruption,” echoed Dorian. “I have known something of both. It seems terrible to me now that they should ever be found together. For I have a new ideal, Harry. I am going to alter. I think I have altered.”
vi: “Giáo hóa và tha hóa,” Dorian lặp lại. “Tôi đã biết chút ít về cả hai. Giờ đây tôi thấy một điều dường như rất khủng khiếp là ta luôn thấy chúng cùng lúc. Vì tôi đã có lý tưởng mới của mình, Harry. Tôi sắp thay đổi. Tôi nghĩ tôi đã thay đổi.
tr: Dorian arkadaşının sözlerini tekrarlayarak, “Kültür ve ahlaksızlık!” dedi. “Bunların ikisini de az çok yaşadım. Bir arada bulunabilmeleri şimdi dehşet veriyor bana. Çünkü yeni bir ülkü edindim. Harry. Temelden değişeceğim. Sanırım daha şimdiden değiştim bile.
es: -Cultura y corrupción —repitió Dorian—. Sé algo acerca de esas dos cosas. Ahora me parece terrible que vayan alguna vez unidas. Porque tengo un nuevo ideal, Harry. Voy a cambiar. Creo que ya he cambiado.
vi_translation: “Education and corruption,” Dorian repeated. “I have known a little about both. Now I see something that seems very terrible: we always see them together. Because I have my new ideal, Harry. I am going to change. I think I have changed.”
tr_translation: Repeating his friend's words, Dorian said, "Culture and immorality!" "I have experienced both to some extent. Their coexistence now terrifies me. Because I have adopted a new ideal. Harry. I will fundamentally change. I think I have already changed."
es_translation: -Culture and corruption —repeated Dorian—. I know something about those two things. Now it seems terrible to me that they ever go together. Because I have a new ideal, Harry. I am going to change. I think I have already changed.

en: “You have not yet told me what your good action was. Or did you say you had done more than one?” asked his companion as he spilled into his plate a little crimson pyramid of seeded strawberries and, through a perforated, shell-shaped spoon, snowed white sugar upon them.
vi: “Cậu chưa nói cho tôi biết việc tốt của cậu là gì. Hay cậu vừa nói là cậu đã làm nhiều hơn là một việc?” bạn cậu hỏi, lúc y đổ vào đĩa mình một hình chóp nhỏ đỏ chót những hạt dâu tây đã lẩy hạt, và, qua một cái thìa hình vỏ sò xoi lỗ, rắc đường trắng lên chúng như tuyết.
tr: Arkadaşı, “Yaptığın iyi şeyi söylemedin ya. Yoksa sayısı birden çok muydu?” diye sorarak tabağındaki küçük, kırmızı çilek piramidini yıktı, deniz kabuğu biçiminde, delikli bir kaşıkla üzerlerine pudraşekeri serpti.
es: —No me has contado cuál ha sido tu buena acción de ayer. ¿O fue más de una? —preguntó su interlocutor, mientras vertía sobre su plato una pequeña pirámide carmesí de fresas maduras, blanqueándolas luego con azúcar mediante una cuchara perforada en forma de concha.
vi_translation: “You haven't told me what your good deed is yet. Or did you just say that you have done more than one thing?” your friend asked, as he poured onto his plate a small red pyramid of hulled strawberries, and, through a perforated shell-shaped spoon, sprinkled white sugar on them like snow.
tr_translation: Your friend said, "You didn't mention the good thing you did. Or was there more than one?" and as he asked, he toppled the small, red strawberry pyramid on his plate and sprinkled powdered sugar over them with a perforated, seashell-shaped spoon.
es_translation: —You haven't told me what your good deed was yesterday. Or was it more than one? —asked his interlocutor, while pouring a small crimson pyramid of ripe strawberries onto his plate, then whitening them with sugar using a perforated spoon shaped like a shell.

en: “I can tell you, Harry. It is not a story I could tell to any one else. I spared somebody. It sounds vain, but you understand what I mean. She was quite beautiful and wonderfully like Sibyl Vane. I think it was that which first attracted me to her. You remember Sibyl, don’t you? How long ago that seems! Well, Hetty was not one of our own class, of course. She was simply a girl in a village. But I really loved her. I am quite sure that I loved her. All during this wonderful May that we have been having, I used to run down and see her two or three times a week. Yesterday she met me in a little orchard. The apple-blossoms kept tumbling down on her hair, and she was laughing. We were to have gone away together this morning at dawn. Suddenly I determined to leave her as flowerlike as I had found her.”
vi: “Tôi có thể kể cho anh, Harry. Đó không phải là câu chuyện mà tôi có thể kể cho bất cứ ai khác. Tôi đã buông tha cho một người. Nghe có vẻ tự phụ, nhưng anh hiểu điều tôi muốn nói. Nàng rất đẹp, và tuyệt vời như Sibyl Vane. Tôi nghĩ đó là điều đầu tiên lôi cuốn tôi đến với nàng. Anh còn nhớ Sibyl chứ, phải không anh? Dường như đã lâu lắm rồi nhỉ! Đấy, Hetty không phải một người thuộc giai cấp chúng ta, dĩ nhiên. Nàng chỉ là một thôn nữ. Nhưng tôi thật lòng yêu nàng. Tôi chắc chắn là tôi đã yêu nàng. Suốt cái tháng Năm kỳ diệu mà ta đang được hưởng này, tôi thường chạy xuống gặp nàng đôi ba lần một tuần. Hôm qua nàng đón tôi ở một khu vườn nhỏ. Hoa táo cứ rơi xuống tóc nàng, và nàng cười suốt. Chúng tôi định cùng nhau bỏ đi sáng nay lúc bình minh lên. Đột nhiên tôi nhất quyết để nàng lại vẹn nguyên như đóa hoa lúc tôi thấy nàng.”
tr: “Anlatacağım, Harry. Senden başkasına anlatabileceğim bir şey değil bu. Bir insanı esirgedim! Böbürlenmek gibi oluyor ya ne demek istediğimi sen anlarsın. Gerçekten güzel bir kızdı; Sibyl Vane’e öyle benziyordu ki bu kadar olur. Beni ona ilk çeken bu oldu sanıyorum. Sibyl’i anımsarsın, değil mi? Nasıl da milyon yıl öncesinde kalmış gibi geliyor! Neyse, Hetty bizim sınıfımızdan bir kızcağız değildi, doğallıkla. Basit bir köylü kızı. Ama onu sahiden seviyordum. Eminim, onu sevdiğimden. Şu geçirdiğimiz harika mayıs boyunca, haftada iki-üç kez gidip görüyordum onu. Dün küçük bir meyve bahçesinde buluştuk. Elma çiçekleri saçlarına dökülüp duruyordu, o da gülüyordu. Bu sabah şafakta birlikte kaçmaya kararlıydık. Birden onu nasıl bulduysam öyle bırakmaya karar verdim: çiçek gibi.
es: —Te lo puedo contar a ti, Harry, aunque a nadie más. Renuncié a perjudicar a una persona. Parece pretencioso, pero ya entiendes lo que quiero decir. Era muy hermosa, y extraordinariamente parecida a Sibyl Vane. Creo que fue eso lo primero que me atrajo de ella. Te acuerdas de Sibyl, ¿no es cierto? ¡Cuánto tiempo parece que ha pasado! Hetty, por supuesto, no es una persona de nuestra posición, tan sólo una chica de pueblo. Pero me había enamorado. Estoy completamente seguro de que la quería. Durante todo este mes de mayo tan maravilloso que hemos disfrutado iba a verla dos o tres veces por semana. Ayer se reunió conmigo en un huerto. Las flores de los manzanos le caían sobre el pelo y se reía mucho. Íbamos a escaparnos juntos hoy por la mañana al amanecer. De repente decidí que no cambiara por mi culpa.
vi_translation: "I can tell you, Harry. It's not a story I can tell anyone else. I let someone go. It sounds presumptuous, but you understand what I mean. She was very beautiful, and wonderful like Sibyl Vane. I think that was the first thing that attracted me to her. You still remember Sibyl, don't you? It seems like such a long time ago! There, Hetty is not a person of our class, of course. She is just a village girl. But I truly love her. I am sure that I have loved her. Throughout this wonderful month of May that we are enjoying, I often ran down to meet her two or three times a week. Yesterday she met me in a small garden. Apple blossoms kept falling onto her hair, and she laughed all the time. We planned to run away together this morning at dawn. Suddenly I was determined to leave her as untouched as the flower when I first saw her.”
tr_translation: "I will tell you, Harry. This is not something I can tell anyone else but you. I spared a person! It sounds like boasting, but you understand what I mean. She was truly a beautiful girl; she resembled Sibyl Vane so much, it was uncanny. I think that was what first attracted me to her. You remember Sibyl, don't you? How it feels like it was a million years ago! Anyway, Hetty was not a girl from our class, naturally. A simple peasant girl. But I truly loved her. I am sure that I loved her. During this wonderful May we had, I would go and see her two or three times a week. Yesterday, we met in a small orchard. Apple blossoms were falling into her hair, and she was laughing. This morning at dawn, we were determined to run away together. Suddenly, I decided to leave her as I found her: like a flower."
es_translation: —I can tell you, Harry, though no one else. I gave up harming a person. It seems pretentious, but you understand what I mean. She was very beautiful, and extraordinarily similar to Sibyl Vane. I think that was the first thing that attracted me to her. You remember Sibyl, don't you? How much time seems to have passed! Hetty, of course, is not someone of our standing, just a village girl. But I had fallen in love. I am completely sure that I loved her. During this wonderful month of May that we have enjoyed, I went to see her two or three times a week. Yesterday she met me in an orchard. The apple blossoms were falling on her hair and she laughed a lot. We were going to run away together this morning at dawn. Suddenly, I decided that she shouldn't change because of me.

en: “I should think the novelty of the emotion must have given you a thrill of real pleasure, Dorian,” interrupted Lord Henry. “But I can finish your idyll for you. You gave her good advice and broke her heart. That was the beginning of your reformation.”
vi: “Tôi cho là tính mới mẻ của cảm xúc ấy hẳn là đã cho cậu sự rộn ràng sướng vui thật sự, Dorian,” huân tước Henry ngắt lời. “Nhưng tôi có thể kết thúc bài thơ điền viên của cậu thay cậu. Cậu cho cô ấy lời khuyên tốt, và làm tan vỡ tim cô ấy. Đó là khởi đầu sự sửa đổi của cậu.”
tr: Lord Henry, “Bu duygunun yepyeni, değişik bir şey olması sana gerçek bir zevk heyecanı yaşatmış olsa gerek, Dorian,” diye araya girdi. “Gene de bu kırsal aşk öyküsünün sonunu istersen ben bağlayayım: Kıza çok yerinde öğütler verdin ve onu hüsrana uğrattın. Doğru yolda attığın ilk adım işte bu oldu.
es: —Imagino que la novedad de ese sentimiento te habrá proporcionado un estremecimiento de auténtico placer —le interrumpió lord Henry—. Pero estoy en condiciones de contarte el final de tu idilio. Le diste buenos consejos y le rompiste el corazón. Ése ha sido el comienzo de tu enmienda.
vi_translation: "I suppose the novelty of that emotion must have given you real excitement and joy, Dorian," Lord Henry interrupted. "But I can finish your pastoral poem for you. You gave her good advice, and broke her heart. That is the beginning of your reformation."
tr_translation: Lord Henry, "This feeling being so new and different must have given you a real thrill of pleasure, Dorian," he interjected. "Still, let me conclude this rustic love story for you: You gave the girl very appropriate advice and disappointed her. The first step you took on the right path was this."
es_translation: —I imagine that the novelty of that feeling must have given you a genuine thrill of pleasure —interrupted Lord Henry—. But I am in a position to tell you the end of your idyll. You gave her good advice and broke her heart. That has been the beginning of your amendment.

en: “Harry, you are horrible! You mustn’t say these dreadful things. Hetty’s heart is not broken. Of course, she cried and all that. But there is no disgrace upon her. She can live, like Perdita, in her garden of mint and marigold.”
vi: “Harry, anh thật quá đáng! Anh không nên nói ra những điều khủng khiếp này. Trái tim Hetty không tan vỡ. Dĩ nhiên nàng khóc, và đại loại thế. Nhưng nàng không bị sỉ nhục. Nàng có thể sống, như Perdita1, trong vườn bạc hà và cúc vạn thọ của nàng.” 1 Nhân vật trong vở The Winter's Tale của William Shakespeare.
tr: “Harry, çok kötüsün! Böyle sevimsiz şeyler söylemesene! Hetty hiç de hüsrana uğramış değil. Ağladı, elbette, falan filan. Ama adına leke sürülmedi ya! Tıpkı Perdita gibi, naneler, kadifeçiçekleriyle dolu bahçesinde huzur dolu bir ömür sürebilir.
es: —¡Qué desagradable eres, Harry! No debes decir cosas tan espantosas. A Hetty no se le ha roto el corazón. Lloró, por supuesto, y todo lo demás. Pero no ha perdido la honra. Puede vivir, como Perdita[18] , en su jardín de menta y caléndulas.
vi_translation: "Harry, you are really outrageous! You shouldn't say such terrible things. Hetty's heart isn't broken. Of course she cried, and things like that. But she wasn't humiliated. She can live, like Perdita, in her garden of mint and marigolds." 1 Character in William Shakespeare's play The Winter's Tale.
tr_translation: “Harry, you are so bad! Don't say such unpleasant things! Hetty is not at all disappointed. She cried, of course, and so on. But her name wasn't tarnished! Just like Perdita, she can live a peaceful life in her garden full of mints and marigolds.”
